Reviews.Author: Chris C.
Reviews.Content: Best food I have had in New Orleans. Hands down Food - 5 stars- ordered a half dozen oysters in half shell. Super fresh and very tasty. Mix of large and small oysters. Oysters are not my thing and these oysters had me craving oysters the three days I was there. Also had fried soft shell crab with homemade cocktail sauce.  Perfectly fried and a very large crab. With the $16.99. Friend had the gumbo and couldn't stop saying how great it was. Value-5 stars- large portion sizes and fresh ingredients. All four of us left full. Service- 4 stars- place was packed and had to wait outside for maybe twenty mins. Hostess came out several times and was making jokes and helping the time pass. Waiter was friendly and helpful with menu and getting our food. Cons- can't split checks so bring cash or be ready to have/receive a IOU. Lol Great experience and this will forever be a place I eat anytime I go to New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: Jes K.
Reviews.Content: Food is alright, but they make you stand in a long line outside, I'm assuming because it makes it always looks really busy that way even if it isn't.The oysters are good, but I had way better in New Orleans without the hassle or the price.Most everything else I had (crawfish, shrimp poboy) just tasted like pretty standard fried food. Not worth the hype.

Reviews.Author: Stacy F.
Reviews.Content: Arrived in New Orleans, checked into our hotel and then off to ACME for our first meal in the city. There was a line to get in, but it moved pretty quickly. We were seated by their food windo so we got to see everything come out of the kitchen, what a true treat!2 dozen oysters on the half shell were served quickly and they were fresh, plump, large and delicious. Then for dinner choices. Boo fries (French fries smothered in cheese and debris gravy) pretty yummy! The Crawfish Po'boy and the Soft Shell Crab Po'boy and the shrimp Po'boy were crispy and wonderful without being greasy. And to finish we tried the bread pudding, with a sauce you just may want to drink.Worth the wait in line but beware this is a rather noisy place so conversation may be minimum instead focus on the food!

Reviews.Author: Richard L.
Reviews.Content: Super Busy!!! Long line to get in. Took awhile to get our order in, but the food came quickly. Drinks are relatively cheap, and the food was great once we got it.Hard for people in wheelchairs because others keep on bumping into the chair. It's crowded inside.

Reviews.Author: Ebony B.
Reviews.Content: Overall, Acme was really good! Not the best I've ever had, but pretty good. We tried to come here before, but the line scared us off, like many others. But later we decided to wait and when the line starts to move, it really moves! We waited about 30 minutes. All I ordered was a bowl of seafood gumbo. It was great! It had a good flavor and a good amount of shrimp. Some places really skimp on the seafood they actually put into the gumbo, but not Acme. The service was ok. It was really busy so the waitress seemed a little flustered, but she was very nice!I'd definitely recommend Acme to anyone visiting NOLA!

Reviews.Author: Jeff H.
Reviews.Content: Review is based off of:EtouffeeJambalayaOysters (Grilled and fresh)Fried CatfishEtouffee was amazing - 5/5Jambalaya was amazing - 5/5Oysters were amazing - 5/5 (Try the grilled; they're very good)Fried catfish was good - 4/5 (It was good but not great)This is the place to go to when in NOLA.  It is reasonably priced and the food is quite tasty.Would come back.

Reviews.Author: Angela K.
Reviews.Content: My friend recommended this place on my first trip to Nola. So glad I decided to try it out!There was a long line outside when my boyfriend and I arrived for dinner but we ended up getting seated in 5 minutes (I guess because we were just a party of 2?). We ordered oysters, chargrilled oysters, craw puppies, etouffee, gumbo, and oyster shooters. I thought everything was tasty but those chargrilled oysters CHANGED MY LIFE. I love oysters to begin with but the way they made these were SO GOOD! The oysters are grilled with some kind of sauce which is so delicious and to make it even better they also provide bread for you to mop up all the sauce that oozed out. I seriously need to return to Nola just to eat this again or possibly learn how to make these myself. Service was friendly. Price was very reasonable. I would definitely recommend this place and will return when I am in Nola again.

Reviews.Author: Cathy J.
Reviews.Content: Enjoy the  dinner. I had seafood etouffee. I added fried crawfish tails and it was so delicious. The music was piped in and really loved the selection.

Reviews.Author: K S.
Reviews.Content: Came here because of the ratings and reviews. For an oyster house, the oysters were my least favorite. The raw oysters on the half shell did not taste like anything, no distinct Orleans finish. The char grilled oysters were better.

Reviews.Author: Allan G.
Reviews.Content: Hands down best food i had during my trip to New Orleans. We were hesitant on going the first couple times we passed by because the line scared us away but on our last day we decided to wait. Line wasn't that bad had to wait like 20-25 minutes. We had a group of three and had to share a large long table with another group of three which i didn't mind at all. We got two orders of boo fries. 1 dozen chargrilled Oysters and 1/2 dozen chargrilled Oysters, the "10 napkin Roast Beef Po Boy" and a marinated chicken Po Boy. These Boo Fries are a must if your going to Acme we could not get enough of these. The gravy is a perfect touch to these fries. Once we were done destroying the plate of fries they brought out the rest of our food. The "10 Napkin Roast Beef Po Boy" i got was really good, im not used to having Roast Beef in " debris" style but i enjoyed it, it was really filling too which i didnt get from other Po Boys in the area. I didn't try the marinated chicken po boy but i heard great things from my friend.  Im proud to say the first time i had ever had Oyster's was at Acme in New Orleans. I honestly thought that i wouldn't like Oysters since i'm not really a seafood guy. The only seafood i really eat is shrimp and even then im not the biggest fan. But this changed my mind about Oysters. Dont let the line scare you if you want to try Acme. Its worth it. Only regret i have from my trip is only going to Acme once.

Reviews.Author: S V.
Reviews.Content: Friendly greeting and casual atmosphere!! That is exactly what I needed after long drive with three kids.  Po'boy had a good amount of small size shrimp.  Beware the cocktail sauce has a good helping of horseradish...don't over apply.

Reviews.Author: Diana S.
Reviews.Content: What to eat: a mouthful of the raw oysters literally made me feel like I was swimming in the fresh, crisp ocean! What to drink: please please please! Do not turn down their local beer. I had something recommended of my awesomely friendly oyster bartender, and it did not disappoint. I would come back here just for the beer.Service: friendly, like you're in the south :). Tot

Reviews.Author: Liza P.
Reviews.Content: Don't let the long line dissuade you from eating here; it's well worth the wait! I tried the chargrilled oysters, and they were amazing. My only regret is not ordering more of them. The fried crawfish tails and fried crab claws were also delicious, but maybe could have used a little less breading so you could taste the seafood better. Not that I'm complaining. The breading they were coated in was pure fried goodness. The pecan cobbler brought the meal to a delightful end. The staff here are super friendly, and the service is quick once you've been seated. The noise level is pretty loud, but it works well with the whole feel of the place. I'd definitely recommend getting dinner here.

Reviews.Author: Whitney J.
Reviews.Content: Oh no!  I've never felt like such a stupid tourist!We waited in line well over an hour to eat here.  This was a huge mistake.  The food was ok, the service was ok, but absolutely nothing was good enough to wait for.  We had raw oysters, char grilled oysters, hush puppies, oyster po boy, crab cakes, hush puppies, cole slaw and potato salad.  There was nothing particularly great or terrible.The redeeming quality was the price. Our meal was not overly expensive.The oysters at dragos are better with less of a wait.  Do yourself a favor and do not wait to eat here.

Reviews.Author: Allen C.
Reviews.Content: Pretty much any time of the day, you're gonna see a long line coming out of this place. If you want a table, expect a long wait. But if you're a solo traveler or just with one other person, just sit at the bar and you'll get seated right away without having to wait at all. I did see a brief window where there was no one in line (though the entire restaurant looked packed) around 4pm, so if you're down for eating a really late lunch or really early dinner, maybe that's the time to go.While most people come here to try the oysters, I actually came here because I was told they have some amazing po boys here. I tried the soft shell crab po boy, which comes with a side of fries. Despite the large and awkward shape of the crab pieces, it's actually not hard to hold all of it into a sandwich, and tastes really great when dressed.Service could be better at the door. They seem to be kinda rude to the people who are waiting in line because tourists always look for ways to just walk in and take a seat. Service inside is really fast and really nice though. Refills are free for non-alcoholic drinks, and I noticed that the bartender always got refills ready for customers as soon as they looked like they were about to finish their current glass.If I'm ever in NOLA again I'll definitely come by again to try the oysters.

Reviews.Author: Sonja C.
Reviews.Content: We sat at the bar here and engaged in playful banter with Maurice the Oyster Shucker  We learned the difference between the raw and the chargrilled oysters.The Shrimp Po' Boy was amazing! The Crab Cake was OK, but the remoulade sauce made it.  We recommend this place for fresh oysters and Po' Boys!

Reviews.Author: Abby T.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled oysters -- best thing I ate on my whole trip. The long line out the door was definitely worth it, especially because there was a jazz band playing in the street outside.

Reviews.Author: LA F.
Reviews.Content: We came here because my husband cousin can't stop talking about this place. She said if she could eat here everyday she would. She recommended the chargrilled oysters and fried soft shell crabs omg she is so right it was best we ever had in Louisiana. The long wait tells you have great the food here. We waited for so long to be seated but its all worth it. Hush puppies, potato fries, fresh oyster, bread pudding for dessert hmmm it was all good. My mouth waters thinking about it now. I can't wait for our next trip back to new orleans. I wish we have Acme here in Tucson.

Reviews.Author: Kate G.
Reviews.Content: Big fun, good food. Crowded and expect to wait during high tourist season. There's lots of great oyster places, so you don't have to go to this one. But you should stop at least once. Their soup is amazing.

Reviews.Author: Catherine L.
Reviews.Content: This is a late review. I visited NOLA back in April. This was on my list of restaurants I wanted to try. I was not disappointed. *Char-grilled oysters were orgasmic*Sampler with gumbo, jambalaya, red beans and sausage was perfect. SO GOOD. I miss it. I didn't expect to like it... but I loved everything*Great service!*Strangely dark interior. It was pretty dark in there from what I remember... I felt like a little more lighting would have been nice. *If you are visiting NOLA you must eat here. ~ if you live there?! Lucky you. It's still yummy.

Reviews.Author: Jeff S.
Reviews.Content: We went to the French Quarter location. Dont let the very long line deter you from hitting this landmark up. The food was very good. Had the Craw Puppies, Chargrilled Oysters, Boo Fries, and the Peace Maker Po-BoyCraw Puppies - Very tiny order. Very good tasting. Chargrilled Oysters - World famous and def worth the purchase. I wish we ordered more then just a dozen! Boo Fries - Pretty good, but I would not get these again. Peace Maker Po-Boy - Very good po-boy. I would get this again because it was very good, but I did have a better Po-Boy from a different place. Hope this helped!

Reviews.Author: Emily B.
Reviews.Content: Not impressed.  My father cooks better Creole/seafood and he's a Yankee.  Service was not good, seated at a long table with a family that had been there.  No big deal, it was just myself and husband.  Prior to our order being taken I let them know were need separate checks,  as my husband's meal needed to be expenses for work.They do not do separate checks, however if you want to sit at seperate tables, that's allow and you can get seperate checks...  Uh, you cant be serious? Yep, she was.  We waited upwards of 45 minutes for two po-boys and while several tables that were seat after us were served main dishes of fried fish, ect.  I dont mind waiting typically but we'd just flown in and hadn't ate all day (not their fault) but if it is going to take that long, at least warn your customers.  Food wasn't anything to rag about if you know what good food is.  High priced for what we got.  Good luck.

Reviews.Author: Ben L.
Reviews.Content: This is the first place I wanted to visit when I came to New Orleans, this and Cafe du Monde. The place itself is super casual, nothing fancy just good affordable blue collar seafood. I came on a Saturday around noon and the wait was 30 mins, not terrible really.The food:Chargrilled Oysters- I thought both oyster dishes were just OK. The chargrilled was salty and all I tasted was cheese, the oyster is too mild in flavor. yelp.com/user_local_phot…Fresh, Iced Oysters- No wonder they are so cheap, the oyster, while big, don't offer a lot of flavor. The cocktail sauce was excellent though. yelp.com/user_local_phot…Boiled Crawfish- it was tad spicy and it had nice flavor but it is so much work for such little meat lol yelp.com/user_local_phot…Jambalaya- seasoned rice with smoked sausage and chicken. I really liked their jambalaya a lot, it was more wet than I expected it to be but the flavors were great, highly recommend. yelp.com/user_local_phot…Fried Peace Maker Po-boy- Golden fried oysters and shrimp, seasoned to perfection with Tabasco infused mayo. I liked this dish but I didn't love it. The bread kinda bothered me, it wasn't stale but felt kinda stale. The shrimp was good but the oysters were great. I say stick with the oyster po-boy instead. yelp.com/user_local_phot…Side order of red beans and rice with grilled smoked sausage. I don't see the appeal to this dish, even though southerners love it. I thought it was, dare I say, too simple? yelp.com/user_local_phot…

Reviews.Author: Andrew C.
Reviews.Content: You know when you had those dreams about oysters and they were gigantic and you didn't know if you could survive because they were chasing you through the water? Me neither.The oysters here are: large. fresh. a mouthful. delicious. worth the wait.Everything else: Meh. Crawfish etouffee and gumbo looked literally like the exact same thing. Literally. Crawfish po boy was decent but the bread was not good. Crab finger appetizer comes out looking amazing and plentiful, but you realize that they piled on the crab claws on top of a large piece of bread. Waitstaff at the bar was nice and friendly as they were shucking the oysters.You'll see a line. Don't be too intimidated. Grab a drink and enjoy the new orleans atmosphere!

Reviews.Author: Sean P.
Reviews.Content: Good food, but expensive, small portions.  They don't split checks.PROs:Food is deliciousRight off Bourbon street (convenient location)"Famous"CONs:Expensive for Small portionsAlways a wait to get in (but not too long)Expect to spend between 14 and 20 for your lunch.They don't split checks.It was credit card only the day I was here.An $8 bowl of gumbo was a shallow snack.  Delicious but small.Raw oysters were good but standard fare for any decent oyster place.

Reviews.Author: Vijay P.
Reviews.Content: Acme Oyster House is the quintessential establishment for dining in NoLa.  This is a MUST place for enjoying everything that NoLa has to offer.  From the Red beans and rice, Poe Boys, Jambalaya, and shrimp/crawfish étouffée, its all good.  The charbroiled oysters was not as good at Dragos though...Overall another must try embellishment.

Reviews.Author: Tara G.
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience! There was a line of only about 4 groups when we got there at about 1pm on a Friday. So we only waited about 10-15 minutes. The service inside was fast and friendly. We got the fries with gravy and charbroiled oysters as apps to share. Both were divine. Then I got a soft shell crab po-boy. It was to be expected, kind of a standard po-boy with good flavor but nothing different than you would expect. The cocktails were great - the blue blood martini was a real treat.This was definitely one of the best meals we had in NOLA.

Reviews.Author: Amberli P.
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely delicious and the line around the block can vouch for that. We got there before it opened and still had to wait in line but it was well worth it.The food was delicious and the wait staff and service was really good. The only thing I didn't love was that we sat at a large table with another noisy party (I'm pretty sure they were hungover from the night before). But even that couldn't take away from the deliciousness that was the food. This place is definitely worth going to. Next time I'm in New Orleans I plan on stopping in again. (:

Reviews.Author: Cindy T.
Reviews.Content: MMMMM SO GOOD. I love RAW oysters! My friends and I had kind of a difficult time finding some good, fresh oysters in NOLA. (coming from Seattle, we know a good one, when we see/taste one). But on the day before leaving, my friend and I came here for a early dinner, and so happy we were able to! Also, there was no line when we went - around 5-530ish, so best times is probably mid-late afternoon to avoid dinner or lunch rush. We ordered two dozen of their raw oysters. Yup..we each had 12, AND ordered the oyster po-boy. Can't get enough! Anyway, needless to say, probably one of the better places to-go to for oysters. Not really a fan of the charbroiled oysters (since I feel like you can't even taste the oyster with all the stuff layered on top). The poboy was excellent...wish we had po-boys back home! Definitely try to stop by here if you're visiting NOLA!

Reviews.Author: Angeline M.
Reviews.Content: So this is my first time in Nola and I'm here for work so i have limited time to see the sites...I wanted my first meal to be amazing and local.  My hotel was on Poydras so I wanted somewhere near by that I could walk to.  After looking feverishly through some yelp reviews, talking to my bartender and cab driver it sounded like Acme was the place for me.  I am traveling alone so I wanted somewhere casual with a great experience and did I find it at Acme!  It's also in the French Quarter so I could kill two birds with one stone. There was a long line but I decided to just get in it but as a party of one I was sat immediately.  From what I could tell the line was moving pretty quickly and the hostesses did a great job of wrangling the people.They sat me right at the oyster bar and I had the pleasure of having Michael "Hollywood" Broadway, Master Shucker of 33 years at Acme, take care of me.  I have his business card to prove that is legitimately his name. He's been featured on the Travel Channel, TLC, Food Network whenever they come to New Orleans and talk oysters. What a great person to meet! He was very helpful to a first timer and I've never met anyone more passionate about oysters and his job.  So refreshing.  I ended up getting the Charbroiled Oysters - yum! The sauce that came on it was amazing and they give you bread with it to soak it up.  Then I couldn't decide between the gumbo and the jambalaya so Michael recommended this New Orleans combo that was like a sampler platter of everything you should try - cup of shrimp gumbo, jambalaya, andoullie sausage and dirty rice and beans.  It was the perfect combo.  I do have to say it was a tad more bland than I thought it was going to be but the overall experience was so great I didn't really care bc it was still really delicious especially compared to those "southern cooking" food trucks we have in Los Angeles...  Amateurs. Also I had 2 beers and they were $4 each... Whaaaaaat?!? That's practically free.  My master shucker was appalled when I told him the cost of a good beer in LA (the "other" LA as he said).Overall a fantastic first night in town dinner for this solo traveler and I will definitely be going back if I ever return to Nola.  It's officially a favorite place of mine.

Reviews.Author: Sherry M.
Reviews.Content: In our Smoked Oyster comparison... Dad preferred theirs to Felix's. I thought the were both great, and different. Barb prefers Felix as you can taste more of the smokey flavor.  I enjoyed the crawfish boils, and made a mess of the bar and myself... Happily. Our bartender was spewed and attentive, with a very pretty voice.  I think I may go graze there again this afternoon, reflecting on Yelp made me hungry!

Reviews.Author: Erika W.
Reviews.Content: Fresh raw oyster here.But definitely go to Felix.s for their chargrilled oysters!

Reviews.Author: China D.
Reviews.Content: Phenomenal jumbalaya and chargrilled oysters. I did not like oysters until today!!! The french bread was alright and the shrimp po boy was great but not mind blowing. Helpful and kind waitstaff. I will be back for more chargrilled oysters!

Reviews.Author: Joni R.
Reviews.Content: Be forewarned...This place opens at 11am. The line is out the door by 12:00. But please don't let that deter you. Here's a tip: visit solo or with 1 other person so you can sit at the bar. The service is faster..and you wanna get your food fast here trust me. I'm chatting with other folks in the line for about 5 minutes and my name is called. I have a seat at the bar, greetings all around, place my appetizer/drink order and begin to soak it all in. Acme is not big at all but somehow I thought it was. Long bar along the left wall, several tables with chairs on the right. Big screen tv's with various games on..I'm watching the FIFA Cup Series. When I'm dining solo, my strategy is to try everything I want and share. That way I get to sample different items, meet new people and share the love. I started with sausage/ chicken jambalaya. It was divine! Taste lime the one my cousin makes..not too spicy, no tomatoes that I can see. Color was a dirty brown, plump rice with bits of sausage and green onion every so often. Next came the oysters. You have got to try these. Fresh, juicy oysters cooked in the half shell with butter, wine topped with a crunchy parmesean cheese crust...dead. sop up some of that sauce with a piece of bread and ohhhhh!  I happily shared with the guy next to me and he polished them off with the same feelings of ohhhhh that I had. Finally, my po boy came in all its glory. Let me just say they are more than generous with the seafood. Lightly breaded oysters and shrimp perfectly fried, crisp lettuce, between a soft Italian bread bun. Mmmm.. it was heaven! Then the spicy Tabasco mayo gets in on the action and amps up the flavor of the whole sandwich. So good!  I couldn't eat it all but I stuffed those last 2 oysters in my belly. Couldn't let those puppies go to waste. So for 1 beer, cup of jambalaya, 1/2 doz of grilled oysters and a po boy my total came up to $34. Not bad at all. Get in there you all and eat!

Reviews.Author: Ryan L.
Reviews.Content: Everyone LOVES this place. But if I'm going to wait in line, the place better be really, really good. Luckily, I didn't have to wait in line! I had some special access which got us right in. For that, I'm thankful.So, full disclosure: I don't eat wheat and finding options in the South was a bit difficult. It certainly was at this place. The food was good, but I wouldn't say it was amazing. The place is busy and the food kind of looks like it was prepared and plated in a hurry. So maybe check out the menu here carefully if you're on a restrictive diet. And maybe check this place out if you want to experience what the masses are experiencing.

Reviews.Author: Edward W.
Reviews.Content: We arrived right when it opened on a Saturday morning and the 1st seating had already finished. We proceeded to wait 50 more minutes until they could seat our group of 8. For each group of 4, we had 1 order of chargrilled oysters, raw oysters, seafood platter, and medley.chargrilled oysters - the cheese masked the oyster flavor, but still deliciousraw oysters - best oysters I've ever had. no fishy taste.seafood platter - fried fish, oyster, shrimp, hush puppies. All the seafood was fried to perfection.medley - jambalaya, gumbo, rice and beans, sausage. We probably could have skipped this entree and ordered another seafood platter.Although the chargrilled oysters were delicious, if you like how oysters taste I'd recommend ordering more raw oysters. The food came surprisingly fast and we devoured it all within 20 minutes. When we left, the line must have had at least 50 people in it.

Reviews.Author: Phillip D.
Reviews.Content: The wait was very long and although the food was good, not sure if the establishment lived up to the hype.  The waiter also forgot our oysters and was not very apologetic about it.If you are into oysters, then this is the place to be, but I am sure you can find other restaurants with good low country cuisine that is just as good without the wait!!

Reviews.Author: Jessica K.
Reviews.Content: Dont be daunted by the long line - its worth the wait! Grab a drink at a neighboring bar and prepare yourself for what is pretty awesome cajun food and the best blackened oysters ive ever had! If you can, try and sit at the oyster bar and watch those guys shuck the shell while having a full conversation with you, that takes skill! The jambalaya was alright to me but I love love love the red beans and rice, and im connessuier of red beans and rice!

Reviews.Author: Jessica L.
Reviews.Content: Craw puppies w/ honey horseradish sauce? Yes, please! We had oysters here in late May. A little worried that it is so off season. They tasted local, not northern (no brine). But they had super deep cups and were not spawny at all. Not milky sweet like when in season, but not bad either. Hit the gulf coast oyster spot!

Reviews.Author: Rebecca T.
Reviews.Content: The first meal I had when I arrived in Nola. I came for work in November and this was the first on my list to try. I didn't have to wait very long as I was eating by myself and sat at the bar. I had the: - fresh shucked oyster: these were fresh and firm. They weren't great but are worth a try. They are def different in taste and texture than oysters from the SF bay area. -chargrilled oysters: These were really good, not amazing however. - jambalaya, gumbo, red bean plate: this was okay, nothing to write home about. Ambiance was okay, service was okay. I think this was more of a tourist attraction than a great restaurant. I probably wouldn't come back here if I was in Nola, but I'm glad I got to try it as everyone mentions Acme when visiting Nola.

Reviews.Author: Livvy O.
Reviews.Content: Everyone told me to check this place out. It was a bad start but ended well. It started out bad as there was a long line to get in! To make it worse we had to wait out by the trash and it was drizzling! Almost lost my appetite!  We didn't wait too long - maybe 15-20 minutes.  Except, I was upset because the couple in back of us went before us and we were also a couple.  They have optional bar seating if you want any available seat but they ended up seating us right next to them!! They have to better organize their seating waiting list. Well, I soon got my appetite back! I ordered the fish and shrimp platter. I've never had oysters so I figured I'd try it - I orders half a dozen of the char-grilled. Very good - I think it was cooked in garlic and butter. The shrimp and fish were average but since this is my first time trying oysters; I can't really compare. I also had a side of red beans and rice - yummy.  I could live on rice and beans! Prices were reasonable and the atmosphere was casual.  They had some small tables and long dining hall tables you share with other groups. It wasn't too bad but we were on the end.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly S.
Reviews.Content: When I walked in, I was pretty sure I just time warped into a 1990's Bennigans in a sketchy part of town but that didn't stop me from ordering a dozen of freshly shucked oysters, a dozen chargrilled oysters, a plate of fries, and two Purple Hazes like I owned the joint. The boy was pretty sure I over-ordered, but I had read the reviews and everybody was absolutely correct. Acme Oyster House will always leave you wanting more.The locally harvested, raw oysters were on point! Never in my life have I had such plump, juicy, sweet oysters. And at $13 for a dozen...I should have ordered at least a dozen more! No fancy mignonette or cocktail sauce is needed here. A good splash of lemon allowed me to enjoy all of the bi-valve power in their natural state. The boy is not as much of a raw oyster fan as I am but he threw back the chargrilled oysters down like a champ. How could you not love anything drowning in a butter and cheese sauce? Service is not the friendliest but they are efficient but after two beers, I did not even  notice!I stopped in at 5 pm on a Wednesday with no line in sight but when I left it was around the block. Plan accordingly!

Reviews.Author: Margaret Z.
Reviews.Content: I don't think I can eat oysters from anywhere other than New Orleans anymore. I came to Acme twice during my vacation in NOLA. Both times, I was seated extremely quickly - the first because I came during a weekday in the afternoon, and the second due to pure luck. I went on a weekend evening the second night and was quoted about 2 hours to wait... fortunately we only had a party of 2 and were able to snag seats at the bar within 15 minutes of waiting. If you have a party of 3+, prepare to wait a couple hours. There is a huge variety on the menu so even if you aren't all about seafood, there are still options available. The chargrilled oysters were... interesting. I'm glad I tried them, but they were too rich for my tastes. It's basically oysters baked in butter and parmesan cheese. On the other hand, the raw oysters are HUGE and juicy - definitely the best I've ever had. The jambalaya was also extremely flavorful... a little pricey for the portion price but definitely worth it. "Boo fries" (fries topped with gravy and cheese) were a good starter, but nothing to rave about - I wish the fries had been hotter and crispier but they were already cold when they got to our table. Drinks are strong and well-priced (though I am used to DC alcohol pricing). Highly recommend the Honey Do (like whiskey sour but with honey infused). The staff is friendly and prompt and we had some great conversations with the servers working the bar. Overall - loved eating here and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Author: Fred R.
Reviews.Content: Acme Oyster House........some may ask, "need you say more?", I say, damn it YES!!!  What a place, same crew with me as with our visit to Verona.  Tonight we dined in "family fashion" and yes it was enough!  Tonights feast consisted of a cold pitcher of beer, chilled raw oysters, the chargrilled oysters, the New Orleans Medley, Fried Soft Shell Crab Platter, and the New Orleans Bread Pudding.  This little Oyster joint has a lot to offer everyone (except for kids) the restaurant is air conditioned nicely and the ambience is very lively, much like its city surroundings.  The employees are very in tune with the draw and the need to feel the aim to please.  As you walk in, the shucking  team is busy at work opening the delightful little morsels of pleasure and sets the tone for the high flow of foot traffic that consist of the patrons and the servers.  The music is loud and hair pulling, enough of a mix to keep any generation tapping their toes and their forks as they indulge in brew of their choice.  As for our selection, it left everyone at the table satisfied and ready for more; so much so, that we, in fact did order more oysters.   These little buggers were so fresh and tasty that two of the three of us (really they were fearing the idea of eating them) fell in love with the half heart melters.  On ice or grilled the Oysters are a MUST for any vistor.......IF YOU THINK OR EVEN KNOW YOU DON'T LIKE OYSTERS, I DON'T CARE, YOU MUST TRY ACME OYSTERS.   The Gumbo was so inviting and  smooth that it made me feel guilty that I didn't just order a bowl to my own.  The soft crab was prepared to melt in your mouth and it did!  We all devoured the two naked crustaceans with a verve of starvation.  Finally the New Orleans Bread Pudding was a shameful bowl of pleasure, with every spoonful you curse yourself for eating so much during the main coarse, that you wish you could have another bowl.  The beauty of the portion is the foresight of the maker to portion it in a small bowl in order to entice you to come and come again!   Yes, we are tourist of the first degree and yes, we are foodies as well, but one thing I can tell you is I know flavor and also the fact that my wife and daughter were able to walk away feeling sated, especially after eating (the feared) oysters, proves that Acme definitely knows what they are doing.

Reviews.Author: Ariel H.
Reviews.Content: Their chargrilled oysters are amazing like everyone else said.  The only regret is that we did not order more.Other dishes like the fried shrimp/fish plate and crawfish étouffée were good / decent for what they were.  But go for the oysters - they will blow your socks off. Pros:- amazing chargrilled oysters!!! - efficient and friendly service Cons: - line is too long (there are other places in the French quarter that also have good chargrilled oysters, so not necessarily worth the wait)- the bread that comes with the oysters are a little stale

Reviews.Author: Lady G.
Reviews.Content: This review is from my memory from my previous trip, not my most recent to NOLA.  I remember it as a little dirty and no big deal food wise.  The staff seemed tired and fed up.  I know how a restaurant can get better staff or a great new chef but we looked in and it still seemed rushed service and a little dingier.  No thanks.

Reviews.Author: Justin L.
Reviews.Content: I came here for lunch, and had the oyster poboy along with a half dozen oysters.  There was seriously nothing to write home about.  This place is way over-hyped.  I was very disappointed with the mediocre cocktail sauce served with my oysters, and immediately after my half dozen here, I went to Felix's and had a half dozen there...Acme's oysters paled in comparison to those available at Felix's.

Reviews.Author: Lora V.
Reviews.Content: As usual the wait was long the restaurant was packed and the tables were really small!The food was good not bad I just think the wait is to long for stuff you can get other places and have more room to roam a bit.  Service was good we had to wait a long time for the grilled oysters.I don't think I would wait in line for this again...

Reviews.Author: Jessie H.
Reviews.Content: Best Oysters Ever! Must visit this place if you come to French Quarter area of New Orleans. There seems to always be a line for this place so come during off times. I came around 2. The place was still packed!

Reviews.Author: Debbie D.
Reviews.Content: Second time back in New Orleans and second time back at the ACME OYSTER HOUSE. This place is fantastic on the tummy. I was first drawn to this restaurant because of the oyster eating competition on Man versus Food tv show. But when I got here I realized that not only do they have fresh oysters, their GRILLED OYSTERS is to DIE FOR. Like it is seriously a must order! The crawfish here was super tasty we started with 4 pounds and ordered more. Im not a fan of the jambalaya... but i could eat those soft shell crabs forever! I'll see you again Acme Oyster House!

Reviews.Author: Christian H.
Reviews.Content: The grilled oysters are very good.

Reviews.Author: Jacqueline D.
Reviews.Content: This would be put on my list of "if you've tried it once then that's good enough." Their raw oysters are a lot better than their charbroiled oysters, personallyI visited in the winter when it was windy and freezing so there wasn't really a line *high five*I don't know if people go here after getting drunk on bourbon street (which is why it's so highly rated) but I've had better oysters than at this "oyster house." On the bright side, the environment is fun and the service is good!

Reviews.Author: David H.
Reviews.Content: A bit pricey, but still the best around. Whether you get the raw oysters or charbroiled, you can't go wrong. The charbroiled is prepared in a buttery, garlic sauce sprinkled with cheese which makes you taste buds cheer with pleasure. Our waiter was good even though there's always a wait to get in and he was busy with a bachelor party next to us. We also had the fried crab clams and fried crawfish. That plus a few beers and it was like heaven.

Reviews.Author: Randy M.
Reviews.Content: Acme is a good spot to venture to off Bourbon. The bar seating is nice as you watch the staff shuck oysters right in front of you. We enjoyed the laid back atmosphere of Acme and the friendly staff. The oysters were fresh and good. The sauce was nice and we enjoyed the raw plate with horse radish and hot sauce. The sides we had were good and the place is fairly priced. We ended with a plate of Voodoo Shrimp. It is a good sized helping of addictive gulf shrimp in a spicy honey glaze! Get these!

Reviews.Author: H C.
Reviews.Content: The baked oysters here were so good!  Well worth the wait.  Everything else we ordered--gumbo and raw oysters--was just okay.

Reviews.Author: Wesley C.
Reviews.Content: Acme Oyster House is a New Orleans classic and upon my trip back to the Crescent City it was the first place I had to stop. My wife had never been to NOLA and I was determined to show her a good time. We ate and drank our way through the city in three days. When we arrived to New Orleans I decided to take her to a New Orleans staple and show her a tried-and-true New Orleans dining experience. So when we got there the line was long, as expected. The street smelled of sewage, as expected, And the people were drinking in the street and ready to eat and party, duh! But experiencing all of this was experiencing the essence of the French Quarter. Once we got seated we order probably one of our single favorite dishes that we ate the entire trip. The Char-grilled Oysters. Holy smokes they are delicious! Grilled oysters topped with cheese and lemon served pipping hot. The oysters are taste fresh and the cheese smooths out the flavor of the oyster. You cant go wrong with these oysters. I went with with the 1/2 and 1/2 platter for dinner and I must say that fried platter was great. I went with the shrimp and fried fish and I could barely finish the platter. So there may be slightly better places in New Orleans to get seafood. But there are few places that give you not only great food but also that New Orleans/French Quarter atmosphere that invites you to prepare your mind to experience the great city of New Orleans. Bon appitite and lets party!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Mario C.
Reviews.Content: The chargrilled oysters are to die for! The lines outside the venue are justified. ACME is definitely a must when you visit NOLA.

Reviews.Author: Cecilia P.
Reviews.Content: Got to New Orleans before 11am and saw people waiting outside till they opened for lunch. Parked and walked over to acme. Got in quickly since it was only 2 of us and it was right at 11am. Server came by quickly, took drink orders, ordered half of dozen raw oysters, and half a dozen chargrilled oysters. I've always loved raw oysters, I've tried chargrilled oysters a couple times, wasn't a big fan. Decided to give the one at acme a try since their chargrilled oysters were known. Chargrilled oysters were good, but I wasn't amazed. I'll always be a big fan of raw oysters. For lunch I ordered the soft shell crab, which was delicious! My boyfriend got a crawfish po boys, he said it was good, never been a fan of po boys. Overall def a place worth trying when visiting New Orleans. If you like chargrilled oysters than you'll probably love acme's. Soft shell crab is huge and good!

Reviews.Author: Bobby B.
Reviews.Content: Charles H. said it all. It's simple enough to understand. The food was not worth the hype. I'd rather go across the street to Felix where the line is short or non-existent and the oysters are large. Where I can order the same dish and get a larger version, cheaper.And If this is not long enough, then please, go shove the other reviews up your ass., M.

Reviews.Author: K P.
Reviews.Content: Great oysters! Yay.The line was out the door but I guess we got lucky because we were seated within 5 minutes. Service was timely and friendly.We had char grilled and raw oysters. The char grilled were ok, the oyster flavor was lost in the cheese and butter. However, those aren't bad flavors.The dozen raw were gigantic! Mammoth oysters I tell you.We also had the Boo Fries. Took me back to high school days. Chips n gravy with cheese sprinkled in too.

Reviews.Author: Jerry Y.
Reviews.Content: We were there yesterday during lunch time. Many people waited outside as usual. It has been one of my favorite restaurant since last year. The raw oyster there made me keep eating and cannot stop at all, also the cocktail. Love it.

Reviews.Author: Shy A.
Reviews.Content: Oysters are a must when you visit NOLA. You can go practically anywhere but Acme has to be experienced at least once. Is it busy and should you just expect to wait? Yes. Should you expect delicious food? Absolutely. Grab a dozen iced and chargrilled oysters and a Purple Haze beer. You won't be sorry. The oysters are huge and meaty, not as sweet as we are used to back on the West coast but they were buttery and fresh. We sat at the bar, which to me is always the prime spot. You're elbow to elbow with the next guy but you get a show and get to start up interesting conversations with the staff.

Reviews.Author: Amber D.
Reviews.Content: We found the famous Acme Oyster House during a slightly-buzzed wandering adventure in the Quarter. I knew from friends that this place was worth a stop, and often attracted a line, so I hopped in behind the few others that had congregated there around 4:30. The wait was short, and we sat at the bar. The service was great, our oysters were good, but there's one glaring mistake that I can't overlook: my oysters had shell pieces in them.Not just one oyster, but about 3. Choking on pieces of shell at a famous oyster house is a pretty hard thing to overlook, but the talkative (in a good way) staff, delicious tasting oysters, and quick service made it still a good experience. Hopefully it was a one-off.

Reviews.Author: J M.
Reviews.Content: So GOOD!!!  I had the charbroiled oysters and they were so delicious!!!  We also tried crawfish for the first time and they even teach you how to eat them. The food was good and we were seated right away.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca D.
Reviews.Content: The oysters lived up to the hype! I split the dozen chargrilled oysters with a friend and we also order fried crawfish tails to share. Both were really great dishes and filled us up. The oysters are chargrilled with butter, garlic, and parmesan cheese, and they were so good! For dessert, go with the banana foster cheesecake - amazing!! We got here at 6pm on a Sunday with a party of 6 and we had to wait an hour to get in! I wouldn't skip out on this place because of the wait, I would just plan to go for a late lunch or early dinner instead.

Reviews.Author: Kristie A.
Reviews.Content: How do I convince you to wait in line for this?! Because you have to come here if you've never been!I got lucky because I was by myself and I got seated right away. I sat at the bar so I got to see them work on the oysters. This adds to the experience so I highly recommend it.I got chargrilled oysters-- let me tell you, they were SO GOOD! I've had chargrilled before and I've never had it the way Acme cooks it. It was covered with Parmesan cheese, butter, and all the goodness in the world. It was so good, I could have ate a whole dozen!I also had 2 oyster shooters without vodka. Basically I just ate fresh oysters. It was so fresh and their cocktail sauce is where it's at! It had a little kick to it but it complimented the oysters very well.Seriously, don't think twice. Wait in line. Have great oysters!

Reviews.Author: Gin Y.
Reviews.Content: The best thing here by far was their raw oysters on a half shell.  Normally, I don't like oysters because they don't taste very good when not fresh (and that's most of the time from my experience). But, with a little convincing, I tried out the raw oysters here. Let me tell you, the oysters were so fresh! They had a clean ocean taste to them. It complimented the horseradish and tobacco sauce so well. The horseradish sauce here really had a kick! The other items here weren't that memorable for me. We ordered their seafood gumbo and etouffee here.  I think we make it much better back in Houston. I found theirs was quite bland IMO. Their fried seafood was just meh as well. I didn't really think these were very fresh compared to their raw oysters. Even then, when they served us Oysters Rockefeller, they killed the oysters. I didn't like them as much cooked. So, moral of the story -- just save your money and order the raw oysters!

Reviews.Author: Marcus J.
Reviews.Content: Came here during my adventures in NOLA.  A few friends back home (NorCal) told me to come by here and have the fried oysters, so I said OOOOOOO-tay.Came by for lunch one day, and had to wait a little while (line out the door), but it was worth it.Once seated, we ordered a dozen each of fried and fresh oysters.  I'd never eaten oysters before, and fresh oysters just didn't appeal to me, so I stuck with the fried.  They definitely lived up to the hype.  Super good.  I coulda ate those all day.  The garlic cheese seasoning they cook them in was perfect.Also ordered the jambalaya and seafood gumbo.  Those were just meh.  Very average.  My grandmother made better gumbo.Oysters is 5 star.  Gumbo is 3 stars.  so average it out to 4 stars.

Reviews.Author: Laura M.
Reviews.Content: The food here is so good! We had fried craw dads, fried oysters, gumbo, jambalaya, and hush puppies. Everything was amazing! So fresh and fried just right. This place is really great for kids and we saw a lot of kids there so if you are visiting New Orleans with your family this is a great place to eat.

Reviews.Author: Lauren B.
Reviews.Content: I love oysters. I always have. I love shellfish of all kinds, frankly. So when I was in New Orleans recently and one of the people I was traveling with really wanted to try Acme, I was game. Obviously. We waited in the line outside (which was no big, by the way, moved super fast, and we made friends in line...bonus!) and were seated within less than 10 minutes of arriving. I figured a long line meant it's got to be delish inside. **Rubs hands together in excitement**Anyway. We are seated at one of the communal tables and order up some Hurricanes because we are loser tourists. They were excellent. We also ordered some chargrilled oysters. Those were really very good. Something about the heavy char worked really well with the lightness of the salty oyster. Win!Since we were starving from walking around on our cemetery tour, we also ordered the boo fries (fries covered in roast beef gravy and cheese) - really tasty. Exactly the sort of artery-clogging dish we wanted at the time. As for an entree, we wanted to try a little bit of everything, so our waitress suggested some sort of fried fish sampler platter. It had crawfish, white fish, and fried shrimp. I wasn't thrilled with this. I have had better. I just think it was a little too doughy...I can't even really put my finger on it. I just wasn't impressed and don't know that I would bother if I were to go back to NOLA. But for the chargrilled oysters and those Hurricanes, I might recommend it if there's no line. I will say the waitstaff was friendly, but it was hard to get her attention which is always a bummer, especially when your drink is empty...Meh. I wouldn't go out of my way to return, but wouldn't pass on this place either if you have your heart set on it.

Reviews.Author: Veronica L.
Reviews.Content: We rarely ever patronize a restaurant twice when we're visiting but the raw oysters here were so fresh and delicious we just had to return the next day. The queue was long as usual, but definitely worth the wait! We also had fried fish and medley gumbo which were equally good. The étouffée was just ok. Will we be back if we visit NOLA again? For sure!

Reviews.Author: Steve M.
Reviews.Content: Not a bog fan of fresh oysters but hanging with my friends and everyone else is a fan. The fresh ones were better than I remember so not sure if its the food or location. Also tried the chargrilled which I liked even better. I thought the menu was a little small but found the seafood etoufee really delicious and decent portion. We also had some crawfish but I was so full I just gave up. I thought service was really slow though we got in fairly quickly on Thursday night. Had to wait for drinks and other items. Overall a great experience and prices cheaper than it thought. Finished about $40 each before tip including a few drinks.

Reviews.Author: Angela S.
Reviews.Content: I understand the hype of the place if you like oysters but it was just okay... While some things were good (hence the three stars). The seafood gumbo had a bunch of small bite size shrimp (not sure if they're) deveined and there was no visible crab meat there. The charbroiled oysters were just okay but they smelled and appeared as if they were going to be amazing. Several different reviews at our table about the fish. The shrimp po boy also used the baby shrimp and was okay. Lastly the fried oysters had minimal seasoning and without the sauce they would have been/ were extremely bland.

Reviews.Author: Todd B.
Reviews.Content: Admittedly, we only went to one Oyster House, so I am giving this 4 stars with no basis for comparison.  This is not a 4 star restaurant in NOLA, but it is a 4 star Oyster House in my opinion, or at the least, a 4 star Po Boy.  Call it 3.5 if you want, but I am rounding it up.A negative about this place, as you'll read in many other reviews, is the lack of reservations and space, so you literally stand on line outside.  But don't fret, this is common (oyster house across the street does the same thing).  The line moves pretty quickly, though a lot of large parties come, which tends to slow up the works.  Anyway, there were maybe 8-10 tables in front of us, including a party of 10 or more, but we were seated within 30 minutes.During that time, we got some kind of blueberry martini (you can't bring in outside drinks, but you can get drinks at the bar while waiting and bring them back outside to the line - you gotta love NOLA).  Those were delicious.  Highly recommended.I'm not an oyster eater - my girlfriend is - but the purpose of this visit was to get a good po-boy.  She got a 1/2 shrimp 1/2 oyster and loved it.  I got a roast beef po boy.  Essentially, a roast beef sandwich made to look like a po boy.  Kind of made me wonder what makes a po boy a po boy.  Give me some au jus, and this would have been the perfect french dip sandwich.  Regardless, I don't care if this wasn't a po boy in the classic sense - this was an awesome sandwich.  Enjoyed every bite.The inside is a bit crowded and loud, but its NOLA, so that's what you get.  We were sitting at the oyster bar, so not the most comfortable location, but the inside is lively and pleasant and you can definitely have a good time here and a good meal.  Worth checking out.

Reviews.Author: Kristy S.
Reviews.Content: Holy moly everything was so salty! There was a line to get in (about an hour wait) so I expected great food. Oh Boy... So I ordered a dozen raw oysters ... They was so so. I ordered a cup of gumbo. Oh my it was decent but so salty. I then had a pound of crawfish ($9/lb!) which was salty inside and out, no spiciness either. (At home I can get crawfish cooked Cajun spicy garlic for $4/lb. ) I was disappointed. I also tried the shrimp po boy, jambalaya, grilled oysters.... They all taste like they're soaked in salt. This place is no good for your blood pressure I assure you that!! Service was ok. I would never ever come back here

Reviews.Author: Jenny M.
Reviews.Content: Acme was literally our first stop after dropping our bags off at the Hotel and a great way to start our eating extravaganza in the French Quarter.  There will be a line, but it moves fast and the oysters are fresh and the service attentive.  The difference between Acme and Felix is decor/ambiance mostly.  You have a strong sit at the bar feel, more pub like, at Acme, while Felix feels more like a diner.  At Acme, you can also get your name on the Wall of fame if you eat eat eat enough oysters to make you ... you get the idea...

Reviews.Author: Joe K.
Reviews.Content: My wife is from New Orleans. When we're in the quarter, we used to go to Felix's for oysters. No more. Acme is the best oyster house in town. I like "The Peacemaker" combo shrimp and oyster PoBoy, but everything I've eaten here is great. The crab cake appetizer is the best I've ever had. My perfect meal: crab cake, Peacemaker, a cup of seafood gumbo and a Barq's. (NOT the Coca-Cola product "Barq's Root Beer") When you're here, just ask for a Barq's. You'll see.

Reviews.Author: Mel T.
Reviews.Content: Came in with my parental units on a Monday night at almost 9 and there was still a line! I'm pretty sure they purposely have people line up outside just to make it look poppin' - because once we got inside (after about a 15 minute wait), the restaurant didn't seem that packed. The whole dining experience from wait to check only took about an hour. We ordered the chargrilled oysters, oysters on the half shell, chicken and andouille sausage gumbo, seafood gumbo, and seafood étouffée. The chargrilled oysters had a nice flavor to them but some were overly charred. The oysters on the half shell (gulf coast oysters taste kind of bland compared to the east coast ones I'm used to) didn't seem like they were cleaned properly, if at all. Every oyster had bits of sand and/or shell in them. The chicken and andouille gumbo was WAY salty. Not even the rice it came with was enough to balance it out. I tried my parents' étouffée and seafood gumbo and they were super salty too. The flavor of all three tasted almost the same. The saving grace was the fried crawfish tails we opted to order on the side. These were surprisingly perfectly salted. The one thing I did like about Acme was that they don't jip you on the oysters. If an oyster is super skinny, they'll throw in an extra one. I've never known any place back in NYC to do this. Pretty cool on their part. From my experience, I would say avoid Acme. But if you still really, really want to go to a touristy oyster house, go Felix's across the street. It's almost equally bad but there is no wait.

Reviews.Author: Ilya T.
Reviews.Content: I am as surprised as many of you might be to be giving such a tourist trap location 4 stars.... but this place really REALLY surprised us. We were in the area and feinding for Crawfish and were too lazy to cab it anywhere. Wait time (FYI: Wait line starts outside of the restaurant) was around 20 minutes to be seated for the 2 of us (parties of more than 2 had a longer wait time). We got 2 spots at the Oyster bar. Could not have been happier about that. Ordered:1) Half-Dozen Raw Oysters: (These were some of the largest oysters that we have ever had and possibly some of the best tasting ones as well. Very rich.....in fact so good that we got...2) ANOTHER Half-Dozen Raw Oysters (after we were done with our Crawfish) 3) 1 pound of Crawfish (each):  (The crawfish were solid. Mix of freshness and peppery goodness. After seeing us attempt to eat our first crawfish of the bunch, one of the Oyster shuckers laughed at us and took us to school on how to properly eat them... suck out the head first, then pop open the body.... we all had a good laugh... and a good meal)Beers on tap. Bloody Mary's poured strong. The Oyster Shuckers were the nicest and funniest people....mixed with the interesting people sitting next to us, made what we thought would be a casual Crawfish pig-out into a great experience with a really solid meal that hit the spot.

Reviews.Author: Pam M.
Reviews.Content: I tried the chargrilled oysters at Acme and Drago's, and Acme won hands down.  The oysters were better, with more of a smoky, chargrilled flavor.  And in spite of the long line at Acme, once we were in, the service was better at Acme than at Drago's. Even if you don't like raw oysters, these chargrilled ones will make you happy. From the first bite to the last drips of butter Parmesan oyster liquid, this was really good.

Reviews.Author: Benny K.
Reviews.Content: Fresh raw oysters and boiled crawfish - simply delicious! The queue may be long sometimes but it goes pretty quickly, it's worth the wait. Will definitely come back again when in town, IMO the best fresh oyster house in town!

Reviews.Author: Alex L.
Reviews.Content: Had lunch there today service and food was excellent!! Recommended to all! Raw Oysters so fresh and flavorful!!

Reviews.Author: Christina C.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled - yes.Raw - no.Chargrilled were plump, buttery, salty, delicious.Raw were shucked terribly (shell and sand in every bite), not cold enough, and too big - not a fan of gulf coast oysters at all. Had to fight to keep them down. Ordered a po boy- nothing to write home about.Ordered a Bloody Mary and didn't get it until after we paid the check. Most expensive meal we had in New Orleans and we were disappointed. Too many other good places to go to instead.

Reviews.Author: Xerxes N.
Reviews.Content: Definitely a great spot for oysters. If possible, try getting there by avoiding the nasty ass Bourbon Street so you don't feel like all nasty when trying to eat a good dinner.I must say, the raw oysters are one of the tastiest I've ever had. So so fresh! What's cool is that they have a wall of fame showing how many dozen people have eaten. Lots of 15 baggers with one person throwing down 31 dozen. Justin B, consider this a future challenge. Your 8 dozen is nothing to me. :)So the raw oysters were the app and I had the Fried Peace Maker Po Boy as my meal. It's golden fried shrimp and oysters covered in their special Tabasco and mayo sauce. The sandwich is pretty big and is pretty filling. It doesn't come with a side so I'd recommend loading up on appetizers.The place gets packed so expect a long wait outside. They'll only seat you if your entire party is with you so make sure all of your entourage is present.

Reviews.Author: Robin P.
Reviews.Content: My sister and I went here pretty much every day while last in NOLA in and it did not disappoint.The char-grilled oysters were delicious and the hush-puppies excellent.  You will have to wait in line to eat but even at its busiest was only about 15-30 minutes.  Definitely worth the wait.Keep in mind that your you dining as a group that they will only deliver one ticket so plan ahead.

Reviews.Author: Kristina W.
Reviews.Content: Long line and long wait. I was hoping that was an indication of how this place would be.The red beans and rice were bland. The fried shrimp po boy wasn't anything special.The bread pudding was great, best part of the meal.The restaurant was small and crowded, tons of action. The AC ceiling was leaking from the ceiling, even hitting one member of our party of 5 and the staff didn't blink an eye. Service was slow as well, but that seemed to be our sever, rather than an indication of the overall service in the restaurant.They couldn't separate checks which was a bummer, but we got it figured out.

Reviews.Author: Varun B.
Reviews.Content: This was the first place we went to after landing in NOLA.  Just couldn't get enough of a head start on the food frenzy.  Po boys galore.  The soft shell crab po boy was unbelievably delicious.  Hot. Crispy. Fresh.  Same goes for the shrimp and oyster po boy.  The fresh oysters are also the thing to get when you go there.  The guys that shuck the oysters over the bar counter are like machines, cranking out plenty more nice briny bites.The place was so good, we decided to go there a second time.  Got some different items...jambalaya, soft shell crab platter, gumbo, red beans and rice.  All really good stuff. Definitely satisfied all our cravings for the short trip.

Reviews.Author: Ariane R.
Reviews.Content: I will miss those Chargrilled Oysters of yours! Love it here. If you are visiting New Orleans this is the spot to go.

Reviews.Author: David L.
Reviews.Content: The line at Acme far outstrips those of its neighbors, making it a clear favorite of this part of Bourbon Street. We don't like oysters and chickened out on ordering the char-grilled ones that in hindsight look a lot tastier than any oysters I've ever tried. In addition, they have a great selection of traditional New Orleans dishes that we enjoyed, but it must be the oysters that justify the hype. The space is small and energetic. It's hard not to feel hurried knowing the length of the line behind you.

Reviews.Author: Marlene T.
Reviews.Content: It's worth the wait. I'm not a fan of their gumbo or jambalaya. If you mix the two, they're great together. Just not alone. The fried crawfish was ok; too much batter IMO.My review is only for the OYSTER lovers. Eat here. Grab a drink. Wait in line. Order the oysters. Order a lot. You will finish them. They are delicious and definitely best ones we tried in NOLA. We ate at Felix across the street as well. That was a mistake. Yes it is dive like, they are a bit faster, and there is normally not a long line. BUT, the oysters are no where near the same.

Reviews.Author: Michael F.
Reviews.Content: If you are in the quarter and want oysters it's worth a visit. They are always busy so expect a wait.  (It's the French Quarter)  Great service at the bar- casual atmosphereCharbroiled oystersRaw oysters Oyster po boysOyster shooters ,  Craw puppies

Reviews.Author: Kassi L.
Reviews.Content: We came here prepared to wait a really long time. However, since we were willing to sit at the bar, we were seated after just a few minutes. We also went at an off time (around 3, in between lunch and dinner) so that helped. We only ordered the raw oysters, chargrilled oysters, and seafood gumbo. All were super delicious. I would have given this place 5 stars, but the service wasn't all too great. I'm sure they get annoyed with tourists asking questions about how the line works, and it showed. Our server at the bar seemed a little annoyed too. No one was super rude, just not all that friendly. I know this place is in a touristy part of New Orleans, but the food is incredible. It'll definitely be on my list of places to go next time we come into town!

Reviews.Author: Kimberly M.
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan.  I prefer the one in Metairie as there are fewer tourists.  But this is usually a definite stop when I have friends in town staying in the Quarter.

Reviews.Author: Michael B.
Reviews.Content: When we were in line ( the line moved quickly) we met another family from Chicago who were regular customers they offered us suggestions on the menu. The smoked oysters were nothing short of amazing!! The raw oysters were very fresh we should have ordered a dozen. For dinner we had the peacemaker poorboy & the 1/2 & 1/2 plater with hush puppies great choice. The service was fast & friendly. I would definitely return

Reviews.Author: Hanan O.
Reviews.Content: Mmmmmmmmmmm soooo good we ate here about 4 xs in our trip. It was absolutely delicious!!! N don't let the line scare u it's completely worth it!

Reviews.Author: William C.
Reviews.Content: First time in NO, staff was nice, got seated quickly at a community table.Oysters were fresh and the chargrilled oysters were something I have not tried out before. They were great!The BEST thing I had in NO was here - GUMBO.Their gumbo has so much crab flavor and shreds of meat in it. I will most definately visit NO again and head straight here for the gumbo.

Reviews.Author: Christina Z.
Reviews.Content: If a restaurant with a line out the door or the fact that it was featured in Man vs. Food doesn't convince you I don't know what would.This is a must go to spot when you go to NOLA. The service is fast, great food, and nice atmosphere. Chargrilled oysters like you have never had them before! We also tried the fried crab claws, craw puppies, crawfish tails, and boo fries. You can't go wrong when you go here.

Reviews.Author: Yoori C.
Reviews.Content: Best oysters I've had in my life. Both on the half shell and chargrilled. We liked them so much that we ordered another half dozen of each after we had eaten the the rest of our meal of fried crawfish tails, gumbo, fried stuffed crab and jambalaya.Definitely worth the 45 minute wait during Mardis Gras, but I hear Felix across the street is also delicious. I just couldn't pass this up. Believe the hype!

Reviews.Author: Luis P.
Reviews.Content: The place opens at 11am, so do yourself a favor and dust yourself off the bedroom floor and get in line by 10:45 like my cousins and I do whenever we are in the Nola. Order yourself a pitcher or two, a dozen raw, a dozen BBQ, some mud bugs and some hush puppies. Perfect way to start the day. Come to think of it, kind of sounds like just like we end the day a few hours earlier as well!

Reviews.Author: Charles H.
Reviews.Content: WHO IN THE HELL WAITS IN LINE IN NOLA? For me, if it's not for Preservation Hall or Hansen's Sno Bliz no long queue is justifiable, and certainly not for Acme.  There are way too many competitive options.A NOLA NATIVE'S RANKING OF FRENCH QUARTER SEAFOOD-ERIES:1.  GW FINS - only open for dinner so no bargains, but the finest dining alternative;2.  FELIX'S - better than Acme and no lines; fortuitously it's across the street;3.  DESIRE - affordable, classic Vieux Carré atmosphere, old school wait staff;4.  RED FISH - lunch Prix Fixes less than $20, Brennan's quality, healthy choices;5.  CAFÉ SOULÉ - specializes in crab dishes, Antoine's family, classic atmosphere;6.  DEANIE'S - if you want a menu heavy on fried... uh... everything, huge portions;7.  MRB - if you can handle bar smoke the oyster & crawfish specials are a deal;8.  ROYAL HOUSE - best atmosphere, outdoor seating, but touristy & a tad pricey;DIVIDING LINE BETWEEN BEST & WORST: 9. New Orleans Hamburger & Seafood (a citywide chain; and that should tell you something about the bottom six!)10.  BOURBON HOUSE - good lunch prix fixe but the oysters are lame;11.  ACME - our classic oyster bar, but I'm a New Orlenian & don't wait in queue;12.  OCEANA - nasty dining room, wide but insipid menu, gougingly overpriced;13.  PIER 424 - ultimate tourist trap on Bourbon, you can do so much better;14.  RALPH & KACOOS - buses disgorge snowbirds here;15.  (& Dead Last):  COOP'S - there is absolutely nothing good to be said about it...

Reviews.Author: Alex N.
Reviews.Content: First time in NOLA, so had to stop by this place with all of it's rave reviews! We ended up coming again one more time before we left.I must admit, the 45 minute wait made me curious on how good the food could be. When we finally got it, we were seated right near where they make the chargrilled oysters. Mmm that sizzle...The chargrilled oyster were definitely the best in the french quarter! Their raw oyster were pretty good too. If I'm ever back in NOLA I'm stopping by just for them!As for their other items, nothing else really stood out. A slight disappointment, but at least they weren't what I came for. Overall, I'll give them props for beating their surrounding competition with those charbroiled oysters. Definitely the highlight of the food I had in NOLA.

Reviews.Author: Daniel G.
Reviews.Content: Ate here two different times and personally had a great experience. Chargrilled oysters were extra buttery and flavorful, the New Orleans Melody contained all the flavors one thinks of when they think of New Orleans, and the specialty drinks were on point! Great people watching spot from the second deck. I had to give it 1 less star because my friend got food poisoning (guessing it was a bad oyster). Stuff happens! :(

Reviews.Author: Jim M.
Reviews.Content: Every time I am in New Orleans I go to Acme.The Oysters are the best I think in the USA.I always order 2 dozen of fresh oysters.The only think that sucks is the long line outside.

Reviews.Author: Dan B.
Reviews.Content: Had a shrimp po boy sandwich.  It was late but not sure if it was just me, the alcohol or both but the bread felt stale.  The shrimp and the fixin's were good.  Had the jambalya rice and that was really good too.

Reviews.Author: Daniel W.
Reviews.Content: The oysters were not the best I've had in the area, the shuck was lazy and we got a bad oyster which should have been tossed.The crawfish was great, lots of flavor, all the way through the meat. The chargrilled oysters were really good, in my opinion the chargrilled were better than the charbroiled at Dragos.All and all I have this place 3 stars because for the wait and the lack of atmosphere, you expect the food at a place like this to be the main draw and it just didn't live up to the hype ( which was, to be fair, high).Good touristy spot to try, but that's about it.

Reviews.Author: Vera T.
Reviews.Content: Boy, was this place worth the 45 minutes spent in line outside! Delicious oysters and a must try - char-grilled oysters!!! Delicious, large (although our shucker at the bar told us they were small since it wasn't the right season for them, well, they looked big to me! :) and smothered with smoky and garlicky char.. yum! Also, their sausages are killer! We got bunch of small things to try and everything was to die for!!! Friendly service and if you get seated at the bar you will get personalized shucker that will be shucking oysters right in front of you! He'll answer all your questions if you have any and will make food-related helpful suggestions.If I ever go back to NOLA I will re-visit this place for sure!

Reviews.Author: Erik M.
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I've been to AOH. It's hard to understand how deep fried food could be so good until you try it. There's always a line outside of AOH but it's fast moving. I've been telling my wife that the food's good so we went there for lunch. So of course they spill water all over her and forget to give us a piece of fish. Other than that everything was good. When we get there we're a little pressed for time and want to get in and out. While waiting on our server someone drops a cup of water which splashes the side of my leg and all over my wife. We get a bunch of apologies and some napkins. When the waiter takes our order we get Oyster Remoulade and a Fried Seafood Platter. The waiter says we need to get the Chargrilled Oysters, so we do (we're really glad we did). The food comes out and the waiter says a piece of fish is missing and that he's working on getting it for us. It never gets to our table. We were in a hurry so we scarfed down our food, paid our tab and left. We thought the food was good and these mishaps don't represent their typical service.

Reviews.Author: Michael B.
Reviews.Content: The place always, always has a wait.  Which is pretty typical for all of the "must-try" touristy spots in NOLA.  That being said, this place truly is a must try.  If you are from anywhere but New Orleans you will not have chargrilled oysters like them make them here.  This is a very no frills type of place.  It's loud, it's filled with tourists, the chairs feel like they're about to break underneath you, but again, it's all worth it.  I wouldn't get anything but the chargrilled oysters, because everything else that I've tried here is mediocre at best, but the oysters are PHENOMENAL!

Reviews.Author: Lize C.
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing! We had never been in New Orleans and  we drove up from Houston to the Lana del Rey concert the weekend of April 25th. Our first stop was to walk around downtown and grab something to eat. I had looked online to see what places were worth visiting and this restaurant was on the list. We were dying to have some New Orleans crawfish but reading online, we found out that the quarter is not so great for crawfish. Instead, we settled on eating a good appetizer before the night started. I saw online there was a lot of great reviews for Acme so we decided to try this place out. We parked and walked towards the restaurant. Right away, we noticed there was a line of about 10 people standing outside. I was a little impressed to see there was actually a line - it has to be good, right?! We stood in line and because it was only two of us, we were able to get seated pretty quickly - before the 10 people. Right away, we agreed to try the oysters. We LOVE oysters. Little did we know, we would literally fall in LOVE. We are from Houston, so we've had our fair share of oysters but these were absolutely delicious. They were a decent size, not stale/hard, smooth coming off the shell. They were so fresh. We ordered 3 dozen! We were that in love. We also shared  the New Orleans Medley which was incredibly delicious! This entire meal was outright perfect! I would eat the same exact meal if I could go back right now!The restaurant itself is a little small and crowded which may drive people away but it's really not too bad and the food makes up for it! We sat at the bar so we didn't realize the restaurant was actually bigger until we had to go to the restroom which is at the back of the bar. it was a little odd to pass through the waters area to get to the other side of the restaurant/bathrooms.  it's at a great location too! The experience was amazing and this restaurant was great! When we make another trip up there, we will definitely be stopping here!

Reviews.Author: Kenneth P.
Reviews.Content: Food - Amazing- Chargrilled Oysters:  I've had nothing like this before.  It was like if you took everything amazing about a steak, and you added that into an oyster.  I would highly recommend a dozen of these.- Crawfish Etouffee:  Done very well!  Well balanced.  Creamy and spicy.  Goes well with garlic bread =D.Atmosphere - Busy- The place was jammed packed with a 30 minute line out the door.  The line moved quickly however.  Very loud environment inside, Fun and exciting feel.  Great meal or pre-nightlife.Service - Great!- I sat at the bar.  Bartender was very kind and even spent some time talking to us.  ** Highly recommended

Reviews.Author: Diana N.
Reviews.Content: Who goes to Acme Oyster house and orders a po' boy? Me! Boy, that was a big mistake. The po' boy was a huge disappointment. That bread was SO hard and stale I ended up just eating the protein inside. I think the menu even said it was a "famous" po' boy. Hmmm.I will say that the charred oysters are TOTALLY worth the wait in the line. The few times I have been, the wait wasn't too bad. Anything longer than 30 mins is too long for me... but we got a table within 20 minutes and the line does move pretty fast here. My friends enjoyed their dishes, but I really think the only thing I would recommend here are the oysters. Don't go to a oyster house and order anything else but oysters. That was my mistake. The char grilled oysters come out fresh and piping hot, you can even see the guy making them in one section of the restaurant. Don't forget to dip your french bread into the nice butter afterwards. So good.  Learn from my lesson and just stick to the basics when ordering.  P.S. The door person will catch some attitude with you. Not sure if it's a happening spot and they felt entitled, but I didn't think it was warranted especially since I was not inebriated like most folks waiting in line.

Reviews.Author: Melissa P.
Reviews.Content: Love this place! Me and my husbands first time here last week and enjoyed everything! We started off with NOLA's signature drink, hurricane. Taste just like juice, refreshing and is definitely a creeper!Charbroiled oysters were our most favorite! Parmesan buttery goodness with a splash of lemon that just melts in your mouth. We loved these so much we actually went back to have them again before we headed back home. Raw oysters were nothing like the oysters back home in Cali. They were different in texture and didn't have that seafood after taste. My husband only likes the really small oysters, these were a bit larger for him but he loved it. That says a lot because he is a picky eater. We also shared the soft shell crab platter which we also loved! The batter was so flavorful and the crab just added even more flavor. It came with a side of hush puppies that were also good. We tried the shrimp po boy. Didn't love it. It was just okay. The side of gumbo was pretty good though. Don't forget dessert! The pecan cobbler was AMAZING! I would recommend this place to everyone!

Reviews.Author: Ali W.
Reviews.Content: I love oysters.  Love, love, love.  The wait outside Acme Oyster House usually looks long, but it moves rather fast.  The restaurant is pretty big on the inside, so the turnover is fast.  Their chargrilled oysters have a butter-parmesan sauce on them that is absolutely delicious.  Their fried oysters are pretty good too!  I can easily eat three dozens of their oysters by myself.  I am not bragging.  I am just telling you how good they are.

Reviews.Author: Zeb L.
Reviews.Content: Char-grilled oysters

Reviews.Author: William H.
Reviews.Content: By far the greatest place so far I've eaten in New Orleans. It's amazing. Try the oysters shooters. Wow. Bloody Mary's are out of control. And the soft shell crab is to die for. We love this place!!

Reviews.Author: Alex E.
Reviews.Content: The raw oysters are excellent and worth a dozen if you're into that.The char grilled are TO DIE FOR.

Reviews.Author: Dara M.
Reviews.Content: My first meal in New Orleans, and I was not particularly impressed. Must be a me problem? Luckily, we went at an off time and only waited in line about 3 minutes before we were seated at the bar.Started with the Boo Fries (poutine-esque, with gravy and cheddar cheese). They were tasty, but the overwhelming flavor was salty and texture was mushy.Next up was the soup of the day, crab and corn chowder. The cup was just that, a small cup. Apparently the everything-is-bigger-in-America mentality has not seeped its way into Acme. Fine by me. Again...reasonably tasty, but it was super sweet, like it had a goodly amount of sugar, which was weird. I get that crab+corn=sweetish, but this was beyond reasonable.The crab cake was fine.
