Big enough to share, Not super flavorful, but with a horseradish sauce drizzled on top.The Fried Peace Maker Po-boy.was highlighted on the menu as being ranked #4 out of the top 10 sandwiches....somewhere, by someone, so I went for it. Fried oysters and shrimp, some shredded lettucs, tomato, pickles, Tabasco mayo on French bread. Again, tasted primarily salty. I think it needed more mayo? I doused it in Tabasco and it was fine. The bread was really good (soft and a little crusty on the outside), but there was too much of it.Service was a bit strange. Not rude, but certainly not warm. I wanted hole-in-the-wall, but got more of a chain-y feel. I'll try to do better tomorrow!

Reviews.Author: Carole R.
Reviews.Content: My first dining experience in NOLA - it OK. Had the seafood gumbo & half crawfish poboy and a couple beers.. $29 including tip... Pretty steep for fried fish on bread and a cup of soup. Place was crazy crowded, sat at the oyster bar. Oyster schuckers were not overly friendly, but the fellow patrons were great.

Reviews.Author: Linda D.
Reviews.Content: as always perfect oysters and loved the seafood gumbo. My husband had the chicken gumbo which he also loved

Reviews.Author: Caitlin P.
Reviews.Content: Totally met my expectations!  So let me start out by saying I prefer my fish and my oysters raw.. Having said that - on to the review!We ordered the charbroiled oysters.. And though the flavor was great.. It was way to oily for my taste. I tried soakin it up with the bread but it was still too much for me, however, I would try them again when I return to New Orleans. Now onto the raw oysters... Fantastic!! Coming from California and growing up on the coast spoiled with fresh fish (ie: Monterey, Santa Cruz, San Francisco) these were some of the freshest oysters I've ever had!!They smelled and tasted faintly of the ocean and I was in heaven!! I will definitely return for those! The only con was the oysters weren't scrubbed of excess debris.. But you best believe I worked around it ;)

Reviews.Author: Tammy T.
Reviews.Content: We heard the reviews. We took note of the "extra long lines". We listened to our Tastebud Tours guide when he warned us against going during any sort of meal hour. ("Go to Felix's across the street" was his grandfatherly piece of advice.)And yet my boyfriend and I were still hellbent on having Acme chargrilled oysters before our weekend trip ended.Saturday was our day of battle. We decided to risk getting in line at 6:00 p.m. because our intended 4:30 p.m. time was just too ridiculous and we had other things we wanted to do. My boyfriend and I had just finished watching a three-minute Black Keys video on his phone when the hostess approached us."How many?""Two."She did a double-take."Want to sit at the bar?" "Um...YEAH. Of course.""Follow me."So she led us past the line of hungry, envious people and into Acme, where the restaurant was occupied with tons of people, noise and neon lights galore. We were positively giddy with excitement when suddenly, our hostess stopped short and announced, "Wait. I lied. We actually have a table for you by the window."And THAT was the start of one of the most memorable meals of my 2014 NOLA trip. I waited a total of three minutes to get into one of the most marketed restaurants in (probably) the nation out of pure luck. I've never been so happy to be in a party of two.Believe the hype, you guys. Those chargrilled suckers are delicious - we ordered a dozen for each of us and they arrived at a reasonable amount of time with the garlic butter and Parmesan cheese still bubbling and popping. We also ordered the meat pies, which were good, but I think my boyfriend liked them more than I did. I wouldn't get them again. I was all about the oysters and I'm so happy that I got my fix!

Reviews.Author: Amalia Y.
Reviews.Content: acme oyster house really really reallyyyy is as good as they all say. stellar reviews from thousands of yelpers means good stuff. i didn't even like oysters before this trip. i'm now an addict. damnit.you will be too. try it. i dare ya.the po'boys and hush puppies and gumbo aren't too shabby either. had the raw and the chargrilled oysters... i actually preferred the raw. whatever you do, don't leave NOLA without eating oysters here at least once.yes, there's a line. yes, you're probably on vacation and don't feel like waiting around in line. DO IT ANYWAY. trust.

Reviews.Author: Kevin W.
Reviews.Content: Came here because it was the most popular restaurant in NO and Man vs Food came here. I did not do the oyster challenge but I did get oysters. The restaurant itself is always super busy, so be prepared for a line. It is cool to see the oysters getting shucked. The menu is huge, but I came for the charbroiled oysters.Oyster topping was not to salty or oil and dipping bread into the oil was so good! 1 dozen for $20.Very tasty but I could not eat this all by myself. It would be way to much oil. Would come again if I am ever in NO.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie H.
Reviews.Content: What can I say that others haven't already said? I've never had charbroiled oysters (until now), but they are probably what heaven is full of. Incredible. Totally unhealthy but incredible. We stuffed ourselves with oysters and bloody marys galore. Pretty much the perfect Sat afternoon activity!

Reviews.Author: Jack F.
Reviews.Content: Great food. Don't miss it. Charbroiled oysters had too much butter so I sent it back. The raw oysters rocked!!

Reviews.Author: Ryan L.
Reviews.Content: Just do it. The chargrilled oysters are absolutely amazing. Never had anything like it before. We conveniently got there at about 11:45 on a Thursday so walked right in for a table. I would gladly wait in line for an hour at this place too after that experience. Their signature Po-Boy is the business.

Reviews.Author: Leslie H.
Reviews.Content: Waited in line for an hour and a half---got a great, large sized, no skimping on crab soft shell crab po boy. should have got the grilled oysters, but I was really hungry and needed to throw down on serious food without ordering 2 dozen oysters. I tried a few of my friends and they were delicious.Hubby had two way po boy and really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Author: JR C.
Reviews.Content: Pretty much one of the most popular restaurants that you'll find on Bourbon. This could be a tourist trap, but it could also be a food win. My take is that if you are going to travel 2000 miles, might as well not miss the party. A line outside comprised mostly of out-of-state Asians confirms that everyone is in the same mindset.-=-Oysters: Raw and Chargrilled-=- My verdict? Get in line and wait. You'll be enjoying that beer while waiting in line anyway. Right across the street was a small bar so it was perfect. One thing is for sure, the oysters are hand picked to be enormous. They will not skimp you here. Raw oysters have no special flair, but it's all the same anyway....raw. Chargrilled was where it was at. If I could do it again, I'd get a double load of chargrilled oysters here. Buttery cheesy goodness in every bite. I don't think I've had a tastier oyster than here.

Reviews.Author: Jaime O.
Reviews.Content: sweet and creamy oysters and PLENTY of em.  Sign me up (again).

Reviews.Author: Michael D.
Reviews.Content: This place is as good, but not great.   Worth checking out if your in town.  But not worth waiting 1+ hr for as most restaurants nearby offer the same menu and the food taste about the same. I would recommend the chargrilled oysters over raw ones.  The raw oysters aren't as great. But the grilled ones were awesome.   Overall it's good, but not worth all the hype.

Reviews.Author: Melinda Q.
Reviews.Content: Really delicious oysters on a half shell! Tasty fried soft shell crab and fried fish. Wash it all down with Abita beers and you've got yourself a winner. The line gets ridiculously long so get there early! Staff could always be a bit more gracious and courteous...

Reviews.Author: Cheryl E.
Reviews.Content: Attention Canadians - Boo Fries = some pretty decent poutine. Otherwise, not worth the wait. Oysters pretty tasteless, no brine and poorly shucked.

Reviews.Author: Elsie W.
Reviews.Content: Tourist trap but I guess since everyone and their mothers have come here, you must also. Tiny tiny oysters, chargrilled. Meh. Seafood etouffee with fried crawfish. Better. But meh.

Reviews.Author: Perisha S.
Reviews.Content: What can I say that hasn't been said?Place is freaking awesome.I didn't even like oyster before I came here.Now I compare and judge all future charbolied oysters against them and no one has yet to compare.

Reviews.Author: Akinate K.
Reviews.Content: This place is packed all the time. It takes longer if you have a group. We had seafood food gumbo, Rockefeller oyster soup, and chargrilled oysters. The oyster soup was a bit salty but the chargrilled oysters are delicious.It's not a place for kids. They play loud music and people talk very loud. We feel like we are yelling to hear each other. Overall, it's a good place to try oysters.

Reviews.Author: Debbie L.
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic!  We waited in line about 45 min for 2 people over the holiday weekend.  Service was very friendly and the chargrilled oysters, oyster po'boy, and soft shell crab were all yummy.  The bread to fried oyster ratio for the po'boy was good.  We paid extra for the Tabasco mayo but I think they forgot it.  You're better off just self-dousing your po'boy with the hot stuff.  Would love to have tried other things...guess I'll have to come back!

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth M.
Reviews.Content: Everyone is raving about the oysters but I didn't love them. The chargrilled oysters were just a bit too rich for me and I prefer to have my oysters raw and plain with just a squeeze of lemon. But I didn't enjoy Acme's raw oysters either because they weren't cleaned or shucked well. Tons of sand and dirt on them with shards of broken shells inside. I also noticed the shuckers dumping out the wonderful briny water inside the oysters after opening them!But the etouffee was single handedly the best thing I ate in all of New Orleans. Perfectly cooked rice, topped with a generous helping of shrimp, smothered in a delicious sauce, and sprinkled with scallions for the perfect amount of crunch and freshness. :swoons:

Reviews.Author: Wei L.
Reviews.Content: This place has the BEST chargrilled oysters in town!  The food is absolutely worth the waiting in long line outside!

Reviews.Author: Brian C.
Reviews.Content: There's a very good chance that you will wait about 30 minutes outside for a seat.  Don't feel discouraged though - the line moves because people don't stay long.  The food and service is efficient, so people order, get their food, eat, and leave.Ordered way too much food because I spent the past 14 hours in planes and airports.  Got the 1/2 dozen oysters, one dozen chargrilled oysters, crab platter with hush puppies, a peacemaker po boy sandwich, and fried crab claws.Oysters - they were ok.  If you like oysters, you'll like the oysters here.  Nothing special though, but to be honest, I'm not a big oyster fan.  Apparently they're an aphrodisiac but I don't think it's worked as well as roofies for me.. not that I've slipped anyone a roofie colada every in my lifetime.The chargrilled oysters were a different story.  Not a fan of oysters, but man this was really good.  And you knew it was bad by the amount of yellow oil or butter or whatever was dripping out of those shells.  They had bread which I dipped into that stuff and it made it taste so good (it was probably butter FYI).  The chargrilled oysters were absolutely the best dish that I had in NOLA.After that, everything else was just OK.  The fried crab claws were good until about the fourth one.  That's when the amount of fried stuff that I was eating was making me feel a little queasy.  The single crab platter - I didn't have a bite of it, but apparently it was pretty good.  The peacemaker po' boy sandwich was solid.  But honestly, with all the fried stuff, it's kind of hard not to like it.  I probably wouldn't order any of them when I return here.  It's the chargrilled oysters that make this place worth the 30 minute wait.  Go for it.

Reviews.Author: Jireh H.
Reviews.Content: Life always beckons for answers to certain questions. True, we ditched the ACME line the first time but we weren't able to get away before having our minds imprinted with the phrase, "Is it WORTH it? Is this place REALLY WORTH it?" Yes, it is Bourbon Street and there are always drunk peeps running around doing *interesting* things. Although this guy was obviously plastered (as he sure staggered and slurred), his question remained nonetheless LEGIT. (Side note: same guy was picked up by paramedics much later...)So second time around - this time with friends (with one FROM Louisiana) - we decided to find out the truth behind this establishment by dining there and appeasing our curiosity about the endless line.40'ish minutes waiting in line + 20'ish of dining...here's the VERDICT:1. Answering the drunk dude's question: NOT worth lining up for unless you're curious what the fuss is about. This place is OVER-RATED...even among tourist traps.2. CHARRED oysters...would be the better name for what came out of the halfway burnt mess. 80% tastes dairy...and carbon.3. Raw oysters - same supplier, same size, same price...shucked okay with leftover grit.4. Po-Boys SUCK...which is kinda expected in an oyster bar. Friends (esp our Louisiana friend) hated their sampler plate...esp the rice and beans.5. You can really tell that they are trying to turn tables fast. Not complaining...just telling you to expect it.I'd skip this place if you see a long line. If you really still want to try it so you can tell your friends about it (like we did)...BRING ENOUGH BEER to keep you occupied.#FreakingLoveNOLA#Yelp100 (02/100)

Reviews.Author: Nguyen L.
Reviews.Content: Long line. Probably was a 40-45 wait. But between the people-watching and the alcohol, it didn't seem that long. Staff was friendly. Loud, vibrant place. Ordered 1/2 dozen chargrilled oysters.(11.49 or 11.99)They were very good. Wife ordered Medley(gumbo, red beans and rice, and jambalaya). It was good also. Gotta get the chargrilled oyster man. Or woman. Sitting at the bar does smell though. Nice staff.

Reviews.Author: Kellye N.
Reviews.Content: Oh.my.goodness....their chargrilled oysters are some of the most delicious things I've ever eaten. You absolutely have to order them if you visit Acme Oyster House.Those were by far the best things we had there. We also had their lobster bisque, crab cakes, and a cup of jambalaya. The soup and crab cakes were really good, but the chargrilled oysters were definitely the stars of the show. This place is a must-visit if you're ever on Bourbon Street.

Reviews.Author: Trish M.
Reviews.Content: After watching Adam Richman eat nearly 180 oysters on Man vs Food we had to come here for the oysters. After only 15 minutes waiting in line on a Friday night, J and I were able to get a seat at the oyster bar - this was great because the guys who shuck the oysters like to have a grand ole time chatting up the out-of-owners. The restaurant was divey and dimly lit from the neon ACME sign out front painting the room a jazzy red. We ordered the below:Dozen raw oysters ($14) freshly shucked. These were great - they are juicy and plump. Not briney like some of LI oysters and not overly oceany like some of the west coast ones I've had. They were creamy but the didn't overpower your palette. Dozen grilled oysters ($20) - these were grilled with parmesean cheese and breadcrumbs. They were good but I liked Cochon's wood-fired ones better (possibly because too much Food Network has told me dairy and seafood don't mix?).Shrimp Etouffe ($9) - this was the first time I have had etouffe and maybe I am just not a fan of etouffe in general but the dish was very medicore. There were quite a few baby shrimp in the dish but the flavor just wasn't there and the roux was too thin.Soft-shell crab for 2 ($23) - thick battered giant soft shell crab - just how the south likes it. The soft shell grab was yummy but I am very picky about my fry batter and this was just a tad too thick and thought it could have been seasoned better. It had a good crunch though.We left full, and happy but the 4 beers and alcoholic smoothie from Bourbon could have been a factor.

Reviews.Author: Cavan G.
Reviews.Content: For the amount of time spent in line,  the quality of food, the service and price there are much better places to go in NOLA.

Reviews.Author: Stephen Y.
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to stand in line outside. But the good thing is that you are in the N.O. so you can enjoy an adult beverage outside while you wait in line. I will eat raw oysters but I am not a big fan, but my friend from the N.O. insisted I try the chargrilled oysters. Boy, the oysters were smothered in parmesan cheese and piping hot. An excellent dish. I also had the N.O. Medley, which included gumbo, jambalaya, and red beans and rice.  Excellent flavor and nice portions. Grabbed a to go box and finished two days later back home in Atlanta.Simply delicious.

Reviews.Author: Annie N.
Reviews.Content: About $14 for a dozen - fresh or chargrilled! After paying $3 each here in Chicago I can assure you I simply died and went to oyster heaven. Staff were very friendly; the wait wasnt bad: we told them we'd seat at the bar and we got in within 15 minutes. I'm so glad we waited it out. I'm telling everyone I know to come here when they visit New Orleans!

Reviews.Author: Douglas S.
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? This place is amazing! I would give it 10 stars if I could. The chargrilled oysters are delicious! The service is wonderful and the atmosphere is great. It can get crowded but it's because the food is so great! Grab yourself an Abita Amber and a dozen raw or chargrilled oysters. You will not regret it!

Reviews.Author: Rachel R.
Reviews.Content: Well prepared food, but overall I had a restaurant-chain experience.We were lead up the steps in this neat old building to a table in a busy area.  Don't you hate when you feel like you are in the servers' way?  Yeah...  After taking drink orders, someone else (who was being trained?) tried to take them again.  Our food was served promptly and it was delicious, good quality for the price.  However, again with the service, they tried to take our plates before we were done.  Chill people!Anyway, it was an alright experience.  If you want a safe bet, come to Acme!

Reviews.Author: Gerry H.
Reviews.Content: I don't presume to be so special as to have the ability to add some here-to-fore unmentioned revelatory nugget of wisdom (that the previous 1869 reviewers may have omitted).  But what I will say is that for a high volume, kind of touristy oriented establishment, the staff is extremely friendly and efficient, and doesn't have that kind of "I've seen it all and heard it all so shut the F up, Mr. and Mrs. Tourist" attitude, like the staff of so many of these type of places seem to adopt.I'll  add that the oysters-char broiled, raw, and Po Boy-are all out of this world.  And don't forget to try the pecan cobbler dessert, because if you do, you are depriving yourself of great pleasure.

Reviews.Author: cpp a.
Reviews.Content: The best oysters that I have ever had in my entire life! Acme Oyster House chefs are oyster gods! I can't stop raving to my friends and family about how phenomenal the chargrilled oysters are! I will be making a trip there as often as possible when I start my masters degree program in Mississippi this Fall.

Reviews.Author: B G.
Reviews.Content: Char-grilled oysters?  Unreal. There is a reason this joint has this many reviews and rates out this highly.

Reviews.Author: Jenn K.
Reviews.Content: The chargrilled oysters are amazing! Garlic butter heaven is all I have to say. The line is pretty long for dinner. I ended up coming back just before they closed and only got oysters.I'd love to come back to try a few other things.

Reviews.Author: Julee' W.
Reviews.Content: Awesome chargrilled oysters.  Also ordered the 1/2 shrimp and 1/2 oysters, and the fried oysters were delicious. We waited for more than an hour to be seated, then they seated another couple at the table with us. The four stars are for the oysters.

Reviews.Author: Yen T.
Reviews.Content: Came here while vacationing and after reading Yelp reviews. We ordered chargrilled oyster, raw oyster, shrimp gumbo, crawfish, shrimp, fish and crawfish po boys. The po boys and shrimp gumbo were well seasoned and crispy. The boiled crawfish was bland to our taste. The chargrilled oysters was delicious especially with the bread provided to dip into the buttery cheesy sauce! We had tried chargrilled oyster at another well-known place in the area  but can't compare to the ones here. If I had to choose my last meal, chargrilled oyster from Acme Oyster House would be it!

Reviews.Author: Janet R.
Reviews.Content: Ok if your going to check this place out be prepared for a line.  We went at lunch time and it was not to bad. When we walked by at dinner time there was a pretty long line.  With that said the food was really good. Service was good as well.

Reviews.Author: Justin C.
Reviews.Content: If you spend a lot of time on Yelp, your nose probably starts to turn up at this place as touristy and overrated. While it certainly is touristy, they do a great job. The chargrilled oysters really were fantastic. I discovered I didn't really like soft-shell crab ("the mustard" is nasty!), but that wasn't their fault. Get here about 10:50 before they open and you won't wait long.

Reviews.Author: Scott B.
Reviews.Content: Gotta go here, mainly to say you've done it; probably better oysters at Drago's.  Sit at the bar and watch the boys shuck 'em. I'm not much of a raw oyster fan, but really love their grilled ones here with Garlic and butter. Expect a 10-20 min wait of longer at night.

Reviews.Author: Michele P.
Reviews.Content: Just as good a others say! The line is crazy! We went at 6:30 the first day and didn't want to wait 1 1/2 hours, so the next day we went at 4pm and got seated right away.

Reviews.Author: chad c.
Reviews.Content: The wait can be long so be ready with a few drinks in hand for the line.The atmosphere is laid back with tv screens throughout showing whatever game happens to be on that night.Portions for the entree are huge and not something you have to worry aboutI never ate oysters prior to coming here. I now eat oysters. End of story.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany H.
Reviews.Content: We didn't anticipate the line so I guess it's a good thing we came late, around 10pm. Even at that hour, there was still a 30 minute wait. They're really efficient, though, and the line moved along pretty quickly. I think it helped that it was around Mardi Gras and there was plenty of people watching to keep us entertained.Service was overall friendly and efficient.Amaazing oysters. They have 4 people just shucking oysters at the counter. It's fun to watch. Hundreds of oysters right in front of your eyes. We had the New Orleans seafood sampler as well. The gumbo was slightly fishier tasting than I'd like, but still good. The jambalaya and andouille were yummy with a slight spicy kick. Overall, good place for oysters! Yum.

Reviews.Author: John H.
Reviews.Content: Fried NOLA seafood at its best! Realizing that this restaurant is located in one of the less desirable parts of the Quarter, watch your purses, wallets and women. Avoid puddles too. Good place if you are an oyster, shrimp po'boy or many other seafood dishes. Great fries BTW!Can't'' say that I will be back for the high caloric, high cholesterol dishes, but the hats off to a very efficient wait staff.

Reviews.Author: Anna E.
Reviews.Content: We stopped in for lunch on a Saturday afternoon.  It was raining out, but that did not not discourage anyone from standing in line (that spanned over a block deep) in hopes of getting in to experience what everyone has been yelping about this place.  We had the chargrilled oysters, jambalaya, gumbo, and chicken & andouille sausage étouffée.  Everything we ordered was incredibly flavorful and amazing! We were in NOLA for 4 days, and this was THE BEST meal we had--and that is saying a lot, as there are so many fantastic eateries in the French Quarter!

Reviews.Author: Beth G.
Reviews.Content: This is a bit of a tourist destination, but that shouldn't impugn the quality of the food. Extremely fresh oysters on the half-shell, shucked right before your very eyes by the best in the business. Not a fan of raw oysters?  Their fried seafood is perfectly crispy without being greasy, and you can have it encased within a delicious po-boy, or as an entree.  Like any good New Orleans eatery, there is a good selection of local beers to wash down the food. Now, back to the tourist thing.  This place gets crowded, and you may experience a wait. Even once you are seated, it's not exactly like you have a ton of elbow room.  I've had the best luck going at lunch, and saving my dinners for something a little less hectic.

Reviews.Author: Dean O.
Reviews.Content: Usually any place Adam Richmond touches is a place to stay away from. The Oysters we OK, not the best we had during our trip. I would go back again if we were in the area, but would not go out of my way to go back.

Reviews.Author: Jeanine F.
Reviews.Content: Raw oysters ( 4.5 outta 5 ) grilled oysters were drenched in butter and Parmesan and quite delicious if you like that. Reasonable prices for a dozen. Although there seemed to be a long wait because of the line outside they were able to get us in quick. Would def come back next time I'm in NOLA

Reviews.Author: Kim W.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided to order oysters since I'm no longer living near an ocean.  She ordered the raw oysters and I ordered the char-grilled.  Hands down...the char-grilled oysters were delicious and had lots of flavor.  We sat at the bar and the waiter was very friendly.  I would say that he was the best waiter we had in NOLA...I didn't find the service at other restaurants to be as good as the service at ACME.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie H.
Reviews.Content: During our stay in NOLA, we only got to try Chargrilled Oysters at Acme Oyster House so I can't really compare it to anything else since I've never had Chargrilled Oysters before until now. This place is super packed and there is a line out the door as soon as it opens.  We arrived at 10:45am (this place opens at 11am) on a Saturday morning and there was already a line and we still had to wait.  We weren't really seated until closer to 11:15am.  Just to warn you know, it can be a bit chaotic when lining up.  They only seat you if your entire party is there.  Otherwise, you have to wait in line and they will skip you and seat other people who are there with their entire parties.  It can get crazy when there are huge groups of bachelor parties in front of you.  On top of that, there is no setup for a line.  There were some arguments that broke out and people were upset thinking that they were in line the whole time.  Just be ready for a mess! Once seated, they are pretty quick at taking your order and serving you.  We ordered the three dozen Chargrilled Oysters split between six people.  They come smoking hot to your table and bubbly with the melted cheese.  They can be very rich but they are definitely different and different meaning good.  We also ordered three dozen raw oysters to split as well.  They serve Gulf Oysters which are thick and large.  I'm more used to the smaller varietals and felt that it was a bit too much for me.  I'm still a novice oyster eater but everyone else at the table loved them.  We also got a soft shell crab platter and fried oyster platter.  By far, our favorite dish was the Fried Oysters.  Those were really really good.  Deep fried, juicy and tasty!  The soft shell crab platter was also another great dish with deep fried soft shell crab, not like the Japanese type of soft shell crab.  This was hearty and big and yummy! The gumbo and jambalaya were meh.  Overall, we were in and out within an hour.  Is it worth the wait?  I'd have to say YES if you haven't tried Chargrilled Oysters.  But it's really more worth the wait for their other dishes which are just as good.

Reviews.Author: Sandee T.
Reviews.Content: I heart Acme Oyster House~!Walking by daily at dinnertime, the line was ridiculously long and out the door!  So we strategically came right at the cusp/end of senior citizen hours and with zero wait, the minute we were seated, the line started to form.  Yes~* GET - Hurricane = b/c when in Rome...* NOO - Oyster shooters = Thinking it was like a good tasty shooter.  It was actually raw oyster + tarter sauce in a SHOT of vodka.  Gah.* GET - Soup of day = Corn and crab bisque...what a winning combo.* GET - Chargrilled oysters = Delicious and hot ~* GET - Crab claws = Tiny fried tips of crab claws, yummy ~* GET - Boo fries = roast beef gravy and cheese atop fries!* GET - Sweet potato fries = just b/c they can never disappoint (unless not fried well).* MEH - Jambalaya = Pretty ok & standard.* YES - No wait!  We got lucky.  See above.* YES - Friendly service and they were busy~* WOA [words of advice]:- Huge dining room, bar-like feel with neon lights- Oyster shucking stand with bar seating- Black & white checkered table linens - Great for small or large parties

Reviews.Author: Moni D.
Reviews.Content: Ok so I tasted the off-the-menu boom boom shrimp, the "New Orleans Medley" (red beans, jambalaya and seafood gumbo) and the fried crab claws (it's an injustice to fry crab like that). It was ok. I took a couple bites and came to Deanie's. The bartender Curtis was super cool. Next time I'll try the chargrilled oysters even though I've never had an oyster that I liked. I know...I know...that's what they're known for. My mistake. I just thought the other food would be good too.

Reviews.Author: Marcus B.
Reviews.Content: This place had a line down to the corner when I went, and I see why.  The food is delicious,  the customer service is excellent,  the ambiance was just right. Can't wait until I'm back in NOLA to eat here again.

Reviews.Author: John C.
Reviews.Content: Good place. Strong drinks and the food was prepared properly. Had the seafood gumbo soup and it came out hot with plentiful shrimps. Had the fried seafood platter. Almost could not finish it. Had lots of fried shrimp , fried oyster, and fried fish. Fish was juicy. Only complaint was they they had too much batter but thank god even the batter was tasty. Definitely give it a second visit.

Reviews.Author: Matt J.
Reviews.Content: Char grilled oysters are delicious. Smothered in butter and Parmesan. The raw oysters are Pristine as well. Then we had the peacemaker po boy their signature dish. Fried shrimp and fried oysters with a spicy roumalade sauce. Also had the sampler with andouille seafood étouffée red beans and rice and jambalaya. Étouffée was eh red beans eh. The rest was bomb. Def a NOLA must go

Reviews.Author: Freddy V.
Reviews.Content: I still have dreams about the Oysters at Acme Oyster House.  Acme Oyster House was the first restaurant off the plane when arriving in New Orleans.  This was one of my favorite restaurant spots for a good hardy lunch with amazing taste that explodes in your mouth.  There was a small wait time but well worth it.I had 2 dozen of Acme's Chargrilled Oysters, 2 dozen of Acme's Regular Oysters, & Fried Soft Shell Grab.  Don't forget to done some beers along with the Seafood Comatose!Can't wait to come back to Acme when in NOLA.

Reviews.Author: Cheryl N.
Reviews.Content: WOW.  It really is as good as it gets.  This isn't your fancy fine dining restaurant, but my the food here is just soo good.  The service here is impeccable.  Servers & bartenders were attentive without coming across pushy. If you get a chance to come to Acme, please order the Charcoal oysters & their crawfish.  I was in new orleans for only a short business trip, but managed to eat here twice in the 4 days I was there.

Reviews.Author: Myan M.
Reviews.Content: -Chargrilled oysters-Sit at the bar-Go early-Fried soft shell crab - yum!

Reviews.Author: Charles H.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had dinner here last Friday...it is average for the most part but we really enjoyed the grilled oysters

Reviews.Author: Su H.
Reviews.Content: Definitely an overrated restaurant.   Really can't figure out what the fuss was about. To start I had the charred oysters which were confusing.  The osyters didn't have any of the fresh sea taste and was overwhelmed by the buttery garlic sauce.  The buttery garlic sauce was pretty good for bread dipping though.  Next I split the soft shell crab poboy and the shrimp and oyster poboy.  I do recommend the softshell crab.  This was the only place i saw such a dish and the crab was nice, big, and crunchy.  I didn't see anything special about the shrimp and oyster poboy though.  Just over priced. The place is busy and the service was not all that great.   First, there's always a line to get in.  I tried going for lunch but there was a line so decided to go early for dinner at 5 and still a line. (Line does move faster than expected.)   I had to ask the server for more bread twice and had to look for the waitress to get my soda refilled long after I needed it.   I say that there are other restaurants in New Orlean to be discovered and I will not be returning.I also had food poisoning the next day.  I'm pretty sure it was from one of the dishes I mentioned in the review.Probably more of a 3 star place but giving it two stars to balanced out the bloated reviews and due to the possible food poisoning.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca R.
Reviews.Content: had the chargilled oysters here and they were just "OK" .... just OK compared to felix's incredible oysters!!! I had the boo fries and that was the best thing I had from here...

Reviews.Author: Justine J.
Reviews.Content: Oh my goodness. We were in NOLA for 5 days, eating out several times a day, and this was our ONLY poor experience. Horrible.We arrived around 1:30pm, figured we'd get in quickly... wrong. Line out the door, easily 8-10 people deep waiting OUTSIDE, and the street we were on smelled like trash water. They got through everyone fairly quickly, but when we got inside we realized how much of a chain (or at least it looked like a chain) this was. We were seated at the bar... not exactly ideal, but we were hungry, so whatever.The bartender was friendly enough and took our orders -- my sister-in-law got the seafood gumbo, I got the jambalaya and an order of hushpuppies. Our food came out in MAYBE 3 minutes... honestly not the best sign when we're looking for "made to order" food. My sister-in-law took two bites of her gumbo before declaring that it tasted like beef stew. My hushpuppies were barely warm, and my jambalaya was unevenly heated... HOT on one side, COLD in the middle, and warm-ish on the right. What the hell? Not only that, but both tasted like crap. Cheap, unimpressive, tasteless.It took us AT LEAST 5 solid minutes to get the bartender's attention. She had walked over RIGHT as our food was served and asked if we were okay, and we said yes. It seemed like she wasn't interested in chatting with us again for a while. She walked right by us several times as we sat with our hands folded and didn't even glance over. We finally did grab her (by yelling for her) and told her we were unsatisfied. She seemed confused and called over the manager (I didn't catch his name -- big guy, brown hair). We would have been open to giving Acme another chance if the manager hadn't been such a douchebag to us. The bartender wasn't so great either. The second he walked over she yelled out "I asked them if they were okay and they said yes!" and quickly clarified to us that she didn't want to be blamed. Well, no shit, who blames the server for the food quality?We told him that our food was cold and unappetizing, and he seemed to be in a state of disbelief. He asked us if we would like to order anything else off the menu (no mention of this being on the house), and we declined, saying we'd rather just leave. He then asked, in a rude tone, if we just wanted our food heated up. I'd had enough at this point and told him "heating it up won't make it taste any better". He then let out a big sigh and said "OKAY then, if that's what you want" and just walked off. NO apology whatsoever... he huffed off like an upset 5-year-old and left us sitting there confused. We had to ask the bartender (after getting her attention again) if we were okay to leave. WHAT THE HELL?

Reviews.Author: Sheng Y.
Reviews.Content: ACME is the place for oysters, definitely. I'm not a fan of raw oysters, but the chargrilled oysters are my favorite, especially the bread that way you can dip it into the butter! My favorite thing to start off with is the Rockafeller soup! SO FULL OF FLAVOR! Fried shrimp is cooked to perfection and YOU.MUST.TRY.THE.BREAD.PUDDING. (with a scoop of vanilla bean ice cream on the side)Acme always gets busy. It's jam-packed but don't worry, you'll have enough room to move your elbows to slurp down your plate of oysters. I wouldn't recommend it for a huge group, though. When I went with 5 of my friends, we shared half of a table with 4 other people. I didn't find it as a problem, but perhaps some of you might not like that or feel like you don't have privacy.I've always found that the hostess and servers were really friendly and patient. I've never had to wait too long and I was there with a group of 4 and a group of 6 on two different occasions. Also, make sure your whole party shows up or else they won't seat you. It's just that GOOD of a place, every seat counts!!

Reviews.Author: Joey M.
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to be staying in a hotel right around the corner from Acme. I had added it to the "to-eat" list, but didn't expect it to be as good as it was.On our first visit it was fairly empty at 3 or 4 in the afternoon on a weekday. We sat at the bar and ordered a half dozen grilled oysters. I've never been a huge oyster fan (although I enjoy seafood generally), so I didn't think I would eat more than one or two. The bartender proceeded to warn us of their addictive quality and predicted our compulsive visits for the next week. He also introduced me to the awesome sauce that is Tabasco smoked chipotle. The oysters are worth any amount of walking, waiting, or standing in line that you have to do. I think we ended the week with 4 visits and 5 dozen total. That isn't to say the oysters are their only strength. The staff was friendly and attentive. We went on the afternoon of the bowl game and waited only 5 mins. If you have a party larger than 2, you may wait a bit longer. The other food was also very tasty. They serve the standard fried choices and a large list of po boys. On our first visit, we ordered the roast beef and fried shrimp po boys. The roast beef was extremely tender, soaked in a ton of gravy. The bread somehow held up, and the sandwich lived up to the "10 napkin" claim. The shrimp was lightly battered and tasted very fresh. I look forward to visiting again next time I am in New Orleans. I missed the stuffed crabs, so that'll top the list next time.

Reviews.Author: Danielle C.
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this place and ended up here twice during our stay.  If anything else, stop have a drink and order some Chargrilled Oysters.  Simply amazing.

Reviews.Author: Lauren P.
Reviews.Content: So I've tried all the chargrilled oysters in Nola and Acme is by far the best!The line outside might be daunting, BUT the staff goes down the line and if you're in a small party (it was just me & my boyfriend) they'll move you through the line SUPER quick because they can seat you at the bar- etc.  SERIOUSLY give this place a try! Order yoself some chargrilled oysters and go to town!

Reviews.Author: Chris C.
Reviews.Content: Probably the best restaurant in New Orleans besides Cafe Du Monde in New Orleans. It's got a lengthy history and everything they serve is delicious. They are essentially a jack-of-all-trades restaurant: Oysters, Po Boys, Jambalaya, Gumbo, Etouffee, Crawfish. They have it all.For our first experience, we sat at the oyster bar and ordered a dozen. The master oyster shuckers right in front of us were our servers and were cranking out oysters at a rapid pace. I would say, 15 a a minute. Impressive. They can open any oyster.We got the dozen raw oysters, 6 char grilled oysters (butter, cheese on top), New Orleans Medley (Sampling of gumbo, jambalaya, red beans & rice and grilled smoked sausage) and Seafood Etouffee (Seasoned in a buttery roux, with seafood over rice)Again, everything here was delicious and I wish I could have ate here more often during our trip.Tips:- Lines. Lines. THERE ARE ALWAYS LINES HERE. Whether you come at 2pm. 4pm, 8pm, there will be a line out the door. In order to avoid the line, get there early before they open at 11. We got in line at 10:50am and they were able to fit almost everyone who waited since the restaurant is large. After that initial opening, there's usually a solid hour wait or more.- No reservations so plan accordingly.- Get a dozen oysters, especially the char grilled oysters!

Reviews.Author: Grace L.
Reviews.Content: YUM! Some of the best, freshest, raw oysters on a half-shell ever! Pricing is great!Their Banana Fosters Cheesecake is TO DIE FOR! If you're in the area, this is a must try. The only downside of ACME is that there is a wait. But although the line was out the door and almost at the corner of Bourbon St. it went by relatively quickly. We were told about 45 minutes but it didn't even take 30. I'm glad we waited it out!

Reviews.Author: Kathy D.
Reviews.Content: Should've just listened to my boyfriend, but the age old debate of who has the best chargrilled oysters is finally solved. Acme, you win over Dragos! The oysters here are delicious, as are the po-boys. Definitely the best I've had, though I don't have a lot of cajun eating experience to draw from. Food is great, service is so-so, and expect your plates and silverware to be extremely dirty (or was it just us?). Close your eyes and devour!

Reviews.Author: Rita M.
Reviews.Content: Maybe if I would have started here first for my oyster taste test than my opinion would be higher, but thankfully I did not. I was not that impressed with the food here. The fried oysters and shrimp were fine but then again its hard to screw up fried food. The menu does not have one salad or vegetable on it. No thanksWe did not have to wait in line to eat and thank god we didn't. I would have been super pissed to have waited in an hour long line for these oysters. No thanks.

Reviews.Author: Tammy T.
Reviews.Content: The char-grilled oysters were worth waiting more than 30 mins on line! The New Orleans medley was great, too.

Reviews.Author: Carlos I.
Reviews.Content: Believe the hype!Great service. Amazing food. Must try the grilled oysters. Show up a few minutes before opening to avoid waiting for a table.

Reviews.Author: Nelio C.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled Oysters are excellent.Had the soft shell Poboy which was pretty good.Really long wait and not too pricy.

Reviews.Author: Darin C.
Reviews.Content: I have been here several times and consistently had a good experience.  While all the food I have had here over the years has been good.  This time I am talking about the chargrilled oysters.  I have eaten them all over town and this place has the best ones.  I eat them every day when I am in New Orleans.  If you haven't had them, get down here and get some!

Reviews.Author: Rachel C.
Reviews.Content: What's up with these char-grilled oysters? I know it's all the rage, but all I wanted was fresh oysters. Like every day. So when I got the oysters all char-grilled i was looking forward to trying something new. But really, I felt a little disappointed. Why mess with such a fresh and tasty thing? I know I may be in the minority, but I just wasn't into it. I was able to steal a fresh oyster from the shuckers, which satisfied my craving... a little. I also tried the Anita amber, the local brew, which was okay, but nothing mind blowing. And we got a side of  Boo fries, which were fries drowned in gravy and cheddar cheese. Not quite poutine. Not even close. The fires weren't crisp to start with, so the gravy actually made them soggier. Just nothing special, stick to the oysters. Maybe just the fresh ones:)Just a side note, we waited in line outside to get in, which seemed bad, but honestly we only waited about 15 minutes. We choose to sit at the bar instead of a seat, which I liked more because we could watch them shuck oysters. I know it probably wouldn't be ideal for a larger party, but for two it was great!Cheers to oysters!

Reviews.Author: Matthew L.
Reviews.Content: Okay so this place is a "go to" spot for tourist. Well, I guess there is a reason for that, the food is amazing! I tried both the Oysters on a half shell and the Chargrilled Oysters both were amazing, the Oysters are fresh! Way fresher than any I've had in other cities. And the Chargrilled Oysters will change your life. They are so good. I tried the soft shell crab po-boy and man was it amazing, the side items left a lot to be desired. The red beans and rice were surprisingly bland to me, and is the only reason Acme is getting 4 stars instead of 5. This place gets crowded quick so if you don't want to wait forever I'd go for lunch instead of dinner, and I think it's worth the wait to sit at the Oyster Bar.

Reviews.Author: Jim F.
Reviews.Content: Family and I ate here and it was pretty good.  Had the chargrilled oysters, raw oysters, seafood étouffée, and a po boy.  The chargrilled oysters were really good, but they were shucked carelessly leaving pieces of shell in them.  The raw oysters were really quite good and so was the étouffée.  Although I expected a little more spice in the étouffée.  I don't recommend the po boys, bread was chewy and fried shrimp/oysters were ok, nothing special.The reason I rated it four stars was our service was good.  We waited for about 20 min outside, but once we were sat, our server was fast with the orders and refills.  The restaurant itself was old and badly in need of updating, but decent atmosphere.  Overall I would recommend for someone who liked oysters.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca F.
Reviews.Content: The oysters here are wonderful!! I had them raw, chargrilled and on the Po boy.The fresh and chargrilled were amazing!!!!!! Some of the best I've had.The Po boy was only okay....the bread is what makes it so bad. The insides were great (friend oysters and shrimp) but there was so much bread and it was chewy and rubbery. Also got shrimp étouffée which was only okay.If you go here, just go for the oysters!

Reviews.Author: Nicole H.
Reviews.Content: Came here about 2pm on a rainy Sunday afternoon and were seated right away.  When we left there was a line, as there was every other time we walked by, so I guess we got lucky.We were seated on a long table, just the two of us-so another group was eventually seated on the other side, but it wasn't a problem.  Service was okay-could have been more attentive.  Food was also pretty good, but honestly I would not line up for it.  Here is my take on everything I tried.Fresh oysters: Quite good and fresh.Cocktail sauce: Yum!  Lots of horseradish, which I love.Bloody Mary:  Good and spicy.Chicken & Andouille Gumbo:  Pretty good, but salty.Craw puppies:  Yum!  My favorite thing we had.Fried crab claws: Meh.  Not a lot of flavor-had to drown them in the cocktail sauce.

Reviews.Author: Rich T.
Reviews.Content: Peacemaker po-boy was delicious. Luckily when we went there wasn't a wait, but I can't understand how people would stand in line outside, when Felix's is right next door and just as good.Word of caution, one of our party had the soft-shell crab and did not like it at all. I was happy with my food though!

Reviews.Author: Mike W.
Reviews.Content: We had dinner tonite at the Acme  in Gulf Shores Our waitress was Joe Clark and she did a remarkable jobThe food was great but the attention by our waitress Joe made the nightIt was our last night in town after coming to town for my daughters wedding and because of the special attention by joe it ended our trip on a remarkable note!

Reviews.Author: Greta H.
Reviews.Content: This place is waaay over rated. We came to this place this morning, left the line and went to Felix's across the street. If you're reading my review while in line for ACME...it's not too late. Take this as a sign! Walk across the street to the shorter line...shorter is better in this case.Our hotel told us that both businesses buy their oysters from the same place...Felix's just does a better job preparing them!The service was ok here at ACMe....nothing extra ordinary. The inside of this place was more like a chain. We ordered one dozen raw oysters and one dozen char grilled oysters, one po-boy, 2 beers and warm bread pudding. I think my favorite was the bread pudding. Super moist...just a bit small.Everything was good here....but why settle for just good when great is across the street!

Reviews.Author: Pete P.
Reviews.Content: Oysters three ways, charbroiled, raw, and on a half and half po boy. This was my first experience and this was pre-Katrina. Very late review, but I remember it clearly. Holy crap was it good! I have since been back to another location (Metarie?) and it was just as good. This is an establishment, it is a must when in NOLA to go once. Do go to the FQ location, it's a bit kitschy and cramped, but it is the best ambience of the two I have visited. Oh, the other po boy half was fried shrimps, and they were some of the best I have ever had.

Reviews.Author: Miranda H.
Reviews.Content: I know this place has high ratings and people rave about it. I disagree.  After you wait in a long line to get in, you are seated, possibly with strangers in our case.  That's fine, but the service was very rushed. We did not feel like we could actually sit and enjoy our meal.At our table we split raw oysters and the Chargrilled oysters.  The chargrilled oysters were really good.  My husband and I split the sample with red beans and rice, gumbo, jambalaya and sausage. The sausage was the only good thing on the platter. The rest was pretty bland.  I wish I could give a better review, but were really unimpressed, especially for the all hype.

Reviews.Author: C.R M.
Reviews.Content: As I sit here writing this review I am salivating at the very thought of char grilled oysters. The wait was about twenty minutes in the cold rain and totally worth it!! I hate waiting more than anyone I know, but seriously do not let the long line deter you. If you love oysters or are like me and not a huge fan (before eating here) I highly recommend you come. I ate at the bar and although it was not the most comfortable I will still give it five stars because it was that good.

Reviews.Author: Missie T.
Reviews.Content: Recommend highly on yelp. The service was very good and friendly. We has to wait outside to get a table for about fifteen minutes. The oysters were delicious baked or fresh. The waiters are free with their thoughts on what you should get ( I like that). The gumbo was good but not phenomenal. The Louisiana sampler was very good but their sausage is delicious.  Good beer selection is present as well

Reviews.Author: Jenny C.
Reviews.Content: The wait is long, but it was sooooooo worth it. I split a dozen CHARGRILLED OYSTERS for about $19 and a poboy $13. They recommend the poboys, but it wasn't the best especially for the price. All 5 stars would go to the chargrilled oysters. It was the best I've ever had. The rest of the food... I don't think was worth the price. They also don't do split checks.

Reviews.Author: Diane L.
Reviews.Content: A tourist must do.Not my favorite local oyster house, but a must do if you are in the French Quarter.The line is usually very long and slow. If you only want raw oysters, I suggest just going across the street to Felix's.

Reviews.Author: Lauren L.
Reviews.Content: Come here for the charbroiled oysters but don't expect much else. The food was amazing, the service was not great. We waited in line for about ten minutes, not long considering how long the line was and I understood why when we were seated and it seemed like the waitress was doing to minimum to get us out of there asap so another group could be seated. She was impatient and didn't listen so she missed orders and didn't refill any of our glasses. But the food was great. Charbroiled oysters were insanely good and the po'boy was great although a little dry. So sit at the bar and get the charbroiled oysters.

Reviews.Author: Sarah A.
Reviews.Content: I personally think this place is an absolute must in New Orleans.  The Wait:  Went on Saturday for lunch.  Was there around 1.30ish?  thinking it was a late lunch but the line was still pretty long (which I guess is a good sign).  Was told the wait would be 20 minutes for a party of two (with about 6 parties ahead of us) BUT we were seated in a little over 10.  :)  Ambience:  Very casual.  I think would be nice for a comfortable date or a time out with friends. Food:  Ordered chargrilled oysters, red bean and rice and half and half fried shrimp and fish.  We ordered the coleslaw for the side.  All orders were pretty awesome.  I would never eat oysters anywhere else as I don't really like them but I had to while in New Orleans.  They were great and I would encourage non-oyster eaters to try oysters here.  They came with soft bread and the seasoning was very well done.  Really enjoyed the red bean and rice that came with sausages.  They didn't have overpowering flavor like gumbo which I liked.  The coleslaw was fresh, traditional, and tasty.  Fried fish and shrimp were also great.  The batter was flavorful and crunchy, and the fish were flaky and still moist.  My husband (who's a serious foodie, especially of seafood) said that it was the best fried fish he's ever had.)Service:  Very friendly and efficient.  My husband had some oyster spillage and they got him some baking soda and cloth.  Very accommodating.

Reviews.Author: Dave W.
Reviews.Content: I really hope the food is better than the attitudes of the staff.Not friendly at all. I'm really glad I got here before a line.  If there was a line, then I got treated like Maerd, I would have been really upset.Got the Medley. It was very good, but didn't live up to the hype.  Maybe I was soured by the people.  If I don't have to wait inline, I might try it again.

Reviews.Author: m R.
Reviews.Content: "Grilled Oysters", you think you've had them but unless you've been here you haven't.  They are unlike any place I've been.  I'd give the place 5 stars but they have no vinegar and the waitresses I've experienced are not very detailed oriented (i.e. water and napkins).  I get it, it is a volume shop, no frills so don't get high expectations.  All the staff however are very welcoming.Cold beer, grilled oysters and slaw.. awesomeness.

Reviews.Author: Kareem P.
Reviews.Content: I just love to go and sit at the bar and get me some good ole chargrilled oysters. They are so good and it doesn't take long to get them once you get inside.

Reviews.Author: Ann H.
Reviews.Content: Oysters! Oysters! Oysters!!!We came to this restaurant specifically for the chargrilled oysters and they did not disappoint!!Line to the restaurant was super long but since we only had a party of 2 seemed we got seated in under 10 min!Inside is dark and a little cramped/ bar like ambience. Menu had all the classic nola fare but we were seriously eyeing the oysters so we got a dozen and that was the perfect amount of food for 2. The oysters came out piping hot and covered and garlicky butter and crispy! Yum! Ate those up rather quickly. The place gets busy so although the wait for food was not incredibly long the wait for the check was quite long. We ended up leaving cash on the table to pay for the meal since we were unable to flag down the waiter after 3 attempts.Overall the food = 5service = 3

Reviews.Author: Laura P.
Reviews.Content: Came here for lunch and were lucky enough to walk right in. All weekend long we had seen huge lines waiting to get in and eat so we were pleasantly surprised that we didn't have to wait in line. Service was decent, friendly. We had fresh and chargrilled oysters. Those chargrilled oysters were everything! I wanted more and more! The fresh oysters were great too! We also has gumbo which was really good and fried crawfish tails and a crispy crab cake which I would pass on if I are here again. It IS called ACME Oyster house so..... And they were fabulous!!! I will dream about those chargrilled oysters for sure. They were still sizzling when we got them. A definite must have!

Reviews.Author: Lee B.
Reviews.Content: I missed the opportunity to eat here the first time I was in NOLA. So, I didn't mind the forty minute wait to get in. We sat at the bar near the door, so we got to talk to the guy shucking the oysters. Good convo. Good vibe. The dozen grilled oysters and gumbo was worth the wait and I'm looking forward to going again.

Reviews.Author: Jules Wolfers D.
Reviews.Content: We came here- kinda was dreading the lines, but we came a bit earlier so we managed to get a table almost right away-  awesome!   The heart of New Orleans is pretty much in evidence with the cheerful bartender, (only if I had remembered her name!!! Awesome sweet gal, always smiling! Even after finding out we're deaf, she went out of her way to make us welcome!) and folks sitting next to me, encouraging chargrilled oysters. Curious, I ordered that (after being used to raw oysters)..and you know what?   The friend and I DEVOURED the chargrilled oysters- if we had more time, we'd order another one- but drats!  The ghost tour can't wait for us. LOL   next time I'll be there longer to make TWO orders of chargrilled oysters!  And the John Daly drink is awesome too!

Reviews.Author: Brian C.
Reviews.Content: Best chargrilled oysters I've ever had. I wanted to take the empty shells and just keep licking the flavor off them. They were warm, the cheese melted and tangy, and amazing. The red beans and rice were good as well. I had the raw oysters as well which were huge! But seriously, get the chargrilled oysters. I had such a great experience here as well, everyone was super friendly, and the food kept coming!

Reviews.Author: Patty L.
Reviews.Content: The chargrilled oysters are the reason to come to ACME. If you're looking for raw oysters you can go anywhere else - Deanie's, Felix's, etc. All of these restaurants get their oysters from the same distributor.There is always a huge line outside and I don't know why!!!! The food is just average but the chargrilled oysters were phenomenal as we've never had oysters prepared this way dripping in butter and parmesan. We took a tour with a group of 5 other girls who had also dined here and they said they didn't think much of the po'boys or the gumbo which is why we didn't order it. While we were there, the table next to us got the gumbo and they didn't finish it.

Reviews.Author: Zac P.
Reviews.Content: While the wait was very long, we had a great time at this restaurant. I read other reviews on yelp that stated it's a good idea to go early to beat the very crowded dinner rush. We went around 5:45 and there was already a huge line. That being said it moved pretty fast and once we were in there our waitress was very nice and made sure we were well taken care of. The portions are enormous and you definitely get what you pay for. I had so much food left over that honestly 3 grown adults could have eaten off my plate and we would have been plenty full. Other restaurants around this area didn't have as long a wait. But this was definitely worth it. You won't be disappointed. But prepare to wait in a pretty sizable line to get in.

Reviews.Author: May B.
Reviews.Content: I'd say somewhere between a 3 and 4, but I'll push it up to a 4 since we really liked our server.I guess you really can't go to NOLA and not check this place out, we went on a Saturday for lunch and the line was starting to form about half an hour before the place opened. We figured we'd try it out and waited about 20 minutes. Once they opened they were all business getting everyone seated, drinks, orders, etc. Which was nice after having to wait.We tried the grilled oysters since everyone raved about them. Let me first say that I love raw oysters, so maybe I'm biased...the grilled oysters were good, but I probably won't be ordering them anytime soon. They had great flavor - definitely needed the lemon juice to cut through the heaviness of the dish - very buttery and cheesy. The fresh oysters were awesome and came out so quick! The cocktail sauce was so good - perfectly mixed with horseradish. We had a hard time not finishing the sauce by itself after the oysters were gone. My only gripe is that the oysters are hardly cleaned on the outside (I'm sure it's because they go through so many), so you have to be careful eating them.We also ordered a pitcher of Abita beer which was actually very reasonably priced and a cup of soup (I can't remember what kind it was), but I'd say pass on it.Like I said earlier, we had a great server, very attentive, gave us suggestions and just overall very nice.

Reviews.Author: Alexandra M.
Reviews.Content: I came here while I was attending an international conference in New Orleans. Before coming to NOLA, my friend and I have heard and read rave reviews about this place, queuing for over half an hour in the summer heat to get into the restaurant was not a problem. Plus, we thought that long lines were only because the entire French Quarter was crowded with conference attendees. We were told afterwards that there is always a line to get into the restaurant lunch and dinner hours, so keep in mind you won't be getting a personalized, highly attentive service here.I had the fried soft-shell crab and the special sampler (jambalaya, gumbo, and red bean rice). This was my first time trying soft-shell crab that was fried this way, so I had nothing to compare it to but it was definitely full of flavor. I  The jambalaya and gumbo were far from the best I've had in NOLA, but undeniably better than Southern-style dishes I've tried outside NOLA. I regret not having ordered their signature char-grilled oysters! I guess this means I'll have to be back again to try that.The waitress was very friendly, which was common in NOLA, but also rushed due to all the crowds. Also, my friend and I were sat on the same table as another family; they were on one end and we were on the other, but same table with two seats in between. A lot of other groups were also sat on the same table or connected tables. Some did not even have seats in between - just napkin holders as "separators." I'm not sure if this was because they were over capacity, or if it was just the Southern hospitality and their way of making everything more friendly.I do think it's worth coming here for the experience, but remember not to expect anything fancy or personalized.

Reviews.Author: Danielle L.
Reviews.Content: Wait on line....it moves fast & is totally worth it!! They go through 10,000 - 16,000 oysters a day (in 12 hours)!!! The raw oysters are hugggge, fresh, briny & delicious naked or with a a little fresh lemon juice. The charbroiled oysters are amazing! They're also gluten free, made with just garlic, butter & Parmesan cheese. They're served sizzling hot. Staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Author: Nelson F.
Reviews.Content: Definitely my favorite place for oysters in NOLA.  There's always a line, but usually about 30 minutes depending on the size of the party.  They've got oysters of course, but other New Orleans favorites here that are family recipes and exceptional.  My favorite thing is the charbroiled oysters, and it is so amazing!  It comes to your table sizzling hot and you scoop it up and feels like a cheesy party of flavor in your mouth.  The gumbo and jambalaya here are incredible too, and the raw oysters are perfect though you can always order raw oysters anywhere and they'll taste the same.  They're located right off of Bourbon Street, and they don't rush you while you're seated.  We also ordered a crawfish poboy which was awesome and came with a large order of fries, the crawfish was fresh, battered, and fried and hit the spot after the oysters which barely take any room up in your stomach at all.

Reviews.Author: Nancy L.
Reviews.Content: AMAZING AMAZING Chargrilled oysters. I mean seriously, if you're in New Orleans, you've got to at least dine here once if you call yourself an oyster fan. The half shells are also super fresh, but I don't expect any less from restaurants here considering their geographical location. I would, however, stay away from their gumbos (not flavorful/spicy enough) and PoBoys though. The PoBoys are good, but you're in NOLA, there are better ones elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: Caroline H.
Reviews.Content: Looks like there is always a line for this place but well worth the wait.  The roasted oysters are the best - butter, garlic, and parmesan and the size of the oysters were incredible.  Loud place but service was excellent and quick.

Reviews.Author: Mike F.
Reviews.Content: Arrived and was seated right away.  If we had arrived 30 minutes later, we would have been in a line of 150.- The grilled oysters had a nice smoky flavor.  A little heavy on the cheese.- The oyster rockefeller soup didn't have enough oysters.   It was more of a spinach soup.- The etouffee was buttery and delicious.- The fried oysters were ok.- The fried fish was probably the best fried fish I've ever had.  Light and flavorful.- The hush puppies were nice and savory with the perfect amount of crunch.

Reviews.Author: Cliff M.
Reviews.Content: After waiting for 30 minutes outside, seated our party of 6. Had the chargrilled oysters and creole sampler.. Food was amazing and service was quick. Would go back for sure! Bad: couldn't do seperate checks, but our waiter did an awesome job of splitting everything up!

Reviews.Author: Dan M.
Reviews.Content: Okay, I'm allergic to shellfish, but I still liked this place.  They have po boys and other things that a land lover can still enjoy.  My coworker wanted her oysters, so we went here.  if you get here early (like 11:30am for lunch), you can avoid the line (there seems to be a line for this place no matter what time I walked by).  Nice place with friendly and efficient wait staff.  I couldn't decide between red beans and rice or chicken sausage gumbo.  I was happy they have a 1/2 po boy and side or gumbo - best of both worlds for lunch.  Just the perfect size.  The 10 napkin roast beef po boy is worth the hype.... going for only half allowed me to only use 5 napkins.  My friend loved her oysters and gobbled them up, as I just enjoyed the ambience and cool things hanging around and decorating the walls.

Reviews.Author: Trinh T.
Reviews.Content: ACME Oyster House is a seafood house near Bourbon Street known for their chargrilled oysters, po boys, and reasonable prices.  Don't be surprised if there's a line, but it's certainly worth it.My Overall Rating -43 Stars (Atmosphere, Service, Food, Return)Atmosphere - There are plenty of fine dining establishments in New Orleans.  ACME is not one.  Instead, it's a seedy, divey, non-pretentious seafood joint that focuses on their oysters and food.  Expect lots of beer, neon, communal tables, and customers who share a love of seafood.  There's often a line outside, so expect a wait during busy weekends.  No white linens here, and that's just fine in my book.  1 Star.Service - This varies between time of day and business.  On our first visit, it was a busy Friday night.  Our server was a bit tired, over worked, and more interested in getting orders in than seeing how we were doing.  We had to place our oyster orders first, etc.  No drink refills either.  Our second visit was a more subdued Monday afternoon.   More laid back.  In other words, if it gets busy, the service suffers.   1/2 Star.Food - Good thing the oysters are as good as advertised.  The raw oysters were plump, fresh, and clean.  The real star of course, is their chargrilled oysters.  Their smoky and site in a delectable, warm butter & garlic sauce and topped with melted parmesan.   Dipping your bread into the butter results in an amazing flavor rush.  Other hits were their red beans and rice.  The po boys were good not great.  The bread wasn't as soft as I would have liked.  But if you're here, you're going to eat the oysters.  If not, you're in the wrong place.  1  1/2 Star.Will I Return? - Yes.  In fact, it was the only place we visited twice during our short stay in the Big Easy.  It has the right combination of price, flavor, and seediness that defines what makes eating in New Orleans so great.  1 Star.My Yelp Rating Scale (Sum of all parts):1 Star - Atmosphere - Is it a cool dive?  Perhaps an upscale place?  No matter the type, atmosphere plays a big part and I'll give a star if I like it or thinks it has great charm.1 Star - Service - You can have a great meal with bad service.  But that's also what can make a five star joint drop to four.  It's important to the dining experience that service is great and on point.2 Stars - Food - I'll award up to two stars for the food, since this is the main reason we dine out.  Sometimes the extra star is given for value, but it's really all about the food.1 Star - Will I come back? - If I know for a fact I'll return, I'll give this a star. A place has to make an impression for me to return. Each Category can be given up to 1 star except food (2 stars) because I consider all these categories important to the overall dining experience.  I will sum them up to provide my final Yelp score

Reviews.Author: Leslie d.
Reviews.Content: Good oysters. Long wait. Cold beer. Great location in the Quarter. What could really be wrong?!

Reviews.Author: Robin S.
Reviews.Content: This place is purely delicious! I was staying with my friend and her husband for a few days in New Orleans. My first night in the city, they took me to Acme Oyster House. This was on a Sunday night, so the place was packed! We waited in line for about 25 minutes but the food was surely worth it. I've never had oysters before and don't necessarily prefer them, however, my friend's husband told me I had had had to try the chargrilled oysters! And boy, was he right! They were grilled, buttery, garlicky, they definitely hit the spot after my flight. I also threw in some hot sauce to spice things up. I also ordered a shrimp po'boy. The actual po'boy tasted fine, I just wish they could have spiced it up a bit more without me having to add hot sauce to it. Our server was very polite and when I asked her certain questions about the menu, she was able to give me a clear, honest answer. You can see employees on the side chucking fresh oysters. Typical New Orleans vibe! Food tastes and smells great, and it's located right off of Bourbon Street! I would recommend this place to my friends visiting New Orleans! I've already told a bunch of people about the chargrilled oysters!

Reviews.Author: X O.
Reviews.Content: Great hostess, who kept us updated while waiting in line outside.  However, the dozen raw oysters were not as yummy as we remembered. They were SALTY! The gumbo in the bread bowl was good. The fried crawfish tails was fine. But not as outstanding as before.It is hard to relive the past.  Had such a great time here last time I was in N.O. That was about 16 years ago.  Somehow it is not the same.

Reviews.Author: Katrina S.
Reviews.Content: Don't let the line outside or the popular name fool you... this is a French Quarter touristy spot. The staff is friendly and the food is fine. But waiting in line for oysters here isn't how I would chose to spend my time or money.

Reviews.Author: Lance H.
Reviews.Content: I love this place.  Its got good prices, good food, and the one in Metairie you dont wait very long.

Reviews.Author: Ari J.
Reviews.Content: I am  not sure I have the words to describe this experience... Some landmarks are hype of a long gone memory.. This place is a living and breathing icon. This place is a cathedral.... This place is a religion.

Reviews.Author: Thomas C.
Reviews.Content: Best grilled Oysters I 've ever had.  Shrimp platter also pleased my dining companions.  Little bit of a wait, but well worth it.

Reviews.Author: Monica B.
Reviews.Content: I go to the Big Easy every couple years- to see the Saints play, and to eat at Acme. I literally dream of their char-grilled oysters in between trips. I'm not even actually an oyster person but their char-grilleds are one of the most amazing party-in-your mouth foods I have ever had. I have brought friends to Acme and they have immediately become obsessed like I am. Yes, the line to get in may be long (it always goes quickly) and the oysters are not cheap, but they are so worth it. The service is good, and the oysters and amazing, as are the soft-shell crab, the po boys, the potato salad, and so many other items I have tried there. Though there are other oyster places in town, they all pale in comparison to Acme (Drago's is good and Felix's is ok but they're still not Acme). The Bloody Marys with green beans and okra are heaven as well.In conclusion, I have only 2 pieces of advice: 1. Get the oysters (I have read reviews on here where dummies go to Acme and get a salad and are disappointed. DUH!). 2. Don't be deterred by the line out front or lured in by other oyster establishments claiming to have good oysters- there is only one Acme!Their oysters are like crack. I guarantee you will be back!

Reviews.Author: Bill B.
Reviews.Content: If you like oyster this is one of the places to stop when in New Orleans. Get there at dinner time and there may be a wait as it was with us. The wait is worth it.

Reviews.Author: Shaun D.
Reviews.Content: The best place we ate at in NOLA. The chargrilled oysters were to for for. Add to that the Fried soft shell crabs and we were In heaven. The pecan pie was perfect. Great food. Amazing service .Food comes fast and it is always full. Hats off to the team to running an efficient ship. There is a waiting line, but it moves fast so don't be disheartened and go to another restaurant. We did that on day one and I wish we hadn't.

Reviews.Author: Thomas G.
Reviews.Content: This place was loud and slightly uncivilized, but it was worth standing outside and waiting, as they wouldn't take our reservation for six people.   Just do it. Stand in line like a bunch of cattle being corralled into a feeding house.   The music is loud and there are lots of neon lights.  It's got a funky vibe and not a romantic date place.  Roasted/grilled oysters for appetizer were awesome,  some of us had poboys, some of us platters of food.  This place is so busy, they don't have time to let things sit under a heat lamp or serve things over a day old.  Everything was fresh and hot and delicious.  Our server was fun and engaging as well.    Definitely adding this to my list of must do for the next time I return to New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: Candace C.
Reviews.Content: It's *literally* impossible to choose if the grilled oysters or fresh oysters are better.  I'd rather sacrifice my first born.  So, you'll have to get both types.  Their jambalaya makes me want to back my bags and move to NOLA.   I also ordered the gumbo, but I wish I had ordered another plate of jambalaya instead of the gumbo.  It lives up to the hype and there's a line for a reason.

Reviews.Author: Yiwen S.
Reviews.Content: i'm not really sure i would've liked this place had the wait not been 15 minutes (6pm, monday night).SERVICE:well organized line outside, and nice hospitable people inside. but still, it's not the best. our waitress mixed up our drink orders with the couple sitting next to us. then proceeded to bring us three additional glasses of lemonade throughout the meal even though the one person who ordered lemonade hadn't even finished her first glass.FOOD:1) chargrilled oysters: i thought they were good, but personally i'm not a fan of how salty it was due to the massive amount of butter and cheese used. our party shared a half dozen order between the three of us, and that was plenty enough. any more and i'd have to guzzle a gallon of water.2) raw oysters: pretty fresh. personally i like these a LOT more than the chargrilled ones. but i guess when in nawlins..3) seafood etouffee: my favorite dish of the night. there weren't enough ingredients in the etouffee though, and it tasted slightly bland and watered down compared to other restaurants in the area.4) gumbo: unimpressive and unmemorable.5) jambalaya: see #4 above.overall it was an experience, but i highly doubt i'd go back again. especially if there is more than a 15 min wait.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan N.
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this brief, since there are only like 1,600 other reviews for Acme.Here's the deal: This place is a tourist trap. But it's only a tourist trap because it's SO FREAKING GOOD. I'm new to NOLA so had to at least try it at least once, and let me tell you, the char-grilled oysters are simply amazing. And I'm not even a huge oyster fan. The gumbo was good too, as was my shrimp po boy. If you can find a time to go when you don't have to stand in line for hours, it's definitely worth it. YUM!

Reviews.Author: Christine H.
Reviews.Content: I never liked oysters before I ate the grilled oysters here!!  I still dream about these grilled oysters.  The waiting in line is definitely not ideal, but boy is it worth the wait!  We went there for a late night snack and came about fifteen minutes before they closed and there was hardly anyone in line and they don't rush you out either.  We took our time and ate and it was amazing!  If the wait time is too long the grilled oysters at the place across the street are good too but this place is awesome.

Reviews.Author: Judy L.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to New Orleans for vacation.  Our first stop was Acme Oyster House.  Tourists love it here and the wait is RIDICULOUS!  For my first meal in NOLA, I liked it - I thought the raw oysters were good and fresh, but I was not blown away by the food.  The char-grilled oysters was my fave - that was by far the highlight of the meal.  The oyster goes on the grill and then it's topped with butter and garlic... majorly drool worthy!!!  We also got their soft shell crab platter - nothing to write home about... the crab was super meaty, but it was just deep fried and nothing special about it.  The seafood etoufee and gumbo are southern classics, but I didn't love either of them.  The gumbo was salty while the seafood etoufee didn't have enough seafood flavor.  The crab and corn bisque though was delicious - light and great flavor.At first, I would've recommended Acme Oyster House, but after going to Felix's Restaurant (right across the street) and Luke's, I don't think I could come back here and enjoy it as much as I did the first time.  The quality of the food just doesn't compare to the other places.

Reviews.Author: Jorri N.
Reviews.Content: This was my husband and I's first meal upon landing in New Orleans for Mardi Gras. Of course we have heard a lot  about Acme Oyster here and from friends so we had to stop here first as oyster lovers.
