And the raw oysters were great I must admit.  Everything else just kinda blah.  The fried oysters were soggy, the grilled oysters were way too salty and the service, while polite, was insincere. We kept trying to make a friendly connection and it just didn't happen. An unusual occurence in our experiences. Not to mention sitting on wooden benches is not the way we like to drop $80.  So we just didn't 'get' what the big deal is about. We ate oysters everywhere we went which were equal to Acme's but with much friendlier service better ambiance.

Reviews.Author: Jason H.
Reviews.Content: Acme is the place for Oysters in NO.  Went last night for the third time.  Brother had the chargrilled oysters which are truly awesome.  Had raw oysters because I love them and Acme is always fresh.  Peacemaker Po-Boys = Great!  The only Po Boy I like as well is the Shrimp Po Boy at Killer Po Boys (in the back at Erin Rose).

Reviews.Author: Gene G.
Reviews.Content: So here it is, my humble opinion. Had oysters here and at Filix's across the street. Both are excellent. Here is the difference: Filix's oysters are gently topped with a bread crumbs and gently grilled. At Acme they are hevily topped with cheese and really heavily grilled. Pick the style you like. Truly you can't go wrong at rather place.

Reviews.Author: Leilani D.
Reviews.Content: Acme, you've done it again. There are few things I hate more in life than lines. Even then - the moment we got to the French quarter I happily stood in the long lunch line at Acme, dreaming of the chargrilled oysters I'd eaten a year and a half ago.My memory hadn't failed me - the chargrilled oysters were even more delicious than I remembered. If I can tell you one thing about Acme it's this - get the chargrilled oysters. They are one of the best things I've ever eaten. You're making a huge mistake if you come to New Orleans and don't eat this here.Outside of that the other food we ordered (red beans and rice, sausage, peacemaker po boy, boo fries) was also delicious, but I wouldn't really expect any less.The service is meh, but lets be honest, that's not why anyone comes here. I would legit come back to New Orleans just to have one more dozen chargrilled oysters.Tip: if you want to reduce your potential wait time the best times to come are when it opens, or in the awkward time between lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Author: Shaun W.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I tried this place based on all of the positive Yelp reviews and we loved it.The chargrilled oysters were delicious. It was the first time I had ever had oysters and I would definitely have them again. I also got their oyster shooter which is a half shot of vodka with a raw oyster and the house sauce. That was also excellent! I was quite surprised. We split the fried seafood platter that had catfish, oysters, and shrimp as our entree. The fried oysters weren't nearly as tasty as the chargrilled oysters but the platter was good, nonetheless. The only negative was that we had to share a table with two other people. There were chairs between us but it was still kinda odd. All in all, I highly recommend this place to people visiting New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly H.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled oysters, chargrilled oysters, chargrilled oysters! Have I convinced you yet? No? How about piping hot oysters served bubbling over with cheese and melted butter? Yea, that did it. These oysters were worth the 30 minute wait in the cold, even with a less-than-pleasant host and the oyster shucker creeping through the window. Once inside, we found our actual server to be very friendly and our food came out quickly. Aside from the oysters, we also tried some Boo fries, which are like mashed potatoes in fry form. Crispy fries smothered in gravy and grated cheddar, yes please! And as if that wasn't enough, we also ordered a shrimp po' boy and a side of jambalaya. The po' boy was stuffed with battered fried shrimp, lettuce, tomato and we opted for cocktail sauce instead of mayo. The side of jambalaya was the perfect size and had a good texture and flavor. Although it was all tasty, the chargrilled oysters are what would bring me back. The place itself, is nothing fancy, but I think that is part of the charm. Long crowded tables line the room with big groups ready to go out for the night. It was a lighthearted and casual atmosphere. Just make sure to budget extra time for a decent wait, which they always seem to have at any peak time.

Reviews.Author: Chloe C.
Reviews.Content: Loved it! The raw oysters were fresh, juicy and tasted of the sea. I would've worked my way up that board of oyster eating records (think it takes at least 30 doz to get your name on it) if my wallet would've let me, but either ways, they were worth every damn penny. Everyone loved the chargrilled oysters, and so did we, but between two we split one dozen and that was enough - the grilling shrinks the oyster, and while the garlic herb sauce is amazing to soak up in bread, it also overpowers the freshness of the shellfish.If I lived in Nola I would go to ACME everyday - but do make sure you go in small groups, not at peak hours and opt for the bar, or you might've to wait a while to sink your teeth into those pearly babies.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan M.
Reviews.Content: Last meal in New Orleans and we wanted a bit of everything. Acme delivered in spades, and the staff went the extra mile to make sure we had the best final meal:Raw oysters - super fresh, perfectChargrilled oysters - delectable garlic and butter sauce on themShrimp & oyster poboy - fried just perfectJambalaya - the best we had this tripSeafood gumbo - brilliantA perfect end to a trip full of great foods.

Reviews.Author: Andrew W.
Reviews.Content: Large portion for the half and half fish and shrimp but, the taste was mediocre at best. The batter was definitely not fresh and tasted heated up.

Reviews.Author: Evelyn H.
Reviews.Content: Simple and delicious. The oyster and shrimp po'boy was the best I've had, hands down. The chargrilled oysters were also very good. I tried some of the jambalaya too, but was underwhelmed (I was to comparing it to my mom's, though, so it wasn't a fair fight). I'll be going again, line and all.

Reviews.Author: Lillian C.
Reviews.Content: This place was highly recommended and it def did not disappoint! We came on a Friday a little after the lunch rush and didn't have to wait too long to get a table. Our waitress was great and attentive. We started out with two dozen raw oysters and one dozen chargrilled oysters. Their oysters were super fresh and even though bigger than what I'd prefer, they were very tasty. The chargrilled ones came REALLY hot (so be careful) and came with some bread since it had a butter sauce. I never had cooked oysters and wasn't sure I'd like them, but it was SO TASTY. They really do specialize in oysters! I couldn't decide what to have for my entree, but ended up getting the Fried Peace Maker Po Boy. It was delicious! The oysters and shrimp was in a very tasty batter that had a good balance of salty and spicy. I was so full after my meal but I enjoyed all of it. I would like to see some variety of food on the menu, but overall I was very happy.Oh, if you feel like you want to take the 15 dozen oyster challenge this is the place! I saw a wall with names of people who's done it... and wow... 15 DOZENS?!

Reviews.Author: Marilen R.
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for oysters this is the place for you.  Everyone talks about their char grilled oysters and they sure are tasty, but you can actually find these suckers at many restaurants in town.  (This was my 3rd time eating chargrilled oysters in 4 days, and personally loved Dragos' oysters at the seafood festival.  Something about them being grilled outdoors and served sizzling. Desire Oyster Bar's oysters were larger and juicier.  All comparable, really.)What I really enjoyed here was their oyster po boy.  The oysters were extra crispy and meaty and there seemed to be plenty of them in the sandwich.   Exactly the po boy I was looking for during my entire trip. Delicious!  We also ordered the crab cake which was ok. It is deep fried and the meat is the stringy meat not lump meat.  Husband liked it, but I like my crab cakes with lump meat. All the food was a bit salty, but I think that's just part of the cuisine.  Just drink lots of water.  The line here is ridiculous so we avoided this place until it was Tuesday at 11:30.   I would recommend coming here for lunch on a weekday.  Waiting more than 1 hr is nutty given all the other great options around town.

Reviews.Author: Dominique D.
Reviews.Content: Worst place I ate at in a city known for their amazing food. I'm amazed this place has lasted this long. Their food was drab and nothing special. Definitely felt like a tourist trap. Even the servers seemed to be over that place. I would definitely skip

Reviews.Author: Moses A.
Reviews.Content: Forget the Poboys, gumbo and shrimp here! ITS ALL ABOUT THE OYSTERS!!!! The raw oysters were the plumpest, juiciest and cleanest oysters I've had! I've never seen oysters so plump before! Really none better at that price point! And can't forget the CHARGRILLED Oysters! OMG! Its one of the reasons I need to come back and visit NOLA again! Oysters... nuff said.

Reviews.Author: Louis S.
Reviews.Content: I think we had a good shrimp po-boy a year ago. Probably still the same, but drunk bachelors slamming pitchers of beer at noon is not my scene since I am not one of them. Goes with the territory in The Quarter, but we didn't start early enough.

Reviews.Author: Christy L.
Reviews.Content: Everyone said, "You must go to Acme when you visit NOLA," so I did!I get the impression that Acme is mostly popular due to us 'visitors' and not so much a local spot. Honestly, if I could give half stars, I would. Four is more than generous and three is insulting.The chargrilled oysters were the 'must order' dish, and I will say, they were quite different than any oyster preparation I have ever had. The flavor was really nice, but I had a hard time getting past how gritty they were. Not sure if there was someone new in the back and they didn't quite know how to properly clean oysters, or the oysters in NOLA are just gritty in general.Do you love deep -fried stuff? Then this is your place! I ate so much fried food that evening that I think I may have suffered a mild heart-attack. Craw Puppies - a hushpuppie, but with crawdad (mudbugs)Fried Peace Maker Po-Boy - this was delicious - a fried masterpiece of sammich!Fried Seafood Platter - did I mention they have fried food?And washed it all down with some booze...Favorite part of the meal? When I was asked, "Would you like to take a drink to go?"Damn, I love NOLA!

Reviews.Author: Matthew N.
Reviews.Content: As expected there was a line out the door and for good reason, the oysters are excellent and cheap!  After arriving in Nola, I checked into my hotel and immediately headed to Acme for some fresh oysters for lunch.  There's nothing like those boogery little creatures with lemon juice and Acme's cocktail sauce!

Reviews.Author: Jenny L.
Reviews.Content: Fun atmosphere with great service. The chargrilled oysters were great. We ordered the oyster po' boy, seafood étouffée, fried shrimp platter and dessert. Other than the chargrilled oysters most of the food was just ok. Loved the hush puppies. The atmosphere made it worth it.

Reviews.Author: Quinn E.
Reviews.Content: What can I tell you that the 1738 people before me haven't already said? We stopped in at lunch, which is the way to go. There was no line. It's not worth waiting in line. But hey, if you're determined to try this place, you'll probably have to wait in line. We got lucky. I was nervous about ordering the chargrilled oysters, but they were excellent. I had never had them before, maybe other places do them better, but the ones we had at Acme impressed us. They had plenty of garlic, butter, and cheese on them and were absolutely delicious. I worried they would be grossly chewy like mussels or texturally unappealing like raw oysters, but they were neither. We also split the Peace Maker (shrimp and oyster) po' boy. The po' boy was good, but nothing compared to Parkway. Kind of small, not enough shrimp/oysters, and overpriced. But, those chargrilled oysters were tops.

Reviews.Author: Aaron D.
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a 3.5/4 star restaurant.  However, the char grilled oysters may have been the greatest thing I've ever eaten, so it gets 5.  Gumbo was bland, soft shell crab was good, crab and corn soup was very good.  But wow, those oysters!

Reviews.Author: Ray C.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a dozen charbroiled oysters.  They were as advertised...delicious!  We also had a bowl of chicken and sausage gumbo, which was very good.  We then shared an oyster and shrimp po-boy, and that was absolutely the bomb!!Our waiter was extremely attentive, and anticipated our needs...for example, giving us two plates for the po-boy to share, and refilled our beverages 3 times!  Great service, great food, great experience.  I was tempted to buy a t-shirt, but then said nah, I'll just have to come back again...and again!

Reviews.Author: Stanley W.
Reviews.Content: The food is great and the food is GREAT. It's a must stop shop in new orleans. Get your oysters and po boy!

Reviews.Author: AJay J.
Reviews.Content: Simply amazing!!!

Reviews.Author: Raquel C.
Reviews.Content: Excellent for oysters and poboys!!!! The fried fish was AMAZING!!!The place is very crowded, small and loud.Service is alright!People should deff visit this place if you are visiting NOlA

Reviews.Author: Miss B.
Reviews.Content: I love it here. Apparently there can be a line but there wasnt one when we got here. It was about 5pm or so on a Sunday. We walked in and were seated immediately. The staff was upbeat and fun and our server, Missy, was informative and patient while we made our choices. I had heard this place was good for po-boys so thats what we had. They both were good. The po-boy moreso than the soup but still good. We had a fried crab claw appetizer that was pretty good too. Had never seen it before on a menu and happy we got that. I tried the Abita Amber...a local beer. LOVED it. Very tasty. Would definitely have that again. We also had dessert. I got the pecan cobbler. Its basically a deconstructed pecan pie....A-EFFING-MAZING!!! It was soo good. Reminded me of eating pecan pie and butter pecan ice cream with my father as a child. We left full and happy!

Reviews.Author: Lina C.
Reviews.Content: Must-have when in New Orleans. We came on a Saturday around 1pm, and there was a big line with 30-40min wait. Luckily, we were able to be seated quicker at the bar. It is fun seating at the oyster bar so you can watch oysters get shucked right in front of you. Highly recommend the fresh oysters and charbroiled oysters. The oysters are very fresh and meaty. The seafood gumbo is also flavorful. Go for the half po-boy and gumbo combo. The fried fish po-boy sandwich is delicious. Skip the Boo fries. It came out cold and was really salty. Overall, come here for the delicious oysters and po-boy sandwich and the lively atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Hope C.
Reviews.Content: Touristy, long lines - but worth it. If you're on the fence about whether to go or not: JUST GO. Aceme is a French Quarter institution serving up amazing chargrilled oysters. Smoky, salty, buttery, charred, these morsels are wonderful. On the greasy side, but it's possible to eat the oyster flesh without sucking down the melted butter. The crayfish hushpuppies are also delicious - just the right amount of seafood, sweet cornbread and fried outer crunch. Definitely the most outstanding part of the night was the fried catfish, though. This piece of fish was AMAZING - true southern style, not greasy, tender, with that classic southern cornmeal coating. Haven't had it better except by some parents of a friend of mine - an elderly couple from Louisiana frying their "family catfish recipe" up at home! The house special poy boy had great fried oysters and shrimp, but the touch bread and messy fillings made the entire experience lackluster. If I could re-do that experience, I'd just empty out the fried goods and eat those only.Decor here is really laid back, as is the dining area with paper mats and basically anything goes. It's busy, it's bustling, it's southern. You'll love it!

Reviews.Author: Greg F.
Reviews.Content: This food was amazing!  This was one of those dining experiences that really surprised me.  The Oysters and the Craw Puppies were fantastic.

Reviews.Author: Victor H.
Reviews.Content: Maybe a 3.8, but not exactly a 4 star place.  During lunch, the wait is quite painful, and a bit strange.  You go in line, and then they come to you, to write your name down.  Food:- Grilled oysters - definitely make this place stand out.  Even my non-oyster-eating wife enjoyed them.- Po' boy sandwich - Pretty standard.  The buns are pretty dense, yet still a bit fluffy.- Raw oysters - very well shucked.  These fresh oysters made it worth the trip to this restaurant.- Fried seafood and fries - just a tad bit better than the fish and chips from Ivars or any other seafood place.  Service:They need more servers and to be better organized.  Busy restaurants don't excuse diminished service.  As they are an oyster house, you must try both the raw and grilled oysters.  Everything else is just meh.

Reviews.Author: Carol C.
Reviews.Content: On my stay here in New Orleans this was definitely one of the places that I was most excited to try. The chargrilled oysters were definitely the best thing here. Absolutely delicious and rich in flavor, a definite must try if you are coming here. Also had their famous shrimp and oyster po-boy and although it was good I have had better ones in NOLA. We came around 11:30 in the morning on a weekday so we got seated quickly, but if you are coming during dinner time be prepared to wait in line for a bit. Overall food was good and a must try if you are coming to New Orleans!

Reviews.Author: Brad F.
Reviews.Content: OMG!  Chargrilled oysters! We had a dozen raw oysters, chargrilled oysters and seafood gumbo. Their food is amazing. One of the best meals while visiting NOLA. Walking distance from the French Quarter.

Reviews.Author: Leila L.
Reviews.Content: The food and service are simply amazing! We got there 4:45pm after a tour, so we got a table easily. When we went out at about 6, there was such a long line waiting out there! Lucky that we got there early by accident.We started with raw oysters and the world-famous chargrilled oysters. The raw ones are good, but the chargrilled ones are awesome! We actually got another dozen after the dinner just to go with drinks. The fried crawfish platter is good in a way that it is not that deeply fired and kept the original flavor of the crawfish. The 10 napkins roasted beef po boy was so surprisingly tasty! I didn't expect it to be so good at first but I just love it!

Reviews.Author: Grace T.
Reviews.Content: AWESOME! Very fresh. Both chargrilled and raw oysters are fantastic with a reasonable price. We went there twice in two weeks.

Reviews.Author: Tammy L.
Reviews.Content: Acme Oyster House, located in the heart of the French Quarter is a restaurant that can't be ignored.  Reviewed by over 1800 on Yelp and liked by many on Urbanspoon, this touristy restaurant has seen both good days and bad.  First opened in the 1920's, their claim to fame is - obviously, oysters.  When we went, we had the chargrilled oysters as our appetizer, which was quite heavy (LOTS of butter)!   Beware, those who can't take all the greasiness!  What's worse is they provide bread to soak up all the butter... Three was definitely enough (while I can easily eat a dozen of raw ones of the same size).  We also had the Fried Peace Maker Po-Boy, which is a fried oyster and shrimp sandwich with a tabasco mayo sauce.  I was rather disappointed by the flavoring of this sandwich, even though I love oysters and shrimp!  The oysters were alright, while the shrimp was lacking in freshness and...shrimp.  It was mostly batter, and the flavor was just a bit flat.  The po' boy as a whole just didn't look all that fresh, which was really disappointing!  We also shared the Fried Fish Platter, which was just more fried food.  We could have ordered something that wasn't fried - but in reality - almost everything on the menu is fried!  The fried fish was hot and fresh and not at all fishy, though.  The batter was crisp, and the fish fried to perfection on this occasion.  This sounds a terrible, but the hush puppies and the fried fish may have been my favorite part of my experience at Acme.Whether its raw or chargrilled oysters that fit your fancy, Acme will take care of ya, but at quite the price.  The novelty of this place was enough to bring me here once, but probably not again.  The terribly slow and rude service (I'm not the only one) combined with the price does not compel me to dine here twice.
Reviews.Author_Location: Central Business District, New Orleans, LA

Reviews.Author: Gilad B.
Reviews.Content: Oysters galore!If you want some oysters (and craw-fish in season) this is the place to go. Wait in the long line outside (with a drink in hand) because it moves quickly and well worth the wait. We got a large tray of grilled oysters and then a seafood mix platter and we were in seafood heaven. The cat fish was also great. dont miss it.

Reviews.Author: Kristin G.
Reviews.Content: So I found this place on Yelp, and it had great reviews. We got there and there was a line waiting outside to get in! What is this a club? lol Guess it must be good. So we wait all of 5 minutes (not too bad) and got seated. We ordered the Chargrilled Oysters to start, and boy, were they FANTASTIC! My husband doesn't like oysters at all, and he looooved these! Ordered the shrimp po'boy and it was great and my husband ordered the fish platter, and it was enough for 2 people!! He couldn't finish it all, and he can eat! lol. Overall, great place, great food, and cheap prices! Cant go wrong!

Reviews.Author: Karen W.
Reviews.Content: Come here for the tasty oysters. We decided to get a half dozen, char-grilled. I also ordered the medley (Jambalaya, gumbo, grilled sausage, red beans and rice), and tried some of the peacemaker po-boy. The oysters had a deep smokey flavor, with a buttery cheesy concoction cooked with them. Quite good, although they were just slightly overcooked and a little tough. I wasn't too impressed with the medley. First of all, the portions were pretty small for the price ($13) The red beans and rice were a bit bland and mushy, and while the gumbo was made with fresh crab and shrimp, there were pieces of crab shell in the soup providing an unpleasant and unexpected crunch when trying to eat the soup. The jambalaya and smoked sausage were decent. The peacemaker po-boy (Fried shrimp and oyster) was excellent. The bread had the right balance of crunch and chewiness, and the seafood was fried to perfection.Service, while friendly, was uneven. Since there always seems to be a slew of people waiting outside in line, and a slew of people being seated at any time, it took a bit of time to get our orders in. Aside from getting our initial fill of drinks (Iced tea), we didn't get any service in between our meal for refills.

Reviews.Author: Kristin G.
Reviews.Content: We actually saw this on TV before going to New Orleans but didn't put it together until we were in there.We ate here our first day in NOLA.  It started to rain as we got there, then we got to enjoy the most spectacular thunderstorm while drinking hurricanes and eating oysters.The food was good, the service was completely amusing.  Win/win.

Reviews.Author: Laura A.
Reviews.Content: Delish!  I got the broiled oysters, YUM!  And the crawpuppies were awesome.  Red beans and rice, almost as good as hubby's.  Crawfish poboy, delish.  The bread pudding was pretty snazzy.  Waitress, not so much, but I won't hold it against the place!  Definitely stop here if you have time!

Reviews.Author: Anne S.
Reviews.Content: This is a NOLA staple.  I didn't think it was worth the wait or the money, but it was good.We tried the charbroiled oysters.  These are the only oysters I have liked.  They were very garlicky and buttery which made them good.I tried the grilled chicken po-boy, it was tasty but not very big.   I had the New Orleans medley.  I liked the Jambalaya, thought the sausage and red beans and rice were fine, but wasn't a fan of the gumbo.  It was very sea foody.Service was good, but they are insanely busy all the time.

Reviews.Author: Andrea P.
Reviews.Content: Second time visiting this marvelous city, second time and Acme House and I cannot wait to get back to both!  From my limited experience there always seems to be a line outside, however it moves rather quickly.  The atmosphere is casual and the staff is very friendly!The food is what the hype is all about, and they do not disappoint.  The char grilled oysters are AMAZING and consistent.  In addition I've tried some of the more traditional dishes such as etouffe and gumbo but my favorite were the po boys.  They are not only massive but fresh and delicious.  Acme House seems to be a new orleans tradition so I highly recommend giving it a try!

Reviews.Author: Stephie Z.
Reviews.Content: This is a tourist trap, there is a terribly long wait at times (or at least an unbearable looking line), and it is pricey, but I thought what I got was pretty good. I didn't get a lot nor did I eat in.  I hit Acme up on the way to the airport and asked the hostess at the front of the line if I could go in and order to go.  Pro-tip- they don't take phone orders.  Lady told me to go to the back of the line and wait.  Apparently she gave me the wrong advice since as soon as I got to the front of the line the other hostess was like, oh you could have gone in whenever.  Damn you!  I ordered gumbo and a peacemaker po'boy to go.  The gumbo was decent.  It was made with a roux rather than filé which is my preferred gumbo method.  The main thing the gumbo was missing was spiciness and flavor. Actually most places in New Orleans had dumbed down food.  Come on peeps, step it up.  The peacemaker po'boy with fried shrimp and oysters was great.  I had a couple of bites right after ordering and then ate the rest about 45 minutes later.  Shockingly it was still good, despite the roll being a bit more "steamed".  It did need some extra Tabasco added- again with the weak spicy level. All in all a good solid meal. I would go back.

Reviews.Author: Jaime R.
Reviews.Content: Amazing! Best meal I had in NOLA and we had some good food. The po boy was so good I wanted to come back another time. Oysters are huge!!!!

Reviews.Author: Linda T.
Reviews.Content: Not much left to say that hasn't been said already but here it goes:A.) There is ALWAYS a line here, don't be discouraged though, it goes by pretty quick.B.) The oysters rockefeller is out of this world! They know how to cook them bad boys! C.) This is a tourist spot, (also the guy on Man Vs. Food was here, he ate a ridiculous amount of oysters). With that being said just go give it a try, esp. if you love oysters & seafood!

Reviews.Author: Gisha J.
Reviews.Content: I have been to New Orleans twice so far.  Both times I made sure not to leave New Orleans without going to Acme Oyster House.  The food is delicious!  Every dish I've had at Acme has been amazing.  You cannot go wrong going here for lunch or dinner.  There has been a wait during each of my visits but it goes by quick and it is definitely worth it! I would highly recommend Acme Oyster House if you are looking for a great southern meal.

Reviews.Author: Seth B.
Reviews.Content: Acme oyster house is tucked into the very beginning of the French Quarter and is a tourist spot but also has some very good food. My favorite thing their is the tabasco infused mayonnaise!! This aioli love is spread handsomely all over the delicious poboy's to make them stand out from other spots around town. I would suggest this on the oyster, shrimp and really everything. They also do a great job with the raw oysters which is what makes them famous. I know the line isn't that cool but the food is always spicy and just right. It's a place to hit while staying in the French Quarter and looking for classic New Orleans seafood. Fun spot to have a few beers as well. If you need to have a company party then they also have a banquet room upstairs.

Reviews.Author: Nicole D.
Reviews.Content: I first herd of this shindig from a tv show. I was hesitant to try oysters because of a bad experience but i tried them anyway and WOW! They blew my mind. I will only eat oysters from here!The resturuant was semi busy but the service was great. Our waiter was fast and always kept our glasses full. He was one of the best waiters weve ever had!

Reviews.Author: sarah l.
Reviews.Content: My favorite casual eating spot in NOLA.  Great po boys, gumbo, oysters...everything!  A must go to if you've never been. Don't be scared of the line outside at busy times..goes by fast and worth the wait

Reviews.Author: Candice H.
Reviews.Content: I loved my time here. Steve the oyster shucker kept me engaged and entertained with his stories of the bayou. If you are here with a group be prepared to wait as there usually is a line, but it's worth it! Being alone I didn't have to wait long to be seated at the bar. I met some lovely couples and some friendly Australians as well.I ordered the char grilled oysters which were delicious. What's not to love? Oysters smothered in butter and cheese. Served with bread to soak up that lovely sauce. This along with the Abita amber make a nice combination. On a recommendation I also tried the local Andy gator beer, which had a bit more bitter notes too it. Since I don't enjoy bitter beers, I liked the Abita amber more. As my last dinner in New Orleans I was very happy. Great food and people made my last night enjoyable.

Reviews.Author: Paul H.
Reviews.Content: *TIP: Get here before 11:20am if you want to avoid a wait*Decor: 3/5-Because of the area, it isn't the cleanest. What do I mean by that? Flies in my water.Service: 4/5-We sat at the bar and Terry was attentive and friendlyFood: 2/5-Shrimp PoBoy was very underwelming. No flavor, just battered shrimp. The white bread and lettuce didn't help either. (1/5)-Seafood Gumbo also didn't have any flavor so we added some Tabasco sauce. This helped but felt like it took away from the Gumbo's intended flavor. Oh well. (2/5)-Char Grilled Oysters is definitely a must as mentioned in the other 1000s of reviews. Beware though, if you're sensitive to heavy ingredients like cheese and butter, start with only a half dozen. (3.5/5)

Reviews.Author: Brian H.
Reviews.Content: I have to be super honest here.  Had the food not been amazing, this review would be 1 star.  We arrived at about 1pm on a Thursday and had heard nothing but great things.  Not to mention all of our friends on yelp that have ranted and raved about Acme.  We ordered 1/2 dozen of the Charbroiled Oysters (MUST HAVE), the lady ordered the fried Crawfish, and I had the New Orleans Sample plate (this plate was served with one small piece of sausage, one cup of gumbo, and a small serving of red beans and rice.  While I wasn't impressed with the portion size for the money, my girlfriends portion was more than enough as she chose it from the "appetizer" selection.  I left a bit unsatisfied and I am not a huge guy or a heavy eater.  That being said, the food was very good, authentic, and delicious.  Even though the food was good, our server, Keisha was not!  She was slow, inattentive, and offered nothing to the overall experience of visiting Acme.  She lacked personality and had no recommendations.  I expected more.  When my gf asked if she could get ranch the server's response, "we don't have ranch".  Not, "we don't offer ranch, but you'd like (insert alternative here)".  I don't think she smiled one time during our meal/visit.  I would come back and sit at the bar and order the charbroiled oysters again.  Don't plan on sitting down at a table in the future.

Reviews.Author: Jay N.
Reviews.Content: We came here after 930 so there wasn't a line despite a Saints game going on.  You can't really park around here but you can use a garage.  I'd recommend walking or taking a cab here though.  We ordered some raw oysters and chargrilled oysters.  The raw oysters are pretty juicy but not briny unlike West coast or East coast ones.  I wish they left a little more liquor in the shells for me to slurp.  The chargrilled oysters are really good.  Nice cheese and butter taste along with some french bread to soak up some of the herbs.  We also ordered some sides and the hush puppies were well made and fried to a good crisp.  The red beans and rice were solid and not salty.  The jambalaya was a bit salty for my taste but the roux was quite rich in a good way.  The waitress recommended soft shell crab and that is something never to be skipped.  As many others have mentioned before, it's still a very solid place for great oysters and get a feel for New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: Carl N.
Reviews.Content: Go early to get a table or you will be waiting for ever. Expect to wait even if you go early, but it is worth it. Best cocktail sauce in the world, but they don't sell it! I can't believe they don't sell it, it is amazing. The wife had the oyster po boy and and I had the roast beef. We split fries and there was so much food for a great price. The tables are really close together so be ready to get to know the people next to you, but don't worry everyone is friendly. The staff is great and will bring you extra sauce with no hassle.  Stop in and get a great dinner.

Reviews.Author: Kristi R.
Reviews.Content: Food was decent but not worth the long wait, the incredibly inattentive service, loud atmosphere, or sitting next to a total stranger .  They had no problem getting us the check but was in desperate need of a refill of water which I never got. We had chargrilled oysters, étouffée and peace maker. Will not return and would not recommend. Total tourist trap

Reviews.Author: Essi Y.
Reviews.Content: I'm not a fan of oysters in general, but this place was great. I tried the charcoal grilled and they were just incredible. A must-try if you're visiting.A bonus is the history of the place has truly left it's mark.

Reviews.Author: lan n.
Reviews.Content: Jeez louis the chargrilled oysters were super salty to the point i couldnt taste the oyster, just the butter and cheese.  I recommend getting a half dozen and share it with friends just to have the experience since you are at ACME after all. -The poboy was decent but the bread was hard and a bit stale. -Service was good- this place is really loud. you have to really scream if you want the person next to you to hear you

Reviews.Author: Anna F.
Reviews.Content: Let's face it, this place is a dive -- but ya better believe the hype! The grilled oysters literally made me moan out loud they were so good. Gumbo, sublime. Rich, dark roux with enough file to remind you that you are in New Orleans. If I'm not mistaken, I licked the bowl. And of course, the classic po boy. Perfectly dusted and fried oysters and shrimp nestled on the most delicious crusty bread you've ever tasted. Not overdone with accompaniments. Simply delicious comfort food.

Reviews.Author: Zach L.
Reviews.Content: The line to get in here is probably the most intriguing and most intimidating thing about this place. It makes you wonder if it's worth the wait. The great thing is, that in New Orleans, you're allowed to have open containers of alcohol in the street. So we all grabbed a 32 ounce brew and waited the 45 minutes to get in and the wait went rather fast. And boy it was worth the wait!! Only thing we had here were the Louisiana Horseshoe Oysters, we had 4 dozen raw and 2 does char-grilled oysters. These oysters were gi-normous (that's gigantic and enormous combined) and delicious at that. They had a great house-made cocktail sauce, served it with lemon and throw a little louisiana hot sauce on there and boom, you're sitting pretty well if you ask me!!

Reviews.Author: Callie J.
Reviews.Content: I was at work downtown and needed a quick bite to eat on my lunch break. Acme was the closest thing. I just wanted to order to go, but still had to wait a few minutes outside before they would let me sit at the bar and do so. While I was waiting, I looked at the menu outside, so I knew what I wanted and what the prices were. When I get inside and order, my check comes and everything is marked up by 2 or 3 bucks. When I said something, they just shrugged. I didn't have time to argue, so just accepted it, but thought this was very shady. I get my food and walk back to work where I open it. I ordered the crab cake, which I was told was 1 giant one. It was 1 for sure, but 1 regular sized one. Not only that, but there was no remoulade to go with it. What?! My gumbo was good though.

Reviews.Author: Andy T.
Reviews.Content: With a place that has much history behind it and seeing it have lines all the time that I have been to NOLA (5 times and counting), this place has to be on your to do list of places to eat if you visit. Everything is friend in NOLA...I get that...but the grilled Oysters they have here are off the hook. I don't know if it's the butter on it and other seasonings but we ate so much of it there. Everything else I ate there kinda tasted the same where ever I go...it's all fried. Tip: If you going to wait in line...go get a better across the street at Penthouse so you can at least drink something while you wait in line:) Expect to wait at least 25 mins or more if you are about 10-15 deep with the line outside.

Reviews.Author: Tommy W.
Reviews.Content: The line is worth it. For a "tourist trap" Acme does it right. Char grilled oysters are the best. The raw ones are tasty too, but feel like sometimes the boys get lazy shuckin and leave some shell and grit. Drinks are a little pricey, but its to be understood. Boo fries are the bomb, but ask for extra gravy. Service could defnitely be better, but for a good time ask to sit at the oyster bar and BS with the staff. Especially if there is a line out front (which there always is) this is your shortcut in.

Reviews.Author: Michael F.
Reviews.Content: A trip to Acme Oyster House, just south of Bourbon street, inevitably starts with a bit of a line up.  During slow season, when we visited, the line up was about 20 minutes.  I was at a place across the road on a Saturday night, and the line looked to be about twice as long.  The worse part about this was being stuck in line with filthy smokers with nowhere to get away from it.  My eyes were stinging from having smoke blown in my face by the time I got inside.To reduce the wait, sign up for "first available seating" which means you'll either be at a table or at the bar.The seating that we ended up with was cafeteria style - a table for 6, with 3 different groups of 2 seated at it.We started by sharing a dozen of the chargrilled oysters.  They were delicious - and I don't even really like oysters.  They were sprinkled with butter and parmesan, then cooked.  They were served with a few pieces of bread.  Very good.I also got the New Orleans Medley - a sampling of gumbo, jambalaya, red beans and rice and smoked sausage.  I really enjoyed the jambalya.  The red beans and rice were just ok, as was the smoked sausage.  I didn't enjoy the seafood gumbo that much, but I'm not a huge seafood fan.  I probably would have enjoyed the chicken gumbo more.Overall, I'd rate the oysters 5 stars.  It's the food in the name and obviously the house specialty.  The rest of the food gets 3 stars from me.  The service and atmosphere gets 3 stars.  I'll go with a generous 4 stars for Acme.

Reviews.Author: Frank H.
Reviews.Content: I waited in line for this?  The place was small and packed!  Nothing had a clean feel to it.  The raw oysters across the street were bigger and better.  The char grilled oysters were OK at best.  I really do not understand the attraction, go to Felix's across the street and eat better food in a better atmosphere without waiting in line.

Reviews.Author: Oscar A.
Reviews.Content: AMAZING CHAR GRILLED OYSTERS. Our party of 6 ordered 3 dozens of these because they are just that delicious. The raw oysters were nothing out of the ordinary, just a small issue was that they were not cleaned very well as every bite had rocks and sand. Stick to the Char grileld ones! the smell alone was worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Michael O.
Reviews.Content: Line was crazy during Mardi Gras weekend, but it didn't deter me from going 3 times.  Don't waste your time with raw oysters.  Chargrilled all the way.  If your a big eater like me, you can easily house 3 dozen in a sitting.  I also tried the half oyster- half shrimp po boy.  It was decent but stomach space is better utilized with the..yes.. you know it..c-grilled oysters.  Wish all the oysters were on the bigger side though.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany C.
Reviews.Content: I had Acme bookmarked for several months and couldn't wait to try it while in New Orleans so of course, my girlfriends and I headed here immediately after checking into our hotel. We ended up ordering a dozen chargrilled oysters, two dozen raw oysters, fried crawfish tail and an order of boo fries. The food was amazing and the oysters were so fresh! Also, the service was great and attentive. We actually ended up back in Acme for lunch again on our departure day because the food was that good! For the second time, we ordered the étouffée, pacemaker po boy and of course, a bunch of oysters.The food was just so good that we couldn't help starting and ending our trip with Acme!Also, on weekends there's a line all day so I would recommend coming in right when they open.

Reviews.Author: Ashley S.
Reviews.Content: This was a great stop for getting some oysters. There was a bit of a line outside, but we were seated within ten minutes. Most of the seating is family style, so you will sit with other people, but this worked out great! We were going to get their raw oysters, but the couple next to us recommended the chargrilled oysters and we are so glad that we switched. The char-grilled oysters were amazing!! No matter what you order, you must get these! We also had their jambalaya, which was pretty good.

Reviews.Author: Amanda J.
Reviews.Content: You can't go to New Orleans without a stop here! I was so scared to try oysters but the charbroiled ones are amazing! A little bit of lemon and hot sauce and I am drooling thinking about them! We also ordered a soft shell crab that came deliciously fried! The hush puppies and crab cakes were also delish! The wait wasn't too bad and luckily we had drinks in our hand so it didn't seem so long! I am determined to find charbroiled oysters in California now!

Reviews.Author: Emma K.
Reviews.Content: I would recommend coming here on a weekday for lunch if possible to avoid the lines.  After walking by several evenings when there were lines down the block to get in here, we came back for lunch since my parents are huge oyster fans.  I'm not an oyster person, but my parents seemed to really enjoy them.I stuck with a shrimp po boy and a side of potato salad both of which were very traditional and super delicious.  I wasn't hungry for the rest of the day after this huge lunch.Defintely a yummy lunch, but not sure worth the waits for dinner given all of the amazing restaurants in New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: Danny W.
Reviews.Content: Fun authentic atmosphere. Consistent food.  Reasonable prices - for the French Quarter. Chargrilled oysters were good.  Dipping the bread into the sauce was the best part.  Our table ordered a variety of fried seafood plates and were satisfied. Good flavor and portions.  Don't let the wait outside intimidate you.  They manage the line well.  Just get in the line and they will come tell you how it works.  Don't try to go in and put a name down.  They come out to you.

Reviews.Author: John C.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled oysters are where it's at. Holy smokes those are delicious!! This place is always packed so be ready to wait, however it's is totally worth the wait. Service is quick and polite, and the boudin was simply something you must try. It's a southern thing that will have you guessing whether or not you like it until you take another bite, and another, and another...

Reviews.Author: GJ F.
Reviews.Content: We came here for the chargrilled oysters and we were glad that we did. The oysters are great, some might say it's a little too salty but I think it's just the cheese. The oysters do come for a price. For only 6 oysters it costs about 8 dollars and for a dozen oysters it costs 13+ dollars. The oyster sauce is awesome, we dipped the bread in it until we were out of the sauce. We tried other things like the seafood gumbo and jambalaya which was OK. You come for the chargrilled oysters not for the gumbo or jambalaya. The service was OK. They put on their fake smiles when serving. Overall, it's a good place, nice atmosphere and good chargrilled oysters.

Reviews.Author: SM H.
Reviews.Content: We had the dozen raw oysters, fried fish po-boy, soft-shell crab, and the corn bisque.  Everything was good, but I felt that it was not anything too special.  There's so many restaurants in the French quarters that waiting in line for 30 minutes didn't fully feel like it was worth it.  Still gave it 4 stars, because the food was good.

Reviews.Author: Colin A.
Reviews.Content: Bit of a tourist trap, but the food's still good. I wouldn't wait in any length line for it though, just go across the street to Felix's or down to Coop's and try Acme another day if you want.

Reviews.Author: Kim D.
Reviews.Content: YUMMERS!  My friend and I got here at 10:50AM on Friday morning to wait for them to open at 11:00AM.  And they don't open a minute sooner.  Soon a line formed after us.  We were then seated promptly when they opened.  Between us we ordered a dozen raw oysters and 1/2 dozen chargrilled oysters then the gumbo.  All to share because we planned on getting some po-boys afterwards since we're fatties.The oysters were extremely fresh.  Very well sized.  And plain delicious.  We both enjoyed the chargrilled oysters, too.  And it appears that's what brings a lot of folks here.  The chargrilled oysters were a big puny though.  Itsy Bitsy.  Good flavors nonetheless.  And the gumbo was very delicious.  I'm a fan.When we left around 11:50, there was a small line still.  When we walked by again around 12:30, the line was pretty hefty.  And that's on a Friday.  I can only imagine the wait on a weekend.

Reviews.Author: Grace P.
Reviews.Content: Just tried acme's charbroiled oysters after having drago's oysters last night. We were lucky to have practically no wait on a Sunday after the lunch rush at acme's. Hubby ordered half a dozen half raw oysters and we shared half a dozen charbroiled. We tend to favor west coast oysters more but hubby did enjoy the raw ones nonetheless. We both agreed the drago charbroiled oysters were far superior in the quality and size of the oysters, the seasoning of the garlic butter topping, and even the bread. The ambiance was also much nicer at drago's (we went to the one in the Hilton). Personally I was glad we got to try the acme oysters without a wait bc it's not worth a one hour for the oysters or the experience there.

Reviews.Author: Michelle B.
Reviews.Content: Long wait so get a beer for the line. Grilled oysters are AMAZING!!! And waitstaff is friendly and quick!

Reviews.Author: Lu X.
Reviews.Content: My friend took me to this place for dinner last week. Its oysters, both raw and chargrilled, are the best I've ever had. I also had the French étouffée, which also tasted amazing. Expect long lines, but it's totally worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Michelle A.
Reviews.Content: Chargilled oysters don't sound like much, but believe me, they are.  They come out SEARING HOT, in their shells, covered in cheesy, buttery, salty deliciousness.  My only complaint was that we didn't get enough bread to soak up all the cheesy greasy bits :)I also got the half and half po boy (half friend shrimp, half fried oysters) and that was a strategic error because I should have gone all oysters.  Those little devils are AMAZE-BALLS.I recommend getting here early, when we got in around 5:30pm we got seated right away (despite a few other larger groups in line in front of us) but by the time we left 45 mins later, the line was almost around the block.My only real beef with this place is that it's a little pricey.  There were three of us, we each got a beer and a po boy, and we split one appetizer, and the bill was $80... Even though the sandwiches were big, and filled with oysters, I still think they were a bit overpriced...All in all, this place was good for me though.  Not pretentious at all, you can walk in off the street in jeans and get good food, fast.  If I go back, I'll definitely try the raw oysters and I'll do the half po boy with some gumbo, as I've heard it's good.  And, I want to meet Mr. Norman.  He sounds precious!

Reviews.Author: Anne K.
Reviews.Content: Of all the restaurants we went to in NOLA, Acme would have to be the highlight of my vacation. There's something quintessentially New Orleans about this institution - it's all about the food and the quick, but friendly service. Yes, it sucks having to wait outside in what feels like 100-degree weather, but I swear the sweat and hunger pangs will be worth it. The raw oysters were AMAZING and the chargrilled oysters were even better. I'd highly recommend the half po' boy and side option if you want a little variety. I had the shrimp po' boy (it's a classic) and a cup of jambalaya, which was perfectly spiced and seasoned. Definitely check out Acme if you're anywhere near the French Quarter.

Reviews.Author: Tara N.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely worth the wait. The chargrilled oysters are a MUST! Your trip to NOLA isn't complete if you don't eat here. The wait wasn't even a bother, grab a drink and hang out in line. Large portions for meals as well.

Reviews.Author: Maggie P.
Reviews.Content: Amazing!

Reviews.Author: Natalie T.
Reviews.Content: Wanted to see what all the hype was when I was visiting this past weekend for my birthday.It was rainy all day and sadly we had to stand in the rain. Although the line seemed quite long, it did move relatively fast (maybe around 30 minutes). Some of my friends grabbed daiquiris around the corner and that made waiting less painful ;)We were seated next to some drunkies that made it a bit unpleasant... one spilled water all over the table (and me). Thank goodness they moved tables shortly after.Bf and I wanted to attack the oysters.Raw oysters - Yummmmm. I've never seen or tasted oysters like this. It was very clean and refreshing. I'd love to get some more of that.Chargrilled oysters - Tasty, but I may like it at other places better. New Orleans Medley - Had a sampling of everything (gumbo, jambalaya, red beans & rice and grilled smoked sausage), and it all tasted great. All the rice made it quite filling too.Defintely would come back to get a dozen of those oysters for myself if I ever come back.Note: No split checks! You gotta do all the math yourself if you're in a big group so bust out your phones.

Reviews.Author: Chelsea B.
Reviews.Content: We ate here on a recent trip. I ordered the Chargrilled oysters, which actually ended up being the best I found during my short trip. Staff were quick, friendly. Wait was fast for us since we were not in a group. Would recommend going in a small group to avoid waiting.

Reviews.Author: Lauren V.
Reviews.Content: The only thing I ever get is oysters, raw and char-grilled. Anytime I get other new orleans cuisine it really doesnt stand up to high expectations. I wouldn't ever introduce their gumbo, jambalaya, red beans or po boys to  newbies or visitors as new orleans cuisine. Im sad it just isnt good :( BUT AMAZING OYSTERS!

Reviews.Author: mariza r.
Reviews.Content: Char-grilled oysters are my favorite part of New Orleans! The wait is not that bad because once you get your name down you get called pretty soon after. Minus one star for the bread pudding that left much to be desired; it was mushy with little flavor.

Reviews.Author: Natacha B.
Reviews.Content: The rave reviews over their chargrilled oysters is NOT over hyped! They are THE BEST!!!!! But my seafood etoufee kinda sucked, as did my husband's  jambalaya. I ordered the bananas fosters cheescake and thought it was AMAZING but my waiter then told me where I could get  "a much better REAL one"? Smdh.....Come here, stuff your face with all the grilled oysters and cocktails you can afford, get the cheesecake and bounce is my advice!

Reviews.Author: J.B G.
Reviews.Content: My first time in New Orleans, and I had a blast. This place was amazing. I had jambalaya, fried oysters, seafood gumbo, and fried catfish, and it was amazing I really recommend it.

Reviews.Author: Mad A.
Reviews.Content: I don't know why there are reviews of this place where there is so much hate sometimes but all I can say is this placed SAVED my rear last time after a long workday schedule ! NOTE: If you have a fellow diner who has a SHELLFISH ALLERGY, this IS the place to go! Especially if you love seafood yourself! They have an AMAZING roast beef Po-boy here and the BOO FRIES are INCREDIBLE. Boo Fries by the way are an appetizer of fresh cut fries covered in cheese and roast beef gravy and the dish could be a total meal. The raw oysters on the half shell are a bit pricey but they are FRESH and HUGE! The same goes for the Po-Boy sandwiches as the portions here are generous. If you are willing to eat at the bar you can eat quicker here and they will make anything you want custom to order if it is not on the menu. I wanted a plate of some fried oysters ONLY and they made that for me too.  They also carry the latest seasonal version of any ABITA beer and the kegs are fresh and the taps are clean! (You can taste the difference too!). For the those unfamiliar with Abita Beers, you really can't go wrong on any of them. AndyGator goes great with seafood and the next time they make Mardi Gras Bock I am considering a commando style raid on the brewery to steal all of the kegs. :-) Oh yeah..one more thing that is a biggie: The place is CLEAN! The staff busts their ass and they get your food to you FAST! Don't let a long line outside scare you away because it moves pretty fast. At least it did the night I was there. NOTE: These are GOOD people that operate this place who do their best to make sure everything is awesome. Don't act like a pushy, jackass tourist here. You ain't in NYC! This ain't the Bronx and you don't have to start an argument just because you wanted something extra. Just ask politely and you will have it. It's called "Southern Hospitality" and IF you have the grace and breeding to see it, your "cup shall runneth over".  If ya still don't get it then keep moving past here and go drink some" hand grenades" with the college punks to raise your IQ.

Reviews.Author: Wendy L.
Reviews.Content: I waited three years to try this place after my failed attempt (due to the rain and a long line) during my first time in New Orleans! THREE YEARS! I was not to be deterred this time around. Glad the weather was on my side as well as. Someone must have known I would have thrown a fit if I wasn't able to come again this time.Got here around 5:45-ish and the line was decent. It only got kept getting longer after we arrived. We had a party of six and they were nice enough to hold our table for the 5 to 10 minutes it took until the last two people of our party arrived. After being seated, the waiter came by and took our orders. Obviously being called an Oyster House, you have to order the oysters!The boyfriend and I split an order of a half-dozen raw oysters, a half-dozen chargrilled oysters, and the fried seafood platter (oyster, shrimp, and fish). The raw oysters were nice and fresh, although expect an inconsistency of size. Some were big and others medium. As for the chargrilled, these oysters might have been small due to the cooking process but they came out bubbling in seasoned butter and cheese that was just oh so tasty! I was literally sticking the bread in all the leftover butter I could get! Hell, I probably would have drank the seasoned butter right from the oyster shell if it wasn't super hot! Definitely a must when you come here!As for the fried seafood platter, these was a delicious dish as well. The fried fish was nice and tender. The fried oysters were nice and big with a good oyster taste, unlike some places that give you the dinky small oysters that's mostly batter (YES! I'm talking about you Pappadeux!). The fried shrimp was cooked perfectly that I definitely cried when one fell of the plate on to the floor. Yes, I'll admit, I contemplated about the 5 second rule, but with the streets of New Orleans being as dirty as they were, I decided it was better left there then in my stomach.As for why 4 stars? I can't remember if they wrote down our order or not, but when we ordered the seafood platter, we asked for a side of coleslaw (absolutely delicious btw). However, our plate came with hush puppies instead. Easy fix, but I just didn't like having to wait and flag down the waiter to get it changed.

Reviews.Author: Susanne C.
Reviews.Content: Hell yes!I am not an oyster person, I think they are gross.  But, my other half loves them and insisted that we go to Acme Oyster house.  There was a very long line that we waited in, probably 35 minutes or so.  We ended up getting seated at the bar, which was totally fine with us.  There we got to meet Stormin' Norman.  He was shucking the oyster the whole time we were there.  These are not any run of the mill oysters, but large ones, like that size of you fist!  My other half says they are the best around.now, onto my food.  I ordered the Acme Special Po-Boy which is Hot debris-style roast beef, ham, turkey, American & Swiss cheese aka as the best thing I have ever tasted.  I was getting so full, but couldn't resist eating the entire sandwich.We try to eat at all the fun places when we travel, but so far, this was by far the best sandwich I have ever tried.

Reviews.Author: Matt M.
Reviews.Content: I'm pretty sure that while I was in line waiting to get in, I got hit by a bus.  Because after eating 2 dozen chargrilled oysters, I know I am now in heaven.  OMG they are amazing; probably the best oysters I have ever had!  Also the seafood étouffée and crawfish were excellent.  Totally worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Orun W.
Reviews.Content: I must say that the hospitality was on point. This was my first stop for geub in this town of New Orleans and they sure did welcome me. My waitress sean was so impressive. ..she actually took a order for 10ppl without writing anything down and didn't mess up a thing. As for the food...everything I ordered was good but the grilled Osters are to die for. I ordered a second batch. Yeah...thats how serious they are.

Reviews.Author: D.L. B.
Reviews.Content: Excellent oysters on the half-shell.  While in NO, I was told that the best raw oysters are at Acme Oyster House.  I had 2 doz. and found them to be decent sized, juicy, and flavorful.  Even during happy hour, their oysters tend to be more expensive then their competitors.  Still, you will enjoy the oysters there.

Reviews.Author: Vicky F.
Reviews.Content: me and my frd went right around opening hours so we didnt wait in line. the later it is, the longer the line will be. oysters are great there! as for the crawfish, if you like flavored ones, I wont encourage u to try theirs.. crawfish in NO in general is just salted crawfish, no other flavors are in it..... the seating will be very crowded. but do try the oysters!!!

Reviews.Author: Michael C.
Reviews.Content: My better half and I ate lunch here today. She had the fried shrimp PoBoy and I had the peace maker PoBoy. Both were very good. We also had the fried crab fingers for the appetizer along with the charbroiled oysters. Both were very good as well. She even commented how the charbroiled oysters were good. (She's never had oysters before but was willing to try them here.) Will definitely eat here again. Service was extremely good thanks to our waitress, Maria. She was very pleasant and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Author: Aisha S.
Reviews.Content: The line outside was well worth the wait! The chargrilled oysters were DELICIOUS! The red beans and rice were authentic and tasty also! Very reasonable prices for authentic New Orleans food in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Author: Janelle S.
Reviews.Content: Crazy long wait. Charbroiled oyster are a MUST. My cousin had their jumbalaya, which had really good flavor but it was on the salty side. But the side of fried crawfish tails were good. Lightly battered and fried is always good!! I had their seafood gumbo poopa!! Poopa! I know, sounds funny, but it's basically a bread bowl. It was good, but it was carb overload with the rice in the gumbo. I'd definitely go back and try more oysters.

Reviews.Author: Joann K.
Reviews.Content: Their charbroiled oysters are amazing. If you don't like oysters or seafood in general, just try the charbroiled oysters once and you will be a changed person. You also will not be disappointed with any of their po-boys or gumbos. Come here if you like good food and a fun atmosphere. Do not be turned away by their long lines. They move fast and there is a reason people wait to get in!

Reviews.Author: Hanae K.
Reviews.Content: Crazy long ass line just to be seated...we waited a good hour.Inside is super crowded and the servers did their best to be attentive with everyone. Oysters: raw- is great but nothing special about themgrilled oysters - yummmm eat them o

Reviews.Author: Melanie N.
Reviews.Content: The first time i tried to come here there was a line.  The second time i stopped by at 2pm, we got seated right away.  Score!  Their chargrilled oysters is everything dreams are made of!  I thought about these oysters for days and when i finally was able to get my hands on them...i was the happiest girl in the world! And when there were no more oysters left, i was frantically moping up the oyster juice mixed with butter, cheese, & garlic sauce with whatever pieces of bread that was left.  I totally thought Acme chargrilled oysters were better than Felix across the street.  The jambalaya was bomb too.  Next time when i visit Acme, i want to try everything!

Reviews.Author: Curtis H.
Reviews.Content: If you like fresh oysters OR if you like them charbroiled this is the place to get them when visiting the Big Easy. Expect to see a line out the door anytime around lunch or dinner, but I promise you it moves pretty darn quickly.Try sharing the fried plate (fish, shrimp, and oysters) with a table mate. It's generally enough to fill two people especially if you order fresh or charbroiled oysters for an appetizer.This is a definite NOLA experience so check them out.

Reviews.Author: Rob P.
Reviews.Content: The food is very good and I've eaten there several times.  However, it is very "touristy" and has always been crowded when I've gone.  I did get to meet George Stephanopoulos there around the Katrina anniversary in 2006, so the touristy part isn't all bad.  Very good food.

Reviews.Author: Nora S.
Reviews.Content: In general, I do trust Yelp as the place to find my eats. But Yelp did us wrong with this one. Over 1500 reviews and 4 stars? Not a chance. By far, this was the least impressive of our Louisiana eateries. Prices were better here than most of the places in the French Quarter, which may account for the high yelps. I'm not sure since I still thought it was overpriced especially for the food received. This was my second bowl of seafood gumbo. Granted the first bowl was so amazing, anything after that would fall down. However, this was the worst out of the three gumbos I tried on the trip (by quite a bit). Gumbo looked dark and was thick, but there was no flavor. It wasn't spicy enough. It was so bland. I added some Tabasco and that helped. But really I didn't sign up to eat Tabasco flavored soup. Not even close to being my favorite hot sauce. My husband was even less impressed with his Po Boy. We may be doing this place a disservice since we did not order oysters. Maybe the oysters would have redeemed them.

Reviews.Author: Shannon H.
Reviews.Content: This place was good but it was very busy and it felt a little crammed . The oysters were good very fresh and charbroiled oysters were delicious

Reviews.Author: Michelle B.
Reviews.Content: I am a woman of my word! Came back to this place with my bf incredibly drunk from day drinking. We were seated quickly and our waiter handled us very well despite our inebriation. Ordered the chargrilled oysters (I'm a creature of habit) and was impressed once again. My bf even tried some despite his apprehension for oysters and now he raves about them all the time! Brought him to the dark side mwahahahaComing back in a week...got another hotel close by for the bfs bday weekend. Can't wait to check it out again with a group.

Reviews.Author: Tim S.
Reviews.Content: After a nice little nap, I decided to wander down here and get some grub.  The line was long but since I was by myself, I got in within 5 minutes and grabbed a seat at the bar.  Placed my order for a dozen chargrilled oysters and a half and half po boy (oysters and shrimp).  I got a Coke to drink.  Since I was at the bar, I watched the shuckers do their thing.  Pretty impressive stuff.  They place dozens and dozens of oysters on huge trays and get everything prepared.  It kept me entertained while I waited for my food.  There were a couple of mix ups during my visit.  The waitress lady first brought out my dozen oysters and sat them down in front of the people next to me.  The shucker quickly pointed out to her that they were mine.  No harm no foul.  This unfortunately wasn't the last situation... They brought out my po boy and I started eating it.  Halfway through, I realized that it was all shrimp and no oysters.  I said fuck it because it was good but what happened was they gave me my neighbors sandwich.  Anyways..........on to the food.Chargrilled Oysters-  5 stars.  Give me 5 dozen of these and watch me go to town.  These were hands down the best thing I ate in New Orleans.  I am headed back in 2 weeks and am going right back to eat some more.  These things were so damn delicious.  Oysters topped with a grip of butter and then sprinkled with parmesan cheese.  They serve them with little rounds of bread so you can sop up the butter and cheese mixture after you are done eating your oysters.  These were AMAZING!  These things can almost be added to my "last meal on earth" list.  They were awesome!Shrimp Po Boy-  This thing was alright.  Besides being the wrong thing I ordered, I ate the whole thing and it tasted fine.  I would skip it next time though and get another order of oysters.  At the end of my meal, they gave me the check and I noticed that my po boy was not on it.  I should have kept my mouth shut, dropped the cash and then bailed (Karma will bite you in the ass though so I brought it to their attention).  What happened was that earlier when they brought out my sandwich, it was really my neighbors and they never charged me for it...therefore, they never placed an order for mine to begin with.  Anyways....got it all sorted out and paid my bill and left.  The chargrilled oysters are not cheap ($19.50 a dozen) but Ill be damned if they weren't one of the greatest things I ever ate and they were WELL worth the cost.  Cant wait to eat some more of them and come back in 2 weeks.

Reviews.Author: James F.
Reviews.Content: Maybe I'm missing a redeeming nuance of Acme oyster house. Upon our first try the wait was forty five minutes. We instead chose Dickie Brennan's with stellar results. The next morning we revisited Acme with no wait time; the interior almost half full with patrons eager to try a NOLA institution. Think old beer joint if your from Texas; two dining areas with the kitchen in the middle. I could see via the glass the chefs char grilling their famous oysters. A bloody mary to start paired with some fried craw puppies. Fried to a perfect golden brown, the pups worked well with the provided dipping sauce. I then ordered what I came for, the char grilled oysters. They were good, but not amazing. A word of advice, gobble them up as fast as you can because the cheese eventually sticks to the shell making it had hardened mess. Maybe I'm just a raw oyster kinda chap and should have ordered those instead.Service wasn't that great. The wife never got the glass of wine she ordered. I felt once the waitress knew we were just gonna order a few items, her interest was guided to tables with more patrons. Recalling the line from the day before and noticing 15 minutes after opening Acme was at near capacity, my three star experience won't hurt their reputation.

Reviews.Author: Tim P.
Reviews.Content: If you're like I was, you may not exactly be excited to eat oysters. However, I wanted the experience, so I begrudgingly went.The charbroiled oysters are incredible and were so good and perfect for a person like me who doesn't enjoy raw food. Would also highly recommend getting an order of the hush puppies and craw puppies!

Reviews.Author: Robert A.
Reviews.Content: We went for late breakfast/early lunch at 11:15 on a Saturday. The line was only about 20 people. We got seated in 5 minutes (a deuce). Very helpful waitress who was friendly and didn't rush us. Got started with a spicy bloody mary - it was dressed with okra and a green bean and wasn't too spicy.We split a dozen oysters and half dozen chargrilled to start. Coulda made a meal of the chargrilled - they were scrumptious. I thought the fresh oysters were kinda watery - didn't get the seawater punch. We also got the crawpuppies. They were good but a little over cooked. The horseradish dip was awesome.  Decided to split the Peacemaker Poor boy and got a side of jambalya (mediocre) and cole slaw (tasty).All in all it was a very filling lunch that didn't break the bank. When we left there were at least 60 people in line. Ironically the Brennan's restaurant next door advertised a very similar menu, but there was no line to get in...My advice is call for a reservation if they will take one at that time.

Reviews.Author: Cristen F.
Reviews.Content: First, I do not like oysters so this review should take that into consideration.  I have gone to the location in the Quarter several times when people visit from out of town.  The po boys are good.  I've tried the shrimp, the roast beef, the turkey, and the burger on po boy bread.  All were ok.  (The grilled shrimp salad is good that is on the Metairie menu.  I can't remember if that's on the French Qtr menu.  It's a good, fresh green salad with fresh grilled shrimp that are seasoned well and cooked correctly.) The fried crab claws were really good though.  The place is ok if you are in the Quarter, need to eat, can't get reservations somewhere else, and do not mind standing in line for up to an hour.

Reviews.Author: Raisa S.
Reviews.Content: So my husband wanted to try this place because its been featured on the TV show: "Man vs. Food". So we make the 15 min walk from our hotel down to the French Quarter. Immediately as we turn the corner we noticed the line outside the door. Oh the excitement has now set in!!! This place must be amazing for us to wait in line, outside, in 50degree &SUPER windy weather.... For 30 minutes! So once we get inside, the ambiance is as expected; super casual, laid back and crawling with patrons and employees. We took the 'first come. first serve.' seats which put us at the bar... Next to the trash where they disposed ALL of the oysters... Yuck! Long story short, the food was just OKAY. Grant it, we didn't order any oysters at an 'oyster bar', but still... that doesn't mean you slack on everything else on the menu. The shrimp taste like it came straight out of a bag and into a grease pot that hadn't been changed in months, his jambalaya was short on flavor and cold... Guess we should have ordered oysters!

Reviews.Author: Luis C.
Reviews.Content: Amazing. Grilled oysters are sooooooo good.PO-boys mmmmmmmmmmRaw oysters... Just keep em coming. PleaseA NO must.

Reviews.Author: Andrew H.
Reviews.Content: I would summarize the Acme Oyster House in two words:  tourist trap.  $20 for a dozen small, sandy oysters covered in Parmesan cheese and oil?  $13 for a shrimp oyster po'boy with tough bread that had fragments of oyster shell still in it?  I thought their $5 fries cover in cheese and beef sauce was the only fairly priced item I ordered!I think I'm mostly just unhappy that I chipped a tooth on the oyster shell fragments that made their way into my po'boy but if you waited in line at 10pm at night just to pay to have your teeth chipped, wouldn't you be unhappy too?

Reviews.Author: Michelle B.
Reviews.Content: Now keep in mind I hate waiting in a long line to get food. It has to be pretty darned amazing for me to wait it out and unfortunately Acme wasn't amazing. I appreciate that they had an employee managing the line and taking down names. Another disclaimer, I don't eat raw oysters. I'll eat them practically any which way cooked, just not raw. So I can't speak about the raw oysters but Acme is known for their raw oysters. You can eat at the bar in front of the shuckers and watch them go to town. But my friend and I came for charbroiled oysters. They were ok but not as good as Drago's. I had the sample plate and it was just ok. Our waitress was nice but it was so crowded inside and tables so close to each other that I couldn't wait to get out of there. Overall not a great dining experience with average food. Personally I wouldn't wait in the long line to get in.

Reviews.Author: Jermaine W.
Reviews.Content: A little line upon arrival but worth the wait. I am not an oyster person at all but hey, I was in NOLA, why not.  The grilled oysters were great! Highly recommend for someone not to certain about oysters.The service was great, really nice staff.

Reviews.Author: Jewells N.
Reviews.Content: Great food and just what you would expect.  there is always a line so try to go early or late - but it you are willing to eat at the counter (cool to  watch them shuck oysters during your meal) you can get right in most of the time.  We had the po' boys - amazing is all i can say, mix of fried shrimp AND oysters with the right bread and right sauce. what a po'boy is suppose to be.

Reviews.Author: Keith H.
Reviews.Content: As always over the top friendly service and food that can't be beat.  Party of two seated at the bar and Curtis took great care of us.  Oysters raw and grilled, they presented the best that any Coast eatery has to offer.   Acme is a must visit in Nola.

Reviews.Author: Elisa K.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled oysters are the best things to ever enter my mouth. You. Must. Go.

Reviews.Author: Niki C.
Reviews.Content: I fully understand all the-freakin' hype!!  The Char-Grilled Oysters are a MUST!Everything we tried here was very tasty, but only the oysters warrant the wait in line.  DO NOT get off line or else consider yourself warned that your visit to New Orleans would have been in vain otherwise.  Seriously.  From my previous visit to The Big Easy, I would have said that Cafe du Monde is the only MUST for their beignets, but I would never ever discuss New Orleans restaurants with anyone I consider a friend and not mention the oysters at Acme, too!  These lil suckers are TASTY!!  Hot, Zesty, Buttery, Garlicky, Cheesy Perfection!!  Make sure you have enough bread to enjoy every bit of the oysters & sauce with...sinfully good, but you will be forgiven.  3 of us shared one full order and seriously considered ordering another round until our entrees showed up soon after.For dinner I ordered the 1/2 & 1/2- half fried fish and half fried shrimp.  Yummy, especially if you try their cocktail sauce, loaded with horseradish!  I loved it!  Thanks goodness for all the kick in the cocktail sauce cause the red beans & rice that I ordered were actually a bit on the bland side.  Perhaps an "off night" cause I didn't think such a thing could exist in Nola!?!  Anyhow, it was still good!  As were the hush puppies and the bite of my friend's bread pudding!  We had to thank the chef manning the oysters on the grill on our way out - it was just THAT good!

Reviews.Author: Laura G.
Reviews.Content: My first meal in New Orleans - My firs sampling of the cuisine in general - so I have to give it 5 stars as I fell in love at the first bite.  We came later so we didn't have to wait - I heard the lines were long...we had Chargrilled Oysters, Raw Oysters and the sampler platter gumbo, jambalaya, red beans & rice and grilled smoked sausage.  This was our FIRST meal in New Orleans - I've never really had this type of food and EVERYTHING was great.  The sausage, jambalaya, gumbo - WOW.  You have to try the Chargrilled Oysters, those rocked my world.  SO Delicious.  Go later to avoid the lines.  I know this place gets alot of hype but it's well deserved - many locals recommended we don't come here (TOO LATE) and I'm glad we didn't listen to them.

Reviews.Author: Elyse Z.
Reviews.Content: Ummm....delicious!  Amazing and worth the wait!  Actually, we were just 2, so while the line was really long Sunday around noon, we were seated probably within 15-20 minutes at the bar.  Got raw and roasted oysters, fried crawfish tails and a side of jambalaya, as well as a bloody Mary and hurricane.  Everything was soo tasty, and it was really cool to see all the shucking right in front of you.

Reviews.Author: Lauren C.
Reviews.Content: Everyone else has said it and I'll say it again...get the chargrilled oysters and top them with a little chipotle Tabasco.  They were so good that my biggest regret is only ordering a half dozen.  Smothered in cheese and garlic...how could you go wrong?My tip is to get here right at 11 when they open to avoid the lines that the other yelpers mentioned.  We were seated right away at the bar and had the best service.  The bartender was friendly and made great recommendations.  Amusingly enough, my friend who isn't adventurous about food ordered the turkey po boy and the bartender said "no, you have to order something that is New Orleans."  She did the roast beef po boy and jambalaya and liked everything.  I also ordered the soup of the day which was a crab and corn chowder and it was yummy but the chargrilled oysters were definitely the highlight.

Reviews.Author: Jason M.
Reviews.Content: Our party of 10 waited 35 minutes -- not bad at all.I've never had anything at ACME other than raw oysters and chargrilled oysters. I personally didn't like the Chargrilled. It's pretty cheesy, comes out piping hot, and the meat of the oyster went through some shrinkage after being grilled. These things will definitely hike up your hot qi.The raws are where its at. Normally I don't even like oysters, but ACME's are great. Not slimy or seafoody. Goes down easy, even without the accompanying sauce. Some of them were HUGE too.People will say Felix's across the street has the same oysters. But really, you came to NOLA for ACME. There's something in a name.

Reviews.Author: Ell B.
