Reviews.Content: Not worth it!!!!  A "half hour wait" turned into a hour and a half for a meal that was as average as a C student (complete with burned fries and stale bread), served in a loud and smelly room. Only the price was exceptional: Shockingly high.

Reviews.Author: Chih-Hsueh H.
Reviews.Content: Grill oyster

Reviews.Author: Abbie T.
Reviews.Content: Definitely a fan of their BOO FRIES! Who doesn't love greasy carby goodess in one plate?! Potatoes, Cheese, and Gravy are definitely a match in heaven! I must go to Canada and have POUTINE!!! No, I can't say much about their chargrilled oysters, cuz well... wait for it.... I don't eat seafood except for shrimp! Haha. Yeah yeah I know you're thinking I'm missing out, but to each her own! This was the first restaurant we went to on our first night in NOLA and it was the way to get the good times rolling! Unfortunately they don't take reservations but when we went around 7:30-8pm the line for a seat didn't take longer than an hour. It kinda sucked lining up outside especially when you're adjusting to the humidity and enduring the sewage smell that makes NOLA, NOLA. As soon as we were seated we were tended to immediately and our food just kept coming. I ordered the New Orleans Medley which came with Gumbo, Jambalaya, Red Beans, and Andouille sausage. It was alright compared to another meal we had the following day - but it's all good because the BOO fries and Oysters were the stars of the meal for our group of ladies!!! We'll definitely come again, because I've been craving for those fries since the moment we finished off that plate :)

Reviews.Author: Sandee L.
Reviews.Content: So we should have heeded the rest of the reviews and just stuck with a ton of char grilled oysters, but decided to push our luck and have a full blown lunch at Acme.Yes, the char grilled oysters really ARE all that.  Whatever number you initially think you want to eat, automatically double your order. The night before, some girlfriends said they had a dozen each and we thought they were piggies.  After sharing only a piddly dozen among the four of us, we all could see how one person could easily throw back twelve of these scrumptious pearls.  One of us is lactose intolerant, and the server was cool enough to bake three for her without the parm on top.  5 stars for the oysters!!!We also got the boo fries, New Orleans Medley (sampling of gumbo, jambalaya, red beans & rice and grilled smoked sausage), and the small seafood etouffee.  The best of the bunch was the seafood etouffee, so get that if you must stray from the grilled oysters.  Pass on the others.We got there 15 minutes before opening and easily got seating.  If you get there right at opening time, you'll most likely not have any issues as well.

Reviews.Author: Ya Y.
Reviews.Content: Grilled Oysters.. yummy.Hush Puppies... fairly good.Seafood Gumbo... not good at all.  Lacking in everything.Bread Pudding w/ice cream...good.Service... good.Overall, it was a mixed bag, but with the main course's disappointing failure, despite a good starter and desert, I have to rate this as 2-stars "Meh, I've had better".

Reviews.Author: Rosalind R.
Reviews.Content: My favorite catfish in the state!

Reviews.Author: Bobby C.
Reviews.Content: Outside of hospitality, NOLA's economy can be broken down into 4 basic parts: oysters, lap dances, alcohol and art. IM(touristy)O, this place represents the best of oysters. I've never been a big fan of oysters, until this place. I was down in NOLA for a weekend and ended up coming here twice. I had no clue oysters could get THAT big. They're usually pretty small in other parts of the country. The three things to try here are the fresh oysters, chargrilled oysters and the soft shell crab. The fresh oysters are the freshest and tastiest I've ever had. The chargrilled oysters are unlike anything else, its cheesy, crusty, charred goodness in a shell, just all around amazingly good. A dozen chargrilled oysters here costs 1 lap dance. A dozen fresh will run you 1 huge ass beer. Both are well worth the price. Just a word of warning to the extremely intoxicated, don't actually try to pay for your oysters with a lap dance or a huge ass beer... and its also probably a good idea to not go to the strip club with dozens of oysters in your pockets...

Reviews.Author: Cynthia M.
Reviews.Content: The chargrilled oysters at the Acme Oyster House goes on the list for, one of the last meals I would have to like before I die. The chargrilled oysters are dressed with lemon butter and a whole lot of parmesean cheese. My partner who rarely eats seafood ordered the roast beef po'boy and he was HAPPY! I can't wait to visit NOLA in the future just to eat here!

Reviews.Author: Matt W.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic oysters. We had raw and grilled. Raw were delicious, but the char-grilled oysters are incredible. Definitely a must have.

Reviews.Author: Asiral P.
Reviews.Content: I'm from California and wanted to try Oysters for the first time while in New Orleans, and therefore wanted to go to a place that specialized in Oysters. I chose Acme because of its good reviews on yelp. However, I should've been weary of any eatery near Bourbon street, but i decided to overlook this. When me and my boyfriend arrived, there was a line outside the door - of tourists. Once inside, I found the place to be too crowded and in need of a good wipe down, but service was friendly so I also tried to overlook this. What I can't overlook is the fact that the shrimp in my "Peacemaker Po Boy" sandwich was not deveined. This made my stomach queasy since I was already being adventurous trying out the fried oysters in the sandwich, and I simply couldn't bring myself to keep eating the sandwich. I don't know if it's protocol to not clean the shrimp, or that they were so busy with people that it slipped on this batch, but I find it unacceptable. Also, the bread was a little hard, and the supposed Tabasco infused mayo tasted like regular mayo to me. Disappointed.

Reviews.Author: K S.
Reviews.Content: Yelpers. Calm down. There's a line outside and right now that emotion urging you to renegade with the masses as if the Pope was handing out rosaries is warranted, but air is needed. Breath. Rational behavior must be employed. The second coming of oyster heaven only meets a 3 star review and is not worth the illustrious wait if a full meal is desired.The chargrilled oysters are simply decadent. I mean -- that is one amazing creation. If you wish to stand in line for this legend, no one will second guess your decision. However, if you are in line for literally anything else you may be very well wasting precious moments that could be spent elsewhere. The food here is wildly average and if not for the amazing brilliance of the chargrilled oysters I would suggest a 2 star rating. Yelpers. Now that air has entered your lungs and the gravity of the line situation has negotiated a reasonable calmness -- ONLY stand tall if awaiting the oysters. If you wish to consume anything else, head to an alternative choice. Lines demand epic tastes, which Acme has only one of.

Reviews.Author: Lin G.
Reviews.Content: 3.5 starsFrom afar you'd think they were hooking people up with free blow jobs by the insane line outside.  Most of the people have to stand over a disgusting smelly sewage drain and it just can't be pleasant.  If you go alone, like I did, you will get seated a lot faster by the bar.  Take a seat and try to make friends with the people next to you.Their grilled oysters were DELICIOUS.  Though for around $13? for 6, that's pretty pricey so they better be good.  I tried their gumbo, jambalaya, sausage combo too and it was just okay.  The grilled oyster's definitely the way to go.  Will get a dozen next time.  The problem with getting oysters is you have to get another entree to fill up since oysters are not very filling.

Reviews.Author: Rolando P.
Reviews.Content: Must have if in town.Chargrilled oyster are a must try and everything else on the menu we had was good also. We had the chargrilled and charbroiled oysters at a couple of other spots in the French Quarter but these were hands down the best. We liked sitting at the bar and talking to the oyster chucker, he can also give you the nice big oysters if you ask. Came twice during our stay and will be back during our next visit whenever that is.

Reviews.Author: Christelle D.
Reviews.Content: Before coming to NOLA, everyone I spoke to recommended Acme for their chargrilled oysters - I was SO happy we made it for dinner! We got there and there was a short line outside to get in (so it must be good, right?!).We all breathed a sigh of relief when we made it in before 11 (even though a few more groups were allowed in). OYSTERS. TO DIE FOR. Chargrilled heaven, truly. We ordered 1 dozen. And another. And everyone was wishing they had just ordered the oysters for their meal. The platter of oysters comes out sizzling, full of cajuny goodness. Not a bit of the seasoning that leaked onto the plate was left; we all jumped at the chance to scoop it up with the bread. All of our food was divine - but the highlight was definitely the chargrilled oysters. We got po' boys, jambalaya, gumbo, hush puppies, red beans and rice, and on and on. BEST decision we made while we were in NOLA and will be my first stop when I return to the Big Easy!

Reviews.Author: Calvin H.
Reviews.Content: I heard a lot about this place so I had to make sure to eat here during my trip to New Orleans. All through out the week I was eyeing this place when walking through the Quarter. Every time there was a ridiculously long line outside the door. I finally managed to make it through a reasonable 20 minute wait at 9:45 PM Sunday night and I have to say it was totally worth it!Appetizers:- 1/2 dozen chargrilled oysters:  Perfectly prepared. I'm not that big on oysters but these were delicious.- Boo Fries: Pretty much just poutine, that is fries with gravy and cheese. A really satisfying comfort food but the gravy was a tad salty.Entrees:- New Orleans medley (gumbo, jambalaya, red beans & rice, sausage): A small sampler NOLA cuisine. My favorite thing here. - Seafood Etouffee: This was good but each of the items in the medley were better. We also added a side of fried crawfish to go into the etouffee following the server's suggestion. I would recommend not doing this. The batter around the crawfish is extremely salty and heavily detracts from the flavor of the etoufee. It's much better without it. Other than the food, I do have to say that the entire staff is very friendly and really added to the entire dining experience. I felt like I got a taste of real southern hospitality.

Reviews.Author: Alethea A.
Reviews.Content: We were in New Orleans for the day on our way to drop our daughter off at college. Last time we were here, she had Boo Fries, and wanted to get some more. As much as I didn't want to, we walked down to Acme and stood in line for about 45 minutes for an average meal.Acme is best known for its oysters, which only my hubster likes. He ordered the chargrilled oysters and absolutely loved them. I thought they smelled good, but didn't taste them. My daughter ordered the fish and shrimp combo and it was the best tasting thing at our table. My sons ordered chicken and red beans and rice, and I had the sampler combo. All of the food was average at best, and none was very hot.I hate to say that I wasted my time eating mediocre food in a city that is filled with deliciousness, but I did. This is the last time that I will go to Acme.

Reviews.Author: Daniel T.
Reviews.Content: Great seafood spot and the chargrilled oysters were delicious.

Reviews.Author: M -dot W.
Reviews.Content: The char grilled oysters are mentioned in nearly every review here and it's because they are VERY good !We sat at the bar and got some Dixie beers and char grilled oysters which really lived up to their garlicy, rich reputation .Keep in mind this place can be empty one minute and then have a line of tourist outside the next. We got lucky with no line. Also, the staff here is used to tourist and might get a little annoyed if you don't know what you want. So don't be slow because she can get snappy !!!

Reviews.Author: Valerie T.
Reviews.Content: I wish I had known about this place the first day I arrived in New Orleans.  Hot damn, those grilled oysters make me wanna slap yo mama.  Even though it was the 4th of July, we didn't wait more than 15 minutes.  The worst part of the wait was the need to jump out of the way of what looked like raw sewage in the streets....a girl who definitely thought she was cute wearing flip flops realized her mistake after unwittingly stepping into liquid that smelled like a whorehouse at low tide.But I digress. I tasted my first Abita Purple Haze here at Acme Oyster House, which was an experience unto itself.  I will update this review soon, when I remember the rest of what we ate.  More Crescent City reviews to follow......

Reviews.Author: Dustin P.
Reviews.Content: What's the HYPE!?  The food was good, not great.  The OYSTERS were fresh, but GRITTY!!  Don't wait in line.

Reviews.Author: Lisa M.
Reviews.Content: I just don't get it! This place had a 1/2 hour wait. The food was bad and the wait staff rude. I won't go back.

Reviews.Author: Grey B.
Reviews.Content: Loooooong wait...BUT terrific oysters and very decent shrimp poboy...the bread was especially delicious...think Gambino

Reviews.Author: Rosalind C.
Reviews.Content: So me and some of my peeps were in town for a conference and decided to hit this spot on our first night for dinner. When we got out of our taxi we noticed there was a line outside which got me super excited because I knew this place had to be good! Suprisngly we only waited about 10 minutes to be seated. I already knew I had to have oysters but I'm not a fan of raw oysters so I decided to go for the fried shrimp and oyster platter. Our server was super helpful and patient since we had a million questions. My food came out and I immediately got excited again! It smelled soooo good. The oysters and shrimp were crispy and the batter has great flavor! This was a great way to kick off our N'Awlins trip!

Reviews.Author: Rene D.
Reviews.Content: Acme. Long lines, long lines. Naturally, oysters on the half shell are my favorite, but you can have all thing fried in terms of seafood. They offer a decent Bloody Mary. The service is quick and efficient.  However, sitting at a cramped bar trying to enjoy these items are next to impossible. I'll saunter elsewhere where it's not a chain.

Reviews.Author: Barry G.
Reviews.Content: So when you see a line all the way down the block, it means one of two things1. The place is overhyped and all the tourists go here2. The place is really good, and EVERYONE goes here.Luckily, Acme falls into number 2.From our first day we keep wanting to go there. Every time we went by, dinner, lunch, in between, there was a LINE!Finally, on a Monday night, we got in line and waited.++ key : although most places will let you bring in outside drinks, they do not. They ask you to finish it. So dont bring a drink, or finish it in line ++Once inside, it was crowded, smelled great, and lots of local 'charm'. I say charm, because it was a nice comfy joint. Chalkboard walls, contest boards, TV's, noise, and great a nice atmosphere.And now to the foodFirst - Skip the oyster shooters. Cheap at $1, but not worth the conflict of taste with vodka, hot sauce and salty oyster.Second - The po'boys - big and overloaded. hard to fold up and eat unless you take half the stuffing out first (crawfish in this case)Lastly - the oysters - after all, that is what we CAME for!Chargrilled - Wow. to perfection. Hot, salty, spicy and delicious. So great we ordered a second order... then a third order too..Just enough cheese in there, not to much. and BIG!and then the raw ones. Also HUGE, delicious, fresh and tasty.You can get oysters anywhere, but I say go here. They are good, the staff is great, the atmosphere rocks, and prices are pretty decentWorth the wait in line...

Reviews.Author: Sarah B.
Reviews.Content: What's a trip to New Orleans without a visit to Acme Oyster House? I've got plenty of reviews to write after my recent trip to the Big Easy, but I had to start with Acme. The chargrilled oysters are the absolute truth. Our table of 7 started with an order of two dozen, just to see how they were. After our first bites, we immediately flagged down our waiter and put in another order. The rest of the food was .. good? I'm sure it's hard for all the other dishes to consistently be in the chargrilled oysters' shadow, but my seafood étouffée was tasty (albeit a bit salty). I'll mention here that Acme won't seat your party unless you're all actually there, and while our group waited for one person, we were politely declined entrance to the bar and told "it's not a waiting area." I recommend arriving early, and with your whole party!

Reviews.Author: Richard K.
Reviews.Content: Was only in New Orleans for less than 48 hours, but knew I had to hit up Acme.  Just grabbed a Bloody Mary and a dozen oysters.  Got my BM spicy, and it was excellent.  I sat at the bar so I chatted it up with the guys as they shucked my oysters right in front of me.  Probably the best raw Oysters I've ever had.  Super friendly staff. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Author: Jeff C.
Reviews.Content: Visiting New Orleans, we definitely wanted to get a good dose of seafood and so we chose this place based off of the yelp reviews.  We had to wait about a hour to get in on a Saturday night around 7pm.  It's a little chaotic inside, lots of activity and noise with a laid back, casual feel.  We were sat down at a table that was basically a long bench and not long after we arrived, another party of 5 was seated right next to our party of 3...  a little strange since one of their group was basically right next to us, so close he could have reached out and shared our dinner if he wanted to!  We ordered a dozen of the chargrilled oysters, boo fries, craw puppies, a large seafood etouffee, and a pound of the crawfish.  We had heard that the chargrilled oysters were the thing to get here, but my wife (who loves her oysters) was a little disappointed in these.  Maybe she just likes her raw oysters better, maybe it was the flavor, but she just didn't dig these oysters.  Not bad, but not great either.  The crawfish were tasty, it's fun to eat with your hands and be messy!  The etouffee was a winner, nice and buttery, and we loved our craw puppies and boo fries as well.  If you have to pick and appetizer, get the boo fries...  how can you go wrong with gravy and cheese slathered over your fries?  De-lish!Overall, we enjoyed our dinner despite having higher expectations for the oysters.  Not a great place for a quiet date night, but definitely a better place for a family night out or a group of friends.

Reviews.Author: Kim N.
Reviews.Content: Did I like ACME? Kinda. Was it worth the wait (45 mins) next to smelly dumpsters & sewers? Heck no!! ACME's pretty small inside (no wonder the line is super long!) Servers/bus boys were discussing LOUDLY about personal matters... kinda rude & this might contribute to the long wait.-char-grilled oysters - too cheesy and salty, huge oysters though so I would've preferred them raw on half shelves-boo fries - pretty much a poutine, I've had much better ones elsewhere-seafood gumbo - decent... missing okra

Reviews.Author: Kathleen V.
Reviews.Content: There was a pretty decent line for a late lunch, but it moved quickly.  The hostess and other staff worked hard to turn over tables as quickly as possible and seat people/groups as efficiently as possible.  It was worth the 30ish minute wait in line.People go for the chargrilled oysters for a reason - they're amazing. Also had the Acme "10 Napkin Roast Beef" Po-Boy.  I only needed 8 of the napkins, but it was absolutely delicous.  Our waiter, Will, was great.  Made great recommendations and took good care of us.  Save room for dessert - the bananas foster cheesecake was phenomenal.Surprising note - Acme may have the best Hurricane cocktail in the city.  Not that they need any more press or help getting people in the door, but they may want to consider hyping their Hurricane a bit.  Was the best cocktail I had during my trip.  It wasn't served in a fancy souviener glass that you pay a tourist price for, but it was delicious.  Absolutely, no question about it, made completely fresh to order - not from a mix.  The fresh fruit juice really put it over the top.  Glad I listened to our waiter when he suggested it.  Go for the oysters, enjoy a great cocktail, save room for dessert!

Reviews.Author: Katy L.
Reviews.Content: If you love oysters and are in NOLA, you need to head here. We headed to ACME around 6 on a Saturday. There was a short line outside the door, but we were seated within 20 minutes. The service is average. Nothing above and beyond but nothing to make you not want to come back. Our food was hot and our drinks were refilled but it wasn't enough to be memorable.Now to the food. We ordered a dozen each of the chargrilled and fresh oysters. I would have to say I prefer the fresh of the two. There is a place in D.C. that does chargrilled oysters just a bit better. That being said, they were still incredibly delicious. I think I just prefer the briny bite of fresh oysters.For my main, I got the crawfish tail po boy with a side of hush puppies. Is there anything better in the world? The crawfish tail meat was tender and buttery. The hush puppies were firm and delicious. I tried to talk my husband in to going back one more time during our four-day stay, but alas, I lost that push.

Reviews.Author: Cairo D.
Reviews.Content: Well worth the wait!  We waited for about 30 minutes for a seat, w/ high hopes.  The waiter didn't even write any of our orders down; but repeated it back to us.  Everything came out perfect, fast and hot.  Oysters both raw and charbroiled were awesome.  Soft shell crab, best I've ever had.  Oyster Rockefeller soup, get the bread bowl size.  Looking forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Author: Elana L.
Reviews.Content: You can't go to NOLA and not go to Acme!!!!!I don't like Oysters, but they have tons of other choices to choose from!  I was completely impressed at how friendly the waitresses and all the employees were!  I ordered take out and waited at the bar.  Probably the best way to hear the history of Acme because the guys that were shucking the oysters were full of stories!  Definitely a fun place to go!

Reviews.Author: Steve S.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently ate at Acme Oyster House and had a great time.  We were walking to Bourbon Street and wanted to eat first before enjoying the bar seen.  There was a line out front but after talking to some people the line moved pretty quick.  We waited for about 20 minutes or so, we were seated and had beers in hand.  The place has a great atmosphere, very comfortable.The waitress came right over to take our order.  We started with the crab cake and raw oysters for an appetizer which both were good.  The oysters for the price were very good, about a dozen for $14 or so.  For being from the Northeast I still can't compare them to a good cold water oyster from New England.  For dinner my wife had the beef Po Boy and I had the Fried Peace Maker Po Boy.  That thing was great, I would highly suggest it.  The wait staff were very friendly and attentive to us even though the place was packed.  If you're heading to New Orleans I would definitely suggest finding one of these places in town and checking it out.

Reviews.Author: Angela P.
Reviews.Content: I had my doubts about Acme, since it's right in the middle of tourist-town, but it was featured on Man vs. Food, and a friend highly recommended it to me.  She didn't steer me wrong with other restaurants, so Acme was our final meal in New Orleans.First, the food is outstanding!  The charbroiled oysters are a must.  My only other oyster experience in New Orleans was at another restaurant, where they were fried and too salty.  The charbroiled oysters at Acme were a thousand times better, and we really should've ordered a dozen instead of a half.  The po-boys are also very good.Second, the service is not good.  Yes, you will have to wait in line, and there was a line down the block before they even opened.  We were prepared for this, so I was pleasantly surprised that when they did open, we didn't have to wait - we were one of the first diners seated, party of 2.  Our waitress took our order and got our drinks fairly quickly.  Then it went downhill.  I noticed that 3 other groups, no bigger than party of 3, all were seated after us, ordered after us, but got their food, paid their check and even left - all before we got our food.  The waitress apologized and asked if we wanted a bowl of gumbo while we waited, and she blamed the kitchen for being behind.  I'm almost positive she just forgot to put in our order.  Why would I want a bowl of soup?  She did not comp anything on our check either, just kept asking us if we wanted something else.I also thought it was strange that there was a small group of military standing in line, and they made them wait until they seated other parties of 2.  They do seat smaller parties first; however, when we sat inside the restaurant I noticed 2 tables open with more than enough seats for this group.  What a way to treat your military!The only way I'd go back here, after the awful service, is to sit at the bar and have oysters.  I really wouldn't want to interact with any of the servers again.

Reviews.Author: Amy M.
Reviews.Content: Rude hostess, no grilled oysters on a Monday?  How can that be when they have raw oysters in abundance?  Overall way less than we hoped for...Raw oysters were fine and competitively priced but cocktail sauce was lacking (thin and spiced with Tabasco instead of horseradish.  Disappointing.

Reviews.Author: Javier O.
Reviews.Content: UNBELIEVABLY GREAT FOOD!The oysters were huge and fresh, and delicious, we had both raw and char-grilled. Their po' boys, both shrimp and sausage were great and filling. The server was really laid back, friendly, and helpful. It was a really bustling environment, even late at night. There was a line to get in, but only took about 5-10 minutes.

Reviews.Author: Brittany M.
Reviews.Content: Came here because the charbroiled oysters were highly recommended. They were good but Felix's were sooooo much better.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer T.
Reviews.Content: Went to acme yesterday for lunch got there around 1pm and say shortly 20 mins later I say shortly because of the location and popularity of this restaurant it was fairly fast seating but then again it was only 2 of us eating. We sat at the bar and had the chargrilled oyster which were both our first time trying and were phenomenal and we had the seafood platter which was also very appetizing we left both very happy customers and full as well. Will we go back a second time? I'm not quite sure I think once was enough.

Reviews.Author: Anika K.
Reviews.Content: Went to Acme for an early lunch on a Friday. The place was comfortably busy at 11:10 am, 10 minutes after it opened. We were seated right away.My 4 friends and I ordered a lot of food. We got a dozen raw oysters, a half dozen chargrilled oysters, the peacemaker po' boy, the soft shell crab po' boy, the fried fish po' boy, the friend shrimp po' boy, the fried oyster po' boy, the chicken/andouille sausage gumbo, the Rockefeller oyster soup and the bread pudding.The oysters were great. The raw oysters were some of the largest raw oysters are group ever ate. The chargrilled oysters were wonderful and flavorful. We were a bit skeptical, but we would definitely order them again. The po' boys were all great. The proteins were properly cooked in the frying process and were crispy on the outside & soft on the inside. The soups were a bit too salty for our tastes and the gumbo could've had more heat to it, but they were ok. Unfortunately, the bread pudding wasn't really a pudding. It was more like a candied soft piece of bread. We didn't get any pudding with the bread. Just bread.Overall the food was good, and I'd definitely return for the oysters and po' boys. Wouldn't recommend the soups because of the saltiness, nor would I recommend the bread pudding.Of note, as we were leaving around 12:20 (less than 90 minutes after the establishment opened for the day) we saw at least 10 people in line outside. The restaurant itself was full, with every bar stool occupied.

Reviews.Author: imran m.
Reviews.Content: Good spot for seafood.Always a long line with tourists.

Reviews.Author: Annie A.
Reviews.Content: This place has HUGE amazingly fresh and delicious oysters with the BEST tangy/spicy cocktail sauce.  I was never a fan of oysters but this place had my craving them during my whole trip and back in SF.  We also had the grilled oysters which were so rich and flavorful--so full of butter!  I know they were probably heart attack central but who cares.  Anyway, the shrimp po boy wasn't that great for me.  Go with the oysters.  Amazing.  Just.  Amazing.

Reviews.Author: Helen C.
Reviews.Content: The wait was worth it.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer M.
Reviews.Content: Even on a weekday this place has a line outside its door an hour after opening! Came here minutes after they had opened looking to do some serious grub on action for their infamous CHARGRILLED OYSTERS. We had ordered a set of fresh raw oysters, ordered a pound of crawfish that our server mentioned to us that was on sale for $9.99l/b, and an order of fries. My boyfriend order an Abita on tap, and I stuck with my water.CHARGRILLED is by far the best thing I've eaten in New Orleans. It will not disappoint. The little slices of white bread as absolutely essential for cleaning the shells with leftover butter and Parmesan residue.Service here that day was a little neglectful, nothing came out together, but I'm pretty sure that was all just because they literally just opened doors for the day. After all their normal opening hours are 11am and we were already eating at 11:21!Get the Chargrilled Oysters.

Reviews.Author: Kyle M.
Reviews.Content: Fried Oysters are fantastic! Crab bisque was aight.  Wish they had a seafood Sampler. only options are fish or crab and oysters.  Where are the fried Scallops? Still yummy though

Reviews.Author: Linda D.
Reviews.Content: I saw this place on Triple D and had it on my places to eat while in New Orleans. There was no line and we were able to walk right in. I ordered a  1/2 dozen raw oysters and my friend ordered the chargrilled oysteres to start with and they were very good. I later ordered a platter of food to include fish, oysters, shrimp and french fries. I was disappointed to see that they try to fill the plate with french fries to make it appear to be a lot of food they are serving. How wrong they are. I should have stopped at the oysters because the rest of the meal I could have gone without.

Reviews.Author: Philip P.
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to New Orleans and the chargrilled oysters would be one reason I would make New Orleans a city I would visit on a yearly basis.  The chargrilled oysters from Acme are probably one of the best things I've ever had.  We ordered 6 chargrilled and 6 raw.  The raw oysters were really good as well.  This is the first time I've ever seen oysters this big.  If you're hesitant with raw oysters, you definitely need to try the chargrilled.  It will probably change your life.One mistake we made....we went to Acme Oyster our first night....all other oysters we ate from other places were no comparison.

Reviews.Author: Loni N.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. I went with some of my co workers one night. Place was packed but luckily we found a table for 6. We got the raw and charbroiled oysters. The charbroiled oysters were beyond delicious. I have had raw oysters many times but never charbroiled. They were very good. I also got the fried shrimp and my co workers got other entrees such as the gumbo, Po boys, red beans and rice. Everyone left with a clean plate. The bread pudding I got for dessert was good too. Overall a great place to eat.

Reviews.Author: Jamie S.
Reviews.Content: Let me preface by saying, I don't like oysters. They're slimy and sloppy and not my thing. I was on a trip with 3 friends and the general consensus was to have lunch here. I was a little apprehensive at first but decided I would try the Chargrilled Oysters I had heard so much about. I have to say... THEY WERE DELICIOUS. Lots of grated cheese, lemon butter, and french bread. I mean, what's not to love. I also had the Seafood Étouffée which was yummy however I wished I would've had another order of Chargrilled Oysters instead. Yes, they were THAT good.Believe the hype people, make the 20 minute line, and ENJOY! It's totally worth it!

Reviews.Author: Char Y.
Reviews.Content: we walked in with no wait and were seated right away. we orderedchargrilled oystersgumboshrimp po boyeverything was oily and not good. not worth the hype!

Reviews.Author: Matt H.
Reviews.Content: Loved the food but the hostess was the biggest bitch! She was way empowered for what she had to accomplish.

Reviews.Author: Dennis Y.
Reviews.Content: Liked their grilled oyster much better than their fresh shucked ones as I'm just not a big fan of there uber large fresh water oysters that they serve here.  But surprisingly these are even more tasteless than usual.  Definitely not a place for fans of terroir as these oysters taste like they were from a farmed tank... But deep fried, char grilled with a dollop of butter and cheese sauce or baked these meaty monsters works well.  Do like that this place "donates" the oyster shells for road pavement and that they keep the long line moving nicely and the service is nice and friendly here.

Reviews.Author: Court Y.
Reviews.Content: If you can catch it when the line is minimal or nonexistent, lucky you!  My husband and I managed a couple times while we were in NOLA and it was always great.  We always sat at the bar because it's generally the fastest way to get a table and the people behind the bar are always friendly and interesting to talk to while waiting.  The chargrilled oysters are amazing, can't say enough good things about them!  The boo fries are also soooo good!  Hopefully you'll get lucky and be in New Orleans while Abita Strawberry Harvest is in season and can enjoy that with your meal.  It's the perfect complement to everything they serve.The bartenders are also really friendly and willing to give recommendations and let you try samples of the drinks before ordering.  I had a taste of some Andygator that I was very grateful that he saved me from ordering because it was way too much for me!

Reviews.Author: Larry S.
Reviews.Content: I bookmarked Acme before we ever left Nashville, and the clerk at our hotel also suggested it.  We got there at 5:30, and the place was crowded, but we were seated immediately.  There was a fairly long line by the time we left.We asked about their specialty drinks.  My wife really enjoyed her blue bloody Mary and I was really getting into the Acme Sunsets.  The chargrilled oysters were simply awesome.Maria was our waitress, and she took very good care of us.  We followed her dinner recommendations and were rewarded with some great New Orleans specialties.  My wife had the NO Medley, with samples of sausage, gumbo, and jambalaya.  I tried a little of everything and enjoyed it as much as she did.  But my meal was even better than hers.  I had the ettoufee  with crawfish, and it was so rich and flavorful, and was just marvelous.We finished up by sharing some bread pudding.  The whiskey sauce really made a difference.

Reviews.Author: Mitch E.
Reviews.Content: Woke up on a Easter Sunday and asked myself "What would Jesus do in New Orleans?' My friend and I came to the conclusion he would first shower after being resurrected. After that he'd hit up the Acme Oyster House. We shipped the shower part because I don't have time for that. I need to fill up my belly with as much food as possible before I start drinking heavily again. We ordered a boat load of food. Hush puppies, Oysters, Shrimp and Crab. All fried!  I never leave food on my plate (EVER) but this time I just couldn't finish everything. If there is such a thing as too much fried food, this would have been that experience. After awhile you can't just consume everything if it's fried. Lesson learned.

Reviews.Author: Shamicka M.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely worth the wait! Fast food. Friendly service, Sean, our waitress was fantastic!  Went back twice on my trip...sad I couldn't make it a third time...The cost is reasonable and you'll be graciously satisfied.  If you don't like oysters, you might change your mind after a visit.

Reviews.Author: Angela Y.
Reviews.Content: Have to add to the gazillion yelp reviews... Acme lives up to the hype! Gotta come here for charbroiled oysters, something I never had before coming to New Orleans (and I LOVE oysters!) They're oozing with butter and cheese and it just melts in your mouth... so good we came back for dinner another night and ordered 3 dozen for the 3 of us. The fresh oysters were some of the best I've ever had - not too salty, nice big size, and paired perfectly with cocktail sauce and horseradish. YUM! We tried some other things on the menu, but really... just come for the oysters. Add Acme to your NOLA list, be prepared to wait in line (it goes pretty quickly) and enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Richard A.
Reviews.Content: Great food! Highly recommend the grilled oysters!! So good!!! Pricing was acceptable, only complaint was the wait and the slow service to start. Other than that 4 out of 5!!!
Reviews.Author_Location: Central Business District, New Orleans, LA

Reviews.Author: Jen Q.
Reviews.Content: What can I say, I wish they had this place where I live! During my trip out to Nola, we my friends and I heard this place is the place to eat. We got here around 1 pm and there was already a line out the door. Don't worry, the line moves fast. When we got inside, we ordered the oysters first. A dozen of the chargrilled and a dozen of the raw oysters. I'm not a seafood person by I was blown away at how awesome the chargrilled oysters were! It came in a tray with bread and had lots of butter and cheese on the bottom. Sure enough, those disappeared quickly. Normally I don't eat raw oysters but my friends kept raving about them so I had to try one. Boy they were right! It was awesome. The marinara sauce was on point. We also ordered the seafood étouffée with a side of crawfish tails. Omg it was amazing! I would definitely try this place again if I'm in the area.

Reviews.Author: S T.
Reviews.Content: Tried the Oyster Po Boy and Seafood Gumbo.  Po Boy was okay.  I enjoyed the fried oysters.  Quite tasty.  Pretty small portion though for the $15 combo.  Seafood Gumbo was bit too salty.  Also got a sample of the seafood étouffée - again, a bit too salty.  Sat in the back area.  A fairly dark, loud, sports bar environment.

Reviews.Author: Vicky R.
Reviews.Content: I am a tourist so of course I had to stay in line for an hour and try the Acme oysters.The line was actually not bad and only took us ~30mins to get in. Waitress was as promised, only available sometimes, so we took out time with the menu. These are what we had:1. dozen oysters on half shell ($13.99)  - I don't eat raw oysters, but bf said it's the best out of the oyster bars we tried (Felix, Desire, Acme) in term of freshness. He said they are all fresh but the oysters in Acme are so fresh you feel like they grew up in a loving family that's filled with laughter and kindness, whereas the oysters from other placed tasted like they had a conservative, middle-class upbringing. Go figure whatever that means. However, these oysters are tiny, like oyster-fetus kinda tiny. The oysters we got at Desire is about twice or three times the size of the ones served in Acme. 2.  1/2 dozen chargrilled oysters ($12) - best chargrilled oysters, definitely get it when you're here. The last time I had an oyster was before I could talk and I've lived on a seafood-extinction diet for as long as I can remember, but the chargrilled oysters here is so tempting I ended up trying one before my conscious stopped me, and boy, was it delicious! And no, shrimp doesn't count as seafood.3. Fried Shrimp platter ($14) - skip this. This is the worst dish I've had during my trip in NOLA, and that includes a ham and turkey sandwich from CVS when I was in a rush. There were 10 tiny fried shrimps scattered pathetically on some fries and a lot of bread. Not exactly sure what the bread's for, maybe for propping the fries up so it looks as if there're a lot of them. The cole slaw was mediocre too.

Reviews.Author: Sharon W.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for the grilled oysters2 stars for the hostess/hostambiance - non existent but who cares? I am here for the FOOD.Wait time - 25 mins for a party of 4, no calling aheadIt was our last night in Nola and we were looking for somewhere yummy to eat, nothing too fancy, but we wanted a good mix of food to try for our last night.Starters - Grilled oysters - This was my favorite thing on the menu. The butter herbed sauce, melted Parmesan cooked over an open fire. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. There was extra butter sauce on the plate after we scarfed down the oysters and 2 pcs of bread that come with the platter, so we asked for another loaf and drenched up the rest of the buttery goodness.Craw puppies -  not sure what this really was, but it was fried bread thing dipped in some white sauce.Crab cakes - Real chunks of crab and yummy sauce to dip it in. Not sure if the crab was fresh, but did I say Big Chunks?Po Boy - half with catfish, half with oysters. I am not a fan of fried food, but I had one bite of the hunnie's sandwich. While it didn't seem too heavy because of the lettuce balancing it out, it just wasn't up my alley. The hubs enjoyed it though.Shrimp Etoufee - It was kind of odd, everywhere we went in Nola, they could not make my food spicier for me., this Shrimp Etoufee included. Wet shrimpy saucy gravy over rice. I've never had this before, so I don't know what to compare it to, but it would have been bland had I not doused it in Tabasco Chipotle. Rice, gravy easy to eat with a spoon, I was satisfied with this dish. Luckily I ordered the Large size.Gumbo - The folks said this tasted about average. Looks like this is right on point compared to the other yelper's experiences hereJambalaya - The folks said this was about average too.Note- Try to show up with the entire party before hopping into line. It was kind of interesting , ok fine, it was annoying when the hostess asks you if your party of 4 is here and you have a few people wandering off(the curious boyfriend), and first she groups your with someones elderly grandmother, and then another group of people behind you, who are looking at you like you have lost your mind (There are no asians in NOLA) even after you point out your boyfriend is right over there 5 feet away several times as soon as the hostess/host team approach you. I wonder why 2 people are needed for this job.I would come back though, These grilled oysters are so delish!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie G.
Reviews.Content: Hands down has the best chargrilled oysters I have ever had in my entire life. Yes the line outside gets long but you may get lucky and get a seat at the bar. I don't mind waiting since the oysters are so worth it. I will continue to visit this place every time I am in the area.

Reviews.Author: Shellie D.
Reviews.Content: My friend told us about this place and raved about the oysters. While the oyster po boy was good, I have had better. The prices were a bit much especially since the po boy doesn't come with any sides but they give you a decent amount of oysters in your po boy.I would come early since this place seems to be pretty popular.

Reviews.Author: Liz D.
Reviews.Content: Awesome raw and charbroiled oysters. Make a meal out of an oyster platter and étouffée. You're more than likely going to have to wait outside for 30-45 minutes, even on a weekday.

Reviews.Author: Denise P.
Reviews.Content: Best oysters ever! Totally worth the wait, the line can be intimidating but it moves fast and this is hands down best grilled oysters ever! So delicious. Staff is very friendly and the food comes out fast. Must do in New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: Marcin M.
Reviews.Content: The line to get in was relatively long, but it was worth it, and we were able to pass the time by having a to-go beverage from another establishment.  Definitely the proper way to pass the time in line.  And actually, the wait time for two people if you're willing to sit at the bar wasn't too bad; I've definitely waited longer for worse.I really enjoyed my meal here.  We shared red beans and rice, the peacemaker po-boy, chargrilled oysters and a dozen oysters.  I loved everything that was served that night.  The oysters are huge (compared to those I see on the west coast) though the really large ones are grilled.  Make sure to eat the grilled ones relatively quickly as that's when they are the best.Enjoyed my experience here and I would come back on a future trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: Lovetodine L.
Reviews.Content: Sooooo good!!! you must eat here for lunch or dinner when in NOLA. Very authentic, tasty, everything about it screams New Orleans. We waited in line for less than 30 min. We did chat it up w/ others in line to make the time go by (met some cool people). My husband had the raw oyster app. along w/ the seafood and oyster po- boy. I had the chicken po-boy. Both were soooooo good! Make sure you get your po-b0y "dressed" and leave your diet at home, you will walk off the calories anyway. We finished the meal w/ a pecan cobbler w/ vanilla ice cream (such a great way to end the meal). IT was actually the only dessert we had in NOLA b/c we were so full all the time! Visit Acme, don't get discouraged by the line it goes fast. Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Nick W.
Reviews.Content: Been here twice- throughly enjoyed it both times. There is almost always a wait to get in, and busy weekends in the quarter will test your patience- it's worth it though. My favorite is the jambalaya pasta- perfection for those of us who do not care for seafood.

Reviews.Author: Thuan P.
Reviews.Content: I don't know what the hype about this place is about. There was always a long line every time I walked by so finally decided to try it when there was no wait. I find that the food across the street at Felix is equally tasty if not better

Reviews.Author: Garreth G.
Reviews.Content: If you ever had oysters before like I have, this is the place to definitely check out because they know how to present, cook, and clean the oysters. If you NEVER had oysters before or if you had it before but did not like it then cancel you thought about it and try the ones that Acme is serving you. Best oysters I have had in my life!Lines can be rough so I advise either going early or waiting in line with two drinks in your hand and get wasted before going. Once your in... YOUR IN!Best thing to get on the menu is the Char-grilled Oysters and get a dozen of them. If you not tired of it then get another because that's how your going to have to roll when you in the Acme Oyster House. The oysters have Parmesean cheese sprinkled on it and i don't know if there is garlic and butter that was in it too but it was effin delicious. The oyster itself was the best it was so velvety and everything they say about an afrodisiac is true because it  was just as good as a sexual experience when you were in 8th grade and you just wanted to do it with you teacher.The fried oysters is the second best thing to get on the menu. Holy crap was it good. Not too greasy or too over cooked. The oyster was also as velvety as ever and melted in my mouth. Was I too full? Hell yeah I was! But who care's. I was in New Orleans.I also ordered the Fried Soft shell crab and that was just amazing as the fried oysters.. You can literally eat all of it and no bone is to hard that will make your insides bleed.All in all this Acme Oyster House a must go. If your a foodie definitely you got to tap this ass.

Reviews.Author: Sarah K.
Reviews.Content: TOURIST TRAP, but worth a visit! You will wait in line pretty much 24/7. We went on a Sunday evening around 730 and still waited over a half hour to be seated.  We sat at the bar, very nice servers but they're a little overwhelmed by the number of demanding customers.  The oysters were great of course, the craw puppies are very potent in seafood flavor. The 10 Napkin Po-boy disappeared from my husbands plate so fast I was lucky to get a bite.  And if you go, ask your server about items that are "OFF THE MENU".  They have a lot of tasty things here but our server highly recommended a small dish of "BOOM-BOOM Shrimp" best decision of my life! You'll be in for a wait here but it's fun and worth the time there.

Reviews.Author: Tian Q.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled oysters completely lived up to the hype. They were so legit I cried, though most of the water in my eyes were mostly due to the burn after I slurped the first  fresh-out-of-the-grill oyster whole and not being able to feel my tongue for the next 5 min.Tip: dip your bread in the leftover garlic butter left in the shells! AMAZING.Service-wise, a guy who looked like Mr. T seemed to have taken my order but nothing happened while I sat at the bar for the next 10 min (not even water) until the guy next to him started taking care of my service. Mr. T also refused to smile and had a butcher face compared to the much nicer oyster shucker next to him.

Reviews.Author: David A.
Reviews.Content: The place had a line out the door that stayed strong through the night.  We waited it out and were happy with the decision.The oysters, of all varieties, were top notch.  Very fresh and tasty, even compared to other places on the block.One person got a fried platter and the breaded white fish was absolutely fantastic.  Light, flaky, and extremely tasty.  I was impressed.This was my first trip to NOLA and I would certainly go back to ACME, but perhaps I would try to beat the crowd....if that's possible.

Reviews.Author: Connald C.
Reviews.Content: Strawberry daiquiries 50 oz in line... got even more of those yummers grilled oysters and of course raw. but seriously, why are all the oysters in new orleans so damn big? whatttttttttttt. really quite a mouthful... i mean don't get me wrong, yum. but, biggest oysters in my life, and i'm taiwanese, we're seafood people. got the seasoned crawfish, yum yum yum. i could only eat those for the rest of my little life and nothing else. great spices. this place, amazing. i shall dream of those bright red babies everyday moving forward.

Reviews.Author: Jenna U.
Reviews.Content: New Orleans is known for their oysters... Acme is by far the best place to try them!While spending 10 days in NOLA, I experienced and tried many oysters at just about every place I ate.  Acme was the best hands down.  They are delicious! Acme is a must go to when visiting Nola!

Reviews.Author: Hugh S.
Reviews.Content: A New Orleans Tradition. For the best oysters in the area visit Acme

Reviews.Author: Pam S.
Reviews.Content: I had higher hopes for Acme after I tried their oysters and the Oyster Festival this year.  Unfortunately while the raw oysters at the festival were super tasty, the ones at the restaurant were weirdly bland.  We also tried the chargrilled oysters which was a bit overly buttery for my tastes (couldn't taste the oysters much).  Also not a fan of the hushpuppies here, but the soft shell crab was nice!Waitress was a little rough around the edges, but efficient and friendly enough.  I think with all the other places in New Orleans to eat, I wouldn't necessarily be itching to return here.

Reviews.Author: Shirley Y.
Reviews.Content: Oh how I love Acme Oyster House! I think this is my third time visiting the establishment and have not been disappointed. I'm sure the boys in my family who refuse to eat oysters thought this place was just okay but my mom, my sister, and I went to town on the Chargrilled Oysters and raw oysters. The very first time I went, the wait was about an hour and this last time with seven people only took about 30 minutes. I would go earlier in the evening to make sure you beat the rush. It never ceases to amaze me how the waiters can take the whole order without writing a darn thing down and get the food correct. The etouffe is very good, I ended up sharing the larger portion of this with my mom since we were also eating oysters. I heard the po-boys were good too. Luckily they do offer a cheeseburger if you are like my nephew and don't care for seafood.

Reviews.Author: Molly H.
Reviews.Content: Went on the recommendation of our pilot and it did not dissappoint ate here on our first night and it was a great intro into nola dinning. The chargilled oysters are good but I discover after I ate one they have parmesan cheese so I went for just the regular one and they were delicious and fresh fresh fresh. Get the oyster shooters the are under $2!!! Such a good deal we may go back this afternoon just for them!

Reviews.Author: Beatrice T.
Reviews.Content: $1.50 oyster shots.  Fabulous service.  And charbroiled oysters drenched in buttery heaven.  WHAT A HAPPY NIGHT. To be fair.. it wouldn't really have mattered what was under the charred cheese and butter, it would have been delicious regardless.  And then toasted bread they give you to soak up any remaining butter and juice was perfect.  Also got the gumbo, jambalaya, sausage combo and loved it.  Probably my favorite out of several of hot spots.  Much better than the Gumbo Shop in my opinion.  As mentioned in other reviews, getting the staples meant warm, not hot, dishes off a steam table.. but our waitress was great and replaced my plate with a new order in steaming perfection =) Will def be back.

Reviews.Author: J P.
Reviews.Content: Great food great place, BUT if the line is long, I'm just as happy with Felix across the street.

Reviews.Author: Shane W.
Reviews.Content: Every time I am in NOLA, I end up at ACME at some point for some oysters.  Tonight didn't disapoint, although there were some a bit too large and didn't have the taste of the smaller ones.  Sat at the bar, had a couple dozen, and also ordered the jumbo - which was awesome, and had just the right amount of heat.  will definitely come back, again.

Reviews.Author: G C.
Reviews.Content: TLDR: Chargrilled oysters and New Orleans Medley (gumbo, jambalaya and redbeans&rice) are a must. Gumbo is amazing!Fresh Oysters - 4/5. Nothing to complain about :] Oysters were fresh as advertised and definitely gigantic.Chargrilled Oysters - 5/5. Firm, but not overcooked oysters served on the half shell. Atop these delicious creatures, a mix of mozerrella, hot sauce and garlic. On the side are slices of baguettes that are just barely larger than the oysters themselves!Hush Puppies - 3/5. Unfortunately, there was nothing that made these outstanding :L They were pretty standard and did not disappoint, but for some reason I expected something more.New Orleans Medley - 4/5. Sampling of gumbo, jambalaya, red beans & rice and a grilled sausage. Of the three, definitely enjoyed the gumbo the most - a complex seafood gumbo with a myriad of spices? Next in line was the red beans & rice, followed up by the jambalaya.Seafood Etouffe with Fried Crawfish tails - 4/5. Thick and buttery roux smothered over a rice dish. The fried crawfish tails provided an excellent texture contrast, but there was a tad more batter than I would have desired.

Reviews.Author: Ed L.
Reviews.Content: Seriously, don't put anything else down in your stomach except for the oysters. Just order a dozen fresh and a dozen grilled and you will be all set. The oysters are fresh and meaty with no overwhelming seafood odor. Eating them raw are quite nice to start. then you move on to the charbroiled once which are drenched in herb butter and coated with thick parmesan. They were cooked perfectly and go so well with the french bread. Just delectable. Go off peak hours to minize the wait.

Reviews.Author: Lola W.
Reviews.Content: I've lived in NoLA for a year now and while other places can come to close to their chargrilled oysters, Acme is still the best. Casamentos is second.

Reviews.Author: Travis M.
Reviews.Content: ACME is a place yo go so they can say they were there. As the bartender told me, "It's local food for tourists".Don't believe the hype about the quality of eating here. It is nothing special This place is maybe a notch above a dive. I think it took less time to order, eat and pay than it did to wait.  I ordered a dozen of the raw oysters and these boys are HUGE and...flavorless. They were also dirty and not cleaned properly. For being so near the gulf I was seriously underwhelmed. Nothing like what I've experienced before. I also ordered the seafood gumbo "Poopie". Lets just say I've had a better bread bowl at Panera, and the gumbo was bland and overcooked. It didn't taste fresh at all. Texture was mush all around.Good thing the wait moved briskly and was only about 30 minutes. Longer than that is not worth it. If you have to go, its only to check it off your "list". If its for food, save your time and money.

Reviews.Author: Lyn L.
Reviews.Content: Honestly, was the server so flighty that she charged someone else's food to our check as well as our food!  And to top it off, she could barely get back to our table to check to see if we needed anything else.   That's the main reason for my negative review of this popular tourist establishment.   First off, the waiting line is literally a line where you wait outside above a smelly sewer drain.  You want the wait for their food and service to be worth the stench you have to endure for 10-45 minutes.  Food-  meh, their fried shrimp was a tad over done, and if you want the sauce(mayo and Tabasco) then you cough up another .50.   The oyster lovers in the group enjoyed those oysters on the half shell.   Overall food, not as great as some of the smaller dive places on the city.  Service-  definitely needs to step it up a bit.   The servers seemed over worked thus didn't know who ordered what.

Reviews.Author: Mrunal D.
Reviews.Content: i got hooked on to eating oysters here, but noone of the other place have been able to meet my expectation. This is an amazing place and no other place can complete with rregards to its grilled and raw oyester. Simply Awesome.

Reviews.Author: Carrie T.
Reviews.Content: Po'Boy, po'boy, po'boy s! One of New Orleans best foods. I was so excited about coming here because of Man v. Food. I wanted those oysters! The food was good and the service was prompt and the staff were excellent. There were alot of people there that Friday night, but the wait wasn't too long. The parade was going to be floating by there too, so it was a perfect place for us to have dinner. We had a party of 12 people and they were very accomodating. Almost everyone ordered a po'boy. If not for themselves, it was shared between 2 people. Everyone had raw oysters and the chargrilled oysters. I enjoyed both types of oysters, but if I had to choose one, I like the raw ones better. They were plump and delicious. They weren't as sweet as some oysters I've had but they were fresh. I had the soft shell crab po'boy with a side of fries. The crab was a little fishy but, overall, it was a tasty sandwich. It had a great crunch, not soggy at all. My favorite was the seafood gumbo. It was really good...I am still craving for it. The oyster po'boy was good...probably better than the soft shell crab po'boy. The hurricane was huge and tasted a little bit like cough syrup.I should have done the 15 raw oysters challenge!  Acme is a great place. It's very casual and the people there are super nice!

Reviews.Author: Ryan G.
Reviews.Content: Great food, great service can't say much more but its worth the trip!

Reviews.Author: Dami R.
Reviews.Content: Oysters were good. Had better night before at Bourbon House. Ambiance at ACME is better but they had pre-mixed cocktail sauce and no mignonette.

Reviews.Author: Andrew R.
Reviews.Content: Lines be damned. Get here early, and you'll have a great time. Stand in line for forever, and you'll be cranky.We got the Gumbo, Oyster and Shrimp Po'Boy, and Char-grilled Oysters. Some of the best oysters we've ever eaten were in that po'boy. They really make the po'boy, hands down. Tender beyond comprehension. Great seasoning. The bread could use some work though. A bit tough and chewy for my tastes. Maybe others like to tear off bites with the full force of their molars.The gumbo, though, was sorely lacking. I actually couldn't believe that it tasted the same as anything one can get on a supermarket shelf. This is was forces me to lower the rating.Despite how delicious the po'boy was, however, the only thing I would go back for are the Char-grilled oysters. My god! The best oysters I've ever eaten. If you're going to cook an oyster, that's the way to do it. Anything else is almost a waste.

Reviews.Author: Jessica C.
Reviews.Content: I'm so sorry Acme... This place is waaaayy overrated. I heard so many good things from friends, saw everyone Instagramming pictures of oysters, and read so many positive Yelp reviews. I was expecting something mind blowing. Luckily I came here at 5pm on a Tuesday night and didn't have to wait. After eating the food, the long ass line is definitely not worth the wait. Especially not in that smelly street..My family and I ordered two dozen of oysters: one dozen fresh and the other chargrilled. Both sets of oysters were on steroids. My god, they were huge. I was a little turned off because I actually like smaller oysters. Don't get me wrong, the oysters were extremely fresh but a little overwhelming. My dad, who loves oysters, actually had a few and said he was done with oysters for a couple of months. The chargrilled tasted Italian with all the Parmesan crumble on top. They were good but not "amazing" as everyone else described them to be. :(My cousin and I both ordered the peacemaker po-boy and both were surprised when we discovered it was half a shrimp po-boy and half an oyster po-boy. We both thought it was a shrimp and oyster (mixed) po-boy. The oyster one was definitely better than the shrimp (tasted ordinary), but I could barely taste the Tabasco mayo and had to add a bit more hot sauce. I also had a bowl of gumbo, which wasn't anything special.As my first meal in New Orleans, I was completely overwhelmed.

Reviews.Author: Gretchen P.
Reviews.Content: Such a tourist destination, but it's worth the hoops of touristy fire and spangles (amateur drinkers in boas and sparkles) to dine here.  It's not the be all, end all oyster spot in the city, but it's worth the effort.  They offer raw, chargrilled, and fried oysters.  Oh, and an Oysters Rockefeller Soup.  However, why not have an oyster stew on the menu?  Acme OYSTER HOUSE, why do you have so few oyster options?  I suppose I was expecting more varieties of oysters, from various parts of the US and Canada, prepared in many other ways.  Because of this, I was a bit let down.  Not enough to give anything less than a four star review, though.I wound up with a half dozen of the Chargrilled (house special) and a half dozen raw.  They were medium to rather large and plump - quintessential gulf oyster perfect.   My opinion?  Go with the raw.  Just the raw.  Fried if you like fried, but otherwise, skip the Chargrilled unless that's truly your thing.  Mine were swimming in butter and melted parmesan, and came with mediocre french bread slices.  If oysters are good, you shouldn't mess with them, much less kill them by cooking, then drowning them.  "Rasputin oysters."  Again, get the raw, add some horseradish sauce, put everything on a saltine, and have at it.  Their sauce (it's a cross between a cocktail sauce and horseradish) is pretty great.  I piled it on high and used it to help my woebegone sinuses.

Reviews.Author: Logan P.
Reviews.Content: Please do yourself a Favor and come here if you want some of the best oysters in New Orleans. We had the oyster shooter, the chargrilled oysters, the oyster PO boy, shrimp PO boy, and all the gumbos. If it's oysters you want this is it! Delicccccious!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Now.....let's see how this bread pudding is

Reviews.Author: Umair K.
Reviews.Content: Acme is awesome. If your lucky you might get a short waiting queue. Aside for your their famous chargrilled oysters, a seafood etoufe is a must try. Very delicious!

Reviews.Author: Ray C.
Reviews.Content: The first time we visited Acme, the charbroiled oysters were amazingly great. The second time, the wait was long, so we had charbroiled oysters at a different restaurant across the street. We should have stuck with Acme! The wait would have been worth it.

Reviews.Author: Olga T.
Reviews.Content: The char grilled oysters were hands down the best thing I've had a long long long long time! Worth the wait and worth every penny. Can't speak for the other stuff on the menu....try coming at an off time so you don't have to wait too long on the line. I daydream about those oysters pretty much every day. WOOOOOOW!!!!

Reviews.Author: Frances B.
Reviews.Content: The line that is constantly outside of this place, no matter the time, speaks for itself. Every local we met told us to make sure and come here, and they were absolutely right. The oysters were the biggest I've ever seen- raw and chargrilled. They were amazing, period. So was their red beans and rice. I had their signature oyster and shrimp po' boy, which was very good but not great. It needed sauce of some kind. If they made a great sauce for it, it would be over the top. I made one out of ketchup and the buffalo tabasco they had on the table, and that was tasty, but it needed a better one for a wow factor. The hush puppies are passable. Come here for beer, oysters, and a fun, noisy atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Chuck G.
Reviews.Content: My Summer 2012 family vacation to NOLA had to include a visit to Acme. I had heard great things about this place. I was excited when we were first seated. The place seemed unique. A nice blend of old school brick with some flashy neon behind the bar. The place gets crowded and loud. Service is mediocre. I loved the chargrilled oysters were ordered. They were so good that we ordered another batch. The rest of the food was ok. In my opinion Felix's food was better overall, faster seating, faster service. Acme has a nice vibe inside and the chargrilled oysters are definitely worth a try.

Reviews.Author: Ani T.
Reviews.Content: This place lives up to the fame.  Even though the line is long, the oysters and food are totally worth it!  I never used to like oysters, but I've fully converted now to absolutely loving them.Raw Oysters- fresh and flavorful with perfect spicy horseradish topping.  They just go so quickly, one after another. MMMMmhChargrilled Oysters- savory cheesy garlicky flavorful.  I dip my bread in the leftover juices in attempts to get every last bite.This place gets a 5/5 because I'm seriously considering coming back and I was just there 5 nights ago!

Reviews.Author: Erika M.
Reviews.Content: Had to stop by before leaving The Big Easy... The chargrilled oysters are the business! Do yourself a favor and get the dozen. You won't regret it. While you're at it, get yourself an oyster shooter as well. In fact, at $1.50, get yourself a few :) Don't let the line discourage you. It moves pretty quickly. And if you get a chance, sit at the bar. Those guys will have you rolling!

Reviews.Author: Caitlin M.
Reviews.Content: Overall a good experience. It was a long wait outside of the restaurant (opt for first available seating) but we were entertained by a few beggars with corny jokes and street preacher with a speaker fanny pack. It was amusing to hear all the ways I'm going to hell.Once we finally got into the restaurant, we ordered a dozen oysters on the half shell, half a dozen of the chargrilled oysters and a plate of the Boo fries. Boo fries were good. I thought there would be checks of roast beef on them but it turns out it was just gravy. I might have misread the description.The chargrilled oysters were really tasty. Buttery, garlicky and delicious.The oysters on the half shell were nice and fresh tasting. My only complaint is that they were a little sandy. Or maybe the outside of the shell wasn't clean? That makes it a little awkward if you are a straight from the shell slurper like me.

Reviews.Author: Carl Y.
Reviews.Content: Get here early or come with just another person because you're going to have to wait for this Nola Mainstay. I came here with my buddy and we got in pretty soon after opening because we elected to eat at the bar. (I did come here during Mardi Gras weekend)So what do you get here? The oysters... You can get them raw or char-grilled. We got a dozen of both. The raw oysters were delicious paired with the cocktail sauce (i loved the sauce because of the horseradish potency). The char-grilled oysters are the ace of the restaurant. The garlic butter and the char flavor from the grill is the perfect combination for oysters. Depending on how many orders go in at once, you might have to wait for these bad boys to come out. I recommend this place and would definitely wait to satisfy my oyster craving. Also this was the place where Adam Richman (Man vs. Food) did the 15 dozen challenge for those who watch the food channels.

Reviews.Author: Lana K.
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I don't particularly like oysters but this blew me away and I am from the Bay Area that has great seafood. It was so delicious and cheap!!! Try the charbroiled oysters. It comes out fresh off the grill. Between 10 of us we ordered 9 dozen, I seriously could have eaten them all night loooong. We also had some gumbo and jambalaya which was good as well. I know the line is long but it is definitely worth the wait, we went on a Sunday night and it wasn't too bad. Just grab some beers to go and wait in line! Nothing wrong with that! YOU MUST TRY IT.

Reviews.Author: Tai F.
Reviews.Content: We waited in line for about thirty minutes to devour these oysters. I was originally just going to order the raw oysters but after some convincing from an acquaintance we thought to get the chargrilled too. Everyone in line that had eaten there before was so enthusiastic that we started to get pretty excited. Once we were seated everything happened so quickly. We had a dozen raw and a dozen chargrilled for the three of us. I also had a cocktail but I don't recommend getting one. It was weak. The raw were good but the chargrilled were even better. I really very much love raw oysters but I've had better than at Acme. The chargrilled were inspired. It sort of reminded me of the cheesy, buttery, garlicky deliciousness of escargot. Plus we dipped it in bread. Later in our trip we experienced more delectable oysters at a different restaurant that wasn't as popular or famous. Acme is great but it's not the be all and end all of oyster life.

Reviews.Author: Tingxiao Z.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled oyster is too salty and sour, not as expected at all ..so disappointed..seafood étouffée is pretty tasty but again, too salty...gumbo and jambalaya are just normal, nothing impressive. Overall, quite disappointed:(

Reviews.Author: Jay S.
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why this place as so many 4 and 5 star reviews. It's loud and touristy with small drinks, small oysters and marginal service. The chargrilled oysters are good - but what isn't good smothered in Parmesan and butter? Go to Felixes across the street instead - better food, better service, bigger drinks and less of wait.

Reviews.Author: David T.
Reviews.Content: The line was incredibly long, but we got lucky and dodged it (they had a table that was just the right size open up). Our table got oysters and crawfish as appetizers, which were very popular. I had the roast beef po boy, and it was fantastic- the right amount of au jus and it was falling apart of the bun- probably one of the best I've had. The line was really long, and it wouldn't have been worth quite the half hour wait we were slated for, but the prices are good and the food is great.

Reviews.Author: Sabrina K.
Reviews.Content: After seeing 4 stars on Yelp!  We were very excited about trying this place out.I have to say I don't think I've ever been more disappointed in a restaurant that I was looking forward to trying.This place was like a Chain restaurant so you would think at least their Go-To Items would be on point.... Not the case at all.Between myself and my cousin we ordered 4 plates::Gumbo -- terrible, very bland and coldThe Charbroiled Oysters -- these were something they are known for, not that great but probably one of the better things we had here.Side of Hush Puppies -- probably the best thing we tried, how sad is that?The Sampler Plate -- came with gumbo, already knew that was a thumbs down, The Rice and beans had no flavor to them and the sausage was disappointing as well;  but the best thing on the sampler plate.We had barely started eating when we just immediately asked for the check.  we wanted to get the hell out of here and on to a place with something that was actually edible.The only reason I'm not giving this place a 1 is because our waitress was nice, the hush puppies were decent, and the oysters were okay.

Reviews.Author: Andy F.
Reviews.Content: Call it a tourist trap if you want, but consider my opinion as that of an oyster purist... a guy who loves them raw and prefers the sweet yet briny Apalachicola ones (which they don't have here).  I consider putting heat to an oyster one of the seven deadly sins. But this is the ONLY restaurant I've ever been to where the chargrilled oysters are better than the pure raw ones.  I don't know their secret is, but they are worth every penny and the wait.  The rest of the food is average at best, but why would you go here for anything else?

Reviews.Author: becca w.
Reviews.Content: Oysters were sooo good both raw and char grilled. But service was only so-so.  And some of the oysters had shell bits in it that caused my husband to chip his tooth. So I deduct one star for those two things. Otherwise food is good.

Reviews.Author: J. C.
Reviews.Content: Good food. Bad service. We walked in and saw a scrumptious looking plate spread on the counter -- had to order it! Who would've thought cheesy oysters could be do good! Chargrilled oysters.

Reviews.Author: Stephy S.
Reviews.Content: Came here for lunch, and there was a line outside! Don't worry, the line goes fast. Get the chargrilled oysters!!! If you sit at the bar, you can watch the friendly staff behind the counter work at the opening all the oyster shells you are about to eat!jamabalya was good, as well as shrimp po-boy. but if you can only do 1 thing, CHARGRILLED oysters

Reviews.Author: Matt C.
Reviews.Content: With over 1300 reviews I can't really add anything that hasn't been said, except echo a few things.After an evil relative gave me a raw oyster at around the age of 4 I have hated oysters. the thought of eating one that wasn't battered and fried made me gag. I have eaten some fried, but wasn't impressed. I read all the reviews about the chargrilled oysters at Acme and I figured what the heck - I would try at least one chargrilled one here. It was one of those magical moments where your eyes roll back in your head and your taste buds overwhelm all the thought processes!!!!!. It was so good I ordered a dozen. I think I could have easily eaten about 3 dozen, but I didn't want to over do it. We were lucky enough to be seated at the bar where we got to talk to our server, who was also shucking oysters. The guy knew his stuff and was quite entertaining. Great evening despite standing in line for about 45 minutes. Good food. Good experience. Oh yeah, I also got a roast beef poboy which was good too. Person with me got Jambalaya which was quite tasty as well.

Reviews.Author: Mike L.
Reviews.Content: So in 2 trips to NOLA over the past few months, I've managed to eat at Acme Oyster House 3 times.  Each time I enjoyed the fresh oysters and chargrilled oysters.  I think both are some of the best in town.  The atmosphere is casual and the beer expensive, but the food is good - that's why they've been in business for the past 100 years. Compared with some of the other reviewers, guess I have been lucky to have had pretty good service on each of my visits.  Hell, the waitress even bought our last round of beers on my second visit - of course lunch was disrupted by the guy having a stroke at the next table being carted out by the EMTs.This has become a spot near and dear to my heart -  I can get great NOLA food without having to dress for dinner or make a reservation.  Definitely on my list of must eat places when in town!

Reviews.Author: Dee D.
Reviews.Content: Best Oysters and Po Boys in town!The highlight of my 4 day trip,was this gem in the heart of the French quarter! The po boys were outstanding and the charbroiled oysters were out of this world. The price on the oysters were high $20 a dozen but I would happily pay it again to eat these buttery, salty, flavor explosion oysters everyday for the rest of my life!!

Reviews.Author: Ana E.
Reviews.Content: AHHHmazing!!!We got there around 8pm on Sunday the line was pretty long,but after we got seated the waiter told us that we got in pretty fast after only 20 min.Food.Food is absolutely fantastic,Ohhhh the Chargrilled oysters are out of this world we ordered first only 1/2 dozen and ended up ordering another dozen afterwards.The fresh oysters,seafood gumbo soup,oyster soup,jambalaya rice,all the food in the restaurant is a piece of heaven.The restaurant is a gem,food and drinks are awesome and our waiter Eduard was fantastic!!!If you are visiting New Orleans it's a must try!

Reviews.Author: Dee K.
Reviews.Content: BY FAR FAVORITE SPOT IN NOLA. The chargrilled oyesters are delish, heaven, A MUST. We had chicken gumbo and dunked our texas toast from the oysters in the gumbo. Sit at the bar, grab an Abita and eat multiple dozens of chargrilled oysters. The staff is laidback, friendly and great to chat with at the busy dive.

Reviews.Author: Rachel S.
Reviews.Content: I'd never been to NOLA before, and a fellow oyster-lover recommended I go to Acme. The front desk staff at our hotel also recommended Acme, but encouraged us to head over before the dinner rush. We were welcomed and seated quickly, in the front room, and ordered some local brews without a problem. But, when they were brought to us, they were just small plastic cups, not pint glasses (although they were pint-priced), and the waitress didn't seem to notice  or care that she spilled some of mine.Now, coming from CA, $13.50 for a dozen oysters is an excellent price, so I of course ordered a dozen. It was kind of strange that they weren't served on ice, but they were huge and crazy delicious! I'm assuming this is the reason Acme gets so packed, because everything else was overpriced and disappointing. The "seafood" ettoufee with crawfish was really a small plate of shrimp ettouffee with fried crawfish in a cup on the side (and it was more breading that crawfish).
