My boyfriend's "10-napkin" sandwich was also small, and disappeared quickly.Despite the fact that we were in the front room and in the path of all the wait staff, we were largely ignored by our waitress. When my boyfriend wanted to order dessert, she seemed annoyed by his questions, and the ice cream he ordered was TERRIBLE: it had almost no flavor and was waxy in texture. We had a hard time flagging her down to get our check and to pick it up again, which I just don't get. Why make it hard to PAY YOU?? I left Acme feeling frustrated and ripped off (at over $30/person), despite the wonderful oysters at the start of the meal. The oysters are the ONLY reason this is a 2- and not 1-star review. I guess I should have known what I was getting into, this being such a touristy location... So, despite the giant line and now-questionable recommendations from hotel staff, I strongly encourage you to go elsewhere, like Royal House. Although they are equally touristy, they at least take pride in good service, FULL PINTS of beer, and quality food.

Reviews.Author: Cookie R.
Reviews.Content: Whimper.Chargrilled oysters. They come to the table bubbly and hypnotic, exuding garlic. This is the most wonderful thing I've eaten.The other stuff is okay.The line outside does keep moving.Though I'd like more beer options, Abita owns this town and does go with the food.

Reviews.Author: Leanne M.
Reviews.Content: After being in NOLA for a few days, ACME always seemed like it was buzzing with people, so I had to go in and try it. Before this, I had never tried oysters, so I was a bit skeptical. Here's the run down on what we ate:1 raw oyster- wasn't too keen on trying a 1/2 dozen of these, so I just went for the one. It was actually pretty good1/2 dozen of char grilled oysters- omgahhh... one of the best things that I ate in NOLA. There was some type of melted butter, cheese, and breadcrumb concoction sprinkled all over it. It was like crack on an oyster shell. I def used the bread to scoop all of it out.Fried Peace Maker Po-Boy- soooooooo delish! oysters AND shrimp WITH tabasco mayo?! heaven in a bun!I also had a hurricane to wash it all down. Really great and really strong! Overall, I really liked this place. A lot of the places in NOLA have a ton of personality- especially this one. Our waitress was very nice and although it was very busy, she never forgot to check up on us, make sure our drinks were always topped up, and that we were enjoying our food.

Reviews.Author: Dennis H.
Reviews.Content: Amazing scrimp Po boy (my first ever) and gumbo was so yummy. Wife and kids loved theirs too

Reviews.Author: Mitra K.
Reviews.Content: Their Oysters were delicious, Crab Claws are making me drool now and the staff was super friendly! Acme is a must visit for me for all future NOLA trips!

Reviews.Author: Karla I.
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with Acme Oyster House. It's just one of those places that's consistent and never disappoints. I've eaten here during my previous visits to NOLA and last week we ate at this place three times! (given that it was close to our hotel so it was accessible). But other than it's accessibility, it's one of those places that always delivers and doesn't disappoint.There is a wait especially at night but it doesn't take long so even if you see a line, give it a chance.I read a lot of the reviews about their chargrilled oysters so I tried it this time around, and although it was tasty, I wouldn't necessarily order it again only because I personally preferred the raw oysters. Their gumbo, red beans and rice with smoked sausage are awesome. I've also had their po-boy sandwiches (fried fish, fried oysters) and they are also really good. Their crab cakes are also really good. I personally loved their coleslaw. Prices are also reasonable. Casual environment. Can be loud at times but that's part of the fun of being in NOLA. ;)I definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Author: Steve L.
Reviews.Content: Disclaimer: I was never an oyster fan.Revelation: I LOVE oysters from Acme Oyster House. Holy hell, are these things amazeballs.Don't let the long lines that form in front of this place deter you from eating here. We waited about 30 minutes in line before being seated at the bar, which afforded us a birds-eye view of the oyster shuckers working their magic.Service was a bit lackadaisical, but in all fairness, our server was also shucking shells, so that's to be expected.  We loved the half order of raw oysters; a little lemon and just a dab of the sauce, and you've got a delicious, briny treat. So yummy.The half order of chargrilled oysters arrived after a short wait, and wow - these things are like crack. I could've easily planted my name on their wall of fame; I suspect it would be quite easy to down dozens and dozens of those gems. Be sure to use the little rounds of french bread to mop up any errant oyster drippings.Jambalaya and fried crawfish arrived slightly later and both were super tasty. The jambalaya was actually quite incredible - the more I think about it, the more I realize I really, really loved it. A few Abita Purple Hazes helped wash things down. When the tab arrived, it was a bargain at just over $50 for the entire meal.Acme Oyster House = WINFood = 4.5 starsService = 3 starsValue = 4 starsMISC = 5 starsGo. Go now. Get the chargrilled oysters.

Reviews.Author: Michal F.
Reviews.Content: This trick always works at uber popular spots that don't make reservations and is intuitive as well. Get there as soon as they open or right before they close. That's what my friend Carl and I did and probably saved an hour of wait. We got in 10 minutes after showing up and by the time we left saw a line with over 200 people waiting.We got exactly what you think. Oysters. The first dozen was raw. Fresh and delicious. Paired with the red tartar sauce and a lemon dousing it makes for a meal that disappears in seconds. The char broiled oysters took 30-40 minutes to make. Everyone in the restaurant ordered them. Well worth the wait they came out with a smokey flavor and covered in parmesan and garlic butter. Succulent. Our last dish we should have skipped in preference to more oysters. We got two soft shelled crab. They were good but it felt like a ton of fried food. The frying, to me seemed to take away some of the flavor. Stick with the oysters.Good place but not the best oysters I've had in NOLA, that prize goes to Luke. It's tough to live up to so much hype. I'd recommend going only if the wait is not over 30 minutes.

Reviews.Author: James R.
Reviews.Content: Words can not describe how the chargbrilled oysters taste. They must  be eaten to properly understand. The rest of the menu is solid as well. The crawfish are spicy, the po'boys are yummy, and the seafood etouffee is to die for. The oysters Rockefeller soup and seafood gumbo are also pretty amazing.If you don't eat here at least once in NOLA you are doing yourself a disservice. It gets a lot of hype, but they deserve it.

Reviews.Author: Matt C.
Reviews.Content: 3.5 - 4 starsHonestly it's more of a tourist trap than a place to get the best oysters you've ever had...The oysters are solid, definitely good.  But, not worth an hour wait in line.People like the ambiance; it's kind of a rite of passage type place...Best oysters ever, no...  I have had better at several places.If you're lucky enough to have no to minimal line its worth it, otherwise "Just keep walkin'"...

Reviews.Author: Amy A.
Reviews.Content: I did come back the day after for more - so here's an updated review:This place definitely made my vacation here in New Orleans. I was so stunned by how good it was, especially at the price paid. I highly highly highly (have I emphasized it enough now?) recommend the charbroiled oysters. Something about them is so scrumptious, and they are covered in romano cheese. I also highly recommend the soft-shell crab, get two if you're hungry. It was so crispy and tender and I love that when it's soft-shell you can eat the entire thing. If you're looking for some good Louisiana beer, I'd recommend the Abita Amber. You'll inevitably wait in line if you have a huge group, and there are people waiting at all times of the day. Just as an FYI, just wait in the line and someone will come and get your name. You don't need to go inside to put your name down.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly B.
Reviews.Content: Not as good as in years past. I asked about the fried fish po' boy and our waiter said it was very similar to catfish. I suspect he thought we'd never had catfish and wouldn't know the difference. It was nothing like catfish. About 25% of all of the food we got was over-fried. AKA burned. Yes, that's right. Burned. The peacemaker was good but see above about the burning issue.I don't know -- I've been here on a previous trip and it was easily top on my list to return for a quick, casual lunch. I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Regina H.
Reviews.Content: My favorite of all our New Orleans food adventures! If you stop by Acme Oyster House, the chargrilled oysters ARE A MUST!Oysters topped with butter and melted cheese - how can one resist? I could've eaten a dozen (maybe more) by myself! We also tried the gumbo, which was pretty decent. Service was efficient and as others have said, the interior is kinda like a bar. But hey, you're not here for fine wines and molecular gastronomy.A little warning: We tried to stop by our first night, but the line was ridiculous and we were too hungry to wait in line. Our second attempt was more successful when we went in between meals at 3 pm. We didn't even have to wait!

Reviews.Author: Jake H.
Reviews.Content: Second-best oyster house on Iberville. Having just discovered a few months ago that I actually love raw oysters, I was really excited to go to New Orleans and see what they had to offer. If you're on/around Bourbon St, Acme and Felix's are the two best-reviewed oyster houses and, having tried both, I have to give Acme a close second. The line at Acme was always longer than the line directly across the street for Felix's, so you're likely to wait between 45 mins and 2 hrs if you come with a party of four or more during dinner hours. That said, they let you take pitchers of beer outside, so it's not as bad as it sounds if you're committed to having good seafood.  I'll base my ranking of Acme as the second-best oyster house on Iberville based on two dishes: chargrilled and raw oysters. The chargrilleds were a little overpowered by the parmesan cheese and the raw were too big for my taste (perhaps sacrilege to some, but although I love the flavor, I am a beginner).  One thing Acme did do much better than Felix's was beer--the draft selection was much larger and the Abita SOS is a great pilsner for washing down seafood. I also ate a pretty good (if standard) shrimp poboy, which had great fried shrimp and was made even better by the application of hot sauce (although I wish they offered something aside from Tobasco). Overall, a good meal, but not worth the wait with Felix's less than 200 ft away.

Reviews.Author: SD C.
Reviews.Content: We were there January 18.  When we got there, the waiting line was pretty long, but it did move along pretty quickly.  Chargrilled oysters were amazing; fried oysters were also good.  There was an assembly line feel about it, but a New Orleans landmark that should be experienced.

Reviews.Author: Michael C.
Reviews.Content: Acme is your obligatory tourist restaurant stop.Come here once, get the grilled oysters (which are slightly above average), everything else on the menu was very unremarkable.No line on a Monday afternoon around 2pm (in December 2012). Otherwise, this place is supposed to have long lines especially during tourist season.Eat at Acme once, just to say you've done it, but don't bother coming back.

Reviews.Author: Kal M.
Reviews.Content: Last stop on our N'Awlins trip back in July and i can still crave the chargrilled oysters that make Acme so different from other places by having this special oyster available. I would go back to New Orleans only for that.Lines are constant here and it's just because the oysters are so fresh and yummy. Raw, chargrilled or other-- this is the place to go!i'll be un-vegetarian for oysters. ;)

Reviews.Author: Margaret L.
Reviews.Content: Just go here already. It's a glorified bar with drinks served in plastic cups and rowdy patrons, but you're gonna eat great food (the oysters! the fried fish po boy!) and get awesome service. I came here on a Friday night after flying in from St. Louis, and to my surprise we were seated right away (totally lucky, as we were the only group of 2 in the entire line outside the door). The vibe is hard to pin down... it's a mix of neon lights and domestic draught beer, but with a touch of class. Is that incompatible? Maybe, but I'm not thinking straight after 3 bud lights and a tray full of oysters. In terms of Po Boys, I tried the Fish and the Peacemaker- both were great. Fish takes the cake for me, in terms of taste and price. As far as Po Boys go, I say keep it simple- no need to go mixing sea creatures and adding bacon and getting fancy. My fish po boy stuck right to the point and got it totally right.I'd tell anybody looking for a genuinely great (albeit a little touristy) New Orleans meal to get down here immediately and get yo' oyster on.

Reviews.Author: Adam E.
Reviews.Content: Though it's been around since 1910, we discovered Acme Oyster House via Yelp, and it absolutely crushed it for birthday dinner. We got lucky and found it with only a 10-minute wait, but it's good enough you should expect longer. Chargrilled oysters are fantastic; hit them with some lemon juice and they sing. We had the New Orleans medley with incredible red beans & rice and jambalaya, though I can't say the gumbo was my favorite (girlfriend disagrees, but it's my review). Also enjoyed the seafood étouffée with fried crawfish tails, with a slice of bananas foster cheesecake to finish, plus a pitcher of Abita Andygator. Brusk service, but endearingly so (it's New Orleans, you expected different?) Will happily and hungrily return.

Reviews.Author: Bernadette W.
Reviews.Content: We opted for a seat at the oyster bar right next to the door - breezy, but a perfect little spot for us. Stormin Norman was our oyster shucker. He was great, and we really enjoyed our charbroiled oysters, bloody mary's, and the peace maker po boy. It was delicious - just the right amount of fixings. This place always has a long line, but it is worth the wait, especially if you like oysters!

Reviews.Author: Leila M.
Reviews.Content: I've only eaten here once, despite having regularly visited New Orleans over the last three decades thanks to my parent's LSU roots and my father's love for all things Cajun, Creole, seafood, jazz and blues and of course, tigers. And I may be a little more critical of the food since we've heavily adopted Louisiana cuisine and we make it at home regularly.  We have been on the quest for perfect gumbo for three decades and to date, the best bowl of gumbo was made by a little old black lady out of a small shack in the Audubon Zoo. This lady seemed to always serve up a consistently perfect finger-licking bowl of seafood gumbo through the 80s and 90s and it may have very well been the best kept secret the the time predating Yelp.So, when we choose a place to grab a good bowl of seafood gumbo my family and I have the highest of expectations, without losing sight of the fact the French Quarter is first and foremost a touristy place that most likely won't deliver a comparable bowl of gumbo to what we make at home or to what we have had in the past. Having said this, what really pissed us off about Acme was the number of times we asked several different people if the Seafood Gumbo had any pork or sausage, to the point of pestering the staff.  We were repeatedly and sometimes half-indignantly told the Seafood Gumbo did not contain any pig.  So, you can only imagine my mom and dad's displeasure when they saw chunks of Andouille sausage floating in their gumbo.  The manager was very cordial and apologized but it was so loud I couldn't tell if he was explaining that someone in the kitchen had combined the Seafood Gumbo with the Chicken/Andouille Gumbo or if they had mistakenly served us the Chicken/Andouille Gumbo. I'm leaning towards the first option because the gumbo my parents got had both shrimp and Andouille, but no chicken. He immediately picked both bowls up and assured us they would bring out the seafood gumbo and comp them from the ticket. Forget about the refund, that alone is a HUGE red flag! Who mixes two different dishes in a diet-conscience time when people can be sue-happy over allergic reactions to foods and strict religious dietary restrictions?  My mom and dad were not happy for a good portion of the meal, so when the server brought out the seafood gumbo, my dad barely touched it.  It wasn't until we got the Seafood Etouffees that we somewhat regained our composure. And the Seafood Etouffee was good for a touristy area, but not as special as the long queue of people waiting to get in would suggest.  The shrimp in the Etouffee and Gumbo was so tiny, I wouldn't even bother using it as bait if I was fishing. And I'm almost certain it's frozen shrimp. You know, the kind you buy in a big bag from the frozen section of your grocery store of choice. The Fried Stuffed Crab Platter was tasteless, the crabs tasted like they were stuffed with 90% breading and 10% crab, and the fries tasted like they were frozen, so no, I wouldn't order this again. The hush puppies were decent.I'd most likely come back here for the ONLY item I enjoyed off the menu: the Raw Oysters. But you are in Louisiana. If anyone here messes these up, I think they chase them out of the state or throw them into the Mississippi. I'd also try the following menu items: Fried Peace Maker Po-Boy, Acme "10 Napkin Roast Beef" and the Boo Fries based on curiosity and the rave reviews by other Yelpers, but to be honest, I'd come back reluctantly based on the first experience with The Great Gumbo Gaffe.If you are looking for good Gumbo in the French Quarters, skip this place and head on over to Johnnys Poboys!

Reviews.Author: Jessica M.
Reviews.Content: In search of the best charbroiled oysters in the french quarter. These hit the spot but were slightly over buttered. I think my search continues.......

Reviews.Author: Dave S.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled oysters are the best oysters ive ever had! This place is amazing! Had the chicken gumbo and it was ok but the oysters are absolutely amazing. Is this a review yet? Or a tip? How many times do I have to eat here for it to be a review. ..

Reviews.Author: Deanie B.
Reviews.Content: Had the chargrilled oysters.  Excellent.  Had the gumbo.  Nasty.  Tasted like frozen from a bag.   Very surprising.  The debris po boy was good.  Will move on to try other places.

Reviews.Author: Tanay N.
Reviews.Content: I went on a road trip around the US for 2 months, and ate a lot of good food along the way.  My dinner at Acme was the best meal and it isn't even close.  I found the place on Yelp, and after a 20 minute wait, I was seated at the bar.  Michael "Hollywood" Broadway was shucking oysters right in front of me.  He told me I could go back home to California and say I met a bad mother-shucker ;)I started with a half-dozen of the highly-touted chargrilled oysters.  They were INCREDIBLE.  This being my first time in NOLA, I also got the New Orleans Medley -- jambalaya, gumbo, red beans + rice, and sausage.  I loved everything, especially the gumbo.  And even though I was past full, I knew I wasn't going to make it back on this trip, so I finished up with another half-dozen chargrilled oysters.  They're soo good!!

Reviews.Author: Duncan D.
Reviews.Content: It's a tourist trap and it is awful. The char broiled oysters tasted like they were prepared on top of burning tires. Too much char, too much char fuel residue.  The shrimp Po Boy I had was filled with popcorn sized shrimp. Not fresh and definitely not Louisiana native.  I read the Yelp reviews and I was hopeful after living in the area some thirty years ago and now not knowing the good places. Spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: Michelle L.
Reviews.Content: Hmm, I don't quite understand why people would say that a dozen chargrilled oyster priced at $20 is actually high. Even half-sized raw oysters are priced at $3.5 per oyster in Los Angeles... I have been to ACME three times, and I enjoyed it EVERY SINGLE time. Since the wait is usually very long, we would always like to make our wait well worth..here is a list of things we ordered for my boyfriend and myself just the two of us: 2 pounds of boiled crawfish; 1 dozen of fresh oyster; 2 dozens of char-grilled oyster; one pull-boy; one Jambalaya; one gumbo; and one rootbeer float. And yes, we finished them all in no time, so you should know how amazing they are! Since lots of people have commented on the oysters and the pull-boys, I feel obligated to say something about the rootbeer float, definitely the best rootbear float I have ever had in my life, and it goes so well with the spiciness of the cajun food.  I still dream about their char-grilled oysters and hope one day I will be able to find something comparable in Los Angeles....So far, none of the places that claim they can do char-grilled oysters have come even close to what I have had in ACME. I don't say this often at all, but for ACME you will regret if you skip the line, cuz the wait is all worth it!!!

Reviews.Author: B B.
Reviews.Content: This was the first place we stopped when we arrived and let me tell you.........my oysters everywhere else did not stand a chance. Get here early or be prepared to stand in line. Had the chargrilled oysters, crawfish and poboy. The Hurricane was good. Second visit before we left the oysters were just ok but better from the rest. I went to see who was on the grill and wasnt same person as first time. Older woman at bar.....had to lookup ingredients to a drink that was on their drink menu....Sign the chargrilled oysters are going to be good are if they are steaming when they hit the table and keep cooking until the topping on top crusts over. Also tried these at Oceana, Felix (across the street), and Crazy Lobster, ACME has the best. Will be hard for me to eat these anywhere else. Acme has set the standard for me.

Reviews.Author: Hannah C.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled oysters. The fresh oysters were fine, but I'm a fan of getting a variety of different oysters and savoring their differences. They had one giant, milky kind with very little brininess. On the other hand, these oysters were excellent chargrilled. Other items were good, but not amazing enough to justify the queue that lines the block.

Reviews.Author: Marisa N.
Reviews.Content: We love, love, loved our meals at Acme.  During our recent 4 day vacation in New Orleans, we ate at Acme twice!  Service- Amazing.  We sat at a table the first time, and at the bar the second.  We enjoyed our experience at the bar; watching them shuck oysters, and enjoyed our convos with the employees.  Food-  Crawfish boil was very good, and reasonably priced, and the freshly shucked oysters were amazing.  Also very good is the oyster rockefeller soup.  Yummm!  They have some great beers on hand too.  Wait times- Of course avoid coming here on a friday or saturday night for dinner, as the line can get pretty long.  We were just a party of 2, and that was very advantageous.  On thursday around 3pm we were sat almost immediately.  If ever back in New Orleans, we will definitely be back here for a few meals!

Reviews.Author: Diana W.
Reviews.Content: I need a cold shower after this place...The chargrilled oysters are the best in New Orleans! Don't let those Drago's lovers fool you, Acme is the spot! They grill them not broil...and I think they add a few angel tears, it's kind of like good sea salt.

Reviews.Author: Ivy L.
Reviews.Content: Must try the chargrilled oysters and oyster shooters!

Reviews.Author: AJ J.
Reviews.Content: Sat at the bar and was waited on by Malcolm as he shucked oysters.  What a neat experience.  Service was great.  Food was great (grill oysters & seafood po-boy) and our hurricane was really good - yes you could really taste the alcohol.

Reviews.Author: Johnson K.
Reviews.Content: DO NOT be discouraged by the long lines!  It goes a lot faster than it looks and it is WELL WORTH the wait!  We must have waited about half an hour  when the line was halfway across the block (seating for 2.  It really helped us built up our appetite!  Haha..We ordered half a dozen of raw oysters, 2 dozens of the charboiled oysters, some fried crawfish tails and a pitcher of beer and we still yearned for more charboiled oysters by the end of the night!  The oysters were fat and juicy and probably one of the best oysters I've eaten and prices are very reasonable (about $20 for a dozen).  Soak the bread into the sauce that drenched the charboiled oysters and it's just heaven especially when it's complemented with a sip of beer.  The fried crawfish tails were good, but the oysters definitely stole the show! Acme Oyster House is definitely on my list of must-visits the next time I come to New Orleans.Credit cards are accepted.

Reviews.Author: Mary Grace T.
Reviews.Content: CHARGRILLED OYSTERS. You really don't need to get anything else- just the CHARGRILLED OYSTERS. I really wish we didn't order any more food because all I was thinking about was the CHARGRILLED OYSTERS. I never knew oysters could taste that good. Now I'm back in New York, having just eaten lunch and while I'm typing this, my mouth is salivating at the mere thought of ACME'S CHARGRILLED OYSTERS. I would fly to NOLA and happily wait in line for a couple hours to taste these beautifully, bubbly, babies again.

Reviews.Author: Mel B.
Reviews.Content: Don't hate cause it's a tourist trap.  Hell, if you weren't a tourist, you'd probably be shucking the oysters yourself at home, right?I'm not a big fan of oysters, but when in Rome...Loved them.  The raw oysters were incredibly fresh.  They were crisp and no fishy taste to speak of.  Oh, but the chargrilled ones were insanely delicious.  I'd go back for a dozen of those alone.Of course we had to try the Peacemaker Po Boy, their signature sandwich. It's oyster and shrimp with tabasco mayo.  That too was worth the 30 min wait.  We stuck to the basics and had the red beans and rice on the side.  Good, but forgettable.  It was all about the oysters.

Reviews.Author: Giancarlo R.
Reviews.Content: Decent seafood!  This was one of our first places to go on our trip to New Orleans.  We ordered 3 things: fried blue crab claws, crab cake, and a dozen raw oysters.The fried blue crab claws were awesome.  The batter that they use is thin and tasty.  The batter is not overpowering, which really emphasizes the crab meat, which we liked.The crab cake was meaty, about the size of a hockey puck, and tasted like a mediocre crab cake.The oysters were huge.  This was kind of a surprise to us and wasn't to our liking because we like our raw oysters a bit smaller, and couldn't stomach that much of raw oyster texture.  It tasted ok though.  If you like really big Louisiana oysters though, you'd like this place.Would definitely come back here for some blue crab claws, and good service.  Arrived at 6:00pm on a Thursday evening with a short 10 min wait to get in, but the line was huge when we got out.

Reviews.Author: Chivonne H.
Reviews.Content: This place was so so. Its the only place during our week long trip that we had to wait in a line to get in and it was my least favorite place that we ate at. I wouldn't come back. There are way better places to get your oyster fix.

Reviews.Author: Michelle S.
Reviews.Content: My trip to NOLA was elevated by the fact that I got to go eat at this place more than once...  I loved this place.  Very down to earth and the food...  The oysters were fresh and the fried soft shell crab, OMG, so DELICIOUS!  I need to take another trip to NOLA just to go back.

Reviews.Author: Debbie L.
Reviews.Content: Holy heck, that was amazing!  This place introduced me to CHARGRILLED OYSTERS and now I can't even think about having oysters any other way.  In fact, I'm already thinking of ways to recreate it in my oven, but I digress...Within an hour of getting into New Orleans, I was out and about walking towards the French Quarters from the CBD.  On the way there, hunger struck, so I turned to my Yelp app for the most rated, and highly rated spot.  Turns out that that was Acme and that I was right across the street from it.  We got there at around 4'ish and there was a mini line of two parties ahead of us, but we ended up being seated pretty quickly because we were fine with bar seats.  Tables weren't going to be for a while.We got our drinks and looked straight to the bar grub menu.  We saw plates of delicious-looking chargrilled oysters being bussed around immediately ordered a dozen of our own, plus 'boo fries'.  The boo fries came first and even though they weren't very impressive looking, they were very good tasting and flavorful.  It honestly looked like once-frozen fries with pre-shredded Costco cheese and jarred gravy on it at first, but we ended up licking the bowl clean.Those chargrilled oysters, though, were so good that we had to order another dozen.  That's a testament to how good those are, because as food lovers who don't come to NOLA very often, we could've tried something else on the menu or gone somewhere completely different, but we chose to eat the same dish again at the same restaurant.We were lucky that we got there when we did, because there was a pretty lengthy line when we left, and when we walked by again a few hours later, the line had gotten even more ridiculous.  So on most nights, I would say prepare to wait, and would suggest getting there earlier if you can.Mmmmmm.... still dreaming of those chargrilled oysters :)

Reviews.Author: Jenifer R.
Reviews.Content: Came here the first night we got to the French Quarter. Staff was friendly as they sat our large group down for dinner. I recommend the grilled oysters, shucked oysters, oyster po-boy. It's all DELISH!!!!

Reviews.Author: Michael F.
Reviews.Content: Holy Oysters Batman!  Coming from Philly, I was told raw oyster's at Acme was a must-do.  I agreed, but didn't think much of it until I finally managed to fit Acme in on my last day... what was I thinking?!? I should have visited this place everyday!  The oysters are fresh of course, but they are also huge.  Its fun to watch their pro shuckers at work.  If you're visiting New Orleans, make sure you plan to visit Acme early in your trip.  Grab a seat at the bar, order a half dozen/person, take it the show (shuckering), and thank me later!

Reviews.Author: Krista S.
Reviews.Content: One of the best and least expensive meals I had in New Orleans. My meal consisted of everything New Orleans I wanted to try: oysters, crawfish, po'boy and gumbo. The 1/2 soup 1/2 sandwich option is great, seafood gumbo was bowl-lickin' good. Drowned it down with a few local IPAs. Sat at the bar and met a few other out-of-towners for cocktails later that evening.

Reviews.Author: Jesse B.
Reviews.Content: It just keeps getting better... The charbroiled oysters are easily the best thing I've put in my mouth in this town. A dozen is so appealing and delicious that the only negative is once you've gotten to the last one. The crawfish tail Po boy with tobacco infused mayo, makes you want to stand up and kiss the man or woman who thought it up! Desert, a must the banana foster cheesecake or bread pudding will leave you with a tantalizing ending to your evening. Simply out Acme Oyster House is a MUST STOP, when your in NOLA!

Reviews.Author: Jordan M.
Reviews.Content: Oysters are 5-star. Everything else (gumbo, jambalaya, soft shell crab) we ordered was just average. Line is long too, and service isnt

Reviews.Author: Kevin C.
Reviews.Content: Don't bother with this place. The food is cheap but so is the service. They kept my group with three kids waiting an hour in the rain, and when we finished eating they actually told a disabled mother of two we were with that she had to wait in the bathroom for her ride to pick her up at the door.  If you're a glutton for punishment and over-salted seafood, this is the place be.

Reviews.Author: Amanda A.
Reviews.Content: Acme is a staple of each of my trips to the great city of New Orleans! It has a great atmosphere, great food, and although there's usually a line, it goes by quick and there is plenty of entertainment while waiting (with it being right off if Bourbon)!   When we were there this past time we split boo fries (GET THEM!), a dozen chargrilled oysters (GET THEM!!), and we each got a po boy! Ok who am I kidding.. get all of those! After the oysters and fries we could only eat half of our sandwiches so I would suggest just getting one to share (from experience, they aren't very good heated up later..)   We also got oyster shooters, which I had no idea what to expect! It was delicious! For only $1.49 it is a must try!!  All in all, acme is delicious and a lot of fun!  It has a great atmosphere and great food!

Reviews.Author: Alice Y.
Reviews.Content: Incredibly long wait but for good reason. We went in the late afternoon, and there was still a long wait! If you're a party of two, you've got a better shot at getting in more quickly. Friendly staff! Recommend: The grilled oysters and the medley sampler are a fantastic way to start.

Reviews.Author: Joe O.
Reviews.Content: Alright, you can say that this place is full of tourists because of the really long lines or you can wait and have a great meal. The chargrilled oysters are out of this world with their lemony,buttery, and garlicky goodness. Jambalaya was very good too. Stick around, it's worth it.

Reviews.Author: Rio P.
Reviews.Content: Very good food! (Catfish, oysters, gumbo, jambalaya, soft shell crab all delicious!) You won't be disappointed! We were a group of 7 and everyone enjoyed their dish. If there's a line outside don't worry it moves pretty fast.

Reviews.Author: Douglas W.
Reviews.Content: Please watch that you don't serve your oysters with too much mud.  I am not a fan of mud on my oysters and this is a good way to make your customers sick as well, by the way.  I really like the gumbo here and have always been a fan of the oyster poor boys but it's a bit of a tourist trap/scene so it's not my favorite place for this food.  Still, it's fun sometimes to stop in and if you don't mind the wait it's worth a trip.

Reviews.Author: Alexander L.
Reviews.Content: I went here for dinner. We ordered the chargrilled oysters, seafood gumbo, oyster rockefeller soup, fried fish platter, and fried shrimp platter. The chargrilled oysters was the best dish out of the ones we ordered. The oysters were very flavorful and covered in a tasty sauce. The oyster rockefeller soup was way too salty. The seafood gumbo tasted good. The fried fish was very thin and wasn't very crispy. The fried shrimp was good. The fries were a little too salty on both fried platters.This place gets very crowded. Be prepared to wait in a long line to get in. When you come here you have to order the chargrilled oysters.

Reviews.Author: Sylvia M.
Reviews.Content: Loved it! The oysters were really good. I sat at the bar and my shucker HOLLYWOOD made me a fresh plate of oysters right in front of me! He was very prompt to answer customer questions, wait lines, and place my order with the regular waitress. I would go back. I'm sure when that time comes, he won't remember me. That place is sooooooooo busy, long long long lines. They see plenty of people daily. But definitely a must stop for the thrills, chills, reputation, and good food & company :)

Reviews.Author: Norm And Andy Z.
Reviews.Content: We had come here the night before, but the line was so long and we desperately needed a bathroom. So we went down the street, which was a big mistake.This place is no-frills, and is more about "good old n'orleans and eating" which is fine by me. That's why I'm here. Ambiance is busy/humming and the service is adequate and/or "nice enough". They want you in & out because there's always a line. Barbequed oysters I liked. Dominique did not enjoy them as much but I thought they were good. The Parmesan in the sauce was interesting and I can see how this detracts from the flavor, so I'll cede that it may not be for everyone. I liked them, though.Jambalaya was incredibly fantastic. Get it, a bowl, maybe 2 bowls, not a cup.Soft shell crab platter was good. Not great but good. Fries were tasty. I know, it's odd to review the fries in a place like this but if they serve them, they better be good. They were. Got hush puppies with the meal and I thought they were decent. Dominique says they were the best she's had but she does not typically like them. So that's a vote for them.Coffee was good.If I went back I'd get a lot of jambalaya and 2 other things. I'm a fan but I don't think it's 5 star material. Though it is very good. Can't go wrong though the line can be really crazy at times. So you have to weigh the time commitment versus the payoff. Or just come for lunch and wait 5-10 minutes and be in & out in 30.Overall I'd give it a 3.5 but go with 3 because neither of us was yearning to go back.

Reviews.Author: Mike C.
Reviews.Content: Party of 7. Waited in line 30 mins, they seated 2 other same size parties before us. Then they seat us at a table for 8 , but they want one of us to sit at the end of the table (in the aisle) and they want to seat a party of 2 at our table. When to Felix's instead and had a great dinner !!

Reviews.Author: Kim P.
Reviews.Content: And I came back!I was really wanting those chargrilled oysters and they didn't disappoint! I also got the seafood etouffe with some fried crawfish tails on the side. I tried the bf's gumbo and didn't like it as much as the etouffe. Third time's a charm in NOLA and Acme Oyster House!

Reviews.Author: Tony S.
Reviews.Content: Not worth the wait, and I don't mean outside...  We waited 15-20 minutes at the bar for a dozen oysters on the half shell.  They were small, flavorless & below average.The place is totally mobbed with tourists and the quality has gone done since our last visit.By comparison, we then walked down to Desire Oysters, were served immediately and their oysters were awesome.Don't waste your time at Acme.

Reviews.Author: Sean D.
Reviews.Content: Excellent raw oysters, excellent po'boys, and excellent staff.  The place is a bit small and the lines tend to get long during lunch time.  Be sure to beat the rush to avoid the wait.

Reviews.Author: Bianka M.
Reviews.Content: Seafood Combo or a Shrimp and Oyster Po' Boy are the BEST of the BEST... Now Deenies and also my TOP in NEW ORLEANS but Acme is all I knew since 2002 when I first started flying to New Orleans for the Essence Music Festival in July.The place is small so there is ALWAYS a line, but it's WELL WORTH the wait so just get in line sip on your Hand Granade and wait.

Reviews.Author: Dan H.
Reviews.Content: The vibe here is quintessential New Orleans. Loud, bustling, a sensory overload with the bar and oyster shuckers on one side, and the open kitchen just a few yards away on the other. Great friendly service but all business. Most restos in NOLA know how to turn tables like no other city, but they usually do so with a smile and some humor. And of course with their awesome Louisiana accent. Love it! The charbroiled oysters were off the chart buttery-garlicky delish.The Chicken/Andouille Gumbo sorry to say, not so much. Way too salty, although some at the table said the seafood gumbo was fine. The fresh oysters were just OK, not the best I have ever had. Others at the table loved the fried fish combo, and the shrimp that I stole from one was very tasty, and not too greasy. The hush puppies were also little fried wonders of great flavors. Hot tip: we arrived to zero line 30 minutes before the 11:00 opening and repaired across the street to Jesters for breakfast beers. When we wandered back at 10:50 there were only 4 ppl in front of us. This was on a Friday morning, so this tip is most likely invalid on a Saturday or Sunday. I have been to Acme many times and have never had a long wait, so it's all about planning and timing. We had a party of 6, so arriving early was a must. If just 2 ppl you can usually gain access to the bar fairly quickly, which is where you can watch the talented shuckers.A never to be missed institution for me when in this wonderful city.

Reviews.Author: Elisha J.
Reviews.Content: I must stop here every time I visit NOLA. I'm usually impatient, but I don't mind the lines and I don't mind the tourists. Their chargrilled oysters full of garlicky, cheesy, buttery goodness washed down with an Abita could me by final meal and I would die happy.

Reviews.Author: Judy L.
Reviews.Content: Loved this place! Get the oysters! Fresh and chargrilled! They were so affordable, fresh, and delicious! The chargrilled ones were covered in delicious cheese. We'll dream about these goodies. Shrimp ettouffe was amazing as well. :)

Reviews.Author: Maya S.
Reviews.Content: Service + food is still worthy of 5 stars. Acme is worth the visit if you're in nola. Raw & Charbroiled Oysters: Both are still the best I've had in nola thus far. Fried Peace Maker Po Boy: Tasty fried shrimp and oyster sandwiched on a french roll. Beer: It's all about Abita. Don't forget to ask about the seasonal flavors. I had Purple Haze (raspberry) + Amber (classic smooth) + Satsuma (citrus [seasonal]) + Fall Fest (slightly spiced [seasonal]). All were delicious!

Reviews.Author: Nikki L.
Reviews.Content: I know this place is known for their Oysters, but since I don't eat that, I ordered my first poboy of the trip! I was really disappointed that the shrimps on my sandwich came out cold. I asked the server to send out a new one on the fly but that one wasn't any better. The shrimps were tiny and were breaded heavily, the bread was also on the stale side and the sandwich was an overall FAIL. However, I give them an extra star for service recovery, a Manager touched the table to apologized. Unless I wake up one day and decide I like Oysters, I won't be back.

Reviews.Author: Amy M.
Reviews.Content: Even though it is super touristy, it's definitely a must-go if you're in town (and if you're into oysters).  There is a line, but it goes fast if you have a small party with no preference of where to be seated, we did not wait for more than 10 minutes.  Highly recommend the raw and charbroiled oysters!!  We also got a cup of gumbo and red beans and rice. The gumbo was good, but the red beans and rice were just okay.  The staff was friendly and nice, and it was cool seeing the guy shucking oysters behind the bar :)

Reviews.Author: Jay W.
Reviews.Content: I'm not even a huge fan of oysters but the char grilled oysters at Acme will have me taking another 6 hour drive to the N.O and waiting in line! It's well worth it!

Reviews.Author: Cynthia M.
Reviews.Content: Definitely a great lunch in New Orleans! We got there early right before they opened and there wasn't too much of a line. We got seated right away and service was super friendly and quick. My husband and I shared the chargrilled oysters, shrimp/oyster po'boy, seafood etoufee with fried crawfish on the side, and a pecan pie a la mode. The chargrilled oysters were super delicious and it was my first time trying it in that preparation. Even my husband who is not an oyster fan enjoyed it. The sandwich and etouffe were very good but maybe just a hint too salty. I did have two super delicious bloody marys to wash it down with so I didn't mind at all. Finally the pecan pie with ice cream was divine. A wonderfully sweet finish to a great meal. My favorite meal of my 48 hours here for sure!

Reviews.Author: Marqus R.
Reviews.Content: It's a smallish place, definitely rather divey with sort of dark dingy bar joint feel about it as opposed to a bar/restaurant ambiance. So if you like things on the elegant side or don't like rubbing shoulders with tourists, this is not the place for you.What it is about and what it is totally about are oysters, basically raw or char grilled, and as far as they go, Acme is about the best place to find them. Yes, they also have Po Boys, andouille gumbo, crawfish tails, an etouffee in a roux, soft shells, jambalaya and other Cajun menu items but they aren't really what Acme is about or for that matter items in which they excel. As a tip, I'd suggest you visit Acme during off hours or at off times, otherwise it really gets crowded and your wait time can be a long one and your experience unpleasant.

Reviews.Author: Kay K.
Reviews.Content: I don't care if you are allergic to oysters. Pack your epipen and order the char grilled oysters!!!! Yes it's worth risking your life. Salty buttery magnificence! Make sure you slurp up the buttery cheesy juice with bread... seafood gumbo was also great. Crabcake meh. Pecan cobbler too sweet for me. Plus it's not a pie btw (nor does the menu claim it to be so...just a word of warning for pie crust lovers like myself).

Reviews.Author: Danielle O.
Reviews.Content: This place is one of the best places we went to eat while visiting New Orleans. I had been recommended to come here by a friend and after checking other reviews we decided to try it out.We went pretty late for dinner, around 9 or so and there was a bit of a line but we were on vacation and didn't mind the short wait. Once we were seated our waitress greeted us right away and got our drinks. When we were ready to order we asked our waitress what she suggested and let me tell you she did not steer us wrong. We started with the deep fried oysters, we ordered a dozen and honestly we could have eaten 2 dozen. They were delicious! We then got our dinner entrees, my son got the soft shell crab with a side of hush puppies, my daughter had the seafood gumbo, my husband had kind of platter with red beans and rice, gumbo and sausage and some other tasty things. I had the shrimp  creole which was fantastic.  We all tried each other's food. I honestly can't say who's was the best, they were all really really good. We ate way too much but it was so good it was hard to stop. All in all the service was friendly and efficient and food was all I hoped it would be.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan A.
Reviews.Content: This place is great! Came over here for lunch while on a business trip with some coworkers. I had the 1/2 fish po-boy and gumbo, both of which were great. We also split some boo fries (fries with gravy and cheese). My friends got the Fried Peace Maker Po-Boy, the Acme 10 Napkin Roast Beef, and the crabcakes, all of which I would recommend. Will definitely come here again next time I'm in New Orleans. I'll need to try the oysters next time.

Reviews.Author: J T.
Reviews.Content: Good food.

Reviews.Author: Erin T.
Reviews.Content: It's ok. I'm disappointed actually. Oysters are fresh that's the most important thing. Anything battered is not great. Batter is too thick.If I was basing New Orleans Cajun food on this place ... I would be sad. Oh so sad!On to the next one .Oyster bar is really friendly .

Reviews.Author: Van E.
Reviews.Content: There's much better food and service, plus a shorter wait and far cleaner restrooms across the street at Felix's.

Reviews.Author: Charles S.
Reviews.Content: Acme has the brand recognition and the tourists are lined up out front, but it sure seemed to this visitor to have the same menu as virtually every other oyster bar along the Gulf Coast from Apalachicola to Galveston.What it has that the others don't is people willing to wait in line for 45 minutes.  That plus Rhonda, the helpful waitress.

Reviews.Author: Michael C.
Reviews.Content: A bit disappointed given the high reviews. The char-grilled oysters were good but a bit too salty. The soft crab poboy was very dry and the hurricane was okay. The staff also made people wait outside even though there were empty tables inside (perhaps to create the appearance that they're busy?). Decent meal but nothing amazing.

Reviews.Author: David L.
Reviews.Content: I was down in New Orleans for the Super Bowl and looking for a good place to eat.  See a lot of recommendations for this place so I stopped by for a late dinner on my first night in New Orleans.The line wasn't too bad around 10pm and we were seated after 10 minutes. Now, I normally like my oysters raw. But I want to try something different so I ordered a dozen Chargrill oysters and craw puppies for appertizer.  The Oysters are super plumps and juicy.  The Best I ever had anywhere.  For entree, I ordered the Peacemaker PoBoy.  It's also amazingly good.  But next time when I'm back in town, I will just eat the Oysters all day. The place is loud though so you will need to talk loud.  But other than that, a great place to eat.

Reviews.Author: Felicia L.
Reviews.Content: Slurping down fresh oysters. Excellent! And we were digging the little piece of garlic from the charbroiled oysters. Yum!

Reviews.Author: Cain P.
Reviews.Content: Went to this place with the wife and a friend, had an awesome time. When we walked up there was a line down the street. A helpful tip is when waiting on line get a drink but you must finish it up first before you get in because you cant bring it in. We only waited on line for about fifteen minutes so it was great. I ordered a doz. oysters, fried crawfish tails, gumbo, and soft shell crab. The crab was amazing, a little too much batter for my liking, don't get me wrong still bomb!great place I give it 8 out of 10!

Reviews.Author: F S.
Reviews.Content: The chargrilled oysters are awesome. The order comes with a few slices of bread to soak up all the butter and oyster liquor. The corn and crab bisque (soup of the day) was serviceable, as were the hush puppies, the jambalaya, and the red beans n rice. It really is all about the oysters here. Worth the wait in line.

Reviews.Author: Ronald D.
Reviews.Content: Their Chargrilled Oysters and Boo Fries are incredible, the oysters are a must try and soaking up the garlic butter with the bread was also delicious. Our server, Morris, was amazing and the best in all of New Orleans so far. Service was fast and not bothersomrWe came at 1120am and there wasn't a long wait at all. Definitely stop by this place if you are here,  a little pricey but well worth it.

Reviews.Author: Chris E.
Reviews.Content: Wow.  Their chargrilled oysters were incrediable.  Went there on a Wednesday night and stood in line for 30 minutes around 8pm.  Let me tell you, it was worth it.  Ate somewhere different on Thursday and Friday, but came back again on Saturday nite and waited 45 minutes.  Same experience.  We had a party of 12 and in the end, they broke us up into two tables.  No problem, it was worth it.Can't wait till my next trip to The Big Easy.

Reviews.Author: Chris H.
Reviews.Content: Introduced to chargrilled oysters. Damn the do them right because we tried them elsewhere. Enough said.

Reviews.Author: Crystal K.
Reviews.Content: The line was crazy. We waited a good 30 minutes to get in. Once inside, it was crazy busy as well. I was glad I was not a server here. I don't know how they get the dishes to the tables without running into someone or something. The grilled oysters are so cheesy and greasy but so good. Tastes great with bread. The raw oysters were ok.

Reviews.Author: Lorie K.
Reviews.Content: OMG!! Finally!!! My taste buds have been enticed!! Wont make it long cuz its pretty simple on what to order here: anything and everything~ !I must say that you must get:- CHARGRILLED OYSTERS!!  just get the dozen if your contemplating the half....Just trust me, you wont regret it! -Po boy Sandwiches: any type, they are all good. I did notice that people go the soft shell crab tho! We got the fried catfish and shrimp combo, super Delish.  Dont forget the tarter sauce and hot sauce, makes a world of difference in flavor! Adds the extra kick! - Gumbo, Red beans and rice, jambalaya platter.....super choice when you dont know what you want! The red beans and rice was so good. who knew a simple dish was so flavorful? The jambalaya was bursting with flavor as well! - Price: $$ very well priced and economical.  I would come here all the time if I could! For the two of us it came out to like give and take $40. LK

Reviews.Author: Lee O.
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately as over hyped as it gets!  Aside from the great chargrilled oysters and the oyster shooters, this place fell short in everything else. I had the crawfish po boy and the jambalaya. Mediocre at best. You can find better just outside and don't have to wait in the 45 minute line just to get in.

Reviews.Author: david W.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic po' boy and red beans and rice. Avoid the line. Drink here all day. Great meal. I stop every visit.

Reviews.Author: Justin R.
Reviews.Content: Adam Richman of Man vs. Food was the reason I had to come here. No, while tempting I did not do the oyster challenge. I did however thoroughly enjoyed my visit. The oysters weren't good, they were great. Huge, fresh, succulent, everything you could ask for. It was a toss up between the raw & chargrilled. Both were too yummy to decide.  We also ordered the softshell crab, which was a bit salty but not bad, as well as the seafood sampler (hard to mess up fried food!). I also couldn't go to New Orleans and not try a Po; boy. While they are everywhere I wouldn't say they have the best or the worst. I ordered the Peacemaker which is a fried oyster and fried shrimp po boy. The bread was nice and fluffy and the seafood was good, but I would've like it to be a bit more crispy and they skimped on the shrimp.All in all great dinning experience with a a friendly staff that really takes care of their guests.

Reviews.Author: Tamara K.
Reviews.Content: Can't go to New Orleans without hitting Acme...chargrilled oyster pleaseeeeee!

Reviews.Author: Jelena Z.
Reviews.Content: If ever there was an institution that's magically equal parts tourist magnet and legitimately awesome, then Acme is it. To echo the very wise wordsmith Peter D: I fucking love this place. I've been coming here since 2000 and not too much has changed - you can always expect a wait, but typically it isn't too bad if you come alone and request a seat at the bar. And, it's worth noting that the bar is THE place to sit - not only does your bar stool perch offer a prime viewing opportunity of oyster-shucking, but you get to talk with the good folks behind the bar. They've stories a-plenty between them if you're up for some real talk, local-style!As you'll read in just about every review, you MUST try (err, inhale) the chargrilled oysters. They're topped decadently with cheese and served in a bed of garlic butter sauce and kissed with just the right amount of smokiness. French bread is at the ready to sop up the juices of this adventure in culinary hedonism that you may just want to ride again... so, do yourself a favor and order the full dozen from the get-go!I've also had the shrimp po-boy, which is truly overstuffed with loads of golden shrimp, seasoned to perfection and served with Tabasco mayo (optional, but I say this is mandatory).Two hours of oysters, terrific bloody marys and an Abita Purple Haze will leave you pondering, what else could you possibly want in life? Absolutely nothing; it really all is right here.

Reviews.Author: David I.
Reviews.Content: This place is terrific. The staff is very friendly, the wait was short (even though the line was down the street) and the food was great!! The seafood Ettoufeé was amazing, perfect amount of flavor and a small is perfect size if you're going out afterwards. My friends got the seafood gumbo, they said it was great. My buddy spilled it on himself mid eat and still didn't care, that's how much he enjoyed it. Grab an order of Boo fries to start with and you'll be good to go.

Reviews.Author: Margi T.
Reviews.Content: Epic line. 45 minute wait.Mean waitress. I believe unfriendly is part of the employee training program.No kids menu/options.One vegetarian item - $6 from the freezer GardenBurger.Worst. Hushpuppies. Ever.Complete tourist trap.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer S.
Reviews.Content: Fresh fresh big oysters from the gulf near byThis is a must go to place for oyster lovers!The wait is about 30-40 min but it is worth it Both chargrilled & raw oysters were good but I preferred the raw onesSoft shell crab po boy was yummy; they actually give you a whole crab in the po boy

Reviews.Author: Adam D.
Reviews.Content: Went here on a Monday night for dinner around 8:30 and the line was out the door.  Even though it was a holiday, I was told most nights there is a line.  Not sure if the same is true at their 4 or 5 other locations in Louisiana, but being that this location is in the French Quarter, I'm not surprised there is a wait.  At any rate, we didn't wait very long.  Someone came out and took down our name and we probably sat down sometime between 8:45 and 9:00.The baked oysters were awesome. They're topped with butter, parmesan cheese and something else I wasn't able to identify, but you could make a meal out of these.  I shared some as an appetizer and then moved onto the combo speciality, which entailed your choice of chicken or seafood sausage, gumbo, red beans and rice and jambalaya.  I recommend the platter if you want to try a bit of everything.  The portions weren't huge, but the price was right: $11.  There's also an extensive po-boy option.Overall, the staff could be a little friendlier, but the atmosphere is casual, the food is good, and the prices are very reasonable.  A place I'd like to go again ...

Reviews.Author: J C.
Reviews.Content: Great good. Great price. Chicken andouille gumbo is pretty much the best gumbo you can find and ACMR nailed it.   Go for the Poopa (breadbowl) for us northerners.

Reviews.Author: Aileen B.
Reviews.Content: BEST OYSTERS ever. We waited on a Friday night in line for about 2 hours...which was ridiculous. But then when we had the food, it was AMAZING!!! Plan on drinking in line. Also stop by during the day when it's less busy to see if there's a way to by pass the line. We saw lots of people get in right away without waiting because they had a red ACME card.(If you don't want the crazy long wait, DRAGOS in Hilton Hotel, has amazing chargrilled oysters as well...less known to the tourists & more a local place so the wait is way less).

Reviews.Author: Jennifer F.
Reviews.Content: The chargrilled oysters are delicious! We waited in line and were not disappointed. My friends and I loved them so much that we went back again the following day!

Reviews.Author: Nick S.
Reviews.Content: Delicious oysters, nothing else all that special though. The gumbo tasted very lemony, though, which I didn't like.

Reviews.Author: Brad K.
Reviews.Content: This place was Busy!  As we arrived the restaurant was packed, but we got a seat at the bar straight away.  The service was OK.  Direct, but definitely not cheerful, just a "hi, whattya want" type thing.  Food came came out very quickly.  The Jambayla wasn't the best that I've had before, and the portion was a little small, but my friend raved about her oysters, but thats what they are supposedly known for.Give the place a visit if you love oysters, but otherwise there are better local flare restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Author: Michelle C.
Reviews.Content: We went twice in a weekend.  First, the lines would normally cause me to reject the place but 2 ppl on a first available table made the wait about 15 minutes - yay!  Second, we were advised to go to Felix's across the street but Acme was so good we said, bump that.  Third, Ms. Deborah, at the bar, made this a 6 star restaurant rating.  Awesome personality and customer service.  Ask for her.Now for the food.  Ms. Deborah suggested the Patron margarita when I told her that I wanted sweet and strong.  Now that doesn't sound right, right?  Well she said that I should drink a grown woman's drink that was good and smooth.  I took a sip waiting for that tequila tangy twinge at the back of my neck and... YUM!  Great drink!  Try it!She also recommended the fried oyster and shrimp po'boy (Peacemaker) and it was SO good!  I had the gumbo too.  It was good.  Then came the main dish, chargrilled oysters... OH man!  They were so good we ordered another half dozen.  The next day we daydreamed about the oysters.  We decided one more visit before we leave would be good.  We ordered the po'boys again and this time ate 3 dozen.  Oh my!  SO good.  The people were awesome, the oysters were delish (though they did take long - we learned to order the 2nd dozen right as the first were arriving and they were on time).  I would come here again and again.  Poor oysters, at the rate they were being sucked down, how on earth do they avoid extinction?

Reviews.Author: Tammy R.
Reviews.Content: We walked over here from our hotel one evening after researching local oyster places and luckily arrived there with only a few parties ahead of us in the line outside the front door, so we were seated within 5 minutes. We were so happy with our luck as I'd heard that the wait in line to get in this place can get crazy. We had nice, fast and friendly hospitality here, and the environment was very casual and relaxed. Ordered a dozen of the famously delicious Char-grilled Oysters, served perfectly piping hot. Was our first time having this dish and my hubby and I are true fans now. We also had Boo fries. :) French fries covered in gravy and cheese: what's not to love?? I also had a cup of that seafood gumbo. Loved it all! WE miss ACME Oyster House and New Orleans and can't wait to visit again. Recommended!!!

Reviews.Author: Shu Z.
Reviews.Content: The Charbroiled oysters are the same level as the Drago's, but the atmosphere of this place in the quarter should be something every tourist and native should experience. Not only are the oysters an attraction, just about every single New Orleans favorite can be found here.

Reviews.Author: Gary R.
Reviews.Content: One of our first stops in New Orleans. Fresh oysters, dirty fries and roast beef. Plenty of Abita Amber and anything else you want. Noisy or energetic your choice of how you look at it. A New Orleans staple and if you are into fresh seafood and local food favorites.

Reviews.Author: Benjamin R.
Reviews.Content: Acme is a tradition when visiting NOLA.  Although the char-grilled oysters are defiantly last meal good, the raw oysters are absolutely the best I have ever had.  Frankly, it is called the oyster house for a reason.  If oysters are not your thing, don't come here.  This is five star oyster goodness at its best.  The only other dish here that is worth mentioning, is their fried soft shell crab.  I love soft shell crab, especially fried, and they have the most fresh, jucy, and delicious crabs in NOLA.  Paired with their extra spicy cocktail sauce...amazing.We love raw oysters and order them at a number of different places.  Honestly, none come close to these.  It is hard to explain.  You have to try them for yourself to understand.Make sure to arrive early, say 6:30 or before, if you want a seat within 30 minutes.

Reviews.Author: Katie M.
Reviews.Content: My friends and I visited New Orleans for three days, and two of those we went to Acme for dinner. We split an order of a dozen chargrilled oysters and I got the seafood etouffe. The food was spectacular!  The prices are a bit above average, with my small etouffe being $8.99, but it's worth every penny! The first night we waited 10 minutes for a table, and the next night we waited 40 minutes, both were for a table of five. On the list of places to visit in New Orleans, Acme is now right up on my list with Cafe du Monde!

Reviews.Author: Uriia H.
Reviews.Content: Well we all know Acme is like a New Orleans institution.  The chargrilled oysters are a must if you decide to visit.  You can't go wrong with the 1/2 and 1/2.  I just had the half oyster poyboy and cup of seafood gumbo.  I have to be honest when I say that Acme has a pretty good damn gumbo.  I find this hard to come by in a city deemed the "Melting Pot" of the South. Anywho, ice cold beer on tap and oysters. What else do you need in life?

Reviews.Author: Jenn C.
Reviews.Content: Best oysters (chargrilled with parmesan and buttery goodness) I have ever had and the bar counter patrons and Stormin' Norman, the master shucker, were awesome to chat with. They offered up suggestions of things to do in NOLA and even offered me a date :) I was seated quickly (you get in line and wait to be called in) and everyone called me sweetheart. For a Northwesterner that's a nice treat.If you're in NOLA, check it out.

Reviews.Author: Halle E.
Reviews.Content: Line took over 45 min to get in; had equally good meals at The newly reopened Oyster Factory and at Deannie's, both around the corner.  Excellent oysters and fried shrimp, food really good; quarters incredibly cramped and the place fully packed all the time makes for a very specific atmosphere.  Come here to say you did, but it wasn't better than the others mentioned, just exactly as good and a LOT more crowded.

Reviews.Author: David P.
Reviews.Content: Got into New Orleans late yesterday and headed straight over to Acme Oyster House.  I remember having a very good experience here, on my last visit to New Orleans.  My girlfriend and I got a seat at the oyster bar after about a 20 minute wait, not bad...  We started with a hurricane and a dozen chargrilled oysters, yummy!  We then had another dozen ice oysters with extra horseradish; you have to ask for the extra horseradish, it really makes all the difference.  The oysters were really fresh, but the service was a little slow.  Ms. D took care of us, since we were sitting right by the register, very nice lady.  She gave us some good suggestions for music and other things to do while in town.  I was a little disappointed from my last visit, two years ago, as the prices were much higher.  I also thought that the drinks were pretty watered down.  I'm giving this place 4 stars, as the oysters are very fresh and tasty.  I also appreciated Ms. D, who was a sweetheart.  It's a must visit if in New Orleans, but there are many other great foodie places to visit.

Reviews.Author: Laney P.
Reviews.Content: I guess it's nice for tourists, but as a local, there are SO SO many other places I'd want to go. This place has no character, no story. It's just... seafood (and mediocre at that).The char-grilled oysters here are noooot good. My po boy wasn't made with love. There was a pathetic amount of shrimp on it.

Reviews.Author: Ninette B.
Reviews.Content: If I could go back and redo my dining experience here, I would not order anything else but the chargrilled oysters. ahhhhhh!! So good! So I'm sitting at a bar in Belize, and this girl and I are talking. We get to talking about our love of seafood, and she goes "man. The best oysters I've had were in New Orleans." I say oh? Do tell.... She says they were chargrilled. And I scream (thank you beer) and we point at each other and say "ACME!!" Funny that 5 days after experiencing these heavenly chargrilled oysters, someone else is dreaming about them :)SKIP THE MEALS. Get the chargrilled oysters! 9 dozen of them!

Reviews.Author: Mary D.
Reviews.Content: The chargrilled oysters were amazing! The line out the door was scary but it moved quickly.

Reviews.Author: Judy J.
Reviews.Content: BEST OYSTERS and the most fresh oyster are in the house when you go to acme oyster house. I have been to Boston to eat oysters and I live in California, but this little place in New Orleans, LA, has one of my TOP Favorite place to go to for Oysters. I had 2 dozens of those grilled oysters, that's how good it was, and a dozen of those fresh oysters. All of them were BIG and JUICY. We also ordered the fried crawfish tail, but it didn't taste that great,  Just go there for the oysters....they are so worth your money. The bartender was one of the best service we've got. I wasn't sure what beer I wanted to get to go along with my oysters, he gave me samplers. Then I decided to get the purple haze, which was almost like a girl's kind of beer, not bitter, and not that strong. The bartender was really entertaining and very helpful.  Eventhough the place was so packed with people and very busy, he still gets to take care every customers on his watch.The wait is a loooongggg line. But the wait isn't long, if you're a party of 2 and willing to sit either bar or table. GREAT GREAT OYSTER....worth the wait. I would go there and eat 3 dozens of oysters again. Even until now, I would still think about how good their oysters are.

Reviews.Author: jeff o.
Reviews.Content: Simple, delicious, reliable food and good service in the tourist trap area of the French Quarter. Worth the wait and the line usually moves fast. And despite dealing with some pretty rude tourists at time, the place is well run and friendly. When a friend and I had to wait longer than they'd promised for a table, they gave us a free pitcher of beer in apology. A simple, inexpensive gesture that will ensure we come back next time we're in town.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie K.
Reviews.Content: Sorry, ACME...I think this placed was so overhyped in my head, so it ended up being a letdown. :( The wait actually wasn't bad (20 min), but we went on a Sunday night at 8pm.We ended up sitting at the bar, and our shucker basically paid no attention to us for the first half of the meal. He kept forgetting to put some of our orders into the kitchen and bar. I might just be a hater, but they all shuck pretty slowly. I've seen it done much quicker at Captain Tom's, waddup Houston. Charbroiled oysters - HUGE freaking oysters. Biggest I've ever seen. Sooo salty though with all the cheese and shizFried peacemaker poboy - meh, I've had better. The tabasco mayo was interesting, though.Crawfish etouffee - oooomg this was the best thing I had there. The bf kept saying it was too buttery, but I loved it!!! Been watching too much Paula Deen.I guess this is just one of those things you have to try in NOLA, but I'd probably skip out on it if I ever return..

Reviews.Author: Jo F.
Reviews.Content: I was in NOLA for an annual conference and again, Acme was on our foodie list.  We tried getting in last year, but of course, the line was down the block and we ended up eating at Deanie's - which was quite good.  This time we got to Acme on a Friday around 1:00p and there were no more than 20 people in line - great!  The hostess was cordial and seated us after 15 minutes.  Walking into Acme is a feast for your nose.  All sorts of creole smells and if you are seated past where they do the charbroil, it makes you ravenous.  Ordering was a no-brainer - charbroiled oysters, but also a shrimp po-boy, gumbo, red beans and rice and fried catfish made it to the table.  I've had charbroiled oysters at Deanies and they were quite good.  But Acme is, by correct reputation, better.  They bring you half-shelled goodies still sizzling and smoking from the broiler.  Quite a bit charred that the smoke almost takes your breath away.  I really should have gotten the dozen.  They were delish.Fortunately:  I will not return to NOLA for this conference.  Not a place I would choose to come voluntarily.Unfortunately:  I won't have the char-broiled oysters from Acme.  Most of the food in this city is outstanding.

Reviews.Author: Rick V.
Reviews.Content: Overrated...the long line is not worth the wait when you have Felix's across the street.  Started off with the char-grilled oysters...they we OK, not great...the romano cheese was over powering and took away from the taste of the oysters.  Next was the chicken & sausage gumbo...too salty.  Next was the shrimp & oyster PO-Boy...now this was excellent and would go back for this again as long as their is no line.  Finished with the pecan cobbler...good, but not what I was expecting...usually cobbler has some type of crust...this was just a gooey praline/pecan pie filling with an ice cream ball.

Reviews.Author: Dora S.
Reviews.Content: Oysters are to die for! The atmosphere is warming and unassuming. Service is efficient and friendly. All the appetizers were amazing. Especially the crawfish tail

Reviews.Author: Andrea P.
Reviews.Content: I don't even like oysters but holy moly the chargrilled oysters are absolutely delicious and I'm dying to get back to NOLA so I can have some more. Also, the fried fish is complete perfection!!

Reviews.Author: Anthony J.
Reviews.Content: Has kind of a 50's diner feel to it, which is pretty unique in the French Quarter.We started with the char-broiled oysters, which were awesome.  My wife had the fried soft shell crab, which was full of meat and although it was more fried than what we're used to, it melted in your mouth and was probably one of the best I've had in a while.  I had the 10-napkin roast beef po boy, which was just ok....kind of salty and the "roast beef" was more like pot roast.  And I only needed 5 napkins.  The bloody mary was kind of weak and came in a small plastic cup.Cool place, but not sure it's worthy of the line that's always waiting outside.

Reviews.Author: Serious C.
Reviews.Content: There was a line getting into Acme Oyster House like it was a club. The hostess was super nice and pleasant. She made the wait easier.So, Acme Oyster House has a 15 dozen raw oyster challenge and initially, I got sick of the thought of 15 dozen oysters.. It's too many, I thought. And after I went, I got tough like I coulda woulda shoulda. I wished I had tried. If you don't finish it in the allotted time, you pay. If you do, you get your name on the wall and that 15 dozen is free.If the challenge interests you at all--- DO IT!Now in the restaurant, there's table seating or the oyster bar.. With a long line outside, you get what's available and we got a table. Our server pointed out a few things on the menu and that they're famous for their Chargrilled Oysters. Yeah, the Chargrilled Oysters are sooooo fantastic. Boo Fries and Bread Pudding with Ice Cream are also recommendable..Worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Julie C.
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to lie.  After a long day at the zoo with a kiddie and an even longer more convoluted walk to streetcar-to bus-to-shuttle trek over, I was starving and a wee bit cranky.  When I saw the line at Acme I was like...seriously? We have to wait in this? There's no other place to go? Well...thank goodness for my stubborn cousin who was like, yes, we're waiting and thank goodness for patience because it was yum yum yummy.  Line is well organized and moves fast.  Definitely pays to be a party of two.  Okay. On to what really matters. Food. Um the chargrilled oysters?  I die. Like literally. I wanted to scrape off all that buttery goodness with my teeth and clean the plate with my bread.  This was some good good stuff y'all.  I've had other chargrilled oysters and was simply not a fan...but this changed everything. Super delicious.  I got an oyster poboy and was in love with that too...oysters fried up perfectly, with such a light coating of batter that the oyster-y goodness still shone through.  Perfect bread, right amount of dressed components...ah, perfection.  I would gladly wait again.  Other people dining with me were equally as pleased with their meals; and the crab and corn bisque was a surprise hit as well. For me, the prices were average, maybe a wee but high for the poboy, but the heavenly non greasy light battered fry made it all worth it.  People mumble tourist trap etc...but trap me here any day.

Reviews.Author: Alison B.
Reviews.Content: GET THE CHARGRILLED OYSTERS. Soooo good. Definitely best oysters I've ever had. Everything else was great as well... I got the Jambalaya and tried a bit of my mom's New Orleans Medley.  I also appreciated how even though our party was there for more than 2 hours catching up (don't worry, we kept the beer and food coming), they didn't try to rush us at all. Service was good... attentive enough, but not overbearing. Definitely recommended, especially for visitors. They offer a good variety of New Orleans style cuisine that tourists would want to try, and the food is delicious.

Reviews.Author: Yellow S.
Reviews.Content: I like this place, but not enough to stand in line more than 10 min.  I love the oysters here. I also like desire oyster bar.

Reviews.Author: Brandon M.
Reviews.Content: Came for the gumbo, it was ok, a little shallow bowl, real wimpy like, but the grilled oysters was a big hit. Luckily my relatives can cook gumbo and red beans and rice. Their line system sucks, we came early, someone said wait outside in the cold and another person came out less than 15 seconds later says to go to the back where the tables were.When we left, lots of people waiting in the cold, like the woman in the wheel chair with a tube running to her nose. Get ready to wait outside is all I'm saying.

Reviews.Author: Patrick S.
Reviews.Content: Great oyster place in the French Quarter.  Can't speak to anything other than the oysters but both the fresh and the charbroiled ones are so good can't even think to try anything else.  Oysters are just fresh and has a beautiful brine-y flavor.  These are shucked well, no bits of shell inside, which I've found in other places.

Reviews.Author: Jon C.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled oysters are amazing...  Jambalaya, red beans and rice were incredible as well.   Attentive staff and prompt service, dont be dismayed by the line, its well worth it.

Reviews.Author: Remahn F.
Reviews.Content: Definitely think the charbroiled oysters here are better than Drago's. The overall food isn't though.  I think they lack a bit in the po' boy area.  A lil stingy on the shrimp, etc. compared to any of your generous neighborhood po' boy spots. Visitors probably will never know that lil' tidbit. They do create a nice atmosphere to take watch sporting events, and I must say, hush puppies...mmmm. They do a perfect job in that area,Char broiled oysters, a big blue moon in a frosted stein, and hush puppies...can't go wrong here.Lastly, one thing that saddened me is, they don't allow you to order charbroiled oysters to go.  I was devastated to find that out, but they still deliver on taste and quality.

Reviews.Author: Lydia W.
Reviews.Content: Stick to the raw or chargrilled oysters. They're worth the rave. Everything else was par or sub par fare that you can get anywhere. We sampled their corn/crab soup, gumbo, étouffée, jambalaya, boo fries and fried crawfish. Everything except the oysters were forgettable. Don't expect attentive service since turning tables over quickly to accommodate the long waiting lines is a priority.

Reviews.Author: Peter D.
Reviews.Content: I fucking love this place. Please excuse the profanity, it's just so damn good. Unfortunately, everyone knows it. Everyone and their fat, oyster-virgin, absurdly-stupid-question-asking brother knows it. So you're going to have to wait. But it's worth it. And the good thing about a place that is always packed is that you know these little suckers aren't sitting in a walk-in for days. They are harvested in the Gulf, thrown in a sack, and brought directly to the shuckers in the front who are funny, engaging, and will quickly get you the freshest, plumpest, most delicious oysters you've ever had.If you're scared of the raw (and even if you're not), you should get at least a half-dozen of the char-grilled.
