They were flavored with seasonings and had some cheese melted onto the shells. This I would recommend, probably the dozen or so. But I believe that oysters are better eaten raw. The New Orleans Medley was what you expect in New Orleans. It had the gumbo and jambalaya, as well as beans and a sausage. All 3 of us sampled into each portion. The seafood gumbo was decent. Really watery, which I was told that is not how real gumbo should be (someone please clarify for me). The jambalaya was really good. It was well prepared and is what you would expect as jambalaya. The Acme "10 Napkin Roast Beef" po-boy sandwich is fairly large, so be careful. We all divvied it up and their responses were "This is really good" and "Soft and tender". I would have to agree with them. This was my main course, as I do not eat raw oysters, so a portion of that was allocated to the remaining two. Overall, I would recommend this place. One would have to either get here during off hours to miss the line, or just request for the bar seats. Either way, a good place to eat in New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: Andrew C.
Reviews.Content: Visit Date: 03.07.2011A friend recommended this restaurant as the best place to get chargrilled/charbroiled oysters, and the oysters didn't disappoint. That being said though, these weren't the best oysters in New Orleans, as there's a more well known place that serves larger oysters for a better price, which I won't namedrop. Acme's chargrilled oysters were tasty, with the butter sauce oozing out, but rather tiny, and thus not very filling. Didn't get a chance to order anything else off the menu, so next time I have to try something else. I did sample the local Abita beer, which wasn't bad.

Reviews.Author: Carina L.
Reviews.Content: Fresh Oysters- SOoo FRESH!! Ops did I just squirt some juices onto my LV bag? Nevermind.. keep on munching..Chargrilled oysters- Bubbling, sizzling as it was served before me..Ahh love those buttery cheese bits.. Ohh was it a Goal on that Sports TV in front of me? I DON'T care.. keep on savoring..Crispy Crab Po' Boy- Oh my.. why didn't they serve this in Cali?? How about some ketchup for my french fries? Darn I don't have hands for it, there's no way I'll drop my Po Boy.. keep on eating! Pecan Cobble- Such creamy, caramelly, nutty goodness.. loving the sweet ending to my most unforgettable meal in NOLA!

Reviews.Author: Jared S.
Reviews.Content: I was staying in the Sheraton on Canal for a business conference and this was just a short walk away.  Thank god!I tried to go for dinner on my first night in town but there was literally a line around the block.  Screw that.  So I took the suggestions of other yelpers and went for lunch the next day.  At a little after noon, the place was still on the crowded side, but I was able to get a seat at the raw bar right away.  (When I left a little before 1:00, there was already a 20 minute wait for a table)DAMN THESE ARE GOOD OYSTERS!  I lived in the Northeast most of my life, NYC and Boston, and we get some pretty good oysters up there.  But these Gulf oysters blew them out of the water (no pun intended).  Gigantic and supple (did I just use that to describe food?) and flavorful. . .almost sweet.  AND SO CHEAP!  I tasted one plain, and it was so good at first I didn't want to taint them with lemon or cocktail sauce.  But they were even better dressed!Now I have to TOTALLY disagree with Eddy C.  Based on his review, I ordered a half dozen raw and a half dozen chargrilled.  Don't get me wrong, I loved the chargrilled oysters - hell, I'll eat anything drowned in butter and garlic and breadcrumbs - but it really does a disservice to these wonderful oysters.  Masks all their wonderful flavor.  Perhaps more earthy tasting oysters would be good with this kind of preparation, but I wish I had just stuck with a dozen raw.  If you really like oysters, there's no other way to get them.Anyway, since this place was around the corner from my conference, I decided to come back for lunch again the next day!  This time I got the dozen, and a side of red beans and rice which was also really good.  The two guys shucking oysters (the same both times) were really friendly and we chatted a bunch.  The second time, we were talking about the NBA playoffs and I mentioned how I was rooting for the Hornets to beat the Spurs, and he threw me another oyster!

Reviews.Author: Alan S.
Reviews.Content: I make a traditional visit to Acme for raw oyster's and red beans and rice every time I visit New Orleans.  It's fairly inexpensive and I've always had fairly good service.  If you're in New Orleans and looking for oysters, Acme is the place to go.

Reviews.Author: Lori W.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled oysters...AMAZING!!!The best bloody mary and the most amazing grilled oysters, EVER.  Loved the fried oysters, catfish and SS crab.  Waitress just "got" it and totally anticipated our needs.  Totally worth the wait!!!

Reviews.Author: Erica C.
Reviews.Content: We waited a freaking hour to get into this place (probably because of our party of 10). Once we got seated, we ordered 2 charred grilled oysters for the table. The first bite was fantastic but as I got to my third oyster, I realized I had to squeeze some lemon on it because it started to taste bland. Some of the oysters were unfortunately the size of a dime. ***Fist Shake***I had the Medley Dish which contained the gumbo, red rice and beans, jambalaya, and sausage. If I had gotten each dish alone, my tongue would have probably rolled over and fallen asleep. I have to say though, it wasn't terrible but I don't know if it represented the taste of New Orleans. If it did, I wouldn't say it was too exciting. Overall, I thought this place was a tad overrated. I should have just gotten drinks and ran along and screamed obscenities with the drunkies on Bourbon Street. Probably would have even flashed for beads but then I'd be writing this behind BARS... teehee... i crack myself up.

Reviews.Author: Phil H.
Reviews.Content: Excellent food and service! Had the grilled oysters and seafood po-boy. As my first food experience in New Orleans, I loved it. There was a small line-up around 5pm when we went. Not giving the full 5 stars because of price and the fact that Acme's not heads-over-heels better than some of the other joints we tried in NO. Nevertheless, its a can't miss!

Reviews.Author: Kelly S.
Reviews.Content: Holy cow.  The only other time I have ever had oysters as good as these was when I was in a different country!What do you go here for?  Shrimp?  Perhaps.  Jumbo?  Maybe.  Po-boy? No.You go to Acme Oyster House for it's (Chargrilled) OYSTERS, plain and simple.  I stayed in New Orleans for about a week, pretty much dissatisfied with my food until I stepped into this place.  Sure, there's a ridiculously long wait but with good company and nearby sites, the time will pass by quickly.  The waiters are fun - jumping into our pictures when we were at the front of the line.  The tourist friendly atmosphere reminded me of a grown up's version of applebees.But back to my original point, the oysters are the stars of this place.  Not under or over cooked, each one I had was like butter in my mouth.  The garlic and butter was just right and I could taste every bit of this dish's deliciousness.  As a side dish, the hush puppies are pretty good and the jambalaya isn't too bad either.Summary: Wait a while, order the oysters and enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Jenny L.
Reviews.Content: I love this place!! I was in NOLA for a conference and I managed to eat here 3 times in the 4 days that I was there. That good.So they say there's a "line" to get in, but when we went for lunch (one of the three times) we got there right before it opened and there were only a few people ahead of us. It did get filled up fairly quickly though. But I never experienced that long of a wait - even if there is, STICK WITH IT, it's worth it!!I had the jambalaya as a side to my fried seafood platter and it was yuuuummmmy. But you HAVE TO GET THE CHARBROILED OYSTERS. It is the best thing ever invented. So delicious. I could eat 4 plates of those things. I also had the po'boy sandwich and that too was delicious. You can't really go wrong here. Everything is delicious.Oh, ACME, how I miss you.

Reviews.Author: Tee J.
Reviews.Content: Acme is just a half block off Bourbon Street and it's close to Canal. It's all about great raw oysters, chargrilled oysters, po boys, gumbo and fried seafood.  They don't take reservations and the line can get long but it moves fast and it's worth the wait because they have the freshest oysters anywhere!  I've spent a few afternoons sitting at the bar where they shuck the oysters. The guys are friendly and will tell you everything you wanted to know about oysters, Acme and New Orleans. I suggest coming here to have a few Turbo Dogs (Abita Beer) along with  some great food before you start out on a night in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Author: Jabari R.
Reviews.Content: My first meal in the French Quarter and it was excellent. First of all when we got there, there was no line we walked right in a got seated right by a window which I loved. My waiter Bill I think was awesome. we ordered up some hurricanes and a sampler platter. DAAAAAAAAMN the red beans and rice were good, the Jambalaya was good, the Gumbo was good, one of the top 2 on my whole trip (I sampled the gumbo at every place I went)  I also had my entree which was a combo Po-Boy with oysters and shrimp it was excellent very fresh the shrimp popped in your mouth and the spice and seasoning were right on. By the time we left  after a few more Hurricanes and a long Island we go out side and the line is around the corner......NICE!!!

Reviews.Author: Jason B.
Reviews.Content: Had to wait in the line, but you get what you wait for. Chargrilled oysters are as good as I have ever had. Service is great.  This is the place. You can't go wrong. I loved the jambalaya. Bread pudding was very good. A little different topped in chocolate.

Reviews.Author: Greg D.
Reviews.Content: 4.5 would probably be a more fitting rating. Char-grilled oysters are the way to go, honestly don't even get the regular ones. The grilled ones were definitely top 5 in terms of things I ate in NOLA on my trip.

Reviews.Author: Stephen W.
Reviews.Content: We've been here several times, but this time (October 2012) for some reason it finally hit me that: (1) the place is really overpriced; and (2) the service is inconsistent to the point that it overshadows the food. We had lunch here on a Sunday, and of course there was a line. If you are a tourist this is the place you have to try, and everyone does. And their oysters are really good, especially the chargrilled. I had the "peacemaker" sandwich, kind of a po' boy with fried shrimp, oysters, and chipotle mayo. It was really good, but at $13.49 it was overpriced. The wife got the fried oyster platter--at $20 it better be friggin' phenomenal. All I can say is lots and lots of carbs are congregating on that plate. It was good but priced too high. Our service was lackluster at best. A party of two and a party of three were seated after us and placed their order after us, but got their food a good 10 minutes before us. We sat for a really, really long time while everyone around us, even a party of 10, was served. Finally, our food arrives, described above. Waitress asks if I want another beer and I say no. Five minutes later another beer arrives and I say "I did not order that." She looks confused, looks around, then takes it away. I wonder what she did with that draft beer. I finally get the bill and give her my credit card. She kind of trips over my chair and the wife sees her drop my credit card on the floor. The waitress did not see it. I give it to her a second time and told her she dropped it. "Oh." If the wife had not seen it drop I don't know what would have happened, maybe someone would be having a good time with my card right now.

Reviews.Author: Steve V.
Reviews.Content: Came here in the middle of a Sunday when the Saints were in town and was able to be seated immediately. We had a stroller and the staff went out of their way to find us the perfect able and fast! There were plenty of TVs to watch the game and the service was great.We had the crawfish (which come fried) PoBoy and hush puppies. It was excellent! The portions were decent size and it came out very quickly. We were actually in a bit of a hurry so this worked out well. We got the check and was in and out in about 45 minutes.

Reviews.Author: Amiee L.
Reviews.Content: GREAT Oysters on the half shell....I liked the grilled way too and it was the first time I ate it that way.It was busy when we got there so be prepared to stand in line for a table but it's worth it!Oh Abita on tap and that's the best!

Reviews.Author: Vern G.
Reviews.Content: Seriously, what's not to love?Acme is an institution in New Orleans, and for great reason.I always have the red beans and rice, because they do such a great job.I have been to Acme at least 5 times with groups as large as 37 people. While it is QUITE crowded, and the seating is never all together, the staff has always been very gracious about the size of our group.Expect to wait in line to get in, just because. It's worth it.Order anything, but always order the oysters. Fantastic!If you go to New Orleans, and you don't go to Acme, you didn't see New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: Sandy N.
Reviews.Content: I had to check this place out and see what the hype was about.  There was a long line but luckily I didn't have to wait long since the lady called us out of line and seated us right away.I ordered the charbroiled oysters - good but kinda heavy.  I'm not much of an oyster gal so I didn't order the raw oysters. I should've but they wouldn't let me order just one piece.Etouffe - pretty goodCrawfish - double the price of Big Fisherman but it was yummy!I don't think I would've waited 30-45 minutes in line like people did for this place. It was good but not blow your mind good.

Reviews.Author: Nicole C.
Reviews.Content: When in New Orleans, you gotta have oysters... and what better place to have oysters than at the famous Acme Oyster House? They're featured on Man vs. Food!First, expect craaaazy lines. There was already a line out the door when we arrived at 6:30 on a Saturday. We were seated around 7:30, and the line was wrapped around the block when we left.The menu was kind of limited and had mostly fried foods.Raw oysters were OKAY. I thought they were on the small side and were very muddy. I guess with the enormous amount of people coming in and out of the doors... their focus is on shucking, and not on cleaning. Chargrilled oysters were tasty, but not as amazing as I expected from reading the reviews!The New Orleans Medley was DELICIOUS. It's a sampler of Seafood Gumbo, Seafood Jambalaya, and Rice & Beans. Amazing. Also, save room for dessert-- you do NOT want to miss the Bread Pudding with Whiskey Sauce!

Reviews.Author: Andy C.
Reviews.Content: I gotta say the oysters here are really fresh.  We ordered a dozen raw oysters and a dozen chargrilled oysters.  I usually eat the raw but having tried the chargrilled for the first time...WOW...pretty freakin' good!  Both were so good we ordered another dozen of each.  I think we could have ordered a 3rd dozen but we had other food coming.  I am now a fan of grilled oysters and Acme Oyster House!The gravy fries here are good too.  A must come if you are in NOLA.

Reviews.Author: Claudia B.
Reviews.Content: Every time we tried to come here the line was LONG and it was outside and we didn't feel like waiting (it was quite chilly when we were there).  We eventually made it early enough on a Sunday and only waiting 10 minutes till the place opened.  It's quite small, pretty loud and crowded inside but the food was awesome!  The oysters can't be beat.  I don't usually eat oysters.  In fact, I hardly ever eat oysters!  Can only remember 3 previous occasions (one of them being with Chef Emeril himself serving them to me so I couldn't really turn those down...LOL).The chargrilled oysters MELT IN YOUR MOUTH!!!  WOW.  WOW.  WOW.  Even if you have NEVER had an oyster you must try these.  They are like blackened, super hot, and perfectly seasoned.  I don't know what they do to them but keep it up!Service was fun and friendly and the beers kept flowing.  Best place we ate the entire weekend.  Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Ginger O.
Reviews.Content: I cannot figure out why this gets such good ratings.  The place is messy, the line is way long, it is so loud in there that it is deafening.  The oysters were good but that is about it.  The servers just rushed around you and it was difficult to get served.  There are much better places to eat in New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: Cassaundra N.
Reviews.Content: Wait is killer, but so worth it! Had the Peacemaker and chargrilled oysters. Both delicious and amazing. I will definitely revisit the next time I'm in New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: Linh N.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled oysters were good, comes out hot, and tastes like pizza.Oyster shooter--fishy.Raw oysters? I stayed away from them, seeming there was a recall due to a viral infection (cooked were okay...hence the chargrilled oysters)Medley of jambalaya, gumbo and red beans and rice? Disappointing.  It makes cafeteria food looks good.  And I didn't leave singing any medleys either.I think you can forgo the waiting in line and skip Acme.  You can probably find a place with great oysters and better menus elsewhere.  Probably around the corner at one of the 30 other oyster restaurants.  Skip the hype.  Skip Acme.

Reviews.Author: Nick T.
Reviews.Content: This place was incredible when I went. It was completely packed and for good reasons. This is a very short review but at least its straight to the point. Come here for the oysters !I. Love. Oysters. Damn I miss New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: Catie V.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to come here after hearing rave reviews about this restaurant from friends and internet sources. We tried coming in on a sunday night, but the line was so long we decided to go another day. We successfully came in here for lunch on monday around noon. The place was still busy, but there was no line and open tables in the back. We were greeted by a woman who seemed "thrilled" to be working. She seemed irritated, never smiled or welcomed us, and was unpleasant to the people who came in to get seated after us.We ordered a dozen chargrilled oysters with a side of jambalaya and red beans and rice. For some weird reason, our sides come out first. Not sure if that was a mistake, or if that's just how they do things around there? Regardless, both side dishes were amazing. The jambalaya was perfectly seasoned. It had a bit of heat to it but it was just right. The red beans and rice were very hearty, quite thick, and had a milder flavor. When the oysters arrived, I was quite surprised by the lovely presentation. They were big, fresh, steamy, and had cheese and oil on top. The oysters also came with 5-6 slices of bread to soak the richness from the oyster shells. The oysters were delicious, flavorful, and very filling. I was worried that we didn't order enough food, but it was definitely enough for two people. I had lunch with a bloody mary and it was very tasty and well seasoned. Our waitress was nice too. \

Reviews.Author: Diana P.
Reviews.Content: there's not much to say b/c i suppose everyone already said it. we had the oysters and omg soooo good. and i had the sampler with jambalaya, gumbo, and red beans and rice and it was delicious too.what i was really impressed was our waiter. he was awesome. filled our waters, friendly but not pushy, gave good suggestions and just awesome. i am instantly in a wonderful mood when i get a great waiter/waitress. very happy we came to try this place.

Reviews.Author: Bert N.
Reviews.Content: The line may look intimidating, but it moves pretty fast.  Waiting about 20-30 min for a late lunch.  I guess waiting isn't too bad when you're in a big group since you can just grab some drinks and shoot the breeze.  The oysters here are really good.  I personally am a fan of the raw oysters, but the charboiled ones were good as well.  They charboileds came out sizzling hot and would steam and sizzle even more when you put a little lemon on top.  Pretty good stuff.  Try Deanie's around the corner for a different version of charboileds that come with more cheese and what not.  Also if the lines are too long, I here Felix has a delicious offering of oysters as well.We also ordered the etouffee and the Medley (gumbo, jambalaya, red beans & rice, and sausage).  The ettoufee was a bit plain.  I like my food spicey and the etouffee here can't even compare to Coop's.  The medley was pretty good though.  Out of the different samplers provided with the medley,  I actually liked the red beans and rice the most.  So simple, but so good.  Simplicity sometimes just can't be beat.  Just like how sometimes those hole-in-the-walls are better than fine dining.  Gotta mix it up!

Reviews.Author: Ben M.
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to tell you anything all that new.  It's just that I recently went to New Orleans on an "eating vacation," and this place - touristy though it would be to admit it - beat everything else down.  Hard.The chargrilled oysters may have been the best thing I've had in forever, and the "peacemaker" po boy (half fried oysters, half fried shrimp, all with tobasco-infused mayo) was so good I took a ride back to the Quarter on the day we flew out just to grab another one.

Reviews.Author: Drew A.
Reviews.Content: Now, I likes me some oysters, but these were f#$%ing enourmous.  I could only swallow 3 of the raw ones, and felt like I had to chew the mofos on the way down.  Not for me.The broiled ones were insane, though.  Shrank them down to size.  And with a little Tabasco (they didn't have a great cocktail sauce), them shitz were like candy.Drawbacks: Long lines (anytime of day), some really great smells---but then countered with some really crappy smells (wait, I am on Bourbon St.), and sandwiches were hardly filled with any meat(s)That all said, we saw an Acme in the airport, and had to get a few dozen of the broiled ones again...and they didn't disappoint.

Reviews.Author: Jessica B.
Reviews.Content: Acme is a staple spot to visit when you're in NOLA, especially with it's close proximity to Bourbon Street. Last time I was in NOLA, Felix's wasn't open (it is now) but I had heard from many people that Acme is "better." I hadn't been to Acme in about seven years, over which time oysters have apparently gotten more expensive (a dozen raw was $14, about double the price from the last time I visited). While they're no longer super cheap, they are super GOOD. Acme can turn a girl who is wary of raw oysters into an oyster lovin' fool. They are SO delicious. Rating 4 instead of 5 stars because we waited a long time for our first round of drinks and our second dozen oysters were not properly cut away from the muscle, making them difficult to eat.

Reviews.Author: Nick O.
Reviews.Content: The charbroiled oysters are to die for and could eat them everyday . I also got the shrimp and oyster po boy sandwich and it was also good but kinda of fishy . We went on a Friday night and did have to wait in line for about an hour or so but this is to expected . Grab a drink from around the corner and enjoy the company of friends . Would return again .

Reviews.Author: Jeremy W.
Reviews.Content: I really don't know what else to say other than this is the best oyster bar you will ever eat at. Just accept the gluttony, order 2 dozen grilled, and pig out. Make sure to get extra bread to sop up the sauce once you eat the oysters. Top it off with excellent bread pudding.This is a must stop every time I go.

Reviews.Author: jan m.
Reviews.Content: The benchmark in the quarter for oysters.Always sit at the bar, right in front of the oyster man shucking em, try to aviod rush dining hour, do not order anything off the regular menu except maybe the fried stuff..and never be tempted to walk across the street to Felix's just bc the wait is too long.

Reviews.Author: Eric L.
Reviews.Content: A must visit for all tourists!  I was prepared to wait 15-30 minutes so I had the gf stash a couple beers in her purse!  Mine as well drink on the streets if the law lets you.  While we waited, we met the most interesting retired couples!  According to yelp, Felix's oyster house is just as good and right across the street, but you have to try this world famous oyster house at least once right?Started off with one dozen char grilled oysters.  I think it was close to $14 for a dozen gulf coast oysters, so it's actually pretty pricy!  The oysters were so fresh with buttery goodness combined cheese, herbs!  We also had the oyster, shrimp po boy with a bowl of red beans and rice...both amazing as well.

Reviews.Author: Dianne H.
Reviews.Content: I love the baked Oysters!! and the Seafood Gumbo!! I got here at 11am in the morning and the place was packed. Just had to wait 10 minutes or so to get seated. Ordered pretty quick, food took a little bit, but it was so worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Andrew T.
Reviews.Content: Sat at the bar, had a good time with the shuckers. A lot better than just sittin at the table. Loved the raw/grilled oysters, but out of all the typical creole dishes the jambalaya is the best thing; everything else was just ok compared to other places I've been or even what I cook.

Reviews.Author: Grennan K.
Reviews.Content: You can stalk people online... RIGHT NOW... sitting at ACME eating oysters.Line is ridiculous... so don't try mardi gras weekend. NO RESERVATIONS just a wait list....a long one at that.Ah! So here it is... dozens of oysters from the gulf of mexico for 12 BUCKS (if i remember correctly) Say what?! It's super cheap & you end up getting 4 dozens anyway.  The way they eat it here is on saltine crackers with a bit of tabasco.This joint is dive so who cares if the service is slow or crappy. You get what you pay for.** JUST FOR THE RECORD: To this day I've never done an oyster shooter & I never will be talked into doing an oyster shooter. That's just self abuse. **

Reviews.Author: Karl B.
Reviews.Content: After finishing up a daylong convention while traveling solo, I needed something... and preferred something good. Not hard to find good food in New Orleans, but sometimes hard to get in without a long wait. DO go to Acme Oyster House - it's delicious.DON'T go during normal mealtime hours, because the wait can be awful. I showed up about 11 PM, looking for any place that still had good food for the night... Acme had it.I came back a couple days later for lunch, but no bueno: the line was always out the door, with over a 30 minute wait.So come late, have a nice po boy or some oysters, and wash it down with a turbo dog on tap. You'll leave happy.

Reviews.Author: Felicia F.
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give Acme 5 stars but I just can't. The grilled oysters were just ok and the gumbo was really really salty. However Acme is a staple in the area so you have to go at least once. I've been several times when it's been better hence my disappointment.  They do have great customer service though and a fun atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Alvin L.
Reviews.Content: Despite ACME's popularity their service and hospitality did not suffer.  The oysters on the half shell were amazingly fresh and delicious; the freshest I've tasted in the area.  Due to limited space, I recommend arriving early for large parties.  Overall a great place for oysters (grilled and raw), crawfish, and seafood.Alvin's Tri-Scale Rating (AT-SR):Food: 4 of 5Service: 3 of 5Ambiance: 2 of 5

Reviews.Author: Sarah M.
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were in New Orleans for a bachelorette party. We decided to go to Acme...on Super Bowl Sunday...when hometown boy Eli Manning and his Giants were playing the Patriots. No, we didn't think about that beforehand.We only had to wait for about 20 minutes after the game was over, which was really surprising. Acme had a TV that faced out into the street, so we could actually watch the game and drink our hand grenades at the same time.Once we were seated, we got a half dozen raw oysters and got those plus 6 chargrilled oysters which were delicious. Then we got about 8 pounds of crawfish which we pretty much devoured. The bill was reasonable, and they didn't end up charging us for the oysters we didn't order.The ambiance was great, and I'm not sure if that's just because everyone was so happy that Eli won a Super Bowl, or because it was Mardi Gras, or just because the restaurant was a lot of fun. We had a great time, and once we were done stumbled right out to Bourbon Street to continue our weekend in the Devil's Playpen.

Reviews.Author: Mike Y.
Reviews.Content: Amazing. I don't even like oysters and I thought the oysters were unbelievable! That's pretty impressive.The chargrilled oysters were mouthwatering. We started out with a half dozen of them and ordered another half dozen later on. We also had a dozen oysters on the half shell. The chargrilled oysters were the best oysters I have ever eaten. The seasoned butter and cheese would make anything taste great and boy did they make these taste awesome. The oyster on the half shell would be second best (a far second due to my dislike of raw oysters). They were large and fresh.We also split a fried peace maker po-boy. The fried oysters and shrimp were really good, but the bread was not soft and was difficult to bite through.I'm still craving chargrilled oysters as I write this. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Author: K K.
Reviews.Content: We were told that anyone visiting NOLA must eat here. Apparently, judging from the line down the block, others were told the same thing.  Usually, I'm not a fan of hyped up, touristy places, but this one did not disappoint. Yes, my love may have been partially derived from the grateful relief that our two hour wait in freezing 30 degree temps had finally come to an end, but I must say that I did truly enjoy my meal.  The charbroiled oysters were crazy good (though different than I expected with the buttery cheese topping), and the gumbo, jambalaya, smoked sausage sample plate was delicious.While I would definitely contemplate another visit here the next time I'm in town, I will NEVER stand in a line that long again.

Reviews.Author: Jeremy D.
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, after the raw oysters, I was a bit let down. If only I'd come to Yelp first and read that it's all about the fried oysters here... and it is.The Fried Peace Po' Boy was DE-licious! Padded with a couple local beers and a side of Red Rice and Beans, I was converted to an Acme fan.Round it out with a great ambiance, nice folks both manning and patronizing the bar and I'm sold!

Reviews.Author: Fiesty O.
Reviews.Content: A newbie New Orleans must-do, after you've been a few times you realize standing outside by a dumpster for 30 mins in the swamp air for your dinner just isn't as pleasant when there are sooo many other choices. Loves- the Oyster Rockefeller soup, so decadent and good, fried plates, horseradishy cocktail sauce (my favorite condiment)Dislikes- the andoille sausage on the sampler plate, it is an icky shame, servers are always slammed and service can be spotty.So if the line isn't too long and you want standard fried food & oysters go try it! If you are past #15 in line come back another time.

Reviews.Author: Junebug J.
Reviews.Content: We came here only for: the grilled oysters, a cup of redbeans and rice, and a pint of beer.  The oysters were very good, the redbeans and rice were ok, and the beer was cold.The service here is amazing, quick, courtious, friendly etc.  I'm sure if we'd had a full meal here we would not have been dissapointed.

Reviews.Author: Tom K.
Reviews.Content: Poboys made right, with soft rolls, hot crispy fish, iceberg lettuce, tomato and mayo.  Red beans (with plenty of meat) and rice are a good side.  Don't worry about the line, it moves quickly.  Dining alone? They will seat you at an empty seat at the family-style, oil-cloth covered tables.Service was prompt and friendly.Too full for dessert.I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Hermelinda A.
Reviews.Content: The line was very long, but it moved very quickly.  We sat at the bar.The raw oysters were really good and plump!  The charbroiled oysters were very decadent, but delicious.  I think they were too heavy for me though, so I'll stick to the raw oysters next time.The craw puppies were tasty, with a kick to them.The jambalaya was excellent!Our server, Pam, was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Author: Tweetie N.
Reviews.Content: Old review: from a visit backin July 20113 solid stars for food, atmosphere and price.  Checked out Acme on the first night of my NOLA visit. On a Wed evening there was about a 15 min wait.Got the seafood gumbo, crawfish étouffée and fried oyster po' boy.  Gumbo was good but my small cup size portion didn't justify the $6 price tag.  Crawfish étouffée was delicious - good portions of crawfish.  Wished I had foregone the cup of gumbo and got the large étouffée instead.  The po' boy was a good size and had a nice amount of fried oyster (not skimpy how some places can be).  The fried oyster was delicious and the batter was flavorful and wasn't oily or greasy at all.  Service was great!All in all, it was a good meal on short notice.  Glad I came and enjoyed the food but I wouldn't necessarily say it was a "must go" place, but then again,  I didn't have the oysters that everyone raves about.

Reviews.Author: Tom V.
Reviews.Content: Good as it gets. BBQ Oysters what a treat. After years of eating raw oyster and not liking cooked oysters. I was real did not want to try. Adventure won and I was rewarded with a great experience. ÉtoufféeWas best I ever ate. What a treat of a restraunt.

Reviews.Author: Steven S.
Reviews.Content: Anything on the menu! Get it!Reasons to go:1) Great food!  Hands down, it is great!2) Good menu selection!3) Amazing atmosphere; customers and staff make this place great.4) Good value!  Some might call it pricey but it is worth what you get.  I believe this is the place to get a deal.5) Location just off of Bourbon St if you're into that scene.Reasons to avoid:1) It is popular and you most likely will wait in line.  I waited for about 45min. with a party of 5.  The line you stand in has entertainment value--lots of drunks and interesting people pass by!  Well worth it.2) The line you form into outside under the second-story overhang has 'Bourbon St' asphalt to stand on.  I saw two ladies break their high heels and a dude in flip flops step in a puddle of scummy-nastiness that probably needed to be power-washed off :(

Reviews.Author: Mike S.
Reviews.Content: I don't really know what to say.....mabye don't always believe the hype?  maybe, stop going to the tourist traps in a city with more/better options then just about any city in America?  Here is my beef with Acme:The line to get in is a bit rediculous. ALWAYS a line. -not a big deal, no real minus of starsI LOVE oysters, I was looking forward to Acme all week after a long week of travelling.  But who the hell is shucking these oysters!?  I should say WHAT is shucking the oysters because I find it hard to believe a human can ruin a tasty raw oyster so badly.  An OGRE.  It had to be an ogre with a giant wooden club smashing the oyster shells.  I swear out of a dozen oysters, at LEAST 6 of them had shells in them.  Not tiny little speck of shell, but like, half the fucking shell. I damn near chipped my teeth so many times, I began getting SCARED to eat the oysters.  I had one dozen raw, and one dozen "famous grilled".  Yup, they grill em with the shells also. Over half of them were riddled with grit and shell pieces.  I was in such shock, I had to ask the nice couple next to me if they were having same issue.  They were not, so I just shook my head.  Probably only bad meal i've ever had in New Orleans after mulitple visits. BTW, THIS IS THE FIRST TIME IN MY ENTIRE LIFE I'VE LEFT OYSTERS ON A PLATE UN-EATEN.  I just didn't want to worry about my dental work enough to eat the last 4.Next time I order the oysters, just throw them all in a blender for me.  That way I at least know that I get shell with my oysters.

Reviews.Author: Ted C.
Reviews.Content: The sign says the restaurant opens at 11 and they sure do. The staff has breakfast right before opening, that's cool but they were finished by 10 'til and the doors still hadn't opened. It means a lot to me when I'm hungry and looking in on those that were eating. Yes, this means that Francesca L and I were there together along with another friend of mine. I have no idea what poopie is, but it was on the menu like three times. I did not order it, but I did have the raw oysters. I never liked the concept of it, never thought it would be that good and the slimy texture I heard it had was not appealing to me. I ordered it and now I can't think of anything but oysters now. I loved the taste of it and Acme didn't disappoint. Francesca got the boo fries-which are a lot like poutin, actually just like poutin. She said it was too salty but I loved it. The starters got me nothing but hungrier so when it came time for my seafood platter 1/2 catfish, 1/2 shrimp I was ready. Even after I got a cup of gumbo to go with it. Yeah! gumbo! one of the best I had. I've had 4 different kinds and it's definitely in the one or two spot. The hush puppies were good, number 2 besides Mike Anderson's. The platter was definitely great, the tartar sauce was excellent and went right with the catfish. I always loved fried shrimp and this place didn't disappoint. I could definitely tell the difference I've had between the fresh and fried versions I've had. Go for the oysters, if I go back to New Orleans-a sure possibility I will come here for them for sure.

Reviews.Author: Steven A.
Reviews.Content: Do not let the line outside fool you.  This place is worth the wait even if it is hot outside and you don't have a cocktail in hand (yet!).We told the hostess we would sit at the bar and that saved us probably 30 minutes of waiting in line.  We had to wait less than five minutes to be seated.  Once we sat down we ordered some raw oysters and two shrimp and oyster Po'boys.  The raw oysters were out in under two minutes and the sandwiches were out in less than ten.I barely had time to finish my second Heineken before we were done eating.  Service was lightning fast and the food was superb.Definitely recommend you sit at the bar instead of waiting on a table.  You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Annie H.
Reviews.Content: 4.5 stars!We came around 6ish, because we knew there would be a line.  However, the line wasn't too long and it moved rather quickly.  We waited for maybe 20 minutes?We were a party of 4 and the tables were definitely waaaay too small for all we wanted to eat.  We had to really clear out some of the food fast before new ones could be brought on (okay and perhaps we were also hungry so we ate like beasts too...)We ordered:Chargrilled oysters (different from Deanie's on the previous night, but just as delicious!)3 dozen raw oystersNew Orleans medley (jamabalaya, gumbo, andouille sausage and rice & beans, portion is for 1)Crawfish etouffee (DEEEEELISH!!!)Boo fries (french fries with gravy and cheese)  TIP:  Get the gravy on the side so that it doesn't make your fries soggy!!I have to say, the food here is simply out of this world.  The ONLY complaint I have is with regards to the seating.  We were right smack in the middle and the table was so small we barely had any room to move around.Acme has a very sports bar feel to it... so don't expect any sort of "ambiance" but DO expect good food at a reasonable price!!!They have a 15 dozen oyster challenge -- if you can complete it within X amount of time, your name goes on the board.  More than that, you get to go on the Wall of Fame category.Our bill came out to be 120 after drinks, tax and tip.There are lines at all hours of the day, and they don't take reservations.  By the time we left, there was a line about 30+ people long.  So just go a bit earlier than you'd like to eat and you'll be set.DEFINITELY recommended!!!!

Reviews.Author: Jocelyn L.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite restaurants in New Orleans; amazing Chargrilled Oysters and Warm Whiskey Bread Pudding. If the lines weren't so gosh-darn long, I'd have eaten here everyday. As is, I wish i got up earlier the other day for lunch instead of waiting till 12.30p to venture there. I completely underestimated the place because it was fairly empty @ 12.15p the day before...*sigh*Chargrilled Oysters- I got half a dozen but wish I had  gotten the order of a Dozen. Parmesean, garlic and butter + baked oysters = Yummy. It wasn't too overpowering with the embellishments, which was A-OK with me since I usually like shellfish simply prepared- the best way to taste Fresh seafood.Warm Whiskey Bread Pudding- a small order for $4.99. It was so yummy that I really wished that the portion was BIGGER. It was SO goodPeacemaker Po Boy- I got it to go, which was pretty good, but I'm sure it'd have been so much better if i'd had it HOT. Plenty of oysters and shrimps; it was definitely worth the $12 (+$1 when u order it to go)Seafood Gumbo- I've had better (@ Blues City Diner in Memphis), but it was probably the tastiest Gumbo I had in NOLA ( i had it at several places)I'll definitely be back on my (hopefully very soon) next visit

Reviews.Author: Mike P.
Reviews.Content: This place is now the place to get raw oysters. I Love Oysters on the half shell and this place had the freshest ones Ive ever had. They weren't slimy or runny but just perfect. I regret not getting a couple dozen for dinner. While i was there i also got their catfish & Shrimp platter.  Shrimp was good, i didn't like the catfish as much, but i have the feeling that i just don't really like catfish and it wasn't the way its was prepared. We orders 2 dozen chargrilled oysters for the table as well. Here with a group of 7. was enough for everyone to try one and for who ever liked them to get another. They were pretty good, although i like the raw ones enough to probably just order that again.

Reviews.Author: Serena B.
Reviews.Content: A visit to Acme seemed compusory for my first visit to NOLA, so my friend and I checked it out for lunch on a Monday...and there was still a line! Luckily, we only had to wait about 20 minutes. OMG the chargrilled oysters vere so good...and I don't even like oysters. (I stole a few off my friend's plate.) I could have devoured a half dozen on my own I think. My fried shrimp po'boy was just meh. The red beans and rice side was only ok also. The beer was served in plastic cups, it was lunch on a weekday and no glasses? That was kind of annoying.

Reviews.Author: Katie F.
Reviews.Content: Everyone raves about the oysters here which are good but here's a tip... you must try the hush puppies!!Now what are hush puppies?  Well, they're a geeky pair of shoes you can buy, but they're also these amazing deep fried teardrop pieces of cornbread mixed with garlic, onions and parsley.  LOVE!!!So good!  Fabulous side at $2/order.Now about the oysters, I'm a raw oyster gal and went with the raw.  Fabulous.  In terms of taste/texture, they're much like what you can get elsewhere but super cheap compared to what I'm used to paying.  A half-dozen for $7 something is a steal and a full dozen is even better priced!  The chargrilled ones are about $2 more... I wish I had room for these too - I may try to squeeze some in before I leave here!I had the red beans, rice and sausage... very tasty and simple.  Hubby had a half-pound cheeseburger and fries.  Also good quality although the fries were a bit cool.This is another classic New Orleans spot but I do think this one lives up to the hype!  Don't forget to get your hush puppies when you come!!

Reviews.Author: Nicole B.
Reviews.Content: Well, the name says it all. Oyster house. Dined here with my mum, it was a Thursday night, and it was busy. We probably waited for a table for 10 minutes. Oysters are delicious. We also had the New Orleans medley, which had gumbo, jambalaya, red beans & rice andgrilled smoked sausage. It's always nice to see restaurants offering little bits of everything, especially when your craving a little bit of everything. I was pretty satisfied with the medley. Everything was pretty tasty. Decent pricing. It can get pretty crowded, and you might have to wait in line, but definitely worth a try. The servers are pretty busy, but still able to be attentive to their customers. This restaurant is casual, and has a sports bar like atmosphere. If your ever in N'awlins and craving some oysters, definitely stop by.

Reviews.Author: Terence N.
Reviews.Content: Great po boys!  I tried the special po boy, which was half fried oyster and half fried shrimp.  The sandwich was huge and definitely filling.  Nice soft bread, great remoulade sauce, plenty of lettuce and tomatoes.  I enjoyed the fried oyster more than the shrimp, so I'd recommend just getting a fried oyster po boy.  All in all, a good po boy!   I also ordered the charbroiled oysters to start, which came out hot from the grill...I would recommend letting them cool down, because I tried to grab one and almost burned my fingers!  The broiled oysters have great flavor, they load the top with plenty of parmesan cheese, so if you don't like parmesan then don't get them, or request to skip the cheese!  My friend ordered the jambalaya, which was okay, there are better jambalaya places.  The prices for food are a tad high, since it's in a tourist area, I would go back just to get some more oysters and po boys!  I sat in the back area which has plenty of TV's showing sports, the tables are large and meant to be shared with multiple guests.  The service was good; they filled our drinks without asking.  Prices are a tad bit high, but if you want good oysters, this is the place to go!

Reviews.Author: Lee H.
Reviews.Content: Blech, not a good introduction to New Orleans food. We should have gone with our "stay away from touristy places" rule. There are so many better places, which is why the average four star yelp review really threw me off. The gumbo was flavorless and the crawfish etouffee wasn't anything special. However, those big fat gulf oysters were tasty. I tried one, even though I told myself I wouldn't ingest any gulf/oil spill oysters, but when they arrived at our table looking delectably good, I couldn't resist. I proceeded to plow through half of the dozen that my husband ordered. So much for restraint and will power.

Reviews.Author: Brandon C.
Reviews.Content: Great grilled and raw oysters. Fun, casual atmosphere.  the service was surprisingly good.Be sure to go early if you want to get a table.  After 5:30-6:00 p.m. a line begins to form outside.  If you are looking for ambiance, Acme may disappoint.  It is a bit of a paper plates kind of place.

Reviews.Author: Alison L.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled oysters were pretty awesome but a littler pricey and kind of small! I wasn't a fan of the raw oysters at all, I thought they were too watery. Also, watch out for the cocktail sauce because it already has horseradish and I didn't know that so I added my own and experienced an embarrassing tearing session in the middle of dinner. The fried catfish was actually very good, catfish is usually just catfish but this was so fresh!Helpful hint: there's usually a long wait but they actually told me that tables of 4 get seated quicker than tables of 2 so make friends in line!

Reviews.Author: John M.
Reviews.Content: Slowly but surely, I'll churn out my NOLA NYE reviews.To ring in 2011 the right way, the girlfriend & I spent the week around New Year's Eve in New Orleans. During that short time, we discovered a historic city with long traditions of great music, outstanding food & continuing perseverance.Before I actually get into this review, I have a confession to make (which I have mentioned in a few of my other reviews): I'm not a huge fan of oysters. The girlfriend, on the other hand, loves oysters nearly to the point of obsession. Regardless of our relative level of oyster infatuation, we had both heard so much praise for Acme Oyster House that we had to go. Just like so many other popular places in New Orleans, the 1st couple times we walked by to check it out, we observed a long line to get in. So, we devised a strategy to show up shortly before opening time.It worked, mostly. Arriving early, there was only a short line. We actually ended up getting in & getting a table ahead of the line because we were party of 2 & the line was larger groups. Acme Oyster House has a very fun & lively vibe. The staff are a smiling & jovial bunch. The girlfriend & I started with a round of Bloody Marys. The girlfriend ordered a Fried Oyster Po-Boy & the soup of the day, Crab & Corn Chowder. I ordered a Fried Peace Maker Po-Boy & Red Beans & Rice. We also added an order of 1 dozen Chargrilled Oysters because we had numerous recommendations for the Chargrilled Oysters at Acme Oyster House.Expectations based on recommendations can be dicey. The girlfriend & I had already been to a couple spots in town that had fallen short of expectations built up from recommendations. This was definitely not the case at Acme Oyster House. "Meets or exceeds" is my evaluation of our experience vs. expectation here. My Fried Peace Maker Po-Boy lived up to its name & was easily delicious enough to persuade forgiveness from even the most enraged heart. My Red Beans & Rice were excellent. I tried a couple spoonfuls of the girlfriend's Crab & Corn Chowder & that was really good too. Ah, but the Chargrilled Oysters. I'm not someone who would go out of his way for oysters but I would absolutely go as far out my way as necessary for the Chargrilled Oysters at Acme Oyster House. So good.Everything about Acme Oyster House was exceptional: atmosphere, service & for sure, the food. I don't love oysters but I loved the oyster dishes (as well as the others) at Acme Oyster House.

Reviews.Author: Cossette P.
Reviews.Content: Man VS Food:  Adam, this place was overrated!We were intrigued about all the hype for this place.  We planned to go here for dinner on our first night in NOLA but the long line outside was too much for our hungry stomachs can bear.  Day 2:  We stood in line for lunch...took about 25mins to get in.  We ordered the dozen half shell oysters which was good but after trying out several other oysters they're starting to all taste the same.  I wasn't a big fan...sorry :(

Reviews.Author: Sasha B.
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I was looking for!We came here today about 12:30 for lunch after checking out of the hotel... We only had to wait about 5 mins and were seated at the bar.Everything was delicious.We had:cup of seafood gumboa dozen grilled oysters - amazinga lb of crawfish - incredibleshrimp and oyster po boyI'd recommend this place to anyone who wants to experience tyipcal New Orleans cuisine in a casual, affordable setting.Total with a drink each (good bloody marys!) and tip was $40 per person.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer M.
Reviews.Content: Still not entirely sure why this place has a line outside no matter what time of the day it is. Tried to beat the system by going around 3pm, but apparently the system beat me. Good. The wait was at least somewhat reasonable - about 20 min wait. Apparently the place across the street tastes and sells the same stuff, but I guess this place is a NO tradition. Oysters:Charbroiled - very tasty, but quite heavy and covers the actual oyster tasteFresh - they don't play games when they say fresh. Impressive. No fishy taste, and was able to eat them without basting it with horseradish or sauce.Overall, good experience, but not life-changing enough for it to be worth the wait again.

Reviews.Author: Jen J.
Reviews.Content: This was definitely a let-down. We liked the raw oysters, although some of them were extremely small, not much bigger than my toe nail. Wtf? The people who don't eat raw foods liked the chargrilled ones. I'm in the first camp. While the chargrilled ones are tasty, I prefer my oysters to be naked and not dressed in two inch thick cheese. BUT to each his own. We (large party) waited for a good 40 minutes outside. It was no biggie.  And to go off topic a little, I spent that time looking up some "bad" reviews and was extremely amused by some of the comments. One person said the raw oysters are bland....well, I doubt you will find a non-"bland" raw oyster anywhere in this world. Anyway, back to the food. Everything outside of the oysters were quite bad. This is not the first time I had Cajun food but these were some of the worst gumbo and jambalaya I ever tried. The gumbo was runny and everything was bland. Most of us ordered the peacemaker Po Boy. I didn't think these were all that special. Fried seafood is fried seafood. I've had the same version all over the US at Cajun joints. This place is a PASS, especially for tourists who has had exposure to Cajun food before.

Reviews.Author: Nick N.
Reviews.Content: Food: 3/5Service: 4/5Cleanliness: 3/5Decor & Style: 3/5Did not live up to the hype from yelp =( everything was good but just par. If this place wasn't popular on yelp, you could never tell if it was good or not. Lots of other places to try in the FQ!

Reviews.Author: Carol K.
Reviews.Content: There were two places in the French Quarter that my husband had reviewed and wanted to try, this was one of them.  On our first day in town, this place had a long line outside waiting for a table, so we went down the street for the backup plan.  Eventually, we made it in without a long wait.  We got the raw oysters, but also got the char boiled ones,  we also got a couple of their sandwiches.  The oysters were fresh, fairly big in size, had came with lemon wedges and a tangy cocktail sauce.  It all went well with ice cold beer!I enjoyed these and wouldn't hesitate to go back!

Reviews.Author: Caroline K.
Reviews.Content: I don't think my trip would have been complete without these darn good oysters. Quite frankly, I haven't had my share of oysters to say whether I like them or not. I ordered a half dozen chargrilled oysters to share with my mom. I really should have ordered a dozen because the oysters were amazingly delicious. Freshly buttered with just the right amount of seasoning... I think it's safe to say that I like oysters.Besides that, we shared the seafood etoufee, which was delicious. I was expecting bigger portions since everything else we've been ordering was so big. We finished with dessert - bread pudding, which was excellent!Oof! I think I just ate a month's worth of calories in just four days here in NOLA, but it was well worth it!!

Reviews.Author: Carmen C.
Reviews.Content: Nothing I can say that 1000+ other reviewers haven't already said! Best oysters I've ever had! Fried, chargrilled, raw, yum. Go for lunch to skip the lines..dinner lines can get insane. I also had the fried oyster poboy. Maybe it was an off day but the bread was kind of hard and stale..no matter because I just ate it without the bread.

Reviews.Author: Scef T.
Reviews.Content: Great place! Great food! I'm too busy eating to be commenting. Hit me back!

Reviews.Author: Linda T.
Reviews.Content: OMG the oysters were amazing! As were the po' boys! The place gets busy, and there is a short line, but its so worth it. The service was great as well, our waiter had a great attitude and friendly personality =)

Reviews.Author: Min K.
Reviews.Content: Came here with a group of 11, so the wait was long, but worth it. Came at 8:45 and took about 45 minutes to get a table set up for us. Fresh oysters were delicious but the CHARGRILLED IS WHERE IT'S AT. A friend of mine stated that she didn't like oysters but tried the fresh ones here and actually liked them!Also got the boo fries, which were good but a tad salty. I'll return for the chargrilled oysters. MMM.

Reviews.Author: Thanh N.
Reviews.Content: you MUST try their poboy. It is truly amazing.I am not a fan of shrimp but WOW...WOWWWW..that thing was amazing. It was laced with crack of something. I finished the whole poboy on my own, it was exceptional. I wanted authentic only can be found in New Orleans food..and this definitely hit the spot. If ever I visit New Orleans again, I will definitely have this place in my itinerary.

Reviews.Author: Elijah A.
Reviews.Content: Ok, so let me just say that I have only been here when Haliburton had the place shut down for an appreciation day that I was invited to- but this place was freakin great.  The char-grilled oysters were unreal, and the drinks were every thing a New Orleanian could hope for.  I tend to stay out of the quarter especially during busy times of the year, but this is a great place I would go back to again.

Reviews.Author: Eugene F.
Reviews.Content: I just ate me some yummy crawfish and a shrimp po boy and I'm very contento!  :)  There was a bit of a line (even on a Sunday night @ 8pm) so go grab a drink from Bourbon Street and shoot the shit while you're waiting in the line.  One thing to note is that you cannot bring in any outside alcoholic beverages, so pound that hurricane while you are in line and have a great meal.

Reviews.Author: Eddy C.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled Oysters.That's all you need to know about Acme Oyster House.Sure, the raw oysters are fresh and tasty.  And their fried shrimp platter is pretty good too.  But the only thing you'll care to remember is the plate full of chargrilled oysters.  Topped with cheese and a garlic butter sauce, the chargrilled oysters are sinfully good in that "Damn, I wish I had ordered a second plate of these instead of my entree" kind of way.  Our dinner at Acme Oyster House wasn't necessarily the best one we had, but the chargrilled oysters were definitely the best dish that we had.Oh and in case you hadn't heard, if you go to Acme Oyster House, be prepared to wait.  We thought we could beat the rush by getting there at 5:30 PM.  No dice.  Ended up waiting about 20 minutes, which wasn't too bad all things considered.  Tip: if they offer you a seat at the bar, take it so you don't have to wait any longer to dig into those delicious chargrilled oysters!

Reviews.Author: AaronErin D.
Reviews.Content: We love this place. We actually crave it while we are away. For those of you visiting New Orleans you should stop here and experience it at least once. We have been told this is not the best out of their locations, but we have yet to be disappointed. The entire staff is super friendly!! Huge bonus. Your best bet to eat here is when they open for lunch, be prepared to wait! We have seen lines wrap around the block with over 100 people patiently waiting. Do not be alarmed if you feel "un noticed", as you finally approach the opening an employee will walk around with a clip board and add your name to the wait list. Keep in mind they will not sit you without your full party! Luckily for you there are bars everywhere to grab to go beers for your long wait. We personally enjoy the bar top, but when the wait is long ask for first available. The grilled oysters are amazing, but honestly have you ever had anything bad that was covered in cheese? The gumbo is awesome! Try it in their bread bowl, it's enough to fill you up so you may continue your partying in New Orleans. I have even ordered the burger and it was delicious! A must go to spot!

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth T.
Reviews.Content: I was very, very disappointed with the food here. There was a line outside the door, which caused my anticipation to build. They let you order drinks inside and take them outside with you while you wait, which is great. Blood marys here kick a delicious punch!The fresh oysters were alright. The chargroiled oysters were really good, but were also completely drenched in bread crumbs, cheese, and butter. Something with that much cheese and butter has to taste good, but I feel like it's almost cheating when all you can really taste is.... cheese and butter. The gumbo and etoufee were decent, but nothing to rave about. The po-boy was again, decent, but nothing to rave about. If you're visiting from out of town, I'd skip this place. There are so many other better places to eat while in NOLA, so don't waste your stomach space.

Reviews.Author: Cassie B.
Reviews.Content: After wandering around the Quarter for some time, we stumbled upon Acme, and thought Hey! Lunch! Brilliant! We should have kept walking.I don't get what all the hype is about. Drinks took forever coming from the bar, and they were pretty weak to boot. We ordered a dozen oystersto start, what came to the table was 10.5,with chips of shell in most of them. On the New Orleans sampler, the gumbo wasn't really edible, with any amount of various hot sauces; the red beans and rice were bland, and the jambalaya and sausage were pretty good.The Peace maker Po-boy, I'll hand it to them, delicious! Great flavor, and very generous on the portion.Service was spotty at best, and it took a while to get our check, and then the credit card run. And when we looked at our bill, instead  of being charged for a dozen oysters (10.5) we were charge for a dozen & 1/2dozen.Fame i do not think has been very good to these guys. Stick to the mom and pop shops

Reviews.Author: Erin A.
Reviews.Content: 35 min wait, not a problem! Their oysters are caught in 1/2 salt water and 1/2 fresh water. This is why each bite is so fresh, clean, and does not taste salty. I loved their fried oysters, Chargrilled Oysters, and the Crawfish. I'm on seafood fix -- and I expect to eat here again tomorrow! One of the best ideas is to eat osyters and crawfish in season. I highly expect myself to eat here again tomorrow. This is a must stop in NOLA!

Reviews.Author: Kevin U.
Reviews.Content: Solid! Always a great stop. I could, but shouldn't, sit and eat their char-grilled oysters all day. Never get tired of them and they are, in my opinion, by far...the best (and I try them everywhere!) in town! The atmosphere is loud and energetic, the beer is cold and the char-grilled oysters are...well, you get the point. Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Julie K.
Reviews.Content: How about if you were never a fan of oysters and Acme made you a convert? Wouldn't you say there was divine intervention at hand? The ability to change your palate one slimy mollusk at a time, is like seeing the Virgin Mary in an oil stain.A miracle. A pure and simple miracle.

Reviews.Author: Su Jin K.
Reviews.Content: This place was great to have my first New Orleans meal at.  The oysters were HUGE, fresh, and delicious, but everything else was great, too.  My brother loved his po boy (bread was so soft!), we had 2 orders of the shrimp etouffee because it was so amazing, and we thoroughly enjoyed the jambalaya and the gumbo, as well.  Not only that, but we paid less than we had expected (especially for the oysters).The reason this place doesn't get 5 stars is not really because of the wait.  We knew beforehand that we'd have to wait (ended up being a little over 30 minutes), and it's not the restaurant's fault that it was so bitterly cold.  The problem was that the table we ended up getting was right by the door, so everytime anyone came in or out, we got these huge gusting drafts that actually blew away our napkins and chilled us to the bone.  All of us kept our winter coats on and were shivering throughout the meal.  I'd love it if the restaurant could either raise the temperature inside or install a revolving door to minimize drafts.  Other than that, we were happy.

Reviews.Author: Kelly C.
Reviews.Content: 5 minute wait for 2pm lunch and got window seat. Walked by in the evening and there was a crowd of people outside waiting. This was my first oyster experience so wanted to play it safe, or so I thought. -Boo Fries: Good. Still can't wait to try the real deal in Canada -Char-grilled Oysters: Was great! Great taste...kinda buttery garlic, little parm I think. Was a hit with me. Would love another 1/2 order right now. -1/2 fried oyster Po Boy w/ Tobasco infused mayo added: mayo really didn't impact the large dump of fried oysters on french bread. I really don't get the Po Boy concept. Just dry and fried. Second and last Po Boy I will probably ever try. Guess it's just a personal preference thing. -Seafood Gumbo: I probably should have made a bigger fuss to our server about this, but really hope he got the hint after we didn't finish it. It was bad. By bad I mean fishy tasting and smelling, like old fishy tasting and smelling. I had one bite on quit. My partner had about 5 bites and quit. Later that night she got extremely sick!!! Razor blades in stomach, couldn't get out of bed all night..the whole works. When you have food poisoning and get sick it's very easy to narrow it down to what caused it. All you have to do is think of that food and you almost hurl! For her, it was Acme's Gumbo. Too bad. It ruined an entire evening of an already short trip. If you haven't tried Acme I think you should, at least once.

Reviews.Author: Melissa D.
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. The customer service was awesome. The wait changed from an initial 45 minutes for a table to a total wait of 15 mins. Loved it!My party of three tried the chargrilled and raw oysters, fried seafood platter, and the shrimp/oyster poboy. Food was great. The raw oyster were nice and large. You will pay a pretty penny for some good oysters in NY and still may not get any this large on your platter. No dessert because we were too stuffed.Try this location if you are in town.

Reviews.Author: Dixon T.
Reviews.Content: Try to go when they aren't too crowded (this might be an impossible task) and sit at the bar. Order a dozen or so (my personal favorite is Japanese style: Tabasco soy sauce, wasabi, and green onion sprinkled over the oysters) and make friends. I had a great afternoon here with a lady from Dublin, a business man from Houston, and a shucker who was having the greatest/worst lady problems. We all drank some Dixie's and contemplated how we could get our new shucker friend out of his dilemma of dating four women at once. Poor baby...

Reviews.Author: Candice A.
Reviews.Content: waiting in line took us an hour and 10 minutes. I guess it was because we were a party of 15. after that time, the only thing that they could have done was split us into 2 groups. My friends and I shared an order of: a dozen chargrilled oysters, crawfish etouffee and jambalaya. their jambalaya was so effing stellar, we were all obsessed and converted. the etouffee and the oysters were also delicious. all three servings were split among 4 people that left us satisfied and with a good amount of space for dessert. my favorite dish from here has got to be the jambalaya. the etouffee, I prefer more from gumbo shop, however it is still delicious none the less and not a regretful decision to order. the char grilled oysters were damn butter but very satisfactory. before we left, we saw someone order a soft shelled crab po-boy and the crab was mostly intact. We were so in love was was so tempted to order it for dessert, but we didnt. beignets await!

Reviews.Author: Khoi L.
Reviews.Content: I don't get the long lines to be seated here.  It's a huge tourist trap.Boo Fries: 4/5 - The roast beef gravy & cheese fries were the only thing my friends & I actually liked.Fried Crawfish Tail Po-boy: 2/5 - The po-boy was dry. I love po-boys, but didn't even eat half of my entree because it just wasn't good. My friends had the gumbo, shrimp po-boy, & peacemaker & they didn't like their entrees either.Service: 4/5Ambience: 3/5

Reviews.Author: Loiosh T.
Reviews.Content: Lemme sum up:  Fun atmosphere, very good food, very good serviceIf you've never had oysters before, this is the place to go.  Belly up to the raw bar and watch the shuckers do their thing.  Not only will you get some quality seafood, you'll also get a laugh, as the staff deliver good natured jabs at each other while they work.Perhaps we were lucky, but our wait in line wasn't too long.  We took our place at the bar and ordered a dozen oysters on the half-shell while we looked over the menu.  I went with 1/2 and 1/2:  half catfish po'boy and cup of seafood gumbo.  My friend went with the seafood etouffee with crawfish tails, or "mud bugs" as he liked to call 'em.  The food arrived after our second dozen oysters.  Whhoooooeeeee!  Good stuff.  The cornmeal breading on the catfish is just right and the gumbo has okra in it.  My friend gave me a few "mud bugs" and while they weren't as spicy as he likes them, I thought they were alright.I don't know how some of those folks got their names on the board for eating as many oysters as they did.  I could barely finish my food and I'd only had a dozen oysters.  Still, it seemed like there were folks at the bar that were going for the record as platter after platter was served up.  I was amazed at the skill of the shuckers behind the bar and how well they kept up with the steady orders for " 'notha duzzin' " from waitstaff and customers.  Is it a tourist trap?  *shrugs*  It's definitely a tourist spot.  But the prices aren't that outrageous for seafood, so I feel it was a pretty good value.  Would I wait 45 minutes to get in?  Probably not.  But if you hit Acme at the right time, you can find your way to the oyster bar and have a very good time.  A beer, some oysters, and laughter all around...not a bad way to spend a hot NOLA night.

Reviews.Author: Carol J.
Reviews.Content: I had oysters and drinks here. The raw FAT oysters are sooo fresh. We were told the baked oyster was to die for and it was very yummy. Loved it! Pamela at the bar was very sweet and prompt. Don't let the long line turn you away. It moves fast. Tip - must try their horseradish sauce. it's the strongest I've had. 5x normal wasabi.

Reviews.Author: charise u.
Reviews.Content: Good and quick service.  They always have a long line outside, but it's well organized and it moves pretty quickly.  Hands down, the best chargrilled oysters, yummy po boys and  fantastic etoufee. Oh,  and the staff are friendlyh and attentive to your needs. I highly recommend Acme over Felix's across the street.

Reviews.Author: Reese's P.
Reviews.Content: Waited on line for about five minutes. Not bad since the line is usually around the corner and a hour and a half wait. My sweetie and I were seated and our waiter greeted us. I immediately ordered the fire grilled half dozen oysters. I had read enough about it through the reviews that I had to try it myself. When it hit our table the oysters were bubbling with butter and Parmesan that my mouth started to salivate. As I took a piece of bread and oyster, I saw that it was coated perfectly with enough butter. It tasted wonderful and was not overwhelming. Cutie enjoyed it as well;) The shrimp po-boy was tasty with the right amount of crunch. I used the Tabasco chipotle sauce that was given at the table which made it smokey yummmm! He had the rice and bean bread bowl which looked a bit intimidating to me ha ha! It was HUGE and the rice and beans was spilling out of the bowl! The smoked sausage he thought was good. He wasn't able to finish it all as it was carb overload.:) We left satisfied and full! Great fun atmosphere and vibe!

Reviews.Author: John F.
Reviews.Content: Got to the restaurant and found a 25 minute wait in the line outside.  No problem, just went in to the bar and got a couple drinks (they are prepared to serve you in plastic cups) and went back to the line where my wife was holding down a spot.  the couple behind us did the same and we struck up a conversation.  Don't know how long the wait was, but it did not matter.  We had a drink and some great conversation with our new "friends" and time flew by.Once inside we ordered a half dozen of the recommended chargrilled oysters.  Yum!!!!  they are grilled and coated with butter and cheese.  To die for!For our entree, we finally learned that we keep ordering too much food, so we split the Fried Peace Maker Po-boy.  It is a combo of shrimp and oyster (fried of course) with a Tabasco infused mayo.  With a little added Tabasco that is on the table, it was fabulous.  We also got a side of wonderful Jambalaya.  This was wonderful and just the right amount of food.You have to go to ACME!!!!

Reviews.Author: David T.
Reviews.Content: Man...... New Orleans sure does seafood right! We ordered 3 dozen raw oysters and a deep fried catfish with crawfish etouffee! The catfish dish was good, but the oysters were OUT OF THIS WORLD good! Big size and a decent price!It was nice to sit near the bar and see the shuck oysters in front of you too. 5 Star service as well.

Reviews.Author: Audrey W.
Reviews.Content: I hate the line, although this time it moved rather quickly. We ordered a half dozen of charbroiled oysters and a small etouffe. The total came out to almost 30 dollars because the half dozen oysters were 12.99. I thought it was a little too expensive, but I figured the prices were high because oysters arent in season and the oil spill ordeal. The oysters were delicious though and the etouffe was perfect. Good stop to sober up a bit before our next food stop! I gave this place 4 stars because I didn't have as good of an experience the first time around.

Reviews.Author: Hannah S.
Reviews.Content: Ate at so many places on our recent trip to New Orleans. At at Emeril's place, Besh's place, at touristy places, at bars, the whole spectrum. And Acme Oyster House was the best. Cheap good food. I'm not even a fan of oysters and I LOVED the chargrilled oysters. Looooved. They were delicious. The po-boy was excellent and the bananas foster cheesecake was incredible. Probably the best dessert we had on our entire trip. Toward the end of the trip when I was suffering from perpetual food coma, and moving rather sluggishly through the long list of places to eat. I kept thinking about ditching the list and just heading back to Acme. I persisted with the list, and honestly I think I might have been better off just hitting up Acme again. It was just my favorite place from the whole trip.

Reviews.Author: Nadia z.
Reviews.Content: BEST Oysters in town hands down!!!! At first I thought touristy can't be that good well I was wrong Amazing oysters and poo boys. Staff is friendly I will be back for the most amazing oysters in town!!

Reviews.Author: Guy C.
Reviews.Content: Great, casual dining (4 of 4 stars)(see explanation of ratings below)We arrived at 1:30 on a Thursday afternoon and there was a twenty minute wait---- but it was worth it.Best dish: char-grilled oysters.  They put cheese on them which hardens and gets crusty.  The oysters arrive sizzling to your table, so let them cool a bit first.Also, liked the gravy-cheese fries.About $30 per person for lunch (gratuity not included).About my ratings:Only fine dining establishments can garner five stars.  Until yelp realizes that a fast food joint cannot possibly be ranked equally with a $100 per person place, I need to draw the line somewhere.  If we were only talking about the quality and presentation of the food, it would be a different story.  But, as we know, yelp's rankings take into account the entire dining experience.Therefore, I divide restaurants into three categories (and I wish yelp would do the same):1) fast food (no table service)2) casual dining (table service)3) fine dining (linen napkins, no plastic cups, no TV's in dining room, typically more expensive than casual dining)Fine dining can earn a max of five stars.  Casual dining can earn a max of four stars.  Fast food can earn a max of three stars.

Reviews.Author: Kay Z.
Reviews.Content: Get Bit By the GatorI recommend getting a seat at the bar. The guys shucking oysters are really friendly and we had a great time chatting with them. They recommended the 'andagator' beer when we ordered a pitcher, so we got that. They didn't tell us until afterwards that it could only be legally sold as a barley wine because of the high alcohol content! To be honest, I didn't notice because the raw and grilled oysters were way too good. Didn't get a chance to try the rest of the food, but I know this is a great place to get oysters, they taste great and you really just can't stop eating them.

Reviews.Author: Renato S.
Reviews.Content: No complaints.  I was there at opening, got a seat right away.  affordable prices and wonderful oyesters.try the char broiled oyesters, a can't miss.

Reviews.Author: Thomas L.
Reviews.Content: I've been slowly turning into an oyster lover in the past year.  I just came back from a weekend in NOLA and I am a full-fledged oyster addict.  I actually went there twice over the weekend to eat the half-shell oysters and chargrilled oysters.The first time I went, the oysters were nice, large and delicious especially the chargrilled oysters.  I've never had a better tasting oyster.  After you eat it, they give you sourdough bread to dip it in the monterrey, cajun spiced oil residue of flavor.  Sooo goooood.  The second time was just as good, but the oysters were a lil smaller.I give it 4 stars because all I ate were oysters and a side of jambalaya (real good too).  I'm sure the rest of their menu is just as good.  I want to go back.

Reviews.Author: Sophie B.
Reviews.Content: Today I discovered Charbroiled Oysters.  All I can say is that I MUST find a way to have these again, post my NO vacation.  If you go, these are a must.  They make the line definitely worth the wait.I enjoyed the rest of my meal (seafood etouffe, fried crawfish), but I'm sure there's a better version out there.

Reviews.Author: Brittany G.
Reviews.Content: I really could not have had a better Fat Tuesday than spending my FIRST ever Mardi Gras in New Orleans at Acme!  Thanks to Halliburton for hosting an amazing party which allowed me to, for one in my life, stop eating oysters because I was just too damn full!   Yes- it happened! "Stormin" Norman Master Shucker, couldn't have been any cooler either.  With a smile on his face he shucked every raw oyster I ate that day. (Special thanks to you!)I also thoroughly enjoyed the grilled oysters as well.  (My friends say they are not the best in town, but until I have those, these were!)  The gumbo was also the best I've had to date!

Reviews.Author: Thuylieu A.
Reviews.Content: The fried seafood we had there was pretty good and the service was pretty good. There was only one waitress that night and it was a big crowd- but she was still able to make sure we had everything we needed. I would have given them 4 stars but the oysters were dirty... I dont' mean a little grit, i mean DIRTY. The quality of oysters were very good, they just failed to cleaned them before chucking. We got a mouth full of dirt when we dug into them... yuck. We unded up eating them daintily to avoid the dirt coving the outside of the oyster. Even the grilled oysters were dirty.In other words... It was good, just wished they washed the oysters before chucking and serving them. We almost always get oysters when we go out for seafood... and because of the dirty oysters, we won't be coming back.

Reviews.Author: Bill R.
Reviews.Content: I first enjoyed the Acme Oyster House 39 years ago and there have only been a few changes in the interim. The price of a dozen gulf oysters has increased as expected with inflation, but they still offer good value.
