Oh my!The chargrilled oysters came with lemon and french board to sop up the butter and garlic sauce.  Oh man...I can stop thinking about it.Po-boys yes, they serve them there, but I can get them elsewhere and was not interested in po-boys.  The raw oysters were so yummy.  It was so silky slipping down my throat.  YUM!!!!Although this place may seem cheesy to some locals love it.  Beware all you flimsy eaters---there are no salads on the menu.  Appetizers consist of crawfish tails(fried), crab claws(fried) and I think a handful of others that are allll fried. The catfish plate had 4 pieces of catfish, no doubt had been filet from 2 fish, came with shoestring fries, and a side, in this case, dining partner order the cole slaw which I found rich---in mayo.IF you are looking to get some good grub, then this is a must if you are visiting and are in the Quarter.  It might be cheesy looking to you but Im telling ya, this place is a must try if you coming to New Orleans.  Red and white checker plastic tablecloths, 3 kinds of Tabasco sauce, ketchup all at your fingertips.  Parking can be a pain in the ass so your best bet is to either walk if you are staying in a hotel downtown or to park in one of the parking garages.Kids--well, it's a bit tight up in there for someone to bring a stroller in, but Im sure they can accomadate you.Cash and credit are accepted.

Reviews.Author: Anthony Z.
Reviews.Content: If one of your specialties is po boys, could you please go through the trouble of not using nasty nasty stale bread?Everything was nasty except for the grilled oysters, which were the ONLY redeeming factor of this place on my visit.There simply has to be something significantly better than this out there for po boys.

Reviews.Author: Kevin M.
Reviews.Content: This place is exactly what you're looking for after a day or during a day of drinking on bourbon street.  If you want oysters and good beer for a reasonable price, hit this place up.  Sure it's a little touristy, but hey, so is every restaurant less than a block from bourbon street.  The raw oysters were probably the best i've ever had.  Simply amazing, and REALLY BIG!  Plus, they had several different types of tabasco sauce to put on it.  The smoked tabasco sauce gave them a great flavor.  The chargrilled oysters were really tasty as well.  The seafood gumbo was a little underwhelming, but still pretty good.  Our waitress was very attentive and was at our table within 10 seconds of us needing something.  We didn't have much of an issue with the line and we were there mid-day on a Saturday.  Only took about 10 minutes to get in.  The place itself reminded me of a southern TGI Fridays, but you don't go there to look at the walls.  Get your oysters, maybe a po boy, and some beers and enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Marie B.
Reviews.Content: Since they do not take reservations, you should anticipate to wait outside in line for about 30 minutes with the rest of the tourists.  They will not seat you until your whole party is there.  All this said...you still HAVE to go here!  Try it once, you will not be disappointed.The oysters were as good as everyone said they would be.  The Jambalaya was perfect, not to oily and with all the right seasonings.  Yummy hush puppies too!

Reviews.Author: Fräulein J.
Reviews.Content: I went here specifically for crawfish. Found em for $9.95 a pound, didn't include sides...sooo, not great, not bad.They were, however, delish!  The oysters were 'ok'. Too big for my taste. Then again, I'm spoiled by having Hog Island Oyster Farm so near by here in CA. The sides of red beans and rice and jambalaya were very tasty - and the hush puppies were awesome.The place is really, really casual - as in, paper plate casual. They keep the AC on HIGH - so cold, that in my tank top and shorts, I was uncomfortably cold. Sucks when you have to carry around a sweater just to accommodate the cranked up AC's.The service is "meh". Although, after staying in NoLa for four days, I found mediocre service to be the norm EVERYWHERE.  Which was disappointing and surprising. Four stars for the food (taste wise) but a deduction for the less than average service and presentation.

Reviews.Author: Jenna s.
Reviews.Content: Even if you don't like oysters, you must come here! Oyster aren't on my top ten, but I did enjoy Acme's grilled half-shells.  I must say, coming from the west coast, I am used to seeing enormous oysters. Gulf oysters, like the ones at Acme, are half the size. Smaller, yes, but a must try.  You must also try the fried soft-shell crab, gumbo, and corn and crab bisque. The bread pudding with whisky sauce was so delicious, we had to order two! Come in early, because it does get crowded!Eat it. Like it. Repeat.

Reviews.Author: Frank L.
Reviews.Content: Deep fried Crab claws - the best thing we had at the table.We all ordered deep friend fish:CatfishShrimpClamsSoft Shell CrabBut the winner out of all of these were the crab claws. Perfectly tender - came right off of the claw, and you just wanted to reach back and get another one.Oh, we also had some of those oysters. YOU MUST TRY A CHARGRILLED OYSTER. I don't eat oysters, never have - but even I found them to be delicious.Who goes to Acme?Fans of the deep frier - and also people who like to eat oysters (but i think that's pretty obvious from the restaurant's name)Who avoids Acme?People who don't like to wait (yes LONG LINES), and people who are trying to avoid fried foods...if this is you - why are you in New Orleans?

Reviews.Author: TheGay Z.
Reviews.Content: First of all, the long wait did not justify the restaurant. Sure it looks cute inside but you can get much better quality seafood at Deanie's down the block. This place felt more like a sports bar that served seafood than a seafood place. It's a very loud environment, and drunk people seem to all love making fools of themselves here! Service was frantic but good. A word to the wise: if you want steamed crawfish here, call ahead to make sure they have them in season. I was suckered into the place because I wanted to eat crawfish by the pound but apparently they were off season! Instead, I had raw oysters which were very fresh, but saltier than oysters I've had elsewhere. We also had the charbroiled oysters which were delish, but Deanie's had more garlic and flavor. The shrimp/catfish po-boy was dry and needed tarter sauce, and the shrimp was a bit briney and possibly frozen.Seafood gumbo was salty and just ok...nothing to write home about. Jambalaya was good but also a bit dry. Sausage tasted local. Red beans and rice were too mushy with beans.

Reviews.Author: Jina R.
Reviews.Content: I'd like to start off by saying that I'm not a New Orleans native and I don't normally eat oysters or po boys. So here it goes...Food: Chargrilled oysters & shrimp/crawfish po boyTaste:- Oysters: Fresh and still sizzling when they were brought to our table. I couldn't wait for them to cool down & almost burnt my tongue. My husband keeps insisting we go back just for the oysters.- Po Boy: I never saw po boys as anything special till I had it here. The shrimp & crawfish were perfectly breaded and the tabasco mayo went perfectly with the sandwich.Value: Forgot the price, but I remember it not being as expensive as some of the other restaurants in the area.Parking: Walked. Parking didn't look too fun.

Reviews.Author: shelley h.
Reviews.Content: The line starts right before it opens.  We waiting about 40 mins or so.  I guess that is a short wait from what I am told.  We only had three people including myself .  We ate at the bar so we could be seated faster.  Curtis the bartender was wonderful!  He made good suggestions on the beer.  He recommended the andygator beer and I feel in love haha, also a helpful note is that beer on tap here is always going to be a higher percentage at 13% at the lowest.  Please note I do like beer though.    My mother had the killer buzz, it was tasty.  It reminded me of a AMF (known in la,ca and vegas nv).  Though it did not taste like one just looks wise.  My mother is not a big drinker and did not really get that "killer buzz".Food:I enjoy my oysters and I would like to note I believe there is only two oyster worth my time in eating the komoto oysters and blue point.  Though I gave in and got the local oysters.  If you try to keep a open mind they are refreshing and very good.  We got the grilled ones also which is a lot more heavier but worth a try.  It is very different then any oyster I have been serve though I normal just get them on the half shell.  The gumbo was very good.  The po boy was just okay.  mother's is a lot better.  This is a tourist spot which you should keep in mind.  I am a tourist and was not disappointed.  It was right next to my hotel.  This is a lot better then redfish.

Reviews.Author: Alan J.
Reviews.Content: I was pretty disappointed with the place.  Don't get me wrong, a good meal and good food.  Maybe I had my hopes too high.   It's rated very highly on yelp, they had the longest line for their booth at the oyster festival so all signs pointed to a very good meal. We started off ordering a half dozen charbroiled oysters and a dozen raw oysters.   The oysters were very small.   I know there are different types of oysters, some bigger than others, but these were very small.  This may be due to being the leftovers ordered from the weekend.  But for paying $25 to start off the meal we were not overly impressed. For an entree, we shared the "New Orleans Medley", a trio of jambalaya, gumbo and red beans.   None  of were very great and the gumbo was subpar. Regardless the meal wasn't very great.

Reviews.Author: Alana H.
Reviews.Content: My bf had never had a po boy before! I encouraged him to get one here to have the experience. He got the original po boy and since I had that experience before I ordered the half po boy and gumbo. I got a shrimp po boy and the seafood gumbo. It was just enough food for me and everything was just ok nothing too spectacular.  The gumbo wasn't hot when I got it but it was flavorful, and the po boy was ok. Didn't knock my socks off.

Reviews.Author: Tian X.
Reviews.Content: The char grilled oysters are really the ticket item to get here. They're grilled with a layer of cheese melted on top and although seafood and cheese does not sound like a very pleasant combination, it same out very nicely. I could eat over a dozen of them myself in hardly a blink. We also had the raw oysters, which were good, but the same as anywhere else and nothing to cry home about, and the shrimp and oyster po'boy. The po'boy came packed with plenty of deliciously deep fried shrimp and oyster, but they were just so lazily toppled onto a plain roll with a little bit of mayonnaise spread on top and a slice of lettuce. The shrimp and oysters were deep-fried very well, keeping a crispy, not-too-thick exterior with a hot, moist interior, but I felt so tempted to pick them out from the actual po'boy part of the sandwich. It just felt like a lack of effort for a sandwich and I'm sure there are better po'boys in the immediate neighborhood. We probably would have been better off just getting a fried plate.We came on a Sunday morning, just when they opened so the line was still relatively short and the crowd was still under control. However, I cannot possibly recommend anybody coming here when the crowd is any larger. Having passed by the restaurant many times, I've seen the utter chaos mayhem it can inspire. Even while we were there the restaurant felt rushed and chaotic.If there are any more than a few parties in line, then I would say skip it. Seriously, there is plenty of good seafood at acme, but there is also plenty of great seafood all over New Orleans, or even just the French Quarter. There's no point in wasting your time waiting in this line. If you happen to be lucky enough such that there appears to be no line, then get the char grilled oysters and some fried shrimp.

Reviews.Author: Andria O.
Reviews.Content: There was a good-sized line outside when we arrived at Acme Oyster House, but it moved quickly. We ended up sitting at the bar. Really liked the vibe of this place, the employees and the other customers were all really laid back, having a good time, friendly.I have to say though, I was a little disappointed by the oysters. I expected them to be bigger given the reputation of the restaurant. They were fresh, tasted great. Just wish there was more to them!But the food over all was good. I would go again.

Reviews.Author: Leah M.
Reviews.Content: ....eating seafood  in NOLA post BP spill ...hell ya! ...food here was deeeelicous....my order:Grilled oystersRaw OysterPo-boy - fried shrimp and oysters (#4 i believe)Po-boy - fried craw fish...ALL were awesome and tasty....people were friendly...cocktail sauce will clear your sinuses...

Reviews.Author: Somchai S.
Reviews.Content: Went here with a group of 11. We waited outside the long line after they said it was a 45 mins wait. Half of us went to get drinks and half stayed to hold our spot in the line. They had our table ready in 15-20 mins and our friends were not back yet. They unfortunately came back with Hugh A** Beers from Bourbon St.... which they had to chug since the restaurant didnt allow for other drinks inside. The hostess was quite rude, hence the deduction of a star. She did not have a smile and she looked pissed like this was the last place she wanted to be.The foos was great. I ordered the stuff crab plate. I wish they would give you a bit more though. 1 stuff crab, a side, and fries was $15. The waitress did not tell me it would cost $3 extra to get red beans & rice =( I wasnt very happy about that when I saw my bill. However, the crab was fabulous so I couldnt complain much.My friends got the jambalaya, and their portions were VERY small..... other than the small portions overall....It was a good dinning experience.

Reviews.Author: David C.
Reviews.Content: This place is SOOOO overated!!Had their charbrolied oysters...it was SOOO tiny!! I thought it was cuz they weren't in season but then I went to Drago's and it was HUGE!!!anywayz, i had the mixed sample platter as well and that was a complete rip off.a cup of gumbo, a scoop of rice & beans and a scoop of jambalaya for $17?? WTH??!! and it wasn't even good!!the only thing that makes for the 2 star is their fried shrimp. It was on the smaller side sorta like popcorn shrimp but SO delish!! the fried oysters were blah...(i order the half and half po boy)stick with just the fried shrimp if you are going to eat here?nothing else!!!

Reviews.Author: Amber L.
Reviews.Content: From the moment I first broached the subject of a vacation in New Orleans, my boyfriend bookmarked this restaurant as the number one place he wanted to go. It did not disappoint! Well, I should clarify - the Boo Fries did not disappoint. They were delicious! My 11-napkin (maybe it was 10, I can't recall) roast beef po'boy was pretty tasty (though not out of this world) and my boyfriend enjoyed his fried seafood (peacemaker? pacemaker?) po'boy. We also ordered a 1/2 dozen of the famous chargrilled oysters... it was the first time I'd ever had oysters and let's just say that I'm not a fan. They smelled good though, and were covered in cheese, which was enough to make my boyfriend fall in love with them.The service was great - our waitress was very attentive and friendly. I'd definitely allow my boyfriend to drag me back here.

Reviews.Author: Liz L.
Reviews.Content: Definitely must come here to try their oysters.. mmm yummo!We had an order of the fresh oysters as well as the chargrilled, which I read on Yelp was highly recommended.  Personally, I preferred the fresh oysters over the chargrilled... the chargrilled oysters came out too burnt and some of them shrank so much in size that I could hardly call it an oyster.  The seafood etouffe was delicious.  We made a few pit stops here and there and just wanted to try out as much as we could, glad we came by here!

Reviews.Author: Elorie K.
Reviews.Content: Ommmmggggggg. Oysters. I. Love. Oysters.I work at a restaurant in Houston that originated in New Orleans, so we get a lot of customers from NOLA. I was telling one of them that I was about to take a trip to NOLA and they suggested this place. When we got there, I had to try this place out.The line starts outside, which is a good thing because it was pretty crowded already inside. There wouldn't be anywhere to sit. There were five of us, and we ordered quite a bit of food. It was a while ago though, so I don't remember exacts, besides my stuff. The Charbroiled Oysters; cheeeezus they are so delicious! I normally don't like oysters like this but, man oh mighty, these took me away! And the raw ones? Those are the freshest I've ever had them. They were all huge, too. Not a small one in sight. And from where I was sitting, I could see the oyster bar. There's a giant mirror behind it, so I had a CLEAR view of the ice chests behind the bar and all the unopened oysters just sitting there. My mouth is drooling now just remembering that. I had also ordered a Hot Sausage Poboy. I wanted to compare the Poboys in Houston to the ones there. NOLA definitely wins. I don't know how they do it, but I swear that was the best poboy I've ever had in my life. Our waitress was also pretty attentive for how busy the place was. It was extremely crowded and I'm sure all of her tables were filled, but she kept coming to us and making sure we were satisfied and happy.Overal; DEFINITELYDEFINITELY recommend if you're not from around town. If you're in town, I'm sure you already know what I'm talking about :)

Reviews.Author: Melanie L.
Reviews.Content: This place has got the freshest oysters. Ever.My girlfriends and I visited nola for the first time a few months ago and heard on Yelp that this is the place to go. Thank you fellow Yelpers, for you've done this place justice!There was already a line when we got there so I knew this place had to be good. Got seated and our waitress was very nice with recommending us on what to order. Obviously it was an oyster house so we had to at least order some fresh oysters! She also suggested the chargrilled oysters (topped with romano cheese and butter) that everyone seems to love. I had never tried cooked oysters, but I was ready to try on a new little experience and oh my goodness, they were even better than the fresh oysters! They're so delicious that it makes me want to take a road trip back to nola just so I can have more of them.I also ordered a shrimp poboy. I'm not a fan of mayonnaise that usually comes in the poboy, but for this place I was willing to try their special tabasco mayo. And boy, am I happy I tried it! Overall, I can't seem to find anything wrong with it. This place has become one of my favorite seafood places of all time and I can't wait to come back to nola one day. This will be my first stop!

Reviews.Author: Sarah S.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went here for a mid-afternoon snack.  We sat at the bar and ordered a half dozen chargrilled oysters.  If you don't typically like oysters, you will probably like these because, flavor-wise, there is nothing oyster-y about them.  I would never have guessed that they were oysters if you blindfolded me.  The butter/cheese/garlic concoction smothering each oyster was delicious.  They give you a few pieces of bread to soak up the excess flavor.  I did think the oysters were overpriced, but maybe it's because they are only in season during months with "R"s in them.  I would recommend going here for a snack, but I don't think it's worth breaking the bank for an expensive meal.

Reviews.Author: Peter R.
Reviews.Content: This is a great atmosphere settle down outside of the heat and enjoy quality oysters freshly shucked.Enjoy fresh raw or grilled (with parmesan and tasty herb butter) oysters.  Grilled oysters are cooked well, not to the point of being overly dry and shriveled like raisins.  Raw oysters (from a SoCal native) are unlike local Pacific oysters which tend to be larger and have more of a bite and be more on the firm side.  Rather, they are silky smooth with a sweet finish.Sit down, order AT LEAST a dozen per person grilled or raw (my preference) and just put 'em down the hatch!This will definitely be a staple for future visits.

Reviews.Author: James J.
Reviews.Content: There was a long line to get in. I was able to avoid it by ordering take-out.Friendly staffA Police officer was on patrol right outside of the doors.

Reviews.Author: Rainbow C.
Reviews.Content: Oysters are a must-try in Louisiana, since they're so fresh and abundant there!  We tried Acme Oyster House after seeing good reviews online and in travel books.  The line was crazy at 9pm (there is a line ALL the time), but after getting seated, we were glad we waited.  Chargrilled Oysters - the family favorite, but I prefer raw oysters.  Heavy in seasonings, cheese, garlic, and grilled to a tasty finish.  Raw Oysters - big, plump, juicy, fresh.  I could have eaten a dozen by myself!  Shrimp Etouffee - cajun/creole style seafood over rice.  Flavorful, not a huge portion, but a good balance to all the oysters we were eating.  Directly across the street is another oyster joint: Felix's Restaurant and Oyster Bar, which we tried 2 days later.  The verdict: I think Acme Oyster House is better than Felix Oyster Bar.  Oysters are bigger and fresher tasting at Acme.  Bottom Line:  OYSTER HEAVEN, but long line

Reviews.Author: Jane M.
Reviews.Content: Order the Char Grilled Oysters, they are fantastic. The Ettouffe I had here left a lot to be desired, it was shrimp and that was a little scarce.The service was pretty good but the best oysters I've had in a really long time.

Reviews.Author: Nancy C.
Reviews.Content: Based on the grilled, garlic oysters, it would be 5 stars. Each bite was clean and bursting with flavor and I love that chargrilled flavor... plus garlic and parmesan made it  mouth watering... go for the full dozen if not more. If there's a next time I would def start with this and finish with a shrimp/oyster po boy. The rating went down with service. By the time I got my check I was ready for round 2.  Also, the red rice and beans was bland and the jambalaya was on the salty side. The gumbo was not as hearty as others that i craved, seemed like the okra was added in a little too soon and overcooked.

Reviews.Author: Rob C.
Reviews.Content: 2.5 long waits and low yield.  had the supposedly #4 po boy and now can tell the difference in comparison with Domilise.  more soggy, ketchup tabasco not impressive.  probably better to go for oysters here.

Reviews.Author: Amanda C.
Reviews.Content: The longest line you'll ever wait in to eat at a restaurant but it is definitely worth it. Both times I visited I got the fried oysters which just melt in your mouth. On my first visit I made the mistake of getting the fried oyster po boy because I ended up not even touching the bread the oysters were so good! The jambalaya was very good as well. On my second visit I tried the Oyster Rockefeller soup and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Author: Ananda F.
Reviews.Content: The best char-grilled oysters anywhere

Reviews.Author: Jeremy W.
Reviews.Content: The char grilled oysters were among the highlights of my visit to the area.  The raw oysters were delicious however a little large for my preference (I mean...extremely large).  If you're looking to check it out, I'd recommend making a few passes by or coming at off-hours as the line can literally stretch for blocks.

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey D.
Reviews.Content: A little bit of a tourist trap. Overpriced oysters, but some of the freshest I have eve had!! If staying near French quarter, easy to walk to. I would definitely recommend lunch vs dinner to avoid a long wait

Reviews.Author: Jess R.
Reviews.Content: On a Wednesday afternoon in December, I just walked right into Acme Oyster House and got a seat at the bar immediately.  The bartender Curtis greeted me kindly and offered a menu and drinks.The atmosphere was divey, loud, yet had a nice hometown-bar feel.  Although I wanted to try a bit of everything on the menu, I didn't want too much so I had a Peacemaker Po'Boy.The sandwich was served on fresh bread with Oysters, shrimp, and a Tabasco sauce.  No need to worry- the sandwich was not too spicy.  The oysters were fresh, delightfully salty and didn't get that overly slimey or sandy texture.  Curtis's service was attentive but not overbearing.  He kindly offered me a to-go refill for a walk around town and sincerely thanked me for coming in.  The food was good for what you'd expect from a divey bar, fresh and the service made me feel welcome.  I think I would definitely come back at a non-peak time.

Reviews.Author: David H.
Reviews.Content: I'm going to keep this short. The place is packed and loud. Service was surprisingly good for such a crazy place.Chargrilled oysters, amazing. Peacemaker po-boy, scrumptious. Seafood etouffee, savory and authentic. Will be coming back for more.

Reviews.Author: Bill F.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled oysters...you dang right! This was perfect for lunch. And I couldn't have asked for a better introduction to oysters than the chargrilled bad boys from the Acme Oyster House.

Reviews.Author: Max B.
Reviews.Content: It was ok. This place has received much fan fair. It was decent. The wait is to long for such high expectation. I did have the charbroiled oysters for the first time at this place. They are really good especially with crackers and a little hot sauce. I them had the po-boy (shrimp, oyster and clam) I believe was the in it. There menu states they are known for this sandwich, it was OK. The breading did not hold up on the seafood and it was very grainy (Corn mealy) I'm sure their other options are better then what I had.

Reviews.Author: Tanishia W.
Reviews.Content: Ok so didnt have that great of a story at Felixs sooooo I decide to go rigt across the street to ACME and let me tell you there is no comparison when it comes to the Chargrilled oysters. They were fresh bright in color with the bubbling cheese and butter YUMSTERSSSS threw some hot sauce and lemon and was in the game. I shared with my girls and they ended up ordering some as well...I told ya lol...I also had the fried crawtails the remoulade sauce was a bit salty but still good. The boo fries were good and the crawfish puppies yes I tried everyones food oh yes and the Jambalaya was not bad either(one of my friends tried Jambalaya at every restaurant and this was the winner). Fruit punch wasnt so fruity. oh heres a tip go for whatever comes available most times you get a table..There will be a line so be prepared.

Reviews.Author: Ruth G.
Reviews.Content: Queue was 45 minutes. Don't think the service was brilliant. We ordered raw (on ice) oysters & chargrilled. Kids had the Boo Fries. For some reason we ended up with a platter of a dozen fried oysters with hush-puppies too. I felt sick. Too much. And it took ages for our drinks to come. Not impressed.

Reviews.Author: Todd S.
Reviews.Content: I will make this simple. If you like oysters, 5 stars. If you don't then I guess that is why you see some 3-4 star reviews.

Reviews.Author: Gordon B.
Reviews.Content: As touristy as it gets, but for a reason. Nothing better than sitting at the marble  bar, drinking beer, eating oysters and talking with the oysters shuckers. The wait at 8pm on a Monday night in February was about 20 minutes.

Reviews.Author: Tram T.
Reviews.Content: Seafood is not appealing to me so why am I writing a review for an Oyster house? Simply because they have the best Bloody Mary! I was here a little be for NYE and was looking for a place to dine.  I didn't realize Acme was right by my hotel.  I was going to come by with company for dinner but the line was ridiculous so I suggested we come back the next day for lunch.  The line was still ridiculous the next day for lunch but because it was our last day I said why not wait.  We sat at the bar and met Master Shuckler "Stormin" Norman.  He definitely is the highlight of our time at Acme.  Such a friendly man and told us many different stories while shuckling those oysters.  We ordered baked oysters which were simply amazing, juicy and full of flavor.  Not to mention the oysters were HUGE!  (yes, that's what she said).  We also ordered crab bisque and you can really taste the fresh crab.  My favorite would have to be the bloody mary.  Just right and perfect.  There are so many other restaurants in French Quarter that I would love to try but Acme is probably one I will come back and visit often.  Having friendly employees really make a difference for businesses and I am glad I met master shuckler, "Stormin".   Next time you're by French Quarter, I suggest stopping by Acme for their baked oysters and bloody mary.

Reviews.Author: Michelle M.
Reviews.Content: Amazing service, amazing oysters, amazing experience.I'm not a picky eater, but I was still a little unsure about oysters.  I'd had them before once or twice, drowned in cocktail sauce.  A little hesitantly, we ordered a half dozen raw to start with, and I ordered their famed oyster po-boy for my entree.The raw oysters were a pleasant surprise; extremely fresh tasting without any sand or grit that you can get from other places.  I threw a little hot sauce on one and that was perfect!  The oyster po-boy was an entirely different beast - fried gloriousness - but awesome in its own right.  I'm not a huge fan of fried food (okay, I am, but I hate the way it makes me feel afterward so I usually avoid it) but the batter on these oysters was not greasy at all.  Crunchy, with a slightly spicy kick to it.To top it off, the waiter was really efficient and friendly.  He refilled our drinks before I even realized the glasses were missing from the table.  We don't get that kind of service in New York, especially at an affordable restaurant like this.

Reviews.Author: Eric M.
Reviews.Content: I must state before the meat of the review that I have a bias: having had Northwest oysters in Seattle and Louisiana oysters in NOLA before, there is no fucking comparison at all.  NW oysters beat the living crap out of LA oysters in taste, texture, freshness, you name it.  So if you are fond of NW oysters, go here knowing you will get a different animal.That being said, the oysters were good and fresh...try both the BBQ and half shell.  They're both very good.  My soft shell crab po' boy was GREAT.    Although, they need a grilled shrimp po' boy or something...every option seemed to be fried.  Which is fine, but I already am starting to look like Bubba The Greasy Shirted Truck Drivin' Deer Huntin' Fatass Redneck.  I need to return to my semi-svelte snobby wine sippin' California self.-1 star for the rushed service.  We asked for water when we sat down.  It came halfway through our main courses and after two more requests.But, if in NOLA, ya gotta.

Reviews.Author: El G.
Reviews.Content: This place was great.  It had exactly what we were expecting and needed after a weekend of "fine dining" in New Orleans.  Their baked oysters were ridiculous.  I'm not sure what they do to them to make them taste so damn good, but I want to learn how to make love the way that they bake their oysters.This is a perfect "last day in NOLA" meal while your stomach is still catching up and your ass is a little sore from riding the mechanical bull.

Reviews.Author: blake d.
Reviews.Content: Acme has a welcoming atmosphere to a city guy.  Old, not much natural light, bustling, and kind of dirty like every bar should be.I ate here twice for quick lunches.  My first experience was better.  Seated at the oyster bar, the shucker was quite friendly.  After serving me 10 oysters (I ordered the half dozen) he asked how I enjoyed them.  "I dont touch 'em," he replied to my favorable review.  It was pretty funny.I also had the seafood gumbo and their signature po'boy, which were both decent.Go for oysters and beer.

Reviews.Author: Angelinaaah h.
Reviews.Content: The food is okay. We shared a plate of grilled oysters and gumbo and thought everything was just okay. Not bad, but not good either. Just okay. I also had an oyster shooter which was really strong. All vodka and an oyster. Hardly a smooth experience. Honestly, if you're here on vacation, I'd skip it and look for some better food.

Reviews.Author: Harold S.
Reviews.Content: Good food , good portions,  and the service was fairly fast.  They are all about flipping covers at this place (for all you professional eaters out there)One recommendation, if you have to wait outside for a table, you have a lot of options in the Quarter.

Reviews.Author: Cassie C.
Reviews.Content: Went on a Saturday night with my boyfriend and some of his friends, and waited for about 40 minutes...there are a couple bars close by, so just grabbed a couple drinks and waited in line.Ordered the charbroiled oysters and they were great, loved the touch of cheese.However the Chicken & Andoullie gumbo I ordered was not good. Was tasteless when I put it in my mouth but left a burning feeling in my throat after swallowing...Service was rushed, and the waitress left our cups unfilled even after walking past the table several times.And the table where we sat had a lot of foot traffic coming through and I kept getting hit in the head with people arms, purses, strollers, etc... Overall- Good Oysters, but probably won't be back. I'm not usually such a party poooper but it just wasn't my night.

Reviews.Author: Jazz D.
Reviews.Content: Great oysters are rare, especially if you live in California as I do.  We get these stupid little greasy things that no sane person should ever eat.  If you want OYSTERS, you have to go to the Gulf . . . to Appalachicola Bay, to be precise.  New Orleans practically bleeds oysters, what with all the PoBoys and deep fried lunch plates.  And it's all good.  But Acme has a line on the biggest, most succulent molluscs you'll find in NOLA.  Now, I admit:  it's a bit touristy.  If it wasn't it probably wouldn't survive.  Sucking dollars outa tourist wallets is a time honored tradition in the big easy.  And the line that forms out on the sidewalk at peak hours is tedious.  But the end result is worth it.  I usually just ask to sit at the bar and rarely have to wait to be seated.  Also, the oysters get there quicker, too.  Go get yerself a dozen raw ones and slurp them down with a little cocktail sauce, horseradish and hot sauce.  Oysters are for love.

Reviews.Author: Vince H.
Reviews.Content: It's right off canal street in the western part of the French Quarter. Go there for seafood. I recommend going a little early because the line builds quickly.What to order: Louisiana oysters are meaty and with a touch of sweetness. They're not the most delicate of oysters but definitely delicious. However, the shuckers will usually place the oyster in mud to facilitate shucking.Tip: Use the fork provided unless you like your oysters extremely earthy.

Reviews.Author: Dave M.
Reviews.Content: Acme Oyster House is always my first stop when I visit New Orleans. But the best thing on the menu is not what you would expect. It's the Roast Beef PoBoy. I know it doesn't seem right. TRUST ME. You have never had a sandwich like this.Order it and let me know how right I am. ;~D

Reviews.Author: Adam S.
Reviews.Content: This is old school. hmmmm.... what can I tell you that hasn't been said.Lines are long - but worth it. (and they move fast).I like sitting at the bar better then the tables...Good beer list.Great people.Etouffee was good.Good oyster prices.It is an institution... worth checking out once.  I have been there every trip to New Orleans and will continue to go back.

Reviews.Author: Jon K.
Reviews.Content: If you want good raw oysters, walk next door and eat at Bourbon House.The raw oysters at Acme are huge!  They are also flavorless blobs that leave you completely unsatisfied.  I would never eat them again.However, after they got the grill working again, I ordered the grilled oysters with butter and cheese.  I most definitely would return for those.  They took those aforementioned blobs of goo and grilled them in butter with cheese.  A killer combination for sure, but everything tastes better with butter and cheese!Note, I sat at the bar and tried to engage the shuckers in conversation.  Never met a more surly bunch.  Just really no good reason to go to Acme in my opinion...

Reviews.Author: Jim S.
Reviews.Content: This place was fun and the food was excellent. The grilled oysters were off the charts. Sit at the bar and chat with the shuckers - they were hilarious.Also, a warning: make sure to ask what an "oyster shooter" is before ordering one!!!

Reviews.Author: Catherine B.
Reviews.Content: I love fresh oysters on the half shell and this is a great place to come to get some. The price is so fair, it's ridiculous. Yes, there is a line. It goes quickly, so be patient. They have good gumbo -- try the chicken and Andouille sausage. This is one of my favorite snack places.My order of have dozen raw oysters was $7.49, you cannot go wrong.

Reviews.Author: Marcus F.
Reviews.Content: Oysters. The raw oysters were fresh and divine. We had the oyster po-boy which was also excellent. At first the ratio of bread to filling seemed too high. (Too much bread.) But as soon as you pick it up the bread deflates and a few bites later you wish you had more. The charbroiled oysters were pretty good and came out with cheese baked on top. The fried shrimp po-boy wasn't much to speak of but I did discover that fried shrimp with a round of pickle is quite good.The line. We were lucky enough to arrive at an off time so we were able to get seated right away, however we walked by it many times since and the line can be quite tremendous. So go when you aren't quite hungry yet.

Reviews.Author: Lisa M.
Reviews.Content: Last November my friend and I traveled to LA for an ASHA convention. Upon landing we were tired and hungry! After yelping places to eat downtown we decided on eating at the Acme Oyster House because of their good ratings and the pictures that kept you drooling over their food!We waited a while outside but would have waited longer if we did not decide to eat at the bar top. Our waiter was a friendly guy named Steve(?) who chucked oysters the entire time. He was awesome! He knew we weren't locals so he gave us suggestions on nightlife (where to go and where to stand clear from) and even introduced me to my first LA's brewed beer: the andygator! I ordered a pohboy (because I saw it on Man vs. Food and it looked delish) and it was amazing! Best part was it was affordable! After eating the pohboy, I was stuffed so I took an Andygator to-go and drank it while exploring the streets of downtown NOLA.I would totally eat here again if I had future visits to New Orleans. And I recommend everyone stopping by and eating a few fresh oysters!! Heck, even take your very own andygator beer home with you (I took some to Cali!)

Reviews.Author: Neli S.
Reviews.Content: Hummmm... the charbroiled oysters were soooooo good!!!! and the raw oysters were really good as well. I had never had a po boy before, and was kinda disappointed. We had the shrimp one, but for me it was only OK. I don't know how it's supposed to be,but that on was only some fried shrimp inside a bun. It was tasting good, but not special. But hummmmmm.... the charbroiled oysters.........

Reviews.Author: Lucky L.
Reviews.Content: Their steamed crawfish is some of the best in NOLA. Great, fresh oysters, cold beer, etc.Don't get fancy and stick to the basics and you'll be pleased.

Reviews.Author: Kiristen R.
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find good authentic gumbo in the Bay Area. Actually, I'll say it's impossible to find authentic tasting gumbo in a restaurant in the Bay Area. What you can find is decent okra-chicken-sausage-seafoody impostor soup but no restaurant gumbo has that authentic Louisiana gumbo flavor. So while planning my vacation to New Orleans I turned to Yelp (yay Yelp) to find a restaurant with a good gumbo = Acme Oyster House. Mmmmmm mmmmm mmmmm. Perfect. Taste just like Mom's! Word of Caution: the line is down the block but it moves fast enough and you can drink to go beer in line while you wait Also, it isn't the cleanest restaurant. They wipe down the tables with the old kitchen rag but there's stuff on the floor etc. Still worth it though  I also ordered a whole bunch of other stuff: -Abita (the local beer) yum -Abita Strawberry also good -Fried Oyster Po' Boy = hella good -10 napkin sandwich = hella good. Tons of meat in a gravy sauce. Devoured by my husband -Fried Crawfish - I prefer steamed or boiled but these were good and nicely seasoned -Fresh oysters - this did not impress. They are bigger than pacific oysters but they have a creamy texture. I missed the ocean salty flavor that pacific oysters have -Pecan Cobbler - tastes like pecan praline. Diabetes in a bowl but worth it! -bread puddling - meh. Can't stand up to the pecan cobbler Best Part of the Meal: GUMBO!! - mmmm gumbo. I made the mistake of getting a small side with my oyster po' boy and then I was too full to order another gumbo. Whackness on my part. After leaving Acme all I could think of was the gumbo. I considered going back the next day but hubby and I had to leave for a cruise and would be back in New Orleans in a week but only for a few hours. Not enough time to go back to Bourbon Street. Luckily (so I thought) there's an Acme Oyster House in the airport. (Reviewing that place next - don't go to the one in the airport) GUMBO!

Reviews.Author: Kari P.
Reviews.Content: I last (and first!) visited New Orleans over Easter 2008, where I wandered lots, ate more, and cried a bit, too.Each and every meal was delicious, but Acme was so great, and such a good value (much-needed after a great Cochon dinner), that we came twice in 36 hours!!Fresh oysters, oysters rockefeller, barbequed oysters, garlic parmesan oysters, boo fries, chowder, Abita, whiskey -- so good, I'm still thinking about these meals, two years later.

Reviews.Author: Karla F.
Reviews.Content: I came here a few years ago while on vacation and was super excited to get back. I'm not an oyster fan but this place always has plenty on the menu to make me happy.The seating line always moves quickly and they accomodate large parties really well. Our server was great and my jambalaya was SUPERB!If you have little ones in tow, they have a well-rounded menu of sides so you don't have to commit to a full meal for a toddler. Love it!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie J.
Reviews.Content: Please don't be deterred by the line wrapped around Iberville....it moves quickly! Matter of fact, make friends with the people around you, because you may be sitting at the same table.  What do I recommend?  Like everyone else- the Chargrilled Oysters! Amazing...trust.  The potato salad is pretty DELISH as well.  By the way, the place smells like salt water....so you know the Oysters are fresh! lol

Reviews.Author: Tabitha M.
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time eating here. First time was a few years ago and I had the seafood etouffee which was alright.  This time we'd just gotten in from our flight and checked into our hotel. When we asked the guy at the front desk where to go he suggested Acme. I was hesitant but since the rest of the group was up for it  and I lacked a better option and it was close so we went.  I know this place can get crazy busy with the line out around the block.  Thankfully we had no trouble getting in. The lady at the door was super friendly and encouraged me to give the chargrilled oysters a try this time even though I have never been an oyster fan in the past.Sooo since we had 6 people we ordered a dozen of them.  Let me just say YUM YUM YUM.  I should have just ordered some more of these. I ordered a cup of gumbo which was alright. I am not a huge gumbo person anyway.  My bf said it was tasty and he actually likes gumbo.haha. One of the other couples got the roast beef po boy which they said was really good and looked good. Don't remember what the other 2 people go but they all said their food was tasty as well. Service was quick, food was hot, I should probably give it 4 stars just for the chargrilled oysters but since I am not that keen on the other options I have trouble doing it. So I'll say 3.5 stars.  But I'll definitely go back again for the oysters.

Reviews.Author: Esther Y.
Reviews.Content: The food here is definitely worth the wait! You MUST start off with the chargrilled oysters! The cheese on the oyster was bubbly and even someone who does not like oysters will absolutely love these! We also shared the fried crab claws. They were breaded and fried to perfection! Beware of the marinara sauce that comes with these, the horseradish is potent!Look on the menu for the starred specialty items. I tried the fried peace-maker po-boy. Half is stuffed full of deep fried oysters and the other half with fried shrimp. The texture is different on each side and everything is well-seasoned. He tried the New Orleans Medley. The gumbo and jambalaya were just mediocre, but the sausage was spicy and burst with flavor. On a trip to NOLA, this is a must-go destination. We were planning to make a stop before our flight back home just to get an order of the grilled oysters, but there was a slight issue with not bringing your own canned drink into the restaurant. Luckily, there is a location in the airport. Although the prices are higher than at the other locations, it is worth satisfying your craving! We got 2 shrimp po boys to go and gobbled them up before the flight!

Reviews.Author: Michelle T.
Reviews.Content: Acme is one of those places that everyone says you have to go to when you're in New Orleans.  So for the our first meal in NOLA, we decided to come here base on all the great YELP reviews.The jambalaya and chargrilled oysters were good but not great.  Service was ok (at best).  We didn't understand what all the hoopla was about in the reviews we had read.  Maybe our expectations were too high.  Fortunately we didn't have to wait long for a table.  With all the dinning options in NOLA, don't waste your time.

Reviews.Author: Phoenix R.
Reviews.Content: We've heard good things so we decided to pay a visit. We were just about to leave because the line was looking like a two hour wait but the hostess told us they had two seats at the bar. We took them quickly making our overall wait time less than five minutes.We take a seat and were immediately greeted by two friendly bartenders (who's names I sadly, don't remember).We tried a half-dozen of the charbroiled oysters since we weren't sure if we'd like them but let me tell you, a half dozen was NOT enough. It was one of the best things I've ever eatten!We had the seafood platter (catfish, shrimp, and oysters) with fries and hushpuppies which was also great!Along with the amazing food and wait-staff we were poured some excellent drinks which were not light on the alcohol. We also drank few differnet drinks that the bartender had created herself. (she knew what she was doing!)We ended up paying around $100 for the two of us.  (A dozen charbroiled oysters, two seafood platters, and 3 drinks each alomg with tip.) So so so worth it. When I come back to NOLA this will most definitly be a place I'll stop. I'll even wait in the long line!

Reviews.Author: Misty W.
Reviews.Content: It's all true...this place is the BEST!!!  We got the seafood gumbo, seafood ettouffe and the chargrilled oysters.  The gumbo was just ok, the ettouffe was wonderful and the chargrilled oysters were the bomb!!!

Reviews.Author: Tommy_n_Loretta C.
Reviews.Content: Try the Abita Andygator brew - it's 13% alcohol. Now THAT'S a beer!We spent the weekend in NOLA and went back to this place to eat - twice! My husband says the oysters are great and I certainly cannot get enough of the softshell crab poboy. Last time we visited was in October 2009 and we're heading back this weekend!!!

Reviews.Author: Robyn R.
Reviews.Content: Tourist trap type place in the French Quarter, but awesome location right off Bourbon. We did pre-dinner drinks here, free oysters as long as you are drinking beer? Yes please. Just do yourself a favor, and don't come here for an authentic new orleans meal. Go to K-Pauls - yum yum!Beware, lines start to form early so get here before 5 if you want to get a seat.

Reviews.Author: Q A.
Reviews.Content: WOW!!! Cheap and YUMMY Oysters! In San Francisco it would cost $28 for a dozen oysters but in New Orleans its $13.50!!! ANd you HAVE TO EAT IT the New Orleans Way or else it just isn't the same....Place it on a slice of saltine cracker which they always provide free on all the table, then place their WASABI sauce on there, an squeeze a lemon and there you have it....You put the whole thing in your mouth like sushi and wash it down with a chilled beer, wine, etc.MMMM, MMMM , MMMM!!! Don't go for anything else...just their oysters and drinks :) You can bet I had more than a two dozen...and I WENT THERE THREE TIMES during my trip to NOLA! THREE TIMESLet me calculate now that I'm back in the City...I just saved myself $200 worth of oysters! Oh plus maybe $10 worth of saltime crackers :)ACME I miss you!

Reviews.Author: Tom L.
Reviews.Content: Casual seafood restaurant near Bourbon Street.  Pretty cheap seafood.  A lot of deep fried stuff.  Not too casual though...

Reviews.Author: Karla g.
Reviews.Content: Five Stars. I would go back to NOLA just for one more meal here.Ambiance was fun! We sat next to some really great people and quickly befriended them.The oysters were large and succulent! The exceeded my expectation in every way. The service was great too.My friend and I split a Whole order of the raw oysters and an order of the Char-grilled oysters and we still talk about that meal.  If some one asked me whats the best meal I ever ate, I would have a hard time thinking of something else.mouth watering....

Reviews.Author: Jessah A.
Reviews.Content: Very reasonable price's. You get a lot for the price. Good Fish Po-Boy! Will come back here again next time we go back to New Orleans! Great customer service! Not sure what everything else on the menu taste like, but it sure looks very delicious.  Thumbs up!

Reviews.Author: Stefano G.
Reviews.Content: Omg. Be ready to wait in line outside the restaurant. We loved the friendly staff and made new friends while sharing a large table! For starters we had soup & gumbo. The oysters Rockefeller soup is off the chart. Best soup in a long , long time! The gumbo just ok! If you are interested in a captains platte,r AKA fried fish & shrimp,I'd suggest fish only!   Btw the broiled Oysters are yummy!

Reviews.Author: Jenna L.
Reviews.Content: We were a little scared to go here, because of the oil spill and shortage of oysters. We thought maybe they would be more pricey than normal because of the shortage. We were assured by everyone that the seafood was untainted from the spill, so we believed them wholeheartedly. We went in and beat the line by a few minutes. We had a seat at the bar, next to a guy doing the oyster challenge (15 dozen club.. recently finished by Man vs. Food's Adam Richman). We started with one last shrimp po'boy and some raw oysters.After a little while, and when most of our food was all gone, the guys behind the bar strongly recommended the grilled oysters, which is what I wanted all along anyway ;) These were so freaking good. Butter and some kind of sauce that was super good, spicy almost... but suuuuper good. Grilled over raw for sure. Loved the oysters.When we left we grabbed a po'boy to go and destroyed it as soon as we got back to Texas. YUM! LOVE NOLA, when can I go back???

Reviews.Author: Jay K.
Reviews.Content: The Acme Oyster House on Iberville is a popular restaurant in the French Quarter that I had yet to try on any of my previous trips to New Orleans. Their namesake implies an orientation around oysters, but they have a wide-ranging menu that also includes typical New Orleans dishes (gumbo, seafood étouffée, jumbalaya, po' boys, etc.) as well as fried seafood preparations, including soft-shell crab.Atmosphere is a bit cramped and the restaurant is very dark. When I first walked in, the place smelled funny. After a few minutes, I got used to it, but it is initially off-putting.My lunch would be a half dozen chargrilled oysters ($11.50), a side of hush puppies ($2.25), and a bloody mary ($5.50).Acme's chargrilled oysters were very good - and similar to the charbroiled oysters I have previously had at Drago's. In this dish, the oysters are covered in a garlic butter sauce, sprinkled with parmesan (or romano?) cheese, and then grilled. Acme serves their oysters with a few pieces of white bread to mop up the buttery sauce left in the shells. I prefer Drago's charbroiled oyster dish, which seems to use more heat, resulting in a richer taste due to the resulting fond that sticks to the shell. This is obviously a knock-off of that.One of my oysters had a small pearl in it, a first for me.The hush puppies were good as well, though not special - straightforward, and about what you'd expect.Their bloody mary was a huge disappointment. In a city where I never had a bad bloody mary, Acme produced the first of those for me. It was appropriately spicy, but seemed like there were multiple ingredients missing (horseradish? lime juice? not enough tomato juice?), resulting in a thin cocktail that tasted nothing like the bloody marys I've had anywhere else in New Orleans.The highlight of my meal (sitting at the bar), however, was the friendly barstaff who made an effort to talk to everyone, and really do exude the genteel hospitality that this city is known for.

Reviews.Author: Samuel B.
Reviews.Content: I had the privilege of going to this place twice during my stay in New Orleans.  The line can be a little time consuming so I recommend coming early.  Once you're seated though, it's completely worth the wait. The service is exceptional. All the servers, waiters, waitresses, pretty much the entire staff is absolutely welcoming and accomodating.  Love that about this place.  The atmosphere is awesome.  The oysters are the obvious attraction.  I recommend the chargrilled oysters with the parmesan cheese sprinkled on top, which by the time it gets to your table has developed this nice crust on the oysters. Mmm my mouth is watering just thinking about this plate.  The po-boy sandwiches are pretty good also, and depending on the size of your appepite, try the seafood bisque soup before your entree.  In any event, whatever you choose, you will absolutely enjoy this place. Cheers.

Reviews.Author: Nikki L.
Reviews.Content: Every time we come to NOLA, we eat here once. At $13.50/doz, the raw gulf oysters are fresh (shucked when you order them), clean, and worth the money. I've had tons of raw oysters from all over the US, and these aren't the best ones i've had, but they are pretty darn good for the $. The oyster bar is right out in the open so you can see everything. There are a few other places in NOLA that also serve raw gulf oysters, but you don't know if they are as fresh because you can't see them in the kitchen. This last trip, I tried crawfish etoufee from every restaurant we went to, and Acme Oyster House made their Seafood Etouffee pretty good. Also, not at the top of my list, but the gumbo, jambalaya and shrimp po-boy were okay and sufficient if you are looking to get the "NOLA experience". I just come here for the pub/seafood atmosphere with fresh oysters and a cold beer. Note: Come during off peak hours, like between lunch and dinner, to avoid the long line at the door.

Reviews.Author: Dan H.
Reviews.Content: Great spot for some raw oysters. The guys shucking oysters at the bar were super friendly. The chargrilled oysters had a little too much cheese and seasoning for my taste, but overall it was a great place to stop.

Reviews.Author: Ted S.
Reviews.Content: Five stars for the roasted oysters.  These are just amazing.  Everything else was just okay.

Reviews.Author: Albert S.
Reviews.Content: Heard about this place from my father who likes to look things up when I tell him I'm going somewhere. :)  Glad he told me about this.  The Chargrilled Oysters are amazing.  Had multiple orders because they were so good.  The place itself isn't all that impressive, but definitely come for the food.

Reviews.Author: Shannon B.
Reviews.Content: We stopped here on a whim for seafood one night.  There was a line, but it moved quickly and we were seated at the bar within 15 minutes.  My husband loves oysters, and decided to try the char-grilled oysters they are known for.  He fell in love.  The garlic, butter, cheese combo made him a very happy man.  The po boys are quite good as well. We tried another restaurant a few nights later, and tried the char-grilled oysters there.  They were horrible, and we ended up back at Acme the same night so we could end our vacation on a high note.

Reviews.Author: Shannon T.
Reviews.Content: 1 dozen chargrilled oysters, 1 dozen raw, cup of gumbo, beer great conversation= perfect Nola dinner. Did you see the size of those oysters? I left so full and happy!

Reviews.Author: Shannon L.
Reviews.Content: We have come here a couple times when we're down in the quarter.. The Fried Crawfish tails are good.. Our bartender Pam was very nice, but others seemed to not be too happy.. I'd come back again to try the fried oysters.

Reviews.Author: Wasim R.
Reviews.Content: My first night in NOLA and I had to go to Acme's. I read great reviews on it. The line was on the sidewalk and that's usually a good sign that the food is good. I ordered the sampler plate with Jambalaya, craw-fish etouffee, seafood gumbo and an andouille sausage. I've had Jambalaya before, but never the real thing. I'd never had Gumbo or craw-fish etouffee. When the plate came i was a little disappointed at the portion sizes. I guess that's normal for a sampler plate though. The food was amazing. I was instantly hooked on Cajun food. Everything was cooked to perfection and the flavors were amazing. I honestly could not tell you which one to pick if you had to just get one.After that I was still a little hungry and I was also being greedy. I ordered a half dozed Char-grilled Oysters. I've had Oysters before, but never this way. All i can say is OMG!!! I ate Char-grilled Oysters everyday the whole time i was there. This is an absolute must have. Aside from the great food, the staff was very friendly and took good care of me. If you've never been here and you're in NOLA then stop reading this and get down there now!!!

Reviews.Author: Jacqueline L.
Reviews.Content: Yum! My favorite meal on our food tour of new Orleans :) we got oysters, chargrilled and raw, seafood étouffée with a side of fried crawfish tails and 2 oyster shooters. We tried Felix's the night before... And this place wins for atmosphere, service, and drinks! Delicious variety. Please make a stop here if you ever get the chance to visit NOLA!

Reviews.Author: Vicky R.
Reviews.Content: Another restaurant no one had mentioned to me to go to.  My husband had noticed the line to this place the first night in town and said we have to give that place a try.  So glad we did, hangover and all.  We were there by noon and only stood in line to sit at the bar for like 5 minutes.  We sat right up front where Man vs. Food did in his episode watching the guys shuck the oysters.  Although, we didnt realize Man vs Food was here until after the fact.  My husband had ordered us a dozen of oysters to split.  Also, let me mention to you that I had only had one raw oyster my whole life previously and I was told to swallow it, so I did.  Like a shot.  This time I did it the right way and absolutely loved them!  I was swallowing these oysters down like a pro!I had ordered Fried Soft Shell Crab Platter for 1 w/ Sweet Potatoe Fries.  My husband ordered I think a fried crawfish PoBoy and a side of Gumbo.  I loved my plated, it was very delish and I had never had a better sweet potato fry, damn those were good!  My hubby, he loved his as well.  I had a bite but I am not into PoBoys.  The gumbo, eh...good but had better.  But still good.

Reviews.Author: Orlando M.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled Oysters and the ACME Special Po Boy are must haves!

Reviews.Author: Jon C.
Reviews.Content: The grilled oysters are better than people brag them to be. I highly recommend the 10 napkin roast beef sandwich. The raw oysters aren't as good as Desire.

Reviews.Author: Joe C.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled Oysters are great. and I loved the shrimp Po-boy sandwich. A must go if your in New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: Kim W.
Reviews.Content: Wondered in here after walking the scary streets of NOLA..I think I would've enjoyed my food more if I hadn't been harassed just a few min earlier by some beggars. We ordered the medley, oysters on the half shell and the charbroiled oysters. The gumbo in the medley was really good! My husband enjoyed it very much which is a shocker because he is a Mac n cheese and burger kind of guy. He also loved the charbroiled oysters!!!!!! I did too!!! Thought they were really good and I'm glad we had a chance to try them! Side note: hubby is not a fan of oysters or seafood but loved these...also, the fresh oysters were ok - I agree with another yelper, they were too plump for my taste and did taste farmed. Other than that..the charbroiled oysters are definitely a go to for this place!

Reviews.Author: David D.
Reviews.Content: Let me get this out of the way , the char-grilled oysters were amazing but on the small side. The Boo fries were awesome but a little salty. Everything else was average at best including the service. I had the New Orleans Medley which had jambalaya, gumbo, and red beans and rice. The gumbo was good, the jambalaya had zero taste, and the red beans was more like re-fried beans and rice. My Bloody Mary was good but came in a 12oz plastic cup.

Reviews.Author: Gina K.
Reviews.Content: Oysters.  Get them.  That's it.  You don't need anything else.

Reviews.Author: Jim B.
Reviews.Content: Touristy, but still has some class and style. Oysters are great, beer selection not bad, but could use more local beers on tap.

Reviews.Author: Joe H.
Reviews.Content: Best meal we had while at New Orleans, and it was not even the most expensive.  We ordered grilled oyster (yum), crab patter, and Ettoufee, as well as a bread-pudding dessert.  All are good, and service is, well, quite lively.  Only drawback is the long lines sometimes during dinner time, but otherwise I would go back and visit the restaurant again if I am ever in the same area.

Reviews.Author: Ryan W.
Reviews.Content: ACME I felt was a bit over rated.  Probably because I built my hopes up so high for this place and left with only a satisfactory feeling.  The food was good, but good is the baseline for cuisine in New Orleans.  The staff was extremely thorough and the line to get a table was not nearly as long as it looked.

Reviews.Author: Amy C.
Reviews.Content: Made the trip to NOLA a total hoot! Must see Stormin Norman!

Reviews.Author: ralph a.
Reviews.Content: absolutely one of the WORST restaurants in the city! BLECH!!!!Horrible food, and the surliest staff anywhere. definitely not worth waiting in line for even 5 seconds.Note that most of the better reviews are from tourists, who really have no idea what good new orleans food is.What is with all you touristas who think that this represents good new orleans food.....ya'll need your heads examined! this would insult even the worse n'awlins cook!Better choices are: (anyplace else), Dragos, Felix, or Deanies

Reviews.Author: Cathaleya C.
Reviews.Content: I have never had any raw oysters that were better than this!  I got greedy and must have had about 24 of them with some of the best hot sauce and lemons on this planet.When I'm down here in New Orleans, again, this is where you will find me.

Reviews.Author: Bing S.
Reviews.Content: I usually don't like oysters with their slippery and raw bodies and sharp shells and cold cold hearts.   However i do love the grilled oysters here!  taste like butter!  with cheese!  the absolute caloric content of one of these things can keep you up partying on bourbon street for days! not a fan of crawfish.  i'm not very adept at handling aquatic arthropods with my bare hands.

Reviews.Author: Tommy L.
Reviews.Content: I like this place. A causal laid-back vibe. I had the oysters for starters, but I should have tried the chargrilled ones. Then I had a combo platter of fried shrimp and crab cake. They were good, nothing amazing but solid. The GF had the shrimp po-boy, she was drunk and just ate the shrimp off the sandwich. I believe she liked it. Should have tried more different items but there's always a next time. Service was decent. Good portion and decent prices. It does tend to get crowed with a long waiting line. Nice place to kick back and eat.

Reviews.Author: Kandi W.
Reviews.Content: Sweet Jesus the best oysters I have ever had in my life!This place makes my top ten best restaurant list. The food is amazing. Hush puppies to die for, crispy and delicious soft shell crab, great drinks, succulant shrimp, and oysters from heaven. When you go visit New Orleans this should be your first stop hands down.

Reviews.Author: I N.
Reviews.Content: I am a true glutton and this was my last meal in N'awlins before my flight out, and what a way to end a fantastic trip. Since I walked in knowing that I would not have a chance to go anywhere else, I really made this meal count by ordering litterally everything I thought sounded good...and this is how it went:1 dozen fresh oysters - as with every place I went to, ultra fresh, sweet and delicious1/2 dozen char grilled oysters - freaking amazing, just get them. I would have ordered more if i had the room...1lb of crawfish - biggest crawfish this Cali kid has seen...and the most flavorful as well1 Bowl of gumbo - no matter where I am, if gumbo is on the menu, I am eating it and this was one of the better one's I have hadSoftshell crab po'boy w/ fries - how can this NOT be great? If I HAD to be picky, the bread was a little thick...or it could just be that I have major issues and should not be eating this much...After all that, and yes I really did eat all of that on my own in one sitting as my friends watched in horror, I munched on some of my friends' leftovers. The hush puppies were good, the other po'boys weren't as good as my softshell crab one but still good, and the jambalaya was awesome. Some people have told me this place is a little too touristy but I loved every gluttonous bite. Next time maybe I should try the oyster challenge.....

Reviews.Author: Lindsay C.
Reviews.Content: Let me start off my saying that I'm not sure if I can give the most accurate review of this restaurant because I am not a fried food fan, and the majority of food on this menu is fried. Fried catfish po'boy, fried crawfish po'boy, fried oysters...you get the picture. The atmosphere is kind of half sports bar, half restaurant. There were definitely tourists (it is in the quarter) but you could tell there were locals also enjoying the food. Service was friendly. Beer selection was decent. I ordered the fried crawfish tail po'boy. Mostly breading, very little crawfish, but overall good seasoning. My husband ordered the half shrimp, half catfish po'boy. He enjoyed the catfish half better. We also tried the barbecued oysters which had a nice char-grilled flavor. The raw oysters (which we did not try) are apparently pretty good too. Bottomline, if you like fried food and you are looking for decent food and friendly service, stop by while you are in the quarter. Word of warning...there can be a long wait. Personally I don't think its worth standing in line for more than 20 minutes.

Reviews.Author: A B.
Reviews.Content: I had wanted to try Acme on Saturday night but the line was out the door.  So on my way back from dinner tonight - I noticed there was no line and had to give it a try.  What a mistake it was!  I just ordered a half -dozen raw oysters and a beer.  The oysters had sand and debris - all six-  an they were not tasty.  I had oysters at Luke Restaurant and they were by far so much more exceptional! I didn't even botherfinishing the beer - just wanted to leave the place. Not worth the wait for the raw oysters.

Reviews.Author: Mark H.
Reviews.Content: The service was good at our first table but we moved because they sat us next to a trash can in the back of the bar that had an aweful smell of stale beer. We were moved to the oyster bar and the servers there were not very friendly. When you are that close to your patrons, it is a good idea to be somewhat open to communication. It seemed as if we were a bother to them.Being from Thibodaux La.,  which is 60 miles S/W of New Orleans, I know good RAW oysters and these are not them.  Sure they are huge and fresh and clean but they are flavorless. I ordered 3 dozen. 2 for me and 1 for my date. After the first dozen, it was like I was eating bland blobs of flesh. Not impressed at all w/ their RAW oysters. My date also ordered an oyster poboy and I will say this, it was one of the best I have ever had. The fried oysters were unreal, golden crispy and very flavorful. I say visit here for the fried oyster poboys and gumbo and cheap beer but eat the raw oysters elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: Austin Y.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic oysters, great price, right around Bourbon Street , what more do you want?Acme Oyster House is definitely an institution for New Orleans.  I've been to the great city twice and each time people from all over ask whether I've been to Acme.  Yes I have, and yes, it is fabulous.The oysters are incredibly fresh, I had them raw, but the charbroiled ones looked amazing.    I also had the hush puppies and soft shell crab po boy, fantastic.  This meal was so good I even had to have it in the New Orleans Airport before I left.  I like to save the po boy and eat it halfway through the flight, just to make the other passengers jealous.  If you are ever in the French Quarter and want really good food, head on down to Acme.

Reviews.Author: Rox P.
Reviews.Content: I was in NOLA for a week and went to Acme twice during my visit.  Yes, there is a line to get in but worth waiting.  After checking into my hotel and saying hi to my friend our next stop Acme.  We waited 5 minutes in line - it was 9pm - didn't have to wait long.  Be ready it's pretty loud and crowded in the place.We ordered dozen raw oysters, deep friend crawfish, deep fried oysters and a cup of gumbo.  We had a pitcher of local beer to go with our meal - local beer was amazingly a good company to the food. The raw oysters were sweet and fresh - it's a must have.  The deep fried oysters and crawfish - meh - not a fan of deep fried - nothing special - my friend loved it with the dipping sauce.  The gumbo was ok.  Definitely order the raw oysters - it was worth it - fresh and sweet.  To finish off the meal have the bread pudding - warm and oozing of caramel flavor.

Reviews.Author: Steph O.
Reviews.Content: If I ever go to NOLA again, I'll definitely hit up Acme Oyster House again!  Long lines, but with a large beer in my hand from one of the bars nearby, the time flew! - Raw oysters - It was my first time eating raw oysters...ever.  And I must say, they were pretty tasty.  - Steamed crawfish - I got my friend to peel one for me (hehe) and it was delicious!   - Craw puppies - crispy on the outside, soft on the inside.  The sauce was also yumminess! - New Orleans Medley - we got to try a little bit of other popular items they serve with this dish.  - And for dessert, Bread pudding - can't go wrong with bread pudding.  The staff is also very friendly.  Trust me, my friends and I were asking lots of questions about what things are and what's good.  Good times! :)

Reviews.Author: Fred S.
Reviews.Content: Wasn't what we expected, all tables were family style meaning if your looking for a party of 2 on a Weekend your going to wait a VERY long time. Our waiter was rude and gave us the look of "You Cheap SOB's" when we ordered 2 orders of oysters, he wasnt a happy camper. They oysters are good but everything else was marginal

Reviews.Author: Christine C.
Reviews.Content: This place is heaven! This is the place to be to eat raw Oysters! They are HUMONGOUS!! If there is one thing you have to do before you die, you must visit New Orleans and eat ACME's Oysters!! This place has Po Boy sandwiches, Jambalaya, Baked Oysters, Oysters on a half shell and so much Fried stuff you can afford to wait 45 minutes to get into the restaurant! Trust ME ITS WORTH the wait! My Picks: - 2 Dozen Raw Bar Oysters - Fried Soft Shell Crab Sandwich - Fried Po-Boy Sandwich

Reviews.Author: al a.
Reviews.Content: See my review on Flying Fish in Ft. Worth, TX.  That's right.  Ft. Worth,  TX.  As far remove it is from the water, they do raw oysters just as good.  Shouldn't I expect oysters in NOLA to be better?  Darn right, I should.  Good thing there is Cochon that serves wood-fired oysters better.The catfish fillets were larger though.  I preferred this to be smaller and hence crispier.  The red beans and rice was my favorite.

Reviews.Author: Kim L.
Reviews.Content: I suppose that if I liked oysters more, I'd be giving Acme a higher rating. But the non-oyster food, was just kinda of average. I did try the char-grilled oysters that were grilled in the shell and covered in seasoned butter and grated romano cheese. They were really good.. I actually had a few, which for me -- the non-oyster-eater -- was a big accomplishment and says a lot about how good these are. Then I had the Acme "10 Napkin Roast Beef" Po-boy. It was messy, but I made it through in six napkins... partly because the bottom bun was so soggy from mayo and tomato, that I couldn't pick it up after a while and finished it with a fork. Overall, it would have been a lot better with mustard instead of mayo, so I wasn't that impressed. However, the hush puppies that came with it were AMAZING! I could have just eaten a bunch of those and been a very happy camper. On a second trip here (so the group I was with could eat more oysters), I had half of a turkey Po-boy (with no mayo and no tomato... I learned my lesson) and fries. Much better experience with no mayo and was just enough food for late lunch.

Reviews.Author: Katherine P.
Reviews.Content: Their char-grilled oysters are like crack!Before we went to New Orleans, our friends had warned us about Acme's char-grilled oysters and they were right. So good! I'm not a huge oyster fan, but their char-grilled oysters are amazing. I had no idea that butter and romano cheese would be a perfect combination with grilled oysters. The oyster "juice" was so good, that we were practly licking it off the plate. But don't worry there are plenty more to eat. If your not up for tasting a little piece of heaven, then try the catfish po' boy. The cocktail sauce with fresh horseradish was a perfect combination with the deep fried catfish.Let me warn you! One hit is never enough. We went back for a second oyster helping during our three day trip to NOLA. Then, my husband actually had a third helping at the airport. Yep...crack.

Reviews.Author: Yonnie B.
Reviews.Content: The oysters are HUGE.  Maybe a touch bland compared to others I've had but still pretty tasty.The fried fish and calamari came lightly battered, deep fried at a perfect temperature so the fish came out juicy, cased in a thin, non oily, crispy shell.  The fish was definitely fresh.  No fishy smells here. Not the type of restaurant one could eat at too regularly - there are hardly any vegetables on the menu - but for what it is, it's very very good.

Reviews.Author: Izabella G.
Reviews.Content: This was a fun experience for a first timer in New Orleans. Luckily we came before the huge line formed outside, so we were immedietely seated at the bar. I'm a giant fan of oysters, being from the Pacific Northwest and now a New York City transplant, so I had to try them. Surprisingly they don't have varieties to choose from... They are just "oysters"...What kind, i have no idea....Anyway, my friend and I order a dozen raw oysters. They were well shucked and served quickly. There was plenty of lemon and a delicious cocktail sauce offered. Tabasco available on every table. I'm a bit of a purist so I just take a drop of lemon and a pinch of cocktail sauce. I have to admit that the oysters were huge and very filling. They were not the best but not the worse I've had...They were salty but not very briney (which I prefer). Still, among the large/huge sized oysters I've tried, these are the best. If you favorite oyster is kumamoto or a kushi, then you probably won't like these... Next time I'm going to try the chargrilled oysters...Not sure what that means but I love to try new things!

Reviews.Author: Trey C.
Reviews.Content: Not really much can be said that hasn't been said already...  We got there and the line was about 40 yards long...moved quickly though.  Got in and had the New Orleans Platter (or sampler, or something like that), and it was very good.  The table started with a couple dozen raw oysters and the boo fries...both awesome!  The oysters were larger than ones that we had at most of the other places in New Orleans.  The only complaint I heard from anyone was that they didn't have any grilled options...pretty much all fried...but who cares, he shouldn't have expected that anyways!Good place and definitely worth the wait...will be back next time I visit!

Reviews.Author: david h.
Reviews.Content: When I get to heaven, I just know there is going to be an Acme Oyster House on the corner of clouds 1 and 2. I always try to find something new every time I go out of town but when I go to New Orleans I ALWAYS go to Acme Oyster House. Otherwise my trip is ruined. They have the best oysters. I could eat a billion of them. People ooh and aah about the po-boys. The jambalaya is out of this world good. I can't think of anything that is not just the best. Great atmosphere and good, personable service. Don't let the line 30-50 deep outside the door deter you. Your patience will be rewarded. The way I see it, If you don't like Acme, that's one less person I have to stand behind in line. Smiley face and a star.

Reviews.Author: Jennie N.
Reviews.Content: I don't know what the hype of this place is, but there is a RiDONK-ULOUS line for this place that will have you waiting for at least an hour plus if you have a big party! Luckily one of our friends got us hooked up with free gumbo! It was definitely good since we had been waiting FOR-eva in the freezing cold. A very touristy place that you'll see many others line up for. Man VS. Food was also there as well...If anything you can try it out once if you've never been to NOLA.Food: My friend and I had gotten the Seafood Fried Platter. The only thing that was actually good was the catfish. Everything else was way too salty. They also had BOO FRIES! Yup you heard right, Boo Fries! Fries covered with gravy (from mashed potato gravy) and some sprinkled cheese. I'd have to say this was DeLish! We also go the SHOOTERS...do not get it, it was really gross going down (probably cuz the vodka was warm). Really bad after taste. Other than that lots of Poy Boy sandwiches, your typical fried southern comfort food or if you want get 'em Oysters cuz they do have it there.Ambiance: Loud and tables for your big parties or even your small ones.
