There's a front seating area and there's also one in the back. Great for groups, but if your aiming to go on an intimate date, probably not a good idea UNLESS that what you like. They also have flat screens every where so you can catch up on your latest sports. Service: Nice, quick and friendly!

Reviews.Author: Anthony D.
Reviews.Content: Probably the BEST oyster's I have ever had. We ordered a 1/2 dozen of the charbroiled oysters to start our meal, which came out quick and hot! Delicious, buttery and even came w/ a few slices of french bread to sop up the juices after. I ordered the oyster/shrimp po'boy with a side of red beans & rice and my gf got the catfish/shrimp platter with hush puppies. both dishes were really good.Although smaller than my po'boy from Johnnys Po'Boy, this one was a lot tastier (not to take anything away from Johnnys). The red beans were HELLA good, probably the best I ever had. My gf enjoyed her plate too. Her hush puppies were very light ad flavorful. The catfish had a nice crust and was very good.

Reviews.Author: Mark K.
Reviews.Content: Our first culinary conquest during a bachelor party set an uneasy precedence about restaurants in New Orleans: great food, meh service. But Acme Oyster House's service was by far the worst. It was almost as bad as their food was good!The charbroiled oysters are going to haunt me until I am able to slam down another half dozen the next time I visit. And the Peacemaker Po'Boy brought a sense of true, pure inner peace only deep fried bivalves could possibly muster.But then there was the service. SLOOOOOW. And not even the type of slow that occurs to "inspire" a table to order another round of beers. Just standard uncaring slowness. When our waitress brought over the wrong dish and I informed her that I ordered the peacemaker she responded with "no, you didn't." She produced her scratch pad with indecipherable handwriting trying to convince me, and my table mates who heard my order, that I had not ordered that entree. She brusquely retreated to resubmit my proper order and was shorty called over by our neighboring table to tell her that they did not receive their proper entree either.

Reviews.Author: David M.
Reviews.Content: Place was very busy. Had oysters and etoufee. Very good food! Staff was super friendly. Would recommend trying this place if in NOLA.

Reviews.Author: Idan S.
Reviews.Content: After nearly 45 minutes of waiting, we finally go a seat, but that's OK because this was truly one of the best meals of my life!!! I got the fried oyster po-boy, which one of the top 5 best foods I've ever eaten. My girlfriend (now X) got the  "10 Napkin roast Beef" po-boy, which I also though was amazing... way better than mother's in my opinion!Next time I go to New Orleans this will be the first place I go!

Reviews.Author: Tray R.
Reviews.Content: I went today, on a Wednesday at 12:15 for lunch.  There was NO line when I got there and NO line when I left so don't be scared about all the reviews about lines.  They are not always there.  food was delicious and I was really surprised but how friendly and attentive the servers where.  drinks were refilled without requests.  She stopped over to ask what we needed and we never waited for anything.  My only comment of concern is it was FREEZING in there.  I told my husband I bet they do that so no one stays around, they leave because it's so cold and then they turn the table and move the line.  All and all well worth the visit!Oh, we started with the grilled oysters, moved on to the half shrimp po-boy and cup of shrimp gumbo.  Best cocktail sauce I have ever tasted!

Reviews.Author: Cori V.
Reviews.Content: Best charbroiled oysters! We went to 5-6 oyster bars throughout the French quarter. This place had the best.  Sit right up at the bar to get quick service. Best flavor, largest oysters we saw while visiting, and super fast! A must for oyster lover!

Reviews.Author: Gary W.
Reviews.Content: If you like Oysters this is the place! The charbroiled Oysters are a MUST. Save yourself the time and get 12 to start. Its worth the wait, I can assure you this.

Reviews.Author: Hannah B.
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed this place so much, I went there twice in one weekend!  Everything I had was delicious.  These oysters were better than any I tried anywhere else.  A must for anyone visiting the city.I recommend getting a seat at the bar and having the shuckers serve you up what they are shucking right there - they are fun to chat with too!

Reviews.Author: Stephen L.
Reviews.Content: Food here was great! Ordered a 1/2 shrimp 1/2 oyster po boy, and it wildly exceeded my expectations. They really pack in the seafood - there was an abundance of seafood in every bite, and yet there was always seemingly some more falling out onto my plate. Also tried the jambalaya - pretty good, in my opinion.Atmosphere-wise, it was about as dark as a dive bar. Also, they were blasting the A/C, which is nice at first if you want to get away from the outside heat, but not when you're there for about an hour eating. Still, it's all about the food. Definitely get here early. Had a very early dinner (~4:30pm) and when we left, there was a line stretching about half a block.

Reviews.Author: Catherine M.
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience here!! The crab cakes were great and so were the smoked oysters!!

Reviews.Author: Emieu L.
Reviews.Content: It's not that good and not much option...

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey K.
Reviews.Content: Acme has got that lived in and dive feel of a classic long running eatery; it's the real deal and a gem amidst the other pretenders in the quarter.  That said, it's fairly cramped and dingy but it's one of my favorite joints to eat in NO and while the char-grilled oysters are swell, the plain raw oysters are what keep me coming back.  Sip a beer while in line, watch the people carnival and relax.

Reviews.Author: Molly G.
Reviews.Content: Great place to go for authentic NAWLINS food. I tried the oysters (when in Rome..) which were good. My friend and I both got gumbo which was REALLY good. A NOLA experinece you have to try. But be prepared to wait in line to get in.

Reviews.Author: George N.
Reviews.Content: As good as it gets in NOLA.  Fresh oysters are best I've had, beating out Portland, Seattle, Norfolk, Destin, etc.  Service staff great, and very knowledgeable.  Steamed crawfish are incredible when in season, hot, spicy and tasty.  If you like fresh oysters, try sitting at the bar, while they shuck you dozen after dozen.  Also, their cocktail sauce is super spicy with plenty of horseradish.  Mmmm, wish I live in New Orleans!

Reviews.Author: Bruce C.
Reviews.Content: Had lunch on the day we arrived. Wonderful! Enjoyed their oysters, oyster poboy, and seafood jambalaya. Wife also really enjoyed her meal. Wait was around five minutes and worth it. Going back before we leave the city.

Reviews.Author: Charles S.
Reviews.Content: Awesome, huge oysters at half the price of oysters in the OC. Was not a fan of their gumbo however. Go to the bar and have oysters and a drink.

Reviews.Author: Vu N.
Reviews.Content: Best Sandwich Ever!!!!!!!!!!  Do short yourself and order the grilled oysters.  Be careful with cocktail sauce, it will leave you in tears.This is my only guaranteed stop every time I visit NO.  The other famous po boy places in town are good, but not this good.  With 1k+ reviews this place is legendary.

Reviews.Author: Jayda S.
Reviews.Content: Let me echo what everyone is raving about.  The chargrilled oysters were extremely fantastic.  It was,  hands down,  one of the best things I've ever tasted in my entire life. I'm pretty sure I'll be raving about those oysters for weeks to come,  and it'll be my first stop every time I go to New Orleans.  The jambalaya was also amazing.  The shrimp etouffe was superb as well. I'll take away one star because the gumbo wasn't great, but I definitely think the oysters are worth 5 stars alone. Incredible!

Reviews.Author: Daphney D.
Reviews.Content: I ordered fried crab claws to go It was fried perfectly. I wish they provided another sauce besides cocktail sauce. Quick and good food!

Reviews.Author: David W.
Reviews.Content: Amazing grilled oysters

Reviews.Author: Mallards R.
Reviews.Content: Oyster lovers heaven! Came for lunch on a Wednesday and no line. Grilled oysters were an experience you didn't want to end.

Reviews.Author: Jeannie P.
Reviews.Content: My "out of town" friends ALWAYS want to go here. It's great for groups because it's loud and they turn over tables fast. It's in the middle of all the action near Bourbon Street so tourist love that. I personally have had better food elsewhere but indulge my friends when they come to visit.

Reviews.Author: Eric J.
Reviews.Content: OMG ...Fried Oysters...tried to duplicate...not so easy....if your in NO and don't go there...you deserve medicority....enjoy meh !!!

Reviews.Author: Tan N.
Reviews.Content: I'm not even a big fan of oysters, but my friends love it. My friend that I went to Mardi Gras with can live off of it. There was a big hype on the chargrilled oysters here so she had to try it. The hype can be validated, they are that good. My other friend that doesn't like oysters at all ate half a dozen herself. It was so good that we went here twice during our trip, just for that very item. The red beans with rice and boo fries (french fries drenched with housemade gravy on top) were both very good too.

Reviews.Author: pegah S.
Reviews.Content: Well worth the 45 minutes wait in the line. The chargrilled oysters were amazing, fresh oysters were really good as well. Fyi you get in a lot quicker if you have a party of 2 rather than 3 or more in your group.

Reviews.Author: Stephen D.
Reviews.Content: The only reason to come here is the oysters, so the joint is aptly named. The rest of their food (especially the po'-boys) pales in comparison to other eateries nearby, but you have to snag at least one order of char-grilled oysters from this place when you're in town.You can't cut loose on your drinking, due to it being kind of a tourist draw, so try not to hit a little kid whilst swinging your beer bottle. I have witnessed a couple bar fights erupt here, though. Wierd.In short: Eat oysters, leave.

Reviews.Author: Julie L.
Reviews.Content: This place serves yummy oysters!! I think it was about 10.99 for a dozen of raw gulf oysters. The oysters are pretty big compared to the ones we had in San Francisco for $1 a piece.  I love the chagrilled oysters!!  Boy, we had like 2 dozen oysters each that night :)We found out that the airport has cheaper oysters at the Acme. It was like 9.99 per dozen.

Reviews.Author: Ernest P.
Reviews.Content: Raw oysters were delicious, but not worth waiting in line for.  I was most looking forward to the char-grilled oysters and they were tasty in that they had a super butter-garlic flavor.  Could  you tell that there was an oyster in there?  Not really as the oyster shrivels to nothing in the shell, and the best part sopping up the juices with your bread.Otherwise, pretty standard New Orleans standards.  The shrimp gumbo didn't actually have any shrimp in it.  I guess that counts as a complaint thought the flavor was good.  The red beans and rice were above average though I preferred Popeye's so . . .On a final note the crawpuppies were delicious as seemingly all the fried foods are done well.  In any case there ain't no magic being performed here.  Fresh, raw oysters done well and points for the historic nature of the business (since 1910).

Reviews.Author: YK F.
Reviews.Content: During my 5-day stay in NOLA, I was lucky enough to stay in the quarter and I went to Acme almost everyday.For its price, Acme worths every penny. $10 for a dozen of freshly shucked oyster is pretty decent. But don't pay extra for the baked ones, they are not as good.I never walked out of Acme paying more than $20Avoid the long lines, remember to get there early, before 5pm, get some oysters, local "amber" beer (i forgot the name), then walk around Bourbon St and go somewhere for your real dinner.If you are expecting a nice and fancy oyster bar where you can order oysters by their names, Acme is not for you.P.S. I think Acme is way better than Felix.

Reviews.Author: Sora B.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a wonderful time at Acme!The oysters were fresh, the local beer was good, the service was really friendly and the atmosphere was cheerful.We were so lucky to avoid lines and at one point was skeptical whether it was a tourist trap but we were so happy not to have missed this spot!

Reviews.Author: Jocelyn O.
Reviews.Content: Love this place. Came here twice during my two day outing in NOLA. If you can, eat at the Oyster Bar. Your food comes quick and you can see how oyster shucking is done.Highlights: Chargrilled Oysters, gumbo and bread pudding.

Reviews.Author: Ashley M.
Reviews.Content: Attention all you picky eaters out there!!  Go here.  : )  I am one of you...I loved the Jambalaya & sausage!  Along with the strawberry beer.  Your Welcome.

Reviews.Author: Amy H.
Reviews.Content: :qI never liked oysters. I don't think its because I've only had bad oysters. Some of my friends love oysters, and I make a point to (okay, I don't make a point to, they make me) try the ones they think are great occasionally. This was the first time that I actually really really liked them. Of course, they *were* char-grilled, which I hear is specially for us folks that don't like oysters, but I LOVED THEM!!!! :) So if even if you hate oysters, give the char-grilled ones a try!

Reviews.Author: Adam J.
Reviews.Content: This place is New Orleans at it's finest.  It's not a fancy place, but the Cajun cuisine is top notch.  I had the Etufe (sp?) and a couple John Dailys to drink.  It was one of the better meals I had near Bourbon St, the prices weren't bad... the wait staff left a little to be desired, but it wasn't horrible, and I have to give them a little credit since this is a tourist haven.I'd recommend checking it out if the line isn't too long.

Reviews.Author: Ross M.
Reviews.Content: I don't care if this place has 1000 reviews and every one of them metions the char grilled oysters... I'm still putting in my two cents.  LOVED THEM!  And I will wait in a block long line again the next time I'm in New Orleans.Enough Said.

Reviews.Author: Cameron T.
Reviews.Content: This place makes me ponder the question...how is there a skinny person is New Orelans? I mean wow. I realize that many visitors come to Acme for the same reason I did. Man vs. Food. I admit I watched Adam take down the 15 Dozen Oyster Challenge and made the committment to eat at Acme when I visited NOLA next. In October of 2010, yes post-BP spill, I wasn't letting that get in my way. I ordered the "feast"...a combination of catfish, oysters and shrimp and I was not disappointed. I felt like I was doing a challenge myself when the mountain of food came to my table. I have to say if it was a challenge, Man definitley won!I had a chat with the oyster shucker at the bar and did the touristy thing and got a t-shirt because yes, it was that good.

Reviews.Author: Richard R.
Reviews.Content: This was by far the greatest food and service to date. We had the char-grilled oysters and the seafood platter. Service start as soon as you get in the line outside. Wait was not long hut worth the wait. Side note they ate always cleaning the floors,tables, not just your average cleaning after a meal either... very impressive!!!!. No Louisiana Hot Sause!!!. The cocktail sause is a flame thrower but not a lingering hot which was great.. will open up those sinus drains for sure. I will be returning..

Reviews.Author: Beth T.
Reviews.Content: I know.  I know that ACME is a total tourist trap.  I know.  I know that Felix's is across the street and has basically the same food. I know.But still.  We came here for my birthday on a Wednesday in May.  We waited briefly--not long enough to finish our drinks--before being sat.  This time of year, Oysters are out of season.  We knew that.  But we'd had them someplace else and they were still tasty, so hubs and I ordered a dozen iced.  We also ordered half a dozen chargrilled and some crab claws to top it off.  Everything was delish.  Probably more so the first batch of chargrilled boys.  we ended up ordering another dozen of iced and half dozen of chargrilled and the second batch of chargrilled were a bit overcooked, but still pretty freaking tasty.  We were there with another couple and not one of us left unhappy.  And for the record, the crab claws are DELISH. So despite it's touristy bit, it's solid food in my book.  I'd happily come here again and recommend it to friends. It was exactly what I wanted for my bday dinner and I was not disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Kevin B.
Reviews.Content: My last visit to Acme was in 2003.... until this year. The '03 version was well deserving of a 4 star review. The '11 version is barely worthy of 2 stars. Quick overview: I got the Acme Special Po-Boy. My wife got the 1/2 and 1/2 platter with shrimp and oysters. Oh, and I also got the "jambalaya". My sandwich was ok-ish. Way too messy from the beef and that's all I tasted, even though there is supposed to be turkey, ham, and cheese on there as well. It was all buried in beef and beef gravy. Now about that "jambalaya", it was horrible. Not even close to what true jambalaya is supposed to be. And considering this is NEW ORLEANS, the jambalaya should be something more than an ice cream scoop of rice in a bowl that looks like it might have been sort of touched by tomato sauce, and definitely NO meat in it. For $3.99, I felt ripped off. As for my wife's dinner, when it says "1/2 and 1/2", you should expect the same amount of oysters as shrimp.... Not even close. The shrimp were the dominant seafood on the plate. If I had nothing to compare this visit to, I probably would just chalk it up to a bad night, but never go back. However, I have been here before and it was FAR superior. This place is a shadow of what it used to be.  I urge people to go elsewhere for better food and not settle for below average, especially when you wait for way too long to get in.

Reviews.Author: Al R.
Reviews.Content: Hello Yelpers!!Short and to the point. Though Acme is not the worst seafood you will ever eat, please keep in mind, Acme is just another WAYYYYY over-priced FQ spot that most of the time is crowded with nothing but tourist's.Small portions and high prices is the name of the game with most all FQ spots. Just accept it.If you want REAL Louisiana food, that not only tastes great but it also a great value, you have got to head out of the FQ/ city center area. Please dont leave Louisiana thinking that FQ food/establishments are the real thing.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie R.
Reviews.Content: I need to review this place even though I was here way back last November!Yummy Yummy Yummy.Tried oysters for the first time here. Grilled I believe. Or charbroiled? Not exactly sure but but who cares they were delicioso. I'd go back if I ever visit NO's again.

Reviews.Author: Kenny and Janet C.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing (minus the long line to get in, but so worth the wait)!  Such great value for raw and deep fried oysters!  The service, the food and the pitchers of beer = a fantastic meal!This place is great for groups.  Just order some boo-fries (with roast beef gravy and cheese) and dozens of assorted oysters.  I was curious an had some of the Fried Peace Maker Po-boy as well..it was good and filled me up indeed.If I ever go back to NOLA, I will come back to Acme Oyster House.

Reviews.Author: Andrew T.
Reviews.Content: What a great place for a relatively inexpensive meal and great oysters.  Not sure what happened with other reviewers who claimed their oysters tasted like they had been sitting around - I had the luck to be sat at the oyster bar and watched the guy shuck and plate our order as well as many others!Besides the raw oysters, the charbroiled oysters were fantastic too.  My girlfriend, who does not like seafood, could not stop dipping bread into  garlicky-parmesan sauce - it was good.  Lastly, the po-boy was great as well.  The best takeaway from ACME was definitely the overall atmosphere and experience - friendly guys behind the oyster bar, decent prices, good if unspectacular food, and you've got yourself a great time.

Reviews.Author: Amanda T.
Reviews.Content: For the life of me, I will never understand why this place is so popular and the line is so long.  The food is mediocre, at best.  What baffles me is that there are SO MANY great places to eat on the same block!!  If you're looking to drink a beer and watch a game this place is great.  If you're trying to actually eat great New Orleans food, don't bother.

Reviews.Author: Jeremy M.
Reviews.Content: The hype about this place is accurate. Before I even moved to New Orleans, I had a a few friends in VA tell me that I needed to check out ACME Oyster House. I just took it in passing, but finally made it here and curse myself for waiting as long as I had.I ventured here with my gf's uncle, who was in town visiting. There is always a line outside, but don't be discouraged because it moves really quickly. We had 3 people and only had to wait around 15 minutes for a wait at about 6:30pm on a Sunday. We ordered a few dozen chargilled oysters and devoured them!!!!! I think I was caught licking one of the shells... Hahahahaa

Reviews.Author: randy c.
Reviews.Content: Oysters; check.Beer; check.Po-boy's; check.Can't vouch for anything else, but why else would you wait in line for this place.Just do it.

Reviews.Author: Dayna C.
Reviews.Content: I was with a group of friends and several of them wanted to get po'boys. We were staying at a hotel nearby and the valet suggested that we go to Acme. He said it was the best place in town. When we walked around the corner there was a long line to get in. We were a bit intimidated by it at first so we walked to some other spots. Luckily we decided to go back and wait in line. This place has really good po'boys. I haven't had a lot of them, but I really enjoyed this one. The bread was super fresh, the shrimp and catfish were seasoned really well. I also had a side of seafood gumbo which was delicious. They had this bread pudding type dessert that I loved and I don't even like bread pudding! I got a Hurricane from here (one) and I was done. (I think I will stay away from Hurricane's, especially in New Orleans!) It is a medium sized restaurant. We were seated close to the front of the restaurant and while the table was a bit small for four people, we made it work. I would eat here again if I am ever in New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: Marcus R.
Reviews.Content: Went to New Orleans and this once again was a great place.Friendly service (quite a few other places in New Orleans the host/hostess seemed that someone had just stolen their dog)Long line but it moved fast. We had New Orleans stables such as Grilled Oysters, Po Boys, Jambalaya and Abita. With tip around $50.

Reviews.Author: J P.
Reviews.Content: This place is legit.Yes, it is a tourist hot spot and you should expect a line.  But more importantly, Yes, it is worth the wait.To put things into perspective, I tried only one other oyster bar during my NOLA trip which was also good, but I was skeptical of the long line and that ACME would be a tourist trap.  In fact, the first time we lined up, we left and ate elsewhere...but my inner tourist just had to try again so the next day we tested the waters and scoped out the line shortly after 1pm (thinking it might be shorter).  Lucky for us, it was -but not by much.  It was a rainy overcast day but that didn't keep the hungry tummies away.  There was still a line (moved relatively quickly) and we decided to try it out.We had a dozen raw oysters, a dozen chargrilled, and a "peace maker" po boy (half shrimp half oyster).  All of the above were great!!  ACME did NOT disappoint and lived up to its hype.  Don't you love when that happens?As with most places in NOLA, can't go wrong with the food.  So you decide if you're willing to wait it out and say that you tried ACME (on a side note: not the same experience of course, but there's an airport location as well and we had a po boy there before our flight took off -still good.  they also have the oyster offerings after noon, but not as extensive of a menu (no peacemaker po boy) .  Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Tiffany M.
Reviews.Content: Luckily we caught this place early enough where the wait in line wasn't outrageous, maybe only 20 minutes.  When we got there, I ordered the New Orleans Medley, which I personally don't recommend, I wasn't impressed.  I'm not a big fan of oysters so this was probably the wrong place for me.  However, the service was pretty fast from what I remember.I would suggest going to the one in Metairie, its a lot bigger and not crowded.

Reviews.Author: Meagan O.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for the fried oysters. No wonder this place had a line to sit at the bar. I could have eaten a ton of those perfectly seasoned seafood delights.The fried soft shell crab was delicious as well.I only wish I could have tried everything on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Jeanelle P.
Reviews.Content: So yummy!!! Great food and great service!! We had a blast there!

Reviews.Author: Dionne G.
Reviews.Content: I love me some oysters! I can eat at least two dozen and be a happy Louisiana girl.

Reviews.Author: Kasha G.
Reviews.Content: Food was amazing!! The chargrilled oysters are a must. The roast beef po' boy rocked my world. By the time it came out my husband and I were full, but once we took a bite we got a second wind and attacked it. I have been here three times and each time the service was wonderful. Sit at the bar so you can watch the action as they shuck the oysters.

Reviews.Author: Chris H.
Reviews.Content: Was closed today for a small fire. They told us they would be open soon. Didn't see any damage.

Reviews.Author: Joseph B.
Reviews.Content: Big lines sometimes. Come early or expect to wait a bit.

Reviews.Author: Pravin M.
Reviews.Content: Yes we gave the Acme house five stars. Yes, it deserves five stars. But, caveat, we only ate the oysters. But to be fair, it is called the Acme oyster House - so what else would we eat? The Louisiana oysters raw are delicious with their various toppings. We also experienced the chargrilled oysters. I've never had these before and they are delicious. Absolutely delicious. We went around town and tried these chargrilled oysters at other restaurants like Felix's across the street. I would recommend acme over Felix's. Wait the five minutes in the line, you won't regret it. Also we cajoled the employee at Acme oyster House to show us the oysters in the back freezer. The oysters are all stacked up like so many sacks  of potatoes.  They emphasize customer service at this joint, the poor fellow who showed us the oysters, I do believe he got fired for his indiscretion of letting us into the walk-in freezer. I regret that decision on my part. But nevertheless, the meal was incredible. PS: the gumbo was pretty good too.

Reviews.Author: Milca P.
Reviews.Content: Love their charbroiled oysters! Went because im a big fan of Man vs. Food and the place did not dissapoint!

Reviews.Author: Larry D.
Reviews.Content: Waited on line, not a fan of that but it went pretty quick. There were 6 of us, so larger tables are harder to get. couples were going in a little quicker.  The staff at the door and the hostess were really friendly and truly excellent for a place that looks like it churns and burns.  We started with Oysters both raw and char grilled.  My friends and wife are big Oyster fans (I'm not) so only going on what they told me.  They said the raw were just OK, not a lot of flavor and a little sandy. They didn't think they would like the char grill, but everyone said they were excellent and would definitely get those again.I had the gumbo for appetizer, it was good not great just good. I also had the 1/2 shrimp 1/2 fish platter, pretty good.  Friends had the Fried Soft Shell Crabs and said they were the best they have ever had and they have had them (broiled) at very upscale restaurants in Chicago, and said these were much better.  My knocking down a star was because they had Zero grilled, and or Broiled seafood so my wife struggle with her selection, and opted for the gumbo.  That was disappointing how hard could it be to grill or broil seafood.  Based on the crowds in this place I guess there is no reason to do that.

Reviews.Author: Emily M.
Reviews.Content: i came to this place because all the new orleans tourist books recommended it and seriously, this place really does live up to the expectations. good oysters!  raw oysters - pretty good, fresh, bigchargrilled oysters - verryyy good! some parmesian cheese on top of fresh big oysters baked, with some sauce. 3 of us ordered 3 dozen, it was really satisfying, only way to gopo boy sandwich - an okay-good po boy, but not the best, and you wouldnt come here just to get the po boy either. tomato, fresh shrimpoyster gumbo - disappointing. not many oysters, gumbo wasn't very thick

Reviews.Author: Will G.
Reviews.Content: Pricey but good. We had 1/2 doz chargrilled oysters and 1/2 doz raw. The chargrilled are not $14 a doz as another poster commented. They are $13.50 for 1/2 doz. It could be she did not even read the menu correctly or was not the one paying (probably the latter). The raw were $8.50 for 1/2 doz. So we ordered the oysters and a seafood platter which we shared, had a couple of beers and the total was $70 including tax and tip.

Reviews.Author: Wendy S.
Reviews.Content: yes - the line is long.  YES - it is worth it - if you like oysters - especially on the half shell - big scrumptious flavorful fresh - then this is the place to go. Forget Dragos - this is it. We ordered a dozen of the raw and a dozen of the fresh to compare. Definitely go for the raw if you like oysters. The grilled were oily and covered with cheese. Really detracted from the great oyster within. We sat at the bar which was fun - watching them shuck all those gems and chatting with the staff.  Friendly. WELL WORTH THE WAIT!

Reviews.Author: David F.
Reviews.Content: A bit pricey, but was promptly seated on a Saturday afternoon and had an epic meal (the dozen chargrilled oysters and a pint of Abita Restoration) so gooooood! Will return again next time I'm in NOLA.

Reviews.Author: Brad P.
Reviews.Content: Good food, great service. Nice offering.

Reviews.Author: Sausage D.
Reviews.Content: A little on the salty side for me, but overall it was great. Everyone recommends the chargrilled oysters and I have to echo that sentiment. They were deliciously sinful.

Reviews.Author: Nikole S.
Reviews.Content: Atmosphere lacked. The Po boy was ok...the bread was better than the oysters. Don't think it's all it's hyped up to be.

Reviews.Author: Joseph D.
Reviews.Content: What can I say other than GRILLED OYSTERS!  Sure, this is a tourist trap and, well, I'm a tourist. My wife and I ate so many oysters a weekend when Norovirus (sp?) hit the city. We didn't get it, somehow, but it was still worth the risk. A relatively small eating space, there was a wait, but once we got in, we got after those oysters. In a city that doesn't believe in greens or salads, the grilled oyster is one of it's best creations. Sure we had the bananas fosters, etouffee and beignets (or at least I did since my wife is gluten free) elsewhere, but the grilled oysters are the best and highlight of the trip!

Reviews.Author: Bryan D.
Reviews.Content: The line out the door might scare you away, but think about why this place has a line out the door. The food is delicious, and if you like oysters, then here is a place where you can eat to your heart's content and walk away with a wallet still as full as you.

Reviews.Author: Ingrid H.
Reviews.Content: We eat here every time we are in NO. The chargrilled oysters are amazing. The line can be a little long, but don't let that put you off as it moves fast.

Reviews.Author: Foodie Y.
Reviews.Content: Loved everything!! Must try the grilled and fresh oyster! They both have different uet amazing flavors! my husband and i had a dozen of each! awesome! u can taste the freshness! The crawfish étouffée was heaven! So was the gumbo, red beans and rice and jambalaya!! Everything was delicious and fresh! We wanted to try mote but we definitely had our fill with their good ol' southern portions! :) The line is definitely worth the wait! ;)

Reviews.Author: John S.
Reviews.Content: It's all been said, but to add to the list of great reviews, the raw oysters were great and the char broiled were amazing.  I tried a few different po-boys. The half shrimp half fried oyster was by far the best and the soft shell crab comes in second.  They have a great beer selection and the prices are good.  VERY friendly servers and an overall great atmosphere.  There is a reason that this is the only oyster bar with a wait.

Reviews.Author: Jen P.
Reviews.Content: We tried Acme for dinner on a Tuesday night... we arrived around 9pm and there was a line (which is a good sign, especially on a COLD Tuesday night!)  I agree completely with Dennis S. who said "DON'T go here for a meal- go for fresh oysters, beer and atmosphere."  He nailed it:Oysters: We had 'em roasted and they were DIVINE!  Garlic/butter/parm heaven.  You can't go wrong here!Beer:  Abita- what else when you are in NOLA?  Both pitchers were cold and went down oh-so-good!Entrees:  I had the crawfish etouffee and I have to say, it was creamy and the crawfish, tender.  It was a couple notches better with hot sauce added.  My coworker had seafood gumbo and almost licked the bowl- he really liked it :-)  Second coworker had fried catfish and reported that it was also very tasty.  The hushpuppies were overdone and tough- but we didn't go for the hushpuppies.  Bottom line:  It's a bit of a dive, it was a bit loud and crowded, but the food was delicious and the price was right.  Order the oysters!  The service was exceptionally friendly and several wait staff and cooks asked us how our meal was.  We left happy and full!

Reviews.Author: Tom G.
Reviews.Content: I came here the first time I visited New Orleans, and now every time I visit I make sure to come here at least once.The food is amazing! I love the shrimp po-boy and the gumbo. Be sure to get the Tabasco-infused mayo, its awesome!!!Can't say it loud enough, COME EAT HERE!

Reviews.Author: Dan C.
Reviews.Content: This place was pretty good.  I tried the oysters but it isn't really my thing!  It reminded me of a nasty looking peesh, but isn't that what makes it a sex food?  Seafood gumbo was good, Jambalaya was excellent!  Good location too!

Reviews.Author: Ryan P.
Reviews.Content: I've always enjoyed oysters. However, being from Southern California, they are not always available. Having an oyster bar at almost every restaurant was one thing I was really looking forward to during our trip to New Orleans.Acme House did not disappoint.  My wife and I went there twice during the week stay. Both times we got lucky and were seated right away. I've read reviews about the line going around the corner and was thrilled we didn't have to wait in the heat. The staff was extremely nice and helpful with their welcoming suggestions. We started off with a dozen raw oysters and a dozen char grilled oysters. Hands down, the best I've ever had. Another great thing about this restaurant is the draft beer selection. I really enjoyed getting acquainted with the local beer, Abita. Some were better than others, but that's generally the case for most breweries. My favorite is the Andy Gator. I only came across a couple of places that served this beer and was thrilled to find out they even had it on tap! If I ever return to New Orleans again, I'll be sure to make this one of my first stops.

Reviews.Author: Lanel M.
Reviews.Content: A MUST STOP for any NOLA trip!I love ACME Oyster house. It's a must, must do when visiting the Big Easy. I love the eating Oysters and sucking my crawfish heads. The poor boys are bad either.It does get crowded so try to go their early or expect to wait.

Reviews.Author: Marc C.
Reviews.Content: Completely overrated. Craaazy lines for mediocre oysters.  We sat at the bar and it was fun to watch the guys shucking oysters like lightning. That was the most exciting part of the experience.  If you are an oyster fan...find a better place.  The oysters are covered in muck and are pretty tasteless.

Reviews.Author: Dee F.
Reviews.Content: A NOLA Institution... I was a little disappointed this time around.I've been to this place about a dozen times.  Maybe it's my palate has matured.  Maybe because I've been to more and more places in NOLA.I'll be back for more in the future.

Reviews.Author: Matherine G.
Reviews.Content: Positive: The 10 napkin roast beef po boy was shockingly good. Prices are fairly reasonable, decent service as well. Negative: Expect a wait, (but don't be too scared off if you see a really long line, it moves pretty quickly, we waited about 25 mins at dinner on a wed), we found the raw oysters to be too sandy (wish we had tried the char-grilled ones), and the crawfish po boy to be boring and lacking taste. Decor leaves a lot to be desired, but people don't come here for that.Overall: 3.5 stars. Acme was a bit disappointing, but we'll never forget that roast beef po boy.

Reviews.Author: N M.
Reviews.Content: Crowded and loud,  but a must do in new orleans.  Great oysters, they dump steamed crawfish on your table.  Fantastic PoBoys, don't like the gumbo ...  Always a line.Great casual place, visit everytime I am in town.

Reviews.Author: Melanie N.
Reviews.Content: I expected Acme to be pricey, but to my surprise, it was probably the cheapest dinner we had in NOLA.  I'm not a huge oyster fan, but they were less than $1/each.  My co-workers kept raving about them.I had the "10 napkin" roast beef po boy, and it was pretty good (po boys range in price from $10-12). The only downside to the place is the service.  Most of the servers have attitudes, and if your ENTIRE part is not present, you can't be seated.

Reviews.Author: Michael D.
Reviews.Content: Our party of seven had a great time at this unpretentious, casual, affordable shellfish joint. After a 30 minute wait outside (beers in hand; thanks, open-container law!) we were seated and had excellent service from our waitress Maria. In mere minutes our plastic tablecloth was topped with pitchers of beer, oysters, and crawfish. Entrees soon followed and no one was really disappointed.One person in our party was a vegetarian. After I made fun of him while he was trying to order hush puppies, Maria told him about the veggie burger (not listed on the menu). He was delighted -- and the rest of us were surprised -- when he reported it was actually very good.

Reviews.Author: Renee W.
Reviews.Content: I was blowing through town, saw good reviews on Yelp and decided to try this place for a late dinner. There was a line outside, but I was only one person so I took a seat at the bar and got in pretty quick. The server was friendly and I got a nice view of the boys shucking oysters.I started with half a dozen oysters on the half shell, which were fresh and delicious. I enjoyed a local, dark beer - not sure the name. And my entree was étouffée - so amazing that I have since tried to replicate it at home. After a long road trip, this savory pile of crawdaddy deliciousness was exactly what my body needed.I never felt rushed and my bill was somewhere around $20 bucks, which I didn't think was so bad for a starter, beer and entree. If I swing through town again, I'll be back.

Reviews.Author: Michelle S.
Reviews.Content: While the dinner crowds can be nuts here (seriously, what would you expect of a place so close to Bourbon Street), you can breeze right in at lunch time.We took fellow Yelper's advice and started off with the chargrilled oysters. Not being a huge oyster fan myself, I was delighted at the warm, buttery nectar of those little suckers. After a couple of bites, I was arm wrestling my boyfriend for the rights to a hunk of garlic bread just so I could sop up the butter/oyster drippings at the bottom of the half shell. Not typical behavior of an otherwise refined lady...and a total testiment to how good they were.

Reviews.Author: David C.
Reviews.Content: It's pretty good. Raw oysters are fresh. Char-grilled oysters are good, but not worth $20..Really not. Had Crawfish etouffee, seafood po-boy, some gumbo. I mean, I came out of the restaurant sitll hungry, even after dropping almost $50. I think overall the cajun food is pretty mediocre. If I ever come back, it'll only be for the oysters. Some of the waiters are jerks too. Honestly? Some of their attitudes are a big turn-off.

Reviews.Author: Ha N.
Reviews.Content: One word? It's ... HYPE!Raw oysters are better than the charbroiled ones to my taste. And I had better raw oysters!The shrimp etouffee was delicious though ... however the portion is small. Come back? Not really.

Reviews.Author: Dan B.
Reviews.Content: Really awesome. This place kicked off myMardi gras in a big way and everything was delicious. Food came out quick, service was great and po-boys (roast beef, peacemaker, catfish/oyster) were all amazing. So were the chargilled oysters. Definitely a must do and worth the wait

Reviews.Author: Ws's Mama H.
Reviews.Content: Overall experience: 3.5Charbroiled oysters were definitely hyped up. It was much smaller than what I expected and salty to my Asian taste. Think I prefer raw oysters over charbroiled ones. I had their "medley", which had small portions of gumbo soup, red bean and rice, and jambalaya. I liked them a lot but didn't think they worth $13. Service here was excellent even though they were super busy and crowded during Mardi Gras season. I will miss Acme :)

Reviews.Author: Jessica H.
Reviews.Content: I'm a bread and butter kind of gal. But, when the butter is swimming in a char-grilled oyster shell and the bread is a warm, soft and chewy French roll - that's a whole new level of goodness. Now, let's talk about the oysters. Not overly cooked, right amount of smokiness. I should have ordered a dozen instead of half, but I wanted to try the  1/2 catfish po boy and cup of seafood gumbo. The catfish didn't disappoint - perfectly seasoned with the right amount of breading. I've had better gumbo, but all in all a good lunch.No need to worry about finding the location - there's a line down the block.

Reviews.Author: Sara M.
Reviews.Content: Definitely worth going to. It has a local New Orleans charm and decent prices. We had a group of 13, and we able to order, eat, and pay in less than a hour! The service was fast and the food was great.Needless to say, there is a reason there is always a line out the door. I would suggest getting there about 15 minutes before they open to ensure a seat right away.

Reviews.Author: Matthew K.
Reviews.Content: I guess I'm new to Cajun food, but just about everything is deep fried.  Not a good spot to dine if you're watching the calorie count.  Food was pretty good.  Got the grilled oysters to start off with.  They were yummy, but just drenched in butter and completely covered in cheese.I chose the medley as my entree.  The red beans and rice was probably the best thing on the plate, but the gumbo and jumbalaya were pretty good too.  Sausage was nothing to write home about.The rest of my group got po-boys, and I have to say the shrimp po-boy was beastly in size.The atmosphere is lively.  But gosh darn, you have a hard time hearing anyone at your table with all the noise.  We had to wait outside for about 15 minutes to get a table, so it's definitely a packed house.Altogether, it was fun and the food was pretty good.  Important to keep in mind that with people waiting outside, you'll be "pushed" in and out fast.  Don't expect to sit around for dinner for an hour.  You'll probably be in and out in 25 minutes.

Reviews.Author: D J.
Reviews.Content: Came here for the first time in '95 or so, and was looking forward to it again. Was not impressed. This is not a "bad" restaurant, but I wouldn't return for anything but the raw oysters - which are fresh and not overpriced. But the rest of the selections are disappointingly mediocre. There are still many great restaurants in New Orleans, And I would suggest doing some research before coming to town to dine.   Don't blow your cash here- have a couple beers, a dozen oysters, and go elsewhere for more.

Reviews.Author: Jarrod F.
Reviews.Content: Draggo's and Acme are my two favorite places for oysters in the big easy. I can't make up my mind but Acme is a great place for great seafood. Every time I go to New Orleans I make sure and visit Acme!GO!

Reviews.Author: Jonathan M.
Reviews.Content: An absolute must if you're in New Orleans.  We started off with the chargrilled oysters which were delectable.  For dinner, I had the fried oyster po' boy which is as good as it gets.  I've had a few po' boys while in New Orleans and this was definitely the best I've had.  The jambalaya was also delicious.  For dessert, the bread pudding is their most popular but, personally, I'd go with the pecan cobbler - it was one of the most amazing desserts I've ever had!Very friendly staff, busy restaurant, good food, and great service gets this place a definite 5-star rating!

Reviews.Author: Linda X.
Reviews.Content: I love visiting New Orleans and always stop by Acme Oyster House to eat some yummy oyster. The oyster here are fabulous! We had the fresh raw oyster and grilled types as well. ALL the oysters were delicious!!!The Po' Boys are just average from my point of view so my advice will be to stick with the oysters.I am sad to say that I no longer can eat the raw oyster in fear of contracting Vibrio vulnificus. It's all because I took a Med Micro class and now I am too scared to eat raw oyster but the grilled ones will do just fine.See you in 2014 Acme Oyster House when we visit again.

Reviews.Author: James B.
Reviews.Content: Had a great time here, and definitely worth the wait. Having been a fresh oyster fan for quite some time, trying them char-grilled was something new for me. SImply amazing!! The po-boy could use a little love, but the Tabasco aioli on it was epic!

Reviews.Author: Jonathan C.
Reviews.Content: Meh....real overrated and overpriced compared to the other places we tried in the Quarter.  Borderline tourist trap in my opinion.  The grilled oysters were amazing...definitely worth the wait for them and the only reason they got 3 stars.Had the fish and shrimp combo....ok.  Friends had po' boys they liked them.

Reviews.Author: Mikee H.
Reviews.Content: The grilled oysters are the best in town! In two days - we tried grilled oysters at Deanies and Felix on this trip to NO.  They were nice sized, tasty and still bubblling when served.  2 dz between the two of us and a side salad with Abita Amber.  Can't go wrong here.  Always stop in when in town and never disapointed.  A tourist place yes, what isn't in the quarter. One of the better values in town.  Did not get any other food this trip  but it was good that last time we ate there.

Reviews.Author: Thomas S.
Reviews.Content: The food is good, but the wait is ridiculous.  Yes, the chargrilled oysters are awesome, but who wants to stand out on the street for an hour waiting for a table.  Probably the best or second best grilled oysters in the city (Drago's).  The Chicken/Andouille Gumbo is very good.  They serve draft beer in little plastic cups.  The food is definitely 5 star worthy, but the wait is not.If you are eating alone, sometimes you can get seated right away at the bar.  That's what I usually do.

Reviews.Author: Oliver L.
Reviews.Content: Amazing oysters worth the long wait. They have other foods too, but why would you order those?

Reviews.Author: Joe L.
Reviews.Content: Great raw oysters - very cold. Great fried soft-shell crab

Reviews.Author: Jenny G.
Reviews.Content: The 1+ hr wait outside says it all. Must get the chargrilled oysters! They were amaaazzzinggg drenched in garlic butter sauce. I wish we could have ordered a dozen instead of the 1/2. We ordered their hush puppies, they were okay. I got one of the restaurant's favorite, the seafood etouffee with fried crawfish. It tasted great at first and then the high sodium started kicking in my system so I didn't feel too good. The experience was great. I would love to come back for more oysters! They also have the oyster challenge where you have to eat 15 dozen oysters to make it on their hall of fame.

Reviews.Author: Jme S.
Reviews.Content: Make sure you go on off hours so your not waiting in line outdoors.   But this place is a must stop when your in NOLA!!  Everything is amazing here on the menu.  but you must get the charbroiled oysters!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie G.
Reviews.Content: It's okay.

Reviews.Author: Vy N.
Reviews.Content: 125 oysters later, we were satiated and happy. The line moves fast so don't get discouraged. Sure you can go to Felix if you don't want to wait, but the difference is noticeable.

Reviews.Author: Lori S.
Reviews.Content: We showed up on a Thursday night expecting a wait, we're told about forty five minutes.  Sent the boys for some beers and settled in to wait.  They called us up soon after as everyone in front of us was a party of two.  Had to dump our beers on the way in.  Crab claws and oysters were the apps., followed by some po boys and boo fries. I'd say the boo fries (gravy and cheese smothered fries) were my favorite.  It was very good food but nothing made me stop in my tracks with its utter delicious ness.  I would go back if I were in Nola again.

Reviews.Author: Russ L.
Reviews.Content: This place has the largest oysters I have ever seen. If you are one of those people that likes raw oysters but doesn't order them because they do not have enough meat, try this place. You will be amazed. Étouffée is good but not spicy enough. Every type of Abita beer that exists is on tap.

Reviews.Author: Rachell N.
Reviews.Content: Worth the long lines! So yummy:-)

Reviews.Author: Dana M.
Reviews.Content: Loved the Po Boys last night. Had sign announcing a closure due to "unforeseen circumstances" today. Not sure what that's about.

Reviews.Author: Mike M.
Reviews.Content: Was in NOLA to work my company's conference, and they took the conference staff to a private dinner on the second floor. Char-grilled oysters are AWESOME. I ate as many as they gave us!  Our dinners were pre-ordered, and we all received the same thing - fried shrimp and fish. All good and tasty. Bonus for the second floor balcony that we were allowed to hang out on until closing time. Extra friendly staff and bartender.

Reviews.Author: Rich S.
Reviews.Content: Place isn't bad but not to the caliber of some of the other oyster bars, mostly for the tourist.

Reviews.Author: Jim W.
Reviews.Content: Best food we had in NOLA on this trip. Grilled oysters are the show, but the craw daddies and the NO medley (gumbo, jambalaya, red beans) were also really good. Don't be afraid of the line; it moves fast.

Reviews.Author: Patrick M.
Reviews.Content: Great oysters but our waitress did not seem to like her job one bit.  Recommend the grilled oysters which have cheese and spices!  Hottest horseradish I've ever had and it was awesome.

Reviews.Author: Dennis O.
Reviews.Content: Awesome New Orleans ambiance, quick and courteous service, and friendly regulars. Had the fried soft-shelled crabs that were a little too salty, but cooked perfectly. Drinks were very strong and worth the money. A must for the French Quarter visitor.

Reviews.Author: Jim U.
Reviews.Content: Just what you expect in NO. Great selection of PoBoys that you won't find anywhere else in the country. Party of two had to wait outside for 5 min until we offered to sit at the bar. This was at 4pm on a Thursday! When we left at 5:30 the line outside was 15 deep. Great seafood gumbo. My dinner companion had oysters which were "excellent".  I passed ( not my thing), but enjoyed everything I had including the cheap beers and friendly server. I would go again at off hours, probably wouldn't wait in line too long, only because I'm not a big oyster fan.

Reviews.Author: Rachel S.
Reviews.Content: It really was meh- not great, but not horrible. The food was okay, but nothing super special. I had a soft-shell crab po'boy and some of the chargrilled oysters. Oysters were tasty, and I'd order them again. I think the crab would have been better without the bread.The line was long, and we were seated at the bar, which had very  uncomfortable stools. Our servers seemed confused about who was actually in charge of our order, so it doesn't seem like they have things very organized.I didn't think my meal was worth what I paid for it.

Reviews.Author: Beth N.
Reviews.Content: Felix's across the street is cheaper, better oysters and less of a tourist trap.

Reviews.Author: Phi N.
Reviews.Content: Had to wait in a long line to get in here... but it was worth it. Started with the gumbo, had me some char grilled oysters, a po boy, and then some more char grilled oysters! (You can tell that those were my favorite...) So buttery and cheesy! I recommend the buffalo tobasco sauce on these. Black ladies next to me were holding out! I finally convinced them to let me in on the secret... I could have gone without the Fried Peace Maker Po-Boy or gumbo and just have gotten more oysters, haha. Everyone was drunk and lunchin' in there. Bartender was helpful and fun.

Reviews.Author: Heidi F.
Reviews.Content: Awesome service!  My husband and I ordered the jambalaya, gumbo, red beans and rice combo.  It wasn't terrible, but it wasn't great either.

Reviews.Author: Liz B.
Reviews.Content: I'm one of those weird people... I only eat roast beef po'boys here lol !! They are so good, so messy, just right ! I've tried their gumbo once it was ok. I highly recommend getting a roastbeef po'boy here, it will blow your mind.

Reviews.Author: Thomas S.
Reviews.Content: Came here for lunch on way out of town  greeted by the same rude woman referenced in other reviews.  the Grilled oysters were amazing.  Also had the beef po boy.  While it was tasty I'm not sure it was my best choice.  Should have done the oyster po boy.  I would certainly come back to try Acme's other offerings.

Reviews.Author: Cole P.
Reviews.Content: I came here for lunch and ordered the row oysters, a shrimp poboy with Tobasco-infused tarter sauce, and the seafood gumbo.  The food was excellent.  We didn't have a problem being seated for lunch, but there was a bit of a wait at night.  The speed of the service could have been faster, though.

Reviews.Author: Karen L.
Reviews.Content: We went on a Friday night and the wait was long. We ended up sitting at the Oyster Bar. I ordered Chargrilled Oysters and my sister ordered Gumbo in a Bread Bowl. We shared the Boo Fries as an appetizer and they were delicious! They are french fries smothered in gravy and cheese - salty but tasty. :) My sister thought the idea of having Gumbo in a Bread Bowl was cool but she did not like the gumbo here and wishes she tried the etouffee instead. I really liked the chargrilled oysters here! They came with bread and it tastes so good if you dip it in the garlic oyster sauce. The oysters were a little crunchy though. I don't normally eat oysters so I don't know if this is normal.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth L.
Reviews.Content: Good NOLA eats! My group had the seafood étouffée, the beef po' boys, and a side of sweet potato fries for lunch. It was pretty busy inside, but our waiter was attentive. Not my favorite dining experience due to the hectic atmosphere and dark inside, but definitely a solid place for a good, affordable lunch.

Reviews.Author: Scott P.
Reviews.Content: Sit at the bar, get a beer and a fried oyster po boy and shoot the shit with the shuckers. You'll learn more about NOLA in 20 min than you will on any tour. This was the first place we ate on our trip and I have to say, probably the best. Reasonably priced, great, fun atmosphere. When we return to NOLA, we will for sure be back.

Reviews.Author: Andrew T.
Reviews.Content: What to get for sure:Fresh Raw Oysters Those of you who don't like eating oysters because you don't like chewing up the "guts" should definitely come here. The oysters are very refreshing on a hot New Orleans day. I'm usually not one for raw oysters because of the whole "chewing up the guts" thing, but when they're sweet and delicious and freshly shucked at ACME I'll take em on any hot summer day.Oh yeah, try the grilled ones. They're bomb.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany W.
Reviews.Content: I give this place a 4*. There are always lines outside. At 2pm, when we passed by about 30 ppl were standing i line. At dinner, the line was about 60-70 ppl and we had to wait about 45 min. i didn't like the wait. I would have come very early to avoid the crowds, but another (non touristy) restaurant we tried to go to was closed for dinner. :(Their specialty is oysters obviously. We had a dozen of the raw oyster. They were nice and big. $10.99. Then we ordered a plate of jambalaya with chicken and sausage. Didnt' taste that much meat. And it was only ok. Small portion. We also had the seafood gumbo soup, supposed to have shrimp and crab but all i saw and tasted was the shrimp. That was just ok too. Finally we decided to try the grilled oysters since one of the shuckers kept raving about them. They put parmasean cheese and some butter and garlic over them. It was ok. I'd still stick with the raw ones. Pure and simple and healthy.I dont think this place is necessarily better than the other local faves. The fact that it's situated in a touristy area i think is always why there are lines. I dont think i'd wait in those lines again for it. Try to ask the locals where they go.One thing i was very concerned about is the food handling/hygience. As we sat at the bar, we saw the shuckers doing their shucking for an hour. They don't clean or spray down the oysters b4 they start on them. I mean, oh god, the do it on a stainless steel counter, which accumualated with sand and dirt, on the bags that the oysters come in. They wear latex gloves on one hand. Then they place the oysters onto these roudn plastic trays and they simply stack them up. Think about all the bacteria that is breeding!

Reviews.Author: Brangelina T.
Reviews.Content: Shrimp Po' Boy was mediocre, but the chargrilled oysters more than made up for it. No idea how they cook those, but the char flavor on them is insane. Worth trying even if you're not an oyster fan, which I'm not.The average 45 minute wait in line outside is made less painful by the fact that you can buy a beer two doors down and hold it with you while you wait.

Reviews.Author: M G.
Reviews.Content: Was here with a big group for lunch. First impressions not so great. The place is a bit like a sports bar inside with lots of neon lights and TVs. It had a terrible smell of seafood gone wrong. The service was a bit slow for a Monday lunch as well. We amused ourselves with the wait by reading the wall signs with all the crazies who had joined the 15 dozen club by eating that many oysters in who knows how many minutes. I got the oyster po boy. Was yummy except for the shell I found in it. Others had the red beans and rice- also yummy.

Reviews.Author: Raphael S.
Reviews.Content: Tried this joint near Bourbon Street the day I arrived in New Orleans after seeing numerous reviews on Yelp.  Definately a tourist trap, but then again the food was awesome.  A bit on the pricey side but it was everything I imagined on how food in New Orleans should be after being only exposed to Popeyes.  I ordered the New Orleans Sample Platter, which came with a sausage, gumbo, red beans and rice.  The portion was OK, but not enough for the price.  Definately recommend this place, if you are going to be in New Orleans for a short time and don't have enough time to explore. 4 stars for yelp and 3 stars for my "that's wassup" factor.

Reviews.Author: Mely L.
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to visit New Orleans for the day and we were looking for a great place to eat, so I called my sister and she and her friend told us about this place.  We waited about 20 minutes outside the restaurant before we were seated and within moments ordered our mean.For starters we had the chargrilled oysters as well as fresh oysters and both were very good, and very fresh, no gross fishy after taste, BONUS!  For eats, we had deep fried soft shell crab, ham poboy (for my toddler), New Orleans Medley, and Jambalaya.  HOLY MOLY DONUT SHOP!  SALT IS ON SALE!!  The batter for the soft shell crab, the jambalaya, and gumbo were extremely salty.  The sausage itself was not as salty as the others and had a great smokey flavor, but was a little dry for my taste.  We did enjoy the red beans and rice.  It was the only part of our meal outside the oysters that we were able to finish, otherwise you would need quite a bit of water to get it down.  Too bad our server didn't answer to our call of thirst.  Our glasses remained empty until the bill arrived when she asked if we needed more water. =(Overall, there is a bit of a wait outside, our server wasn't as attentive as I was hoping for, the food was salty and the oysters were delicious!  Will we eat here again?  Of course, but only for the oysters, however, we may find another place that has great tasting oysters with better food than what the Acme Oyster House has to offer.

Reviews.Author: Steve J.
Reviews.Content: It looks like Acme Oyster House isn't afraid to offer all the oysters you can eat. We first saw a glimpse of the wall of fame(15+dozen club) we see it once we got inside which took about ten mins of waiting with 3 groups ahead of us. On our first time here, I ate Charbroiled oysters, raw oysters, and Oyster shooters. On our last day of NO, we went back and ordered the same thing but also asked for the Oyster Po'boy sandwich for the plane flight back to CA. I think that was ok, and eating Acme Oyster House on the plane was certainly more affordable than the airline food! For some reason i felt that everyone on the plane had wished they brought Acme Oyster House.

Reviews.Author: Allen M.
Reviews.Content: Due to the amount of people that want to eat here, the line was a good size and took about 45 minutes to get inside. It was rowdier inside than on the street. This place gets a 5 because of the oysters and the poboys. All are amazing. Service was a little slow due to the amount of people walking around and the hectic atmosphere but nothing to worry about. The fried soft shell crab was the only thing that I probably would not get again. Wasnt as crispy as I would have imagined but with all the other choices on the menu, no need to ever order it! Great food, great atmosphere, and most of all AWESOME OYSTERS!

Reviews.Author: Larry W.
Reviews.Content: Food was pretty good but a tad bland in my humble opinion.  I guess this is why they had three types of Tabasco on each table?Service was terrible

Reviews.Author: Joyce M.
Reviews.Content: Tried both Acme And Felix for oysters. I have to say Felix's was better because the oysters were larger and the Oysters Rockefeller was better than the Charbroiled Oysters at Acme. At Acme, we received a oyster that was one-quarter the size of the others. We asked if we could another one to replace the smaller one and the waitress said " No".  She didn't even offer a "Sorry" or offer to check with the manager first.  Bad customer service!! There was one positive over Felix's: The jambalaya was better at Acme.

Reviews.Author: B D.
Reviews.Content: Saw this place on Man vs. Food - YouTube clip and wanted to try it. Tried the Oyster Rockefeller Soup and the super fresh iced oysters on the half shell. Will come back to try the other menu items :) thanks Acme!Quick Tip:  Line can get pretty long due to its fame...get there before the rest of the crowd.

Reviews.Author: Monica M.
Reviews.Content: Food was FANTASTIC!My friend and I were in New Orleans for a conference and I was dying to try some "staples": jambalaya, rice and beans, hush puppies and some gumbo.  We went to the one in the French Quarter due to all the raves on Yelp.We were not disappointed.  I got the New Orleans Medley an got to try pretty much everything on my list.  Plus a side of hush puppies.  The jambalaya and hush puppies are TO DIE FOR!  Amazing!  Shrimp gumbo was good.  Rice and beans I didn't care for.  The andouille sausage was ok.  Odd that we went to an oyster house and didn't have oysters, but the other food there was AMAZING!  Highly recommend it.  And service was fast.

Reviews.Author: Kat Y.
Reviews.Content: You know food is good when after eating it, you can't stop licking the roof of your mouth to get the flavor just one more time...nom, nom, nom, nom...The line was long, but it was well worth the wait, and moved quicker than you'd think. Oh my chargrilled oysters!!!! I wanted to suck the shell dry. We went back for seconds with the fresh...also yummy! The gumbo was a solid choice as well. And then, finally, for the bread pudding...holy delicious....nom nom nom nom...Service was good, and the food came out quickly. They had a pretty well stocked bar, and some yummy beers on tap.This place is a must in NOLA...nom nom...

Reviews.Author: Tracy D.
Reviews.Content: We Came for oysters, and had the char-grilled oysters, then split a 1/2 and 1/2, we chose half shrimp and half oysters, it was fresh, delicious. The Char-grilled oysters are like heaven on a half shelf. Don't be a wimp, get the full dozen. The 1/2 and 1/2 was also really fresh and hot, and they make there own tartar sauce and cocktail sauce, it was perfect.There was a line, but it moved very quickly, and we were offered the choice to eat at the bar, or wait for a table. So we ate at the bar, on a Saturday night, the bartender Pam, was very attentive, service was quick and efficient.If you do have to wait, it's worth it.

Reviews.Author: Allison H.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for the food & service, 4 for the price. Acme has THE BEST Chargrilled Oysters I've ever eaten, & the fresh oysters are pretty damn awesome, too. Plus, Boo Fries! For those who are uninitiated Boo Fries are French fries topped with roast beef gravy & shredded cheddar. Get some. Again, back to the prices, the portion of Boo Fries you get for $4.99 is relatively small. As far as the oysters go, they have Oyster in the name, & you won't be disappointed. We spent 3 nights in NO & ate supper here twice. Why? The chargrilled oysters. Again, they're overpriced at $20 for a dozen, but DAMN they're good.  Expect to be out some cash when you go, but it's generally worth it. Also, expect a wait.  However, if you make friends with those around you in line the time will fly by.

Reviews.Author: Lauren A.
Reviews.Content: Acme Oyster is one of the rare touristy things that is totally worth it. The chargrilled oysters at Acme have changed my life. I don't think I will enjoy eating anything ever again as much as I enjoyed wolfing down a dozen chargrilled. Go with a small party and ask to sit at the bar. My husband and I were pulled from the end of a long line of large groups waiting for a table. It was fun to sit at the bar and watch the guys shuck oysters.

Reviews.Author: Sandra A.
Reviews.Content: Stop reading reviews now and just go to Acme, sit at the bar, and get you some oysters! Great atmosphere, great food. We had oysters...oh so many wonderful, cold, big, fat, delicious oysters. Rice and beans, shrimp po' boys and you must try the boo fries. OH MY GRAVY!Try to go on off hours, it's a shorter wait. If you go later in the evening, especially right at dinner time - expect to wait outside. If you find yourself waiting and thinking it can't be worth the wait...you're wrong.Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Mallori S.
Reviews.Content: We just went to New Orleans this past weekend and lets just say it definitely lived up to all I expected it to be!  We went to have oysters here on Sunday night at 6pm, there was a short line but we only had to wait about five minutes.  We were seated at the bar and if you are going for just oysters I would recommend sitting at the bar. We had two dozen oysters and they shuck they right there in front of you! How fun!  The guys that were shucking took our orders and were really friendly, we chatted with them while we ate.  The oysters were great, I would have tried the chargrilled oysters but I had already eaten so much heavy food all weekend!  Prices aren't bad either, 13.50/dozenI would highly recommend trying this place if you are in town and if you love oysters!

Reviews.Author: Margarite S.
Reviews.Content: This place always has a wait so be prepared. However, once you get inside you'll see why! We sat at the bar for a quick lunch and were pleasantly surprised. I ordered the soft shell crab po boy and my friend ordered the chicken po boy with seafood gumbo. Unbelievably good!The service was good as it usually is in New Orleans. The decor is nothing to rave about, it has a bar feel with a bar and then dining area that is closely crammed together but the appeal of this place is the food, not the decor. For some authentic New Orleans style food, make this restaurant a priority. It was also inexpensive. I think our check came to about $40. Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Donald L.
Reviews.Content: It is touristy and crowded but I loved the oysters and you can't beat the location (just off bourbon st). Expect a bar atmosphere, great oysters and a cold beer. Nothing fancy.

Reviews.Author: Brian L.
Reviews.Content: Charbroiled Oysters were a good second place to Drago's.  Peace Maker Poboy and Beef Poboy were mighty tasty.  Crawfish were large and delicious.

Reviews.Author: Steve K.
Reviews.Content: So what do I say about this place. Well for one it seems that reviewers that come here simply join in on praising the place like the reviewers before them. I came here today with my gf for lunch. We ordered a dozen and a half of the fresh oysters and half a dozen of the chargrilled oysters.  The fresh oysters were quite bland and tasteless, so the only way we could actually enjoy them and get any kind of flavor was by adding some tabasco and cocktail sauce.The chargrilled oysters were very delicious. Hands down the best thing on the menu. Then came our fried shrimp and oyster poboy which again was a bit flavorless and required quite a bit of Tabasco, lemon juice and pickles. The potato salad wasn't that gear either.The banana pie aka cheesecake was very good. So while everything was fresh and ok,it certainly didn't live up to the hype that this place has received thus far, especially when it came to fresh oysters.

Reviews.Author: Jyll F.
Reviews.Content: Grilled oysters are the way to go...yum

Reviews.Author: Bret D.
Reviews.Content: Great draft beer, awesome raw oysters, and delicious fresh craw fish.  I did not even look at the menu.  Service was quick and pleasant.  Prices were reasonable.  I wish they had such a place in Nashville.  Makes me want to go back just thinking about it!

Reviews.Author: Melissa A.
Reviews.Content: Life changing!!!  I had heard about Acme Oyster House and it was beyond my expectations.  We stood in line for about 30 minutes waiting to get inside.  I'd stand out there for hours if needed!  The char-grilled oysters blew my mind!!!  We also had a cup of gumbo and an order of raw oysters.  It was one of the best meals I've ever had.  For dessert we had a pecan cobbler which was basically pecan pie without the crust....delicious!  I can't recommend this place strong enough.  If you are in NOLA, you need to visit Acme Oyster House!

Reviews.Author: Nicole L.
Reviews.Content: Here's the secret....sit at the bar, don't wait in line. Yes you're welcome! Raw oysters and po boys are the bomb diggity!

Reviews.Author: Erich M.
Reviews.Content: Touristy but fantastic.  Had a bread bowl of gumbo and a po boy.  Probably my favorite meal while I was here.  Didn't know to get the chargrilled oysters, so I guess I missed out somewhat, but I cleaned my plate and it was a lot of food.  The hurricane I drank there was one of the better one's I had in Nola, also.  The wait was about 1/2 an hour, not bad.  Staff was friendly and talkative but not annoyingly so.  Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Bridget G.
Reviews.Content: Delicious!  The char-grilled oysters were amazing...

Reviews.Author: Chelsea W.
Reviews.Content: Seafood Gumbo had great flavor, but was served only luke warm. Chargrilled Oysters were good enough, but not quite sure they met the hype.

Reviews.Author: Sam S.
Reviews.Content: I love this place!!! It's a must go-to place every time I come to NOLA!  They just never disappoint me with the food. Had the service been good this last time, I would have given them 5-stars. Check this place out though!

Reviews.Author: Jacalyn E.
Reviews.Content: Great oysters, small portions

Reviews.Author: Daniel D.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I usually avoid touristy places with long lines but this place is worth it. The New Orleans sampler is solid, the chargrilled oysters are a must, and the service and atmosphere is pleasant. Probably best to come between standard lunch and dinner times.

Reviews.Author: Melina H.
Reviews.Content: Terrible service and overpriced food. The servers and manager talk about the customer, which goes against the golden rule "The customer is always right." Having worked in a restaurant, even if the customer isn't right, you should never make it apparent that you disagree. Will never be back and will make sure to spread the message to others... this place doesn't deserve customers for the way they treat them.

Reviews.Author: Greg B.
Reviews.Content: Greatness.

Reviews.Author: David V.
Reviews.Content: Sure it's tourist city but they still do the best oysters in the city.

Reviews.Author: Richard H.
Reviews.Content: wow you are kidding me, soooo good, baked oysters.  fresh oysters soo good.. best thing for sure was the soft shell crabsjambalaya was really good too and normally i do not like itgot the red bean and sausage, not a fan of beans but it was goodthe beer was good maybe cause i was a little buzzed already.  got a bowl of corn chowder or something that looked like it, and that was okeverything in nawlins compared to cali seems to be much cheaper, as in seafood!!!sooo amazing a have to go!! line is forever, i dont think there are reservations cause it is always so busy, please do not try to cut in line, cause people have tempers, and the hostess will for sure kick you out, with the help of the securiy outsidewait for sure at night will be an least ...LEAST an hour!go early

Reviews.Author: Wendy H.
Reviews.Content: came here on a friday night... expect to wait! there is quite the line!  the raw oysters were soooo good!!! the chard oysters were okay~! and the oyster shots were sooo strong!!  the softshell crab was amazing! jambalaya was delicious.  red beans and rice was okay to me. i would def come back for more raw oysters! soooo good! and the service was great! our waiter was friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Author: Joyce B.
Reviews.Content: The wait is long but totally worth it! Get the oysters. I tried the fresh, iced oysters and they were the best I've had. Definitely recommend! If you want something more buttery, get the chargrilled oysters.

Reviews.Author: JoAnna D.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled Oysters are a MUST. If you're unsure, get 6. Then kick yourself because you didn't get 12. We also had the 1/2 and 1/2 shrimp and fried oysters, the fried oysters were just as good as the chargrilled. The fried shrimp were also good.

Reviews.Author: Idunno Y.
Reviews.Content: A no-frills, authentic seafood place that you must try!  The charbroiled oysters were excellent -- I ordered a half-dozen and quickly wished I had ordered a dozen.  I had a cup of seafood gumbo that was fantastic.  I had the spicy sausage Po Boy (cup of gumbo and half sandwich), which was delicious.  The only drawback was that the delicious draft Abita Amber beer was served in a plastic cup.  Perhaps I could have asked for a mug, but I was having such a delicious meal that it did not occur to me to ask.  I would have gone back every day if I could have.  I went about 3 pm on a weekday and there was no line.

Reviews.Author: Claire H.
Reviews.Content: This place does not deserve the waiting lines or the ratings. My experience was very underwhelming. Shove-y service, average over-fried fried food, and portion sizes that were small by Southern standards. The seafood Veloute was OK. The Louisianan diner décor saved the experience from being a total write off. It must be the oysters, which I didnt try.

Reviews.Author: A, S.
Reviews.Content: Great place. Only downfall, is it is to small. Can be a long wait, may not be worth it. IF not a long wait, go for it. Easy location, and recommend it. Authentic NOLA grub. Oysters really good.

Reviews.Author: Jason B.
Reviews.Content: The food was so good there. Its a restaurant that I have to visit every time that I'm in New Orleans. Their "Oyster Shooters" are reasonably priced. If you have a couple beers and a shooter you will feel good for a couple hours.

Reviews.Author: Vraj D.
Reviews.Content: chargrilled oysters are orgasmic

Reviews.Author: Juleta C.
Reviews.Content: This is by FAR the best oyster bar ANYWHERE! I was in New Orleans for 7 days in April & I went to Acme's every day & ate 1 dozen chargrilled & 1 dozen raw each day. I went back 2 weeks ago with my husband for 6 days & we ate at Acme's 4 of those 6 days (twice on one day). My husband ordered the shrimp poboy one day and said that it was fabulous! The shuckers behind the bar are the BEST. I have come to know them all quite well. The "sauce" that they put on the oysters is like nothing else I have ever tasted at any oyster bar. Living in Las Vegas, where we have several oyster bars. This is saying a lot. Beware if you go there, you will be compelled to go back again & again.

Reviews.Author: Lisa N.
Reviews.Content: A very solid 3 stars for this place! There isn't much to décor or ambience but the food and service are great.  The trick to this very popular spot is to start off with it for a late breakfast/early lunch meal.  We arrived at 11a and were seated immediately. The grilled oysters were a treat but you lose a little of the oyster goodness with the cheese on top. This would be a great choice for those not into the fresh raw ones. As for the rest of the meal, it was all right and tasted very salty. We ordered the New Orleans Medley and Jambalaya which both could have used less salt. Overall, the oysters are a must and service was speedy before noon.

Reviews.Author: Jessica Y.
Reviews.Content: we ordered a dozen raw oysters and a dozen chargrilled, 2 oyster shooters, new orleans medley - Sampling of gumbo, jambalaya, red beans & rice and grilledsmoked sausage, and some abita draft beers.i'm conflicted because i would give the medley 4 stars - it was very tasty and not too salty like other restaurants but for a restaurant called an oyster house they had terrible oysters (1star quality). the raw oysters were extremely sandy. every bite was crunchy. they were on the smaller side/lacked flavor and were not that fresh. the chargrilled ones were super salty. we wanted to try the banana foster pie but they did not have it. in terms of the service it is slow but the hosts and servers we encountered were very pleasant. all in all not worth waiting and don't get the raw oysters.
