Reviews.Author: Colin Y.
Reviews.Content: Over. Rated. I guess 1800 tourists can't be wrong but for the life of me the fresh oysters would not make my top 20 anywhere. The shrimp po boy was alright but there was nothing whatsoever to distinguish it from a million other fried shrimp sandwiches in the world. And the price to enjoy all this avid nance of mediocrity? 30-40 minute wait minimum, and $33 per person for some oysters, a sandwich, and a beer.

Reviews.Author: Mike C.
Reviews.Content: Just chomped on 2 dozen oysters, fresh and chargrilled!!  Yikes so much better than Cali. The Cajun medley was great. Just the right portion sizes. Great fresh seafood!!!

Reviews.Author: Thela C.
Reviews.Content: Charbroiled oysters OMG!!! So we did our yelp reviews before we arrived in New Orleans, we were on our way to a football game and wanted a place to have a beer and some oysters before we head to the stadium. A friend recommended we stop here and after reading all the excellent reviews we said why not. We got here and there was a line which I wasn't too pleased with, I hate waiting in lines but someone on yelp had said that it moves quickly and it would be worth it so we waited and yes it sure did move quickly and we were inside in about 5 minutes. We got seated towards the back and the waiter was very nice and got us our drinks and appetizers promptly. We got the Charbroiled Oysters and they were amazing!  Really hot so be careful, they had some melted parmesan cheese of some sort and a bit of virgin oil but it was soooooo good, they give you some hot french bread to dip in the oily sauce of the oysters. Yummy. My bloody mary was good however I did not like how they put it in a little clear plasltic cup, come on guys get a drink glass , same thing with my husbands beer, it was in a little plastic water cup. So yes I also ordered the crawfish tail po boy fried and my husband got the peacemaker po boy which was fried shrimp and fried oysters. Both were a big portion and were very good. We will def be coming back to this place after we hit up some other spots to try out . All in all good place to eat and bravo zulu to the owner for keeping it a great spot .

Reviews.Author: Matt P.
Reviews.Content: Tourist trap. Go when there is no line. Great charbroiled oysters. I don't know if I'd order anything else. Only reason why this place would not be good for groups is the amount of wait time.

Reviews.Author: janey m.
Reviews.Content: Was a good evening, very busy, crustations abound.Had the Jambolia (being a European tourist and all that) not overstruck, but when in Rome.....

Reviews.Author: Nicole L.
Reviews.Content: First place we ate at when we went to NOLA for the first time.  We had to wait in line for about 20-30 minutes and were then seated right by the door.  Bummer.  The temp was up and down the whole meal.  But, that was the only bummer.Cold beer, amazing oysters, yummy craw puppies, and the New Orleans Medley was a nice taster.  I could have just ate the oysters all night!  haha  Took the rest of my beer with me when we left and the rest of our trip is history!  :)

Reviews.Author: Long T.
Reviews.Content: During my vacation to NOLA i decided to try the 15 dozen oyster challenge after seeing it on Man Vs Food. The oyster shuckers were off the hook and very motivating but the crowd was the best, cheering me on as i ate oyster after oyster. I eventually won and became the first person in Massachusetts to be on that exclusive list.If anyone happens to stop by there please take a photo of the winners. They said it would take 6 weeks for them to create a plack for me. I won in October 2010.Thanks

Reviews.Author: Mike S.
Reviews.Content: I travel at least once a year to New Orleans and this is usually a stop.  The food is top notch for what it is.  But the price is now a little high for my taste and the wait was obnoxiously long.  I can get substantially identical food in many other places nearby.  The seating is tight, but if I had an active audience like that I would have as many seats as possible too.If this restaurant were anyplace else on the planet it would be at least four stars, but its not, its in the French Quarter.Abita on tap is also a winner.

Reviews.Author: Alex C.
Reviews.Content: We walked past this place e day before and they were just about to close after lunch and there was a huge queue, we read a couple of reviews on yelp! And on tripadvisor, so we decided to go for dinner the next evening, there again as a huge queue and we were told it's going to be about a 30minute wait, we were more than happy to wait as we had a late lunch and knew that there would be a queue, So we made it in after 35 minutes and sat up at the bar, we ordered half a dozen oyster to start, they were big and meaty but not very creamy or had much flavour, then we ordered a po'boy this a was a little disappointing. Service generally was okay, but nothing to rave about, overall it was just okay, I would not queue up again to go in don't think it was really worth it.

Reviews.Author: Lin L.
Reviews.Content: Acme got me hooked up with fried oysters. They have various different kind of oyster, from raw and others. Very busy place to eat, make sure comes early if you want to get seated fast. Crawfish  is also addicting. It's spicy, salty and tastes great, only trying to eat and peal small lil lobstery lobsters not always the fun part. They also have root beer float! I wish chocolate ice cream is an option, which would make my day complete!Second time getting oysters, i got a tiny pearl gift inside the fried oyster.Definitely would come back!

Reviews.Author: J. C.
Reviews.Content: This place is just ok and over-rated. The service is curt and rushed. The oysters don't taste any better, and are smaller and had shells in them. The decor is dark, dingy, and crowded. Overall, I was unimpressed and think there are better places for oysters.

Reviews.Author: DeeAnn T.
Reviews.Content: Oh my goodness! we stood in line to eat here twice! Worth the wait! The grilled oysters taste so yummy and melt in your mouth! We ate them both days. I also enjoyed Seafood Etouffee. The taste was wonderful! The prices were good too. Try it...you wont regret it.

Reviews.Author: Renee S.
Reviews.Content: This place is fine, but Felix's is much better, and it's right across the street.  Chargrilled oysters were awesome, but about 1/2 the size of the ones at Felix's, and the same price.  Jambalaya was good- I think Felix's is a bit better, and again, same price.Bananas Foster Cheesecake was amazing- highly recommend.It seemed everyone in our party enjoyed what they had, but the portions were so small, we all left hungry.  Go to Felix's - same food, same price, larger portion.  Service was much better at ACME, in fact our server was awesome, but for the price I want to leave full.

Reviews.Author: Kathryn I.
Reviews.Content: I am a recent oyster connoisseur... less than a year to be exact. It has become a food that i am obsessed with, fresh salty, and just an over all satisfying feeling that waves over me as I gulp them down! Here's whats great about this place... everyone has to wait in line outside... no split parties, no partial seating, and no fuss.  I am a restaurant manager and wish that I could enforce this idea, but of course it would never fly.  Anyway, waiting in line, they ask your party size and take your name.  There is an order to this, and it makes me feel great that no matter when you got there you never feel "skipped" or forgotten about, or even tempted to raise your hand when they call "Samantha Party of 2" when of course my name is Kathryn and my dining guest is Carolanne. Lets get to the food.. once inside you are greeted and asked for your drink of choice for the evening.  I always pair a light beer with oysters, just want to fill up on oysters and not so much the alcohol.  Our server was WILL, and let me tell you he was amazing! Not really too much to get into when your menu consists of oysters, po boys, and platters of the same as the po boy fillers. Its simple and to the point.  There isnt much upselling or suggestive selling going on here.  What we did get was attentive and a smiling server who never let our glasses get less than 1/2 full before offering another round of chilled beverages. We started with 12 raw oysters and 12 charbroiled oysters.  Raw came first, served with a house made cocktail sauce full of horseradish and hot sauce. It cleared my sinuses with the first bite.  These oysters are served simple with lemon and a selection of hot sauces and crackers on the side.  Next came the PIECE DE RESISTANCE  the charbroiled oysters. I all but held up the plate to drink the melted butter, cheese, and garlic. These 12 delicious nuggets are topped with Parmesan cheese, garlic, and of course butter and broiled until the cheese is bubbly and crispy. They are brought out with thick slices of baguette.  No hot sauce needed for these puppies, i did dip my bread in the butter on the plate, top it with an oyster, and chip some melted cheese off the shell and down the hatch... We of course had a 10 napkin roast beef sandwich and a soft shell crab, both with hushpuppies.  Nothing bad to say about the sandwiches, just wish i had ordered 12 more oysters :) The roast beef sandwich was rich, full of flavor and I topped it with swiss cheese and sauteed onions.  PERFECTION! Skipped the top bun and didnt feel too guilty about eating this "pot roast" on a bun!All the while Will was checking on us, making further recommendations in the menu and encouraging us with our dinner choices. He answered all the questions with confidence and really made us feel comfortable and relaxed. I would go there time and time again...probably on my next day off :) Thanks WILL and ACME for welcoming me to this city so wonderfully!

Reviews.Author: Christine J.
Reviews.Content: I finally made it into Acme on the last day of my vacation for a late lunch.  Every time we passed by the line was at least 30 people deep!  I figured that Acme must either be THAT good or a tourist trap.  Based on my one experience I'd say that the latter was likely the case.  We ordered a dozen raw oysters and a half dozen charbroiled.  Both were very good but definitely not the best I'd sampled during my week in nola.  For my entree I ordered the gumbo in a bread bowl.  Definitely not the best gumbo I had during my trip.  I may even go as far as to say it was the worst gumbo I've had, period.  As far as service goes, it was fair.  All in all I'd say that Acme is not worth the long wait.

Reviews.Author: Annette R.
Reviews.Content: We (party of 3) waited in line for approximately 30 - 40 minutes, but it was worth the wait. The charbroiled oysters were absolutely delicious!  They had just enough items on the menu to choose from, not overwhelming. Our server Edward B. was awesome.  He suggested a few items on the menu that were quite tasty. It's a little cramped inside, but everyone was very polite. I would definitely patronize this restaurant again.

Reviews.Author: Chuy G.
Reviews.Content: Must get chargrilled oysters.  They are AMAZING!  Also, I love the jambalaya and the gumbo (I think there are two kinds, I get the chicken/sausage, not seafood).  Anyway, plan on waiting in line most days or time it just right because this place is not a secret.  This is a must see place when visiting in New Orleans.  Every time I go to NO I have to eat here.

Reviews.Author: Debbie B.
Reviews.Content: We were here in Jan. and finally found this place inside of Harrah's casino.  Staff very friendly and the food was excellent.  We found this place to also the best value for the money.  The seating arrangements we a bit uncomfortable; I guess to get you to not settle in.  Overall, I would eat here again for sure.

Reviews.Author: Nicole H.
Reviews.Content: I walked from my hotel to grab some take out for my girlfriend, who was nursing a hangover... Its New Orleans, it happens! I walked in to give them my order as they don't take orders over the phone. They took my order and I waited for 5-10 minutes  before it was ready, fast and fresh (yay). While I was waiting, I was able to take in my surroundings, OYSTERS OYSTERS OYSTERS! I was sad I couldn't take them to go (apparently, its against the law- supid laws! What if I want FOOD poisoning!) The oysters were calling my name as they were plucked from the mountain of ice and freshly shucked right behind the counter! I watched them masterfully open them, and place them on the counter for the wait staff to grab them for their new homes in peoples bellies. I was probably in a trance watching this process because they had to tap me to get my attention- I am oyster obsessed!  We ordered the fried shrimp po-boy and the sampler that came with gumbo, jambalaya, rice with red beans and sausage! First and foremost, the shrimp po-boy was DELICIOUS, hot and crispy and the shrimp was CLEARLY fresh. The bread that cradled those delicate shrimp was soft in the middle and warm and crispy on the outside-PERFECT! They do the po-boy RIGHT! The sampler platter was amongst the best, of that combination of food, I had tried in NOLA; very authentic flavors. Each item (especially the rice and beans) was perfect!  Finally, I bit into the sausage- WOW! It was PERFECTLY smoked and plump. I didn't want the sausage to end but, it did and I was definitely sad; like I lost a plump, grilled friend; I take my food seriously! Don't worry, I wouldn't eat my friends.

Reviews.Author: Leo S.
Reviews.Content: Oysters were amazing and the  Fried fish po-boy sandwich was an excellent choice.

Reviews.Author: Nikki G.
Reviews.Content: NOT SHRIMP ALLERGY FRIENDLY!!! I have severe shrimp allergies. Therefore, my food cannot come in contact with shrimp. Therefore, my waiter informed me that they fried all their food in the same oil. I was a little disappointed that they could not or would not fry my fish and oysters in a separate pot or something. So, I had a sampler plate with jambalaya (pretty good), red beans with rice (pretty good), and chicken/andouille gumbo (taste like paint remover). If I return again, I will stick to the char grilled oysters. :(

Reviews.Author: Dee S.
Reviews.Content: I am wondering if those who are giving it high marks eat crap on a daily basis? Seriously, the worst food experience EVER. Out of the four things I ordered I only finished the oysters. Everything else, a few bites to confirm my disgust. I will agree that the char-grilled oysters are good, but your talking about butter, garlic and lots of cheese...of course its good. It was the only meal that my friends and I had where we sat around in silence. It is the last time I would ever go to this place if back in New Orleans. I definitely would not recommend it to anyone; short or long wait. Luckily we only waited about 15 minutes for a table. Oh and my favorite part was when a random server asked if we needed anything else. We said no we were done and please take away the items from our very crowded table with full plates. He went to tell our server and she looked at our table, rolled her eyes and continued to walk back and forth without lifting a finger just to move at least one or two plates so that we had some space to even sign the check. She did pick up the empty plates from the table next to us as if to say FU to us. P*ta. And yea we still tipped her 20% because it's not her fault the food sucks and her fake smiles were good enough. Besides, karma...

Reviews.Author: Dianela M.
Reviews.Content: I never had oysters and I tried them here for the first time. I went with a group of friends when we were in New Orleans for my birthday trip. This was actually where we decided to have my birthday dinner. We all ordered something different so we could try everything. Raw Oysters for the table, 2 fried oyster plates, stuffed soft-shell crab plate, shrimp etouffe and a shrimp po-boy.  The raw oysters were good, but probably something I would have to get more used to. Everything else was absolutely delicious, especially the stuffed soft-shell crab but the real star of the entire meal were the char-broiled oytsers. OMG, TO-DIE-FOR...I would go back to this restaurant every time I'm in NOLA just for those. The service was decent, there was a line to enter the restaurant (it's a popular place in NOLA) but we waited with drinks in hand :) Our waitress was nice but nothing over the top, they are very busy and the service shows but it wasn't terrible. I would definitely recommend this place and most definitely go back for the char-broiled oysters!

Reviews.Author: Michelle B.
Reviews.Content: fresh horribly prepared oysters. good crab chowder was decent. the oysters and the shrimp po boy was awfully SALTY! heart attack salty..the fried crab were also too salty. everything fried had a super thick breading to conceal the samll size of the sea food. the salt and the flour took away from the flavor of the crab and the oysters. worst of all the order came out cold. cold fried sea food.we had the fried oysters at the Palace Cafe the same day and they were hot, huge and bursting in your mouth

Reviews.Author: Teddy E.
Reviews.Content: I would give Acme 3.5 stars. The fresh oysters are nice and about market price. The char grilled oysters are tasty, but anything with that much butter should taste about that good. My shrimp poboy was tasty, but I could find an equally good sandwich elsewhere for cheaper. The ambience was pleasantly not fancy. The service would have been better off wasting less time checking to see how we were doing instead of making food arrive promptly.

Reviews.Author: Erich D.
Reviews.Content: Had some oysters.  Some chilled and some grilled.  The oysters served here are pretty massive though not my favorite.

Reviews.Author: Carlos R.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I both got the shrimp po-boy. Considering this is a seafood place this would be hard to screw up, so as expected the shrimp po-boy isn't bad.  I also got some jambalaya, it wasn't bad either.  The only thing that disappointed me was the cocktail sauce. It had was too much horseradish in it. If you plan on eating here get there early. They ALWAYS have a line to get in at the door.

Reviews.Author: Cyndi L.
Reviews.Content: Nice atmosphere food....had better

Reviews.Author: Gabbin K.
Reviews.Content: Great Oysters for a good price!  Yum

Reviews.Author: Scott L.
Reviews.Content: Not an oyster fan but STILL dig it, that says a lot

Reviews.Author: Vera D.
Reviews.Content: Came on a weekday at around 5pm and did not have to wait long to sit a party of 2. Sat at the bar.  Our server Amanda was great, but the food was just OK. If I were to come back, I'd probably get my oysters elsewhere. Fried/breaded dishes - too salty.Chargrilled oysters - good.Oyster shot thing - didn't LOVE it but it was certainly fun!

Reviews.Author: Diana L.
Reviews.Content: We came here for a late night snack. There was a line out the door, but we didn't wait long! We tried the char grilled oysters, raw oysters, and the boo fries. Everything was delicious. The grilled oysters came with slices of baguette to sop up the butter. So good! The fries were perfectly crispy and smothered in a yummy gravy. The hand grenade was also tasty and strong! Remember to get one to go!

Reviews.Author: Heather G.
Reviews.Content: Totally over rated and over priced. The oysters sucked. The people who work there are TOO damn corporate. There are too many other awesome places to eat in this city..don't waste your time or money.

Reviews.Author: bridget e.
Reviews.Content: char-grilled oysters and crawfish etouffe- what more could a person ask for?a happy bustling place it is and the server was attentive without being intrusive. lovely food glorious food.....

Reviews.Author: Diana S.
Reviews.Content: Forgettable.  We had the raw oysters (which were huge--big doesn't mean better with oysters), a dozen of the chargrilled, and a plate of crawfish.  This is a  crowded tourist stop--but sadly only mediocre food.

Reviews.Author: Tyler G.
Reviews.Content: Good service and great food. The chargrilled oysters were fantastic.

Reviews.Author: Frances G.
Reviews.Content: oyster |oistr|noun1 any of a number of bivalve mollusks with rough irregular shells. Several kinds are eaten (esp. raw) as a delicacy and may be farmed for food or pearls * a true oyster (family Ostreidae), in particular the edible American oyster ( Crassostrea virginica).How do I define oyster? LOVE.How do I demonstrate my love for oysters on the half shell? By going to Acme Oyster House and ordering 2 dozen oysters on the half shell for myself. Acme Oyster House is the epitome of your French Quarter/New Orleans/ cajun joint. The overcrowded restaurant is a testament to their awesome food but also the reason I sat at the bar...by myself. But you know what?! That's okay I was by myself. No pity party here. I would not have wanted to talk to anyone anyway. I was too busy sucking down some oysters and washing them down with their perfect sidekick, the Bloody Mary (side note: also very good at Acme Oyster House).If you are find yourself in the Big Easy stop by Acme Oyster House. It is not only good oysters but it is the one of those quintessential New Orleans dining establishments that exudes that Cajun lifestyle.

Reviews.Author: Adam M.
Reviews.Content: I came for the oysters and was not dissapointed!

Reviews.Author: Dominick Q.
Reviews.Content: "What I've got, ya gotta get it put it in you." - Anthony Kiedis, Red Hot Chili Peppers.  And if you have any room left over, you're also gonna want to put everything on the menu Acme Oyster House in you as well.Here's the blueprint for how to get this place done right:#1 - Get your group on the line that forms outside (don't be intimidated, it moves quicker than you'd expect)#2 - Dispatch two members of your group to buy 36 oz street beers #3 - Drink said beers while you wait on line for the next 20-30 minutes.  #4 - Get seated/immediately order 2 pounds of crawfish (i.e. "Crawdaddies") for each person in your group.  Crack, peel, snarf.  #5 - Ask your waiter what the fastest "15 dozen oysters" record time is.  You'll be floored, then disgusted, and then you'll incredulously do the math for the next 15 minutes before realizing that some people in this world truly ARE sick.  #6 - Get the Jambalaya.  I had 5 bowls of Jamba down in NoLa and this was the best.  #7 - Encourage the people in your group (who you don't want to come out after dinner) to order the New Orleans Bread Pudding.  Game/set/match. Night over.  #8 - Go back to your hotel and shower.  #9 - No seriously.  #10 - Leave butt-kissing compliment on my Yelp page for making your NoLa trip.

Reviews.Author: Jessica C.
Reviews.Content: Great place. Pretty loud inside. The oysters were fresh and delicious.

Reviews.Author: Casey S.
Reviews.Content: This place is definitely touristy but the food is delicious! The last time we went, we did have to stand in line, but it moved relatively quickly.  It's not overly expensive, and you wouldn't really want to go there for a romantic date.  If you just want some great food, this is a good stop.  I like taking out of towners here because they get the New Orleans experience and I get some delicious food!

Reviews.Author: Mary E.
Reviews.Content: NO. JUST NO. I'm from Orlando, so I know a tourist trap when I see one. The food here was subpar and overpriced. The service was OK until we mentioned some of our issues with the food--something I would never do unless we had a real problem--at which point it promptly became defensive, antagonistic, and confrontational. The ONLY disappointment on our trip to NOLA. I suggest you go elsewhere rather than waste time waiting in line here for bad food and service.

Reviews.Author: Melissa C.
Reviews.Content: A stop at Acme is a must on any trip to New Orleans. I just went to NOLA for the first time and everyone who knew I was going told me that I had to go to Acme for the chargrilled oysters. Apparently the lines can get pretty long, but we must've hit it at the right time, 3:00 pm on a Saturday, because we were seated within five minutes or so. The service was a little slow, but I attributed that to the fact that everything was being freshly made. Our server was very friendly and offered terrific suggestions, cluing us in on what I think is actually their best dish... the fried catfish. Don't get me wrong, the chargrilled oysters were fantastic, but the fish was cooked perfectly, super crispy on the outside and flaky and moist on the inside. I especially enjoyed it with the cocktail sauce... it had a little kick! The softshell crab po boy was also delicious, but a little messy to eat. I wish I could review their desserts, but we could barely finish our meals because the portions are crazy generous! Honestly, my recommendation for two people would be to split a dozen of the chargrilled oysters and a fried fish plate. You'll both leave happy and stuffed. Also, I have to mention that they carry bottled Barq's root beer, the perfect beverage to wash down all the yummy goodness!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie C.
Reviews.Content: Oh my gosh, so good! Our family was only half joking when we considered roadtripping down to New Orleans again just for their char grilled oysters.

Reviews.Author: Wakako U.
Reviews.Content: I hate fresh big oysters, but the ones here were tasty! The chargrilled oysters were equally tasty.  The broiled crawfish was taaaaaaaasty.  Suck the juice from the head!  Everything in New Orleans is tasty to the maximum.

Reviews.Author: Joseph B.
Reviews.Content: Our first meal when we got to New Orleans and our last before we catch the plane back home. Always a great meal.

Reviews.Author: Anna N.
Reviews.Content: I love the Staff here!!!So, i came here for work & decided to come in a few days earlier than needed to enjoy what New Orleans had to offer & let me say i am EXTREMELY happy that i did.  Now i can't tell you if i flashed for some HUMONGOUS beads or not, since i did tell myself i wouldn't do it, but hey its New Orleans right?! I got in town by myself, but fortunately my hotel was around the corner from Bourbon Street so it wasn't hard to keep myself busy.  Every night i would walk around Bourbon Street and check out the entertainment while sipping on some alcoholic drinks.  Each time i went out I would walk by the Acme Oyster House & it always has a VERY long line.  I wasn't sure what the hype was, but i was determined to try it before i leave.  The night before i had to fly out i went there around 5pm, knowing there wouldn't be a line that early & sure enough i got in & was able to sit by the bar where they were shuckling oysters.  Everyone at the bar, including the host are super duper nice!  For starters I had the gumbo, 1/2 chargrilled oysters and the fresh oysters.  For my main entree I had the fried soft shell crab poboy (my first poboy ever) and for dessert I got the bread pudding and the pecan cobbler....yes, i threw this all down in one sitting by myself!  Everything was pretty darn good...the soft shell crab poboy barely fit around my mouth cuz it was so huge, but it did not deter me to kill it with the use of dozens of napkins...i was one messy girl!  The pecan cobber wasn't what i expected, it came in a martini glass with ice-cream and caramel oozing everywhere...delicious!  The oysters were alright, i had better & some of them were quite large.  I prefer the Pacific NW Oysters, but you know i'm a northwest girl so i'm kinda bias...hehehehe.Ok, so here's THE BEST part.  As i was sitting there stuffing my face a contestant for the 15 dozen oysters in one hour contest decided to sit next to me.  So, in order to support him i had to continously order food so i don't get booted off my seat (there was a line building in the front).  As i was encouraging the contestant i gave him some advice i thought would allow him to win.  I told the man to inhale it like he was swallowing water & to NOT stop...=)  I have watched a few food contest over the years so i thought it was really good advice.  He was doing sooOO good, but on his 15th dozen he stood up turned & looked at me then threw up all over the bar & the shuckling area.  I jumped up so fast that i could of had whipped-lash!  Rather than being upset I was laughing my head off & I thought the whole thing was wonderful, even if he did have puke in my soda & food.  For some reason the guy didn't look very happy about my advice.  Seriously, i think his downfall was he ate too much cocktail sauce & drank way too much water...the puke was brownish.  Plus, the workers there told him to stand up so it won't sit on top of his belly & he didn't listen.  I seriously think i can do it, but i don't know if i wanna pay for 15 dozen at $20 a pop.  If i ever decide to do it i'm gonna take my own advice & see if it works for me.  Overall, a great experience!  Everyone is super nice there & i would come back just to see if I can support another contestant!

Reviews.Author: Eva S.
Reviews.Content: Delicious!  Hands down the best Oysters in town.  The raw oysters are fresh.   Our favorites were the chargrilled oysters.  Make sure to get both types and share.

Reviews.Author: Madeline G.
Reviews.Content: Tried some oysters for the first time...not really a fan, but this was a great place to have a first lunch in NOLA. Super busy and always a line.

Reviews.Author: Dylan E.
Reviews.Content: Great oysters. Great po boys. Great jambalaya. The long line is usually a problem if you're going for lunch or near dinner. Service is usually fairly okay too. All around great place to eat.

Reviews.Author: Alexa g.
Reviews.Content: With 120+ reviews there is not much else to add. The chargrilled oysters were delicious, although a bit salty but the service was quick and friendly. The red beans and rice were also tasty, next time I'd pass up a table and head straight to the bar where they shuck them right in front  of you!

Reviews.Author: Jen R.
Reviews.Content: a stupendous place to bust your oyster cherry.  raw, fried, chargrilled - on the shell, a platter, in a po' boy or even as a shooter, acme does all things oyster consistently and tastier than almost anyone else i've ever encountered.and the line that always stretches down the block is proof that i'm not the only one who thinks so.  not many things are worth standing in a 45 minute line for, believe me, i know.  this is one of them.

Reviews.Author: Krista J.
Reviews.Content: ACME definitely lives up to the hype for an oyster house. We got there right at 6pm and there was no line. When we left an hour later there was a huge line out the door so it really depends on your timing. We had chargrilled oysters and they were delicious. Even my fiance loved them and he is not that big of a seafood fan. Anything is good in garlic and butter though. We also had the crawfish po' boy and the oyster and shrimp po'boy. Both were very good. I did not find it to be overly pricey. It was pretty typical of the French Quarter.

Reviews.Author: Suzan W.
Reviews.Content: Well worth the wait in line!!!! The raw oysters are the biggest I have ever seen....literally 2-bite oysters.  The fish po boy was also excellent.  Everything was very reasonably priced (actually cheap by french quarter standards).

Reviews.Author: Heather F.
Reviews.Content: This was my first meal in New Orleans.  I hadn't done any research prior to my trip, so I didn't know how touristy it was.  There was a short line but I got a seat at the bar without a wait.  I got a beer, a roast beef po-boy (the Acme "10 Napkin Roast Beef"), and some hush puppies and watched lots of Louisiana oysters being shucked while I chatted with an interesting Neuropsychologist attending the same conference.  The roast beef po-boy was sloppy and delicious.  The meat was amazingly tender and I wasn't at all ashamed to lick my fingers (I was conserving napkins).  The hush puppies weren't the best I have ever had, but with the po-boy, I really didn't need any sides.  If there weren't so many other amazing restaurant choices in New Orleans, I definitely would have come back.

Reviews.Author: Twanda E.
Reviews.Content: I simply love New Orleans...as long as we are not referring to football :-) The chargrilled oysters are AMAZING. I don't usually like oysters but these tickled EVERY fancy. I cannot wait until we go back to the NO...Super Bowl, Mardi Gras, friend's birthday...

Reviews.Author: Syuan C.
Reviews.Content: Grilled oysters are incredible !

Reviews.Author: Michelle S.
Reviews.Content: Best Chargrilled Oysters on the planet.  That's all you really need to know. This is why they all come from near and far. They are world class. Otherwise, the gumbo or jumbalya is meh. I did have the oysters rockefeller soup and it was good. Needed to be warmer and was lacking in some spice/salt. But a nice small side to accompany the oysters. Keeping it carb-free in the Big Easy.

Reviews.Author: Jacy E.
Reviews.Content: Okay for drunk food. Very loud and noisy, so don't go there if you want to have a romantic meal. The portion size was okay, but for the atmosphere of "I'm drunk and need fried food" they could been a little more generous with the portion size. The boo fries were tasty but definitely tasted like a fried heart attack on a plate. I doubt I would go back there.

Reviews.Author: Robin K.
Reviews.Content: This was the only restaurant I tried in NOLA that I wasn't impressed with and wouldn't recommend.  I guess I like my oysters served nice and cold over ice.  These weren't and they just weren't great.  Meh...This place didn't live up to the hype.  Maybe if you've had too much to drink on Bourbon St...but we were still sober when we ate here :)

Reviews.Author: Vikm P.
Reviews.Content: Best place in town! Boo fries are dangerous and the oysters, well literally right out of the gulf. Do i need to say anything else, it is a must stop when in Louisiana

Reviews.Author: Robin S.
Reviews.Content: The oysters here are delicious!  You will have to wait in line but I think the wait is worth it. This is a must-do every time you are in New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: Jerome M.
Reviews.Content: This is the best place for oysters in New Orleans.  When ever I am there I have to have a dozen or more.  They have other food on the menu, but I can't discuss it because I don't care about it.  There is always a line to get in, but it is worth it. I know there is a contest between Acme and Felix (across the street) like Pats and Gino's in Philly, but when it comes to New Orleans and oysters, I am an Acme man all the way.  I will discuss Philly later.

Reviews.Author: Denise M.
Reviews.Content: Oysters were the best I had in New Orleans. So big and juicy! Awesome crawfish and po-boys too. Gumbo was ok.

Reviews.Author: Natascha C.
Reviews.Content: Of all the places in New Orleans we ate, THIS is the place we made a mad dash to right before we had to be at the airport for our flight home so we could taste Acme's chargrilled oysters just one last time. The chargrilled oysters are so good, you'll be thinking about them wistfully days after eating them.  I've also had the Fried Peacemaker po'boy a couple of times and it quite delicious as well. Plump fried oysters and shrimp with a tabasco mayo on delicious french bread. I'd fly to New Orleans right now if I could just to eat at Acme again. I wouldn't waste time (or valuable stomach space) ordering much from the rest of the menu. The oysters are the real star here.

Reviews.Author: Gina N.
Reviews.Content: We came to NOLA for mardi gras and this place was one of the top on our list to try. We were bummed crawfish was out of season (say what?!!! crawfish capitol and there's no crawfish? they must ship them all to cali goddamnit). We ordered the jambalaya and the oysters. The jambalaya was too salty i thought. The oysters on the other hand was delicious! we ordered 2 dozen of the chargrilled oysters since everyone was raving about them (and according to our bartender, they sell more than alcohol!). Its a must try here! There's usually a huge line, but it goes fairly quickly.

Reviews.Author: Micala H.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went here for lunch and absolutely loved it. I got the 1/2 pound burger. It was massive and cooked perfectly. My boyfriend got the roast beef po-boy which was to die for! Fries were awesome and everything was very reasonably priced for how huge the servings were. Well worth the 45 minute wait for the friendly staff and a great meal.
Reviews.Author_Location: Central Business District, New Orleans, LA

Reviews.Author: Marty Z.
Reviews.Content: Bourbon Street was its usual smelly, seedy self, but Acme's food made up for it. I LOVE their bread pudding with whiskey sauce. YUM!

Reviews.Author: Calleigh J.
Reviews.Content: their baked oysters!!! sooooooo good! And the people who work there were super nice!!

Reviews.Author: Alain M.
Reviews.Content: BEST chargrilled oysters I have ever had!!! Do yourself a favor and make sure to order the chargrilled oysters will not regret it.  I tried crawfish for the first time and absolutely loved them the staff is extremely nice and just good old southern hospitality.  If I got back to NOLA will definitely be going back to Acme.

Reviews.Author: Cheri. A G.
Reviews.Content: If you have never had an Oyster Po Boy you got to come here and give it a try.  What's an Oyster Po Boy you ask?  It is fried oysters in a small loaf with mayo and tomatoes...I add hot sauce.  Doesn't sound good but it really is.  I also had a lb of boiled crayfish but I wasn't too impressed and the seasoning was too mild for me.

Reviews.Author: Wendy C.
Reviews.Content: Awesome place! Pretty evident from the huge line outside waiting around meal time.  We started off with chargrilled oysters as an appetizers. I've never had oysters before but I loved the chargrilled ones. It comes with garlic bread. Yum! We also had boo fries which were fries with roast beef gravy and melted cheese. Bangin! I was on a mission to get gumbo that night so I went with the new orleans medley which came with gumbo, jambalaya and red beans. everything was AWESOME! Prices are reasonable and the staff was friendly. We were being jerks and sat the table talking for a long while but noone tried to kick us out. Definitely going back next time I'm back in NOLA!

Reviews.Author: randy s.
Reviews.Content: eeeeh...   not the worst place I've eaten, but come NOLA, you can do better...  Or maybe I just made a bad choice.  The wait outside the door is not bad at all....  Actually, it moves very fast.  Thought, it's misleading because typically good food will come with a long wait.  Fail....The service was excellent.  Very attentive, friendly, and made sure we were well taken care of.  Though, I never weigh any review on service.  Actually, bad service can still get a 4 star review if the food is good.  We had the gumbo, jambalaya, broiled oysters, oyster shooters, raw oysters and finished it with a banana foster...Raw Oyster- can't screw that upBroiled Oysters - Not impressed, all the grease without the flavorjambalaya- I've had it in a buffetGumbo- blah, bland, and had the little salad size cocktail shrimp...Eat somewhere else, unless you want raw oysters....  or eat there just to say you did.  I'll give it one more chance only because it gets such good reviews...

Reviews.Author: Anna R.
Reviews.Content: Best chargrilled oysters in NOLA! This is a MUST when in the quarter.  Always a long line, but so worth the wait. If you're really hungry and can't stand to wait in line, there's always the bar. Lots of menu options for Southern food which I found to be so-so. The one thing they do best are the oyster so stick with that. One other thing to note, for a restaurant in the south, they don't serve sweet tea!

Reviews.Author: Tu-van L.
Reviews.Content: The Cajun food was alright, but the seafood is the true winner here.  Oysters cooked all ways are spectacular and the fried catfish was the most tender, well cooked piece of fried fish I've had in NOLA.  Don't need to say more about this place that hasn't been said already.  So when you're in town this place is a must-try!

Reviews.Author: Eileen Z.
Reviews.Content: If you are dying to hang out with drunk tourists and overpay for seafood, this is your place!  I will stick with my other local joints that do oysters for 25 cents each and I won't DARE post their names on this review because all you 543 tourists that have reviewed this place will then be there.  Sorry!

Reviews.Author: Monica D.
Reviews.Content: I am not a fan of raw oysters but I went here and had the 1/2 shrimp and 1/2 oyster po boy dressed, no pickles. It was really good stuffed with a lot of shrimp and large oysters

Reviews.Author: Judith P.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in NOLA for our anniversary and I had researched eatery's in the area. After we got to the hotel and dropped our bags we went looking for food, see were walking I looked up and saw Acme's sign, best eating experience. Everything was very well prepared and there was no wait either time.

Reviews.Author: Mardi C.
Reviews.Content: I refuse to spend money in this place.  they ask for a ten dollar deposit for a credit report on all applicants...   got news for you...   the report is free...  and this is a scam.  Not only a scam, but the lines at the door?  I don't think so.  I doubt that any char broiled oysters they sell, match DRAGO;s where char broiled is king, and also invented.   The service folk were rude when I went in to apply, and that was long before katrina hit.  Same folks still workin there.   meaning?  the credit check scam on applicants is a total hoax... they never hire...  they just take app's, charge ten bucks, and make a killin...  go across the street to felix, or go to desire, or anywhere else in the city... if you want oysters... even deanie's down the street.  or casemento's uptown for the real deal, but spending money at acme's?  Wasteful...

Reviews.Author: Michelle H.
Reviews.Content: The more things change, the more things stay the same.  And for the Acme Oyster House, that is most definitely a wonderful thing.  It's been 16 years since I visited Acme and I confess that I had every intention of ordering what my husband and I always ordered:  A dozen raw and a po-boy.  But when I sat down at the bar, the very kind oyster shucker/ waiter told me that the chargrilled oysters were now their bestsellers.  What a treat!  The chargrilled oysters were outta this world, complete with buttery-parmesany loveliness to sop up with the bread.  The raw oysters were also divine, as expected.  I wasn't thrilled when they sat me at the bar, but the waitstaff was lovely and attentive and there were several fantastic women (one from Savannah like me, go figure -- and the other from NYC/Baltimore) who joined me in short order.  Great company, great food --and a win win for solo dining.

Reviews.Author: Chris D.
Reviews.Content: This place is not that good. OK the oysters are good, same as they are at any other place in town. They have no real control over thatEverything else is mediocre to horrible. Dont touch the fried seafood or anything like etoufee It is fun to belly up to the oyster bar and rap with the shuckers.  some have been there decades and they have some stories to tell.Did have a bad experience though last time i was there. We went to settle the bill as the shucker who had been entertaining us encouraged us to pay cash. Why? so he could stuff the tip in his pocket and not share with the rest of the wait staff. He as much as told us thatThis is whats depressing about NOLA at times, good, authentic, hard working, jive talking worker giving us a great show at the same time trying to beat the rest of the staff out of their living.  No honor anymoreyou want good fried seafood go to Bozos in metairie, or even Jaggers in Harahan

Reviews.Author: Sally B.
Reviews.Content: OMG... my hubby had to have Acme almost as soon as he saw the billboard on the highway on the way in from the airport.  We were not disappointed (which is the double negative to say we LOVED it!).  You sit next to fun people and fun people work there.  The raw oysters are wonderful; the gumbo is reallyreallyreally good; the soft shelled crabs are among the BEST I've had (I know... I live in the north, but we get some SSC's up here, and I test a lot of them).  I really wanted to love the grilled oysters, but they were a little too cheesy - - for me! - - and therefore, too salty.  Eat at Acme and have a ball!!

Reviews.Author: Chris L.
Reviews.Content: So, I got another one of my oyster cravings and said to myself, "Self, quit being such a snob and go try Acme."  After all, it was a rainy Monday afternoon a bit after 1:00.  I decided that if there was still a line like there usually is, I'd bounce elsewhere.  Luckily, I managed to get there while there was no line.  This is a self-proclaimed New Orleans tradition, but I'm not sure how many of the patrons were local.  I was seated at the bar and decided to just get a half dozen oysters this time because they're EXPENSIVE (I've said it before, and I'll say it again, F**K BP.)  The oysters were good, of course.  I was disappointed that their cocktail sauce comes pre-made as I prefer to customize mine, but so be it.  Still, next time, I'll just bite the proverbial bullet and order a whole dozen.  Ordering half a dozen is like having halfway sex (uh, UUh,  OYEAH, huh, WTF!)Then my entree sandwich arrived:  The Fried Peace Maker Po-Boy, which consists of fried shrimp and oysters.  When it arrived, I laughed a bit at my own naivete.  I was expecting the shrimp and oysters to be layered atop each other, but the sandwich was a typically NOLA half & half with shrimp on one side and oysters on the other.  I could have mixed them up to blend the flavors, but...naaah.  That could have been messy.  I have to say, the po-boy was STUFFED full.  That's a good thing, but for $12.99, it damn well better be overstuffed.  The service was pretty much what one should expect from a hyper-busy tourist trap:  not bad, not special.  I was glad that I was able to get in and out in 20-25 minutes, most assuredly a rarety here.  Everything was fine, just not spectacular.  However, at $28 (inc. tax & tip) for a half dozen oysters and and 8" po-boy with no drink save water, this frugal diner (AKA, cheap bastard) will enjoy his memories and probably not return anytime too soon.  I'll be at Felix's standing at the oyster bar and laughing at the line outside across the street at Acme (which, btw, had re-formed by the time I left).

Reviews.Author: BB C.
Reviews.Content: I have to say the line was long! We decided to give it a try because it is the highest reviewed place on yelp. It was not a let down because i get to taste the NO foods. I recommend ordering the items on the menu with the star next to it because its creation. I think the foods were mediocre and i guess it is just a yelp hype place. Should I say overrated?

Reviews.Author: Anise F.
Reviews.Content: I have been a frequent visitor to New Orleans for 18 years and I have lived here for a while.  I finally decided to see what all the hype was about and why there is always a line.  After eating lunch there yesterday, I still can't figure it out.  The service was fine.  The decor was average, cleanliness was average, and the food was overpriced and, well, average.  I won't bother going back.

Reviews.Author: Jamison E.
Reviews.Content: Great place just off Bourbon Street. This was the first time I went to Acme and it was solely based on the high reviews by Yelp reviewers so, thanks!  Some reviews said it was over priced long lines and waitstaff weren't great.  Honestly what do you think.... Nola is a tourist town hence high prices and lines.  Waitstaff in Nola also have to deal with more than the average number of drunks. Fortunately, I didn't experience any of these complaints. My experience was great. I went on a weekday early dinner so no lines. Got the much talked about char grilled oysters which were very good even for a non oyster connoisseur I also ordered a shrimp poboy which was really good. Not overly fried or greasy. And Pam my waitress was very nice. Great small restaurant atmosphere vibe.

Reviews.Author: jennifer p.
Reviews.Content: Ok we waited in line for like 30 mins and it was worth it.  The waiters where so nice and attentive.  They where so busy but had time to check on us.  The place was packed at 6pm.  We had the fresh oysters and fried oysters and soup.  The oysters where so fresh and creamy.  The oysters where clean and sweet.  The fried oysters where also delish.  It was loud and a busy spot but a great place to take a group of friends and family.

Reviews.Author: Eddie K.
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favortie places to come when in New Orleans.  The food is good and fresh.  They sure do how to deep fried food right, tasty and not greasy.   The line is usually long but moves quickly.

Reviews.Author: Valerie A.
Reviews.Content: Based on all the yelping, we headed there on our first night in town. We ordered barbecued oysters, which were really good, and a couple of other items. I guess the setting felt a little too like a diner for me, and I am big on ambience when eating out. But the real disappointment came when our waitress threw our bill on the table, and when we glanced at it we realized she had tagged on some items on there we never had... when we brought it to her attention, she just had a "ooops, they caught it" attitude, not even bothering to act surprised and apologize! That left a weird taste in our mouth...

Reviews.Author: Lindsay A.
Reviews.Content: We had the best NOLA experience here. It was raining outside, but luckily we got to skip the line to go to sit at the bar. As we were sitting there, the bartender shucked oysters and chatted with us about his New Orleans lifestyle. We had the chargrilled oysters (of course) that were smothered in butter and parmesan. DELICIOUS. We also had the sampler plate of jambalaya, red beans/rice, seafood gumbo, and grilled sausage ($12-13 i think). The stand outs were the jambalaya and sausage. As were were chatting, the bartender gave my husband a raw oyster to try and he said it was one of the best he's had. It was so good that we came back for dinner the same night with friends. The line was long but it moved quickly. For dinner I had the oyster/shrimp po boy. It had a kick but was very good ($14 i think). It's a must try spot!!! Not too kid friendly though FYI. No kid menu and all the seafood is fried. But delicious!!

Reviews.Author: Three XL T.
Reviews.Content: Worth the wait in line. Everything on the menu is awesome. No bad choices!

Reviews.Author: Erin J.
Reviews.Content: So worth the wait! If you're willing to sit at the bar, the hostess will bring you to the front of the line and you can get in quicker. The chargrilled oysters are amazing! So amazing that my boyfriend and I came back for dinner two nights in a row.

Reviews.Author: Eric S.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled oysters are the bomb! Also had fried crawfish po-boy and wife had shrimp po-boy. They were also very good. Friendly and professional staff kinda cramped space but that gives it a nice feel to me. We will be back. We went at about 4 so we didn't even have to wait in line. Oh almost forgot. Hush puppies were to die for a must order for a side.

Reviews.Author: Nancy C.
Reviews.Content: I admit it: I never liked oysters until I tried them here.  Then I couldn't get enough, as you will see in my other reviews of New Orleans restaurants.  The chargrilled oysters with garlic butter sauce and romano cheese completely lived up to all the hype, and the raw oysters were ridiculously good as well.  This is also a great place to get some filling yummy in the tummy (I recommend the seafood gumbo) for cheap. A great seafood meal for less than $20?  Yes, please!

Reviews.Author: Frank L.
Reviews.Content: Yeah! I had my first raw oyster here. I am no longer an oyster virgin. I liked them so much, I came back the next day for grilled oysters..Yum!

Reviews.Author: John O.
Reviews.Content: Long lines are an annoyance but this is worth the wait.  The chargrilled oysters lived up to the hype.  The fried peace maker po-boy was totally delicious.

Reviews.Author: Tony B.
Reviews.Content: A staple stop on any of my visits to the Crescent City! I was wondering how recent events would affect the oyster crop and much to my dismay...it was sad. The oysters this visit were small and gritty. I don't blame ACME. They work with what they have. I was still impressed with the quality of service and my other food choices. Shrimp po boy. I don't know if people realize the skill it takes to fry foods properly. Perfectly fried crisp and still maintaining their tenderness and flavor. The shrimp in this massive sandwich did not disappoint. ACME...I still love you!

Reviews.Author: Brian T.
Reviews.Content: So we got a chance to check this place out while in town, and I'm happy we did. Now I do have to say that I wasn't blown away but it's just something about eating oysters in a 100 year old oyster bar. I thought the food was good, kinda hard to screw up raw oysters though. My wife decided to get the fried crawfish tails, which I loved. Overall a great littl eplace to get some good oysters and other seafood.

Reviews.Author: Arana W.
Reviews.Content: Abita, ersters and po boys, oh my!Three of us for dinner the day after Christmas.  30 minute line.  That would usually sway me across the street to Felix's, but I hadn't been to ACME yet, and did Felix for my ersters my first trip out.  So wait it was.  We were seated in the very back room (the place is HUGE!) at a picnic table.  Our waiter was quick to bring us drinks (Abita TurboDog for me, Amber for Companion 1, pino grigio for Companion 2.)We started with a dozen raw oysters a dozen chargrilled.  Both were AMAZING! C1 never had an oyster before meeting C2, and is not a fan of raw animal protein in general.  (Sushi is referred to as "bait.")  Holy Mother of WOW were the chargrilled dozen incredible!  Cheesy buttery goodness...and C1 claimed he gets more than his fair 4, since he's not into the raw ones the way C2 and I are.  We fought his claim with the threat of impaling is hand with our forks...and told him he could order another dozen if he wanted more than 1/3 of tha plate - NO WAY were C2 and I granting that concession!For entrees, I ordered the crawfish po boy (I can't get enough!), C1 got the ACME po boy and C2 had a small etoufee.  4 beers + 2 wines + 2 dozen ersters + 2 po boys + 1 etoufee = 3 very full and very happy diners.  Total bill under $90.00?  Best.Food.Value.EVER!

Reviews.Author: Ann L.
Reviews.Content: Overpriced ($12 for a po boy with potato chips and $5 for a cup of soup) and mediocre.  Not worth the rave reviews or the wait.

Reviews.Author: Suzi G.
Reviews.Content: Anorexic oysters, refusal to accommodate large group with individual check needs, and still hungry :/ charbroiled oysters were tasty but small. Overrated.

Reviews.Author: Ken W.
Reviews.Content: THIS PLACE RAWKS!!!!! Now folks I haven't been here since 3 weeks before Katrina but the memory of this place will be seared forever in my conciousness. This place is a true NAWLINS ESTABLISHMENT. You cannot leave NOLA without visiting this Mecca. The freshest oysters around, shcuked right in front of you. Be prepared to wait in line but believe you me brutha it is worth the wait. Besides the oysters, you should try the jambalaya, oyster artichoke bisque or even cajun sushi. IT ALL GOOD here!!!!

Reviews.Author: Vivian H.
Reviews.Content: First of all, oysters are never good a hangover food. That said, the oysters at Acme were still yummy and fresh. I like the raw oysters more. The chargrilled oysters were good, but pretty salty and buttery, and I couldn't eat too many of those. Try the Boo fries (fries covered in cheese and beef gravy). SOO good!

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth G.
Reviews.Content: The oysters and stuffed/soft crab was good. I do have to say that our waitress was not the nicest or helpful. It was our first time here and as tourists, we are not familiar with the some of the menu choices so we kept asking questions and she was not very helpful and rushed us (so she got a cheap tip...lucky she got something!). Other than that, the people who sat us down were really great, but this place does need better servers.

Reviews.Author: David N.
Reviews.Content: Holy moly that chargrilled oyster dish honestly was soo good I was thinking of a way to take home some sauce to try recreate this wonderful dish.. Just give me more bread to dip! Ohh that Aligator Beer or something was very strong, totally got buzzed after 2 cups. After 4 cups even the poboys tasted like oysters.

Reviews.Author: Amanda R.
Reviews.Content: it was okay oysters at a reasonable price. The wait-staff was good and the other New Orleans' staples were good (Po' Boy sandwich and fried softshell crab) . the downside was it was crowded with tourists... i always think if you don't see locals dining, it's not the best.

Reviews.Author: Laraine Y.
Reviews.Content: In New Orleans, you don't need to go far to find great food. Acme Oyster House is one of the best for great prices and down home goodness. The spicy steamed crawfish is delicious, and my favorite, the char grilled oysters are to die for. Everything is good, so just go there often or with a large group so you can taste each other's orders.

Reviews.Author: Dawn O.
Reviews.Content: One of my fav spots in NOLA!!! Everything is good...from the food to the atmosphere!

Reviews.Author: Beth H.
Reviews.Content: The last time I was in New Orleans, I had Acme for the first time.  We ordered a 1/2 and 1/2 po boy - half catfish, half shrimp.  They screwed up the order and brought 1/2 oyster, 1/2 catfish.  We fell in love with the oyster.  So - the decision was made, right then and there, to return to acme for an oyster po boy every time we were in NOLA.  Well, we were lucky enough to have the opportunity to return to NOLA for Jazzfest last weekend...and yes, we went to Acme, just liked we promised.  It was Sunday evening, after the Foo Fighters, and the wait was not too bad.  There are plenty of places around to get a drink, which definitely makes the wait better.  We stood in line for maybe 45 minutes.  We had a table for 2 right up front next to the window, so the view was nice - until a very large rude man couldn't stand on his own and had to lean his ass in to the window, in to our faces.  Try and remember this when you are leaning on windows...your ass crack does nothing for my beer.  We ordered the boo fries - delicious.We ordered Shiners - it was Shiner.We order 1/2 a dozen raw oysters - delicious.We ordered the corn and crab bisque (soup of the day) - delicious (this reminds me to find a recipe).We split the oyster po boy - exactly what we came for - perfect.We ordered 2 more beers - it was Shiner.We ordered the Bananas Foster pie.  I don't like banana really.  It was AMAZING...Amazing.The check was $60.  What?!?....yep.  $60.  That's a whole lot of yumminess for a small ticket.  That's a $150 ticket at Pappadeux...at least... and the food and atmosphere were SO much better here.  I was very impressed with the entire experience.  The people were nice, the service was great, the line went quickly, the food was awesome.  Go Acme!!

Reviews.Author: Heather S.
Reviews.Content: Oh My God!!!! Amazing. Both the boyfriend and I had never had oysters and heard this place was a must! We sat at the bar and Curtis took care of us!!! We now are addicts and cannot wait to come back!!!

Reviews.Author: Helen L.
Reviews.Content: Adequately rated on Yelp, but somewhat overrated as far as word-of-mouth goes. We were told we "had to" go there! It was good, but far from spectacular. I was there post-Katrina, but pre-BP oil spill...so I wasn't too nervous about the local seafood at the time. The local oysters were amazing everywhere we went, so I can't give Acme too much credit. Well, it was nicely shucked...if that can be considered in a review. I had the "crawfish" and my girl had the "shrimp and catfish platter". We ate off each other's plates and concluded that the most exciting item on the table were the raw oysters. That's not to say it wasn't good, it just wasn't worth that line outside. Oh, and get this...the line is a prop! Yes, they make you wait outside and then bring you into a restaurant that's nowhere near full! The concierge at our hotel confirmed...the line is a prop.

Reviews.Author: Dia V.
Reviews.Content: Acme chargrilled oysters...you still haunt my dreams. You are perfect.

Reviews.Author: Amy L.
Reviews.Content: How is it even possible that I don't already have a review up of this place? Oh, wait. I know why. Because there are NO WORDS to describe how very, very wonderful this place is. If I were on death row and had to pick one last meal, charbroiled oysters from Acme would definitely be on the menu. Friendly, fast service, Abita on tap....Heaven.

Reviews.Author: Nancy L.
Reviews.Content: It lives up to the hype!  Ive been spoiled with variety from Oyster Bar in Grand Central, but Acme does just Gulf oysters and does it well. Very fresh & clean tasting, medium to large size oysters. While I like them raw, chargrilled was garlic, cheesy deliciousness. Their menu wasnt expansive, just a sandwich shop. But their po-boys are nicely seasoned fried seafood. Dont let the line discourage you, it moves pretty fast. Unless you have a big party....

Reviews.Author: Senna H.
Reviews.Content: YUMMY! theres no other way to put it.  cool atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Christy T.
Reviews.Content: The oysters are exceptional. When you live a state that treats seafood like an afterthought, any seafood begins to look really, really good. But, even from this outlook, Acme, it goes without saying, has it goin' on. Start with a dozen oysters on a half shell and pick your poison, lemon, hot sauce, or straight up and follow it up with an arbita beer. Wait around a for a little gumbo or go for another dozen oysters. For me, I knew fresh oysters were not in my future so the present it was and it was GOOOOOODDDDD! Enjoy.

Reviews.Author: Haley V.
Reviews.Content: The raw oysters are awesome!! The boiled crawfish leave a lot to be desired.  I ordered one pound of crawfish for $10.  I think I received 8 crawfish total... no corn, no potatoes, no nothing.  The chargrilled oysters were A+!  Our server wasn't great and even though there was lots of seating inside, we had to wait in line outside.  Will definitely return.

Reviews.Author: Anthai L.
Reviews.Content: The Baked Oyster was awesome! yum yum. The food was good and the service was great. I would recommend anyone that's in the French Quarters to most definitely go to Acme Oyster House. I will most definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Mitzi C.
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome, which is why there are lines out the door pretty much all the time.  The oysters are large, sweet and delicious (both fresh and baked).  The po boys just melt in your mouth (I personally like the catfish one).  I've also had the crawfish, which is usually too much work to eat, but its worth it at Acme -- the spices are great.  Another plus - they have Shiner Bock!  I wish this place was open late night -- I'd imagine that they would make a killing!

Reviews.Author: Craig D.
Reviews.Content: I have never liked oysters and was hesitant to try the oysters at Acme, but I was overwhelmed with how awesome they were. The chargrilled oysters were grilled with parmesan cheese....and were to die for. I would recommend Acme to any oyster lover or oyster apprehensive person alike!

Reviews.Author: Dan D.
Reviews.Content: Best oysters.  Yes, it's crowded, because everyone wants to get in to have these oysters.  The last time I was here, we must have had 3 dozen oysters each with a couple of beers.  The horseradish is so fresh, it burns so good.  This is one of my must visit places to eat while in NO.

Reviews.Author: Tylene T.
Reviews.Content: Get the CHAR-GRILLED OYSTERS!!!! I had it everyday while I was in New Orleans at every restaurant and this place was 1 of the best. I figured I had to try a po' boy sandwich while there but realized I don't like po' boy sandwiches lol. Don't know if it was the restaurant or if I just don't like them. Pretty much all they had though, oysters and po' boys. So make sure that's what you want before going.

Reviews.Author: Stephen T.
Reviews.Content: Had lunch here with six of us.  Food was fantistic...chargrilled oysters, poboy's, and the gravy fries...all excellent.  Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Author: Agnieszka K.
Reviews.Content: The worst restaurant experience EVER!Me and 4 of my friends waited nearly 2 hours in line outside this restaurant. We got really cold (it was the end of December) and when we finally got in they put us at the table next to the doors, which opened every 10 seconds (more cold) and the table was for 4 (they just gave us an additional chair). We had problem to fit all the plates since the table was too small and there's no way they'll let you switch tables. That's actually one of the restaurant "rules" that you can read cause it's hanging there  in the window. The other "rule"is no split checks.We ordered fried fish (so so), Boo fries (nothing special), gumbo poopa (the only nice thing about it was french bread bowl, didn't even look good), oysters (these were tasty but I'm sure you could get as good oysters anywhere in town).Basically it was a looooot of waiting, poor food experience and big bill. Please do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Author: Ana M.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled oysters. There's nothing I hate more than waiting in line but I will wait 7 hours for a dozen chargrilled oysters from Acme. They are just perfect. They're now the standard by which I judge all other oysters, baked and raw. And no one has been able to measure up since. Some gumbo and a plate of oysters and I'm in heaven. And despite the fact that you do have to wait in line, they're very efficient and organized about it. Really great, fast service and oh, so delicious.

Reviews.Author: Bridget W.
Reviews.Content: A dinner at the Acme Oyster House will make you appreciate New Orleans flavor.  The menu is classic Louisiana Creole cuisine.  I had the chargrilled oysters, which were heavenly.  Followed with Seafood Étouffée and a side of Hush Puppies, not to mention a few bottles of wine, and my dinner was truly perfect.  You can taste the cumin, cayenne and fresh seafood flavor in each bite.  Next time I visit, I cannot wait to dine on the Seafood Gumbo.The dinner truly made my vacation to the French Quarter memorable!

Reviews.Author: John W.
Reviews.Content: Five stars. Really.  If you are looking for oysters that are as fresh as I have ever had them, go to Acme.  Yes, there is almost always a line in front but you can normally get seated in about twenty minutes.  The crawfish etoufee is also worth ordering.  This is another MUST stop in NOLA.

Reviews.Author: Jessica L.
Reviews.Content: CHARGRILLED OYSTERS CHARGRILLED OYSTERS CHARGRILLED OYSTERS. You must, must get them! Everything else was pretty average (seafood po boy, gumbo, jambalaya) and the line was way too long but I went here with only 1 other friend so our wait time was much shorter than everyone else's (on a Friday night). Large parties - be prepared to wait a LONG time. I would honestly come back here just for the chargrilled oysters.

Reviews.Author: Justin A.
Reviews.Content: One of the best places to get charbroiled oysters in New Orleans. Great red beans too.

Reviews.Author: Heidi P.
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly, raw oyster was good, "charred" oysters were better, gumbo was good.  Overall relatively cheap, relatively yummy, conveniently located, and casual enough to suit me.

Reviews.Author: Drinky C.
Reviews.Content: Louisiana oysters.  If you're here for anything else, you're misguided.

Reviews.Author: Kent J.
Reviews.Content: Acme Oyster House is my most visited restaurant in New Orleans.  Nothing too fancy about this place.  In fact, it looks a little run down, but it's "the place" for fresh oysters.  I don't like oysters, so I'm more than happy with a catfish po boy, a side of hush puppies and red beans & rice.  This place turns 'em and burns 'em, so service will not be an issue.  The line at the door looks longer than the actual wait, so don't be discouraged.  Get your grub and move onto Bourbon Street, or vice versa.

Reviews.Author: Diem M.
Reviews.Content: I was only in town for dinner and I asked my coworker for a suggestion since she lived in NOLA for 4 years. The line was pretty long and we were STARVING! Luckily since we were a small party we were seated within 30 minutes. The charbroiled oysters were DELICIOUS. My only complaint is not getting more! We also had the crawfish tail po' boy and the soft shelled crab po' boy. Both great. Make sure to try the local seasonal Albita, a great beer that went well with everything. I can't wait to go back and eat here again!

Reviews.Author: ava c.
Reviews.Content: I did not do much research on restaurants prior to my trip to NOLA so it was only until my friend asked me to go stand in line 30 minutes prior to everyone's arrival, I realized this place must be a tourist trap. But surprisingly, the food was not bad. We ordered raw oysters which was good and fresh. I had half of a catfish po'boy and gumbo that were delicious. However the service was not great (this place is too busy) and the wait is too long, otherwise I would have given it 4 stars. I wouldn't mind coming back here again, though, since it's conveniently located next to Bourbon street and within walking distance to many hotels in the area.

Reviews.Author: Calysta L.
Reviews.Content: Holy Mother of God!  This place was awesome.  My buddy, Pedro, took me here after my crazy almost panic attack inducing 5th Circuit Oral argument and we ate and ate and ate.  Had a dozen grilled oysters - all I can say is HELL YEAH! Two dozen raw oysters and the best damn crawfish etoufee that I have had grace my lips ever.  We had a little bit of a wait, but it was definitely worth it and the old school ambience just made it more fun.  However, I can't say that I like the mirrors next to the tables.

Reviews.Author: William W.
Reviews.Content: The greatest restaurant on earth as far as I am concerned.  I always get the boiled crawfish (if in season) and the grilled and raw oysters.  Delicious.  If in the drinking mood, I recommend the John Daly which is sweet tea vodka and lemonade.  So good (and potent).   This place is worth the sometimes long wait.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer R.
Reviews.Content: No trip to Nawlins is complete for me without a stop at Acme. Somehow we ended up at the oyster bar for 6 hours last time we were there. Magic is one bad mudda shucka and full of jokes. Jokes aside, our shuckers were a wealth of information about New Orleans and very friendly.  My favorite to eat here is the bbq'd oysters and the oyster po'boys. While Acme is full of toursits, it felt like our local hangout.

Reviews.Author: Roy A.
Reviews.Content: This was one place that lived up to its billing as being on TV. The chargrilled oysters were to die for and he raw oysters were not too bad either. The charred ones came with some great romano cheese which formed a crust on the top and made a crunchy texture. They were drenched in some seasoned butter which some of my companions decided to just soak their breads in because it was so good.We also had the New Orleans Medley (gumbo, jambalaya, smoked sausage, red beans & rice) to get a taste of everything. The gumbo was real good but the others had room to improve. Although, we did have these after the great oysters so it was hard for them to live up to that.Finally, finished off with the fried platter with shrimp, oysters, catfish and soft shell crab. This was pretty good and the cocktail sauce that came with made it even better. The atmosphere as a whole was relaxed and casual and there was a line outside (~630pm Thu) which lasted about 10-15 minutes for us. Lots of TVs (although not many people watching) and almost everyone in there was a tourist which also scared me initially. But overall real good oysters regardless of how you get them prepared.

Reviews.Author: Leslie H.
Reviews.Content: best.  oysters.  ever.worth any wait you have to endure.  we got 'em grilled, and they were plump, tender, and perfectly seasoned.  waitstaff at the bar is attentive and friendly.

Reviews.Author: Marcus H.
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this place because of the staff and the food!  I had the small ettoufee with crawfish tails.  And get dessert--the pecan cobbler is excellent!

Reviews.Author: Justin W.
Reviews.Content: We received an estimated wait time of 20 minutes. Ten minutes later we were sitting and ordering!Wow! All I can say is well worth the wait! Chargrilled Oysters and Etouffee were incredible!

Reviews.Author: Debi S.
Reviews.Content: Yes, there is a line because this place is so good! Just send in one of your group to order Bloody Mary's with zydeco spice and drink them in line while you wait. You can have your oysters raw or chargrilled with garlic butter and parmesan cheese. Jambalaya, gumbo, red beans, seafood platter. It's all delicious and it's a casual, fun place to drop in before you hit Bourbon St.

Reviews.Author: John L.
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to NOLA and this was our first stop for lunch.  Amazing oysters and chargrilled at that.  Gumbo and the Peacemaker po boy was good also. Service was friendly considering it was busy and we have two kids.

Reviews.Author: Howard P.
Reviews.Content: First place I ate at when I arrived at New Orleans. Had my first Abita beer here. Ordered the soft shelled crab po-boy and oysters. Impressed with the size of the soft shelled crab and sandwich. Oysters were fresh and went down easy, although I'm no coniseur as it was my first time having oysters. Both tasted delicious. Desert was amazing as well: the Bread pudding. I'd recommend everything based on the generous portions and to people who enjoy seafood.Busy place. Was impressed by speed and efficiency of service.

Reviews.Author: New P.
Reviews.Content: Love the foods! especially Oyster! :)

Reviews.Author: Ieesha J.
Reviews.Content: Can I say OMG I'm in love with this place. The wait is scary so come early or sit at the bar. We had the charbroiled oysters and they were out of this world. The catfish and shrimp were perfect. I went back the next day by myself before I flew back to Cali and had the Gumbo!! It was delicious!! I will be back this summer and I know I can't wait lol!!

Reviews.Author: John B.
Reviews.Content: Fun atmosphere, great service, cold beer, delicious oysters, po boys...whats not to love?

Reviews.Author: Tina A.
Reviews.Content: the short: get the CHARGRILLED OYSTERS!  i would also recommend the fried peace maker as a safe dish.Chargrilled Oysters:- at first me and my cousins were reluctant to try it because we all do not like oysters, but how can you not get oysters at an oyster house???  the oysters turned out AMAZING!!!  literally the best oysters i have ever had.   the oyster meat was swimming in a bath of garlic, butter, creamy cheesyness...it's been a few days and i am still thinking about it.   - i wish they gave more bread so i could soak up more it's goodness.  some of the oysters had some sand in it still but it was still great!*i would highly recommend getting thisBoo Fries:- gravy with melted cheese on top of crispy fries!  what more can i say?  i come from california so i have never seen anything past chili cheese fries.  this was a good combination, the gravy made the fries taste meaty and the cheese was slightly sharp, and added some texture to the fries also- it was good but not good enough to get again, but these are at least worth 1 tryFried Peace Maker:- basically a fried shrimp + fried oyster po boy with tabasco mayo- a good standard po boy with a small spicy kick.   nothing too memorable about it's taste but it is definitely one better than Mother's Hush Puppies:- my first time having hush puppies - basically deep fried seasoned balls of corn meal.  it was a little dry and hard on the outside.  nothing too special Overall a pretty good restaurant!  none of the dishes were bad and none were a waste of money.  reasonable prices for good/safe food

Reviews.Author: Kristi g.
Reviews.Content: Omg the oysters. I never ever give 5 stars, they are that good. It's worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Thuy V.
Reviews.Content: Had seafood gumbo at Acme last week.  I paid more than $9 for a small bowl.  The whole bowl has 3 very tiny shrimps.  Some okra & lots of rice.  If your menu says seafood gumbo, you should at least have more than just 3 tiny shrimps!  Won't see me there again!
Reviews.Author_Location: Central Business District, New Orleans, LA

Reviews.Author: Daniella B.
Reviews.Content: Affordable prices and great food and service!  We got there around 11:30am and it was easy to find a seat but as we left around noon, there was a line out the door!  We got the boiled crawfish which was about $10 a pound that day and it was delicious and fun to eat!

Reviews.Author: Melissa A.
Reviews.Content: Intrigued by the line flowing out the door nearly every time I passed by Acme during my vacation to New Orleans, when I walked by late on a Tuesday night and saw no line I begged my boyfriend for a bonus late night dinner. It was quite good, but I can't imagine waiting in line on the dirty (the line formed next to a dumpster) street. The charbroiled oysters were awesome and had a good color to them (I had when the cheese isn't browned and bubbly, roast beef po-boy was all good, but really not the best po-boy of my trip. I also wish that they offered hot sauce beyond tobacco. I would definitely go in for another meal if there wasn't a line.

Reviews.Author: Deborah T.
Reviews.Content: Great place for oysters and seafood while in New Orleans. Blackened oysters and house gumbo were delicious. Be sure to stop by the big grill and watch the chefs cook. When we visited there was a line outside, but worth the short wait.

Reviews.Author: Susan D.
Reviews.Content: Don't get anything with scrimp. They are small and probably previously frozen and expensive and maybe foreign. The oysters are great.

Reviews.Author: Nekiba M.
Reviews.Content: It was on my list of places to visit while visiting NOLA after seeing it on Man vs. Food.  I can't comment of the wait because I was lucky arriving at 10 am on a Sunday on Mother's Day.  There was no long line down the block from what I've heard.  I ended up sitting at the bar and chatting up with the customer and the shuckers (I guess that's the term) at the bar.  I knew wanted the oysters but couldn't decide if I wanted the grilled or oysters on the half shell so I go both.  The raw oysters came out first, they were large and juicy.  The best I've had so far.  Up next were the grilled oysters which were piping hot covered in tomato sauce and cheese served with slices of French bread.  Being nosy, I saw the guy next to me order the soft shell crab po-boy seeing it come out I was drooling.  The sandwich looked really good so next time I order that.  Service was great and the guys at the oyster bar were funny.  I'll be sure to come back again to check out other items on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Anna H.
