Reviews.Content: Really good. Now I know why they're famous. After waiting in line for about 15 mins, we got to cut in line because we sat at the bar. Otherwise most people waited about 30 mins. My friend and I came here for dinner on our first night in New Orleans & we had the chargrilled oysters, abita beer, fish and shrimp po boy sandwich w grilled mushrooms & bell peppers with tabasco mayo, cole slaw, & chicken corn chowder. Everything was delicious and set the standard for the rest of my meals in New Orleans. I would definitely come back to try more because their menu is so extensive & the food was all great.

Reviews.Author: Laura S.
Reviews.Content: Yes, people rave about the charbroiled oysters, but these are amazing oysters and you are depriving yourself if you don't go for some fresh oysters, especially if you are an oyster aficionado! These are some of the best you'll ever have, I'm telling you.

Reviews.Author: Roman W.
Reviews.Content: Let's just say this, I was in New Orleans for 5 days, and went here twice.  Once for lunch, once for dinner, and still felt like I could have went there 1 more time.  The raw Oysters are not like anything I have ever had.  Very meaty, big, and sweet, not an easy combo to find for oysters.  I should have asked if they were farm raised or wild caught, but I was too busy stuffing my face.  I also ordered the softshell crab (fried) on one of my visits which was amazing and on another visit I ordered the 10 Napkin Beef Po Boy which was spectacular.  No gripes about this restaurant at all, price point was very reasonable for the quality of food and the service was pretty good.  The chargrilled oysters was good as well but I could have done without the cheese all over it, I prefer raw anyway, definitely a place I will go back to when I go back to NO.

Reviews.Author: Farmer K.
Reviews.Content: Delicious

Reviews.Author: Emily R.
Reviews.Content: It was our last night in New Orleans and we were looking for something to hang on tastebuds on until our return. Winter M., a trip veteran, suggested Acme.  I LOVED this food! She did warn us that because of Acme's popularity, there would be a substantial wait. Though, we ended up only waiting for 30 minutes. In a large, fun group. This seemed like only a few minutes and it gave us some time to chum up with the host and pick his brain on menu favorites. Once seated, we were attended to almost immediately. The menu had many options- seafood mostly and even a hamburger which one of our group did order. She gave it a thumbs up. But, over all,  this restaurant is a palace for the southern seafood lover. The charbroiled oysters are covered in butter, cheese and seasonings. The hush puppies make you say, "yum." The coleslaw was the perfect amount of sweet and perfect pairing with the oysters to balance the palette. I had a bowl of the seafood gumbo too. I couldn't resist. I was in the south and had to run with it. It's not a cheap meal but it doesn't have to put a dent in the bank account either.  I highly recommend Acme!

Reviews.Author: Beatrice W.
Reviews.Content: Great oyster and blue fries. The decor is a bit kitsch and the service was friendly but rushed. Go for the feast and forget about your cholesterol

Reviews.Author: Mai T.
Reviews.Content: Raw oysters = yummyBaked oysters = yummy x 2I'll be back Acme...I'll be back!

Reviews.Author: Tina C.
Reviews.Content: Well it's definitly touristy.  Yes ok the oysters are good.  But honestly I've had better.  If you want to have really good table service, then don't go here.  They really are the worst.  Sit at the bar, you will get your food alot quicker.  It's always crowded in here, swimming with tourists.  If you want good oysters, seriously go anywhere else in the quarter they are just as good.  And you will probably get better service somewhere else.  I would say that this place is a tourist trap.

Reviews.Author: Betty C.
Reviews.Content: Seafood gumbo with shrimp and crab wasn't very spicy. Tasted good with the white rice.Charbroil oysters were delicious. But watch out for the finger-burning hot shells since they grill them right on the shells! Seafood etouffe had plenty of small shrimps so you got some with every spoonful. My daughter also ordered fried crawfish tails to go with it.  Those were addictive. The seasoned coating made it a crunchy delight to just pop in your mouth.Corn and crab bisque was ok according to my son.Boo fries were French fries covered with shredded Cheddar cheese and a brown gravy.  Not my favorite because it made the fries soggy.  The gravy had a rich flavor which I would've love on mashed potatoes. Fried crab claws were a treat for this lazy diner who appreciated that they were peeled and battered so you just had to but down and pull the meat off the cartilage. I just had one since they was Hubby's order. He said it was ok but he wouldn't order it again.Oysters on the half shell were the jewel of the meal.  I skipped it out of fear but now regret it because everyone else said it was the best thing so far in New Orleans, even after dinner at Emeril's.  They said it wasn't slimy and no aftertaste, which were my concerns.We waited about 15 minutes and got in at noon.  The line grew to about 20 people by the time we entered.  The wait wasn't bad because we were given the menu to decide what to order before we sat down.  Very efficient.  Our waitress Gretchen was wonderful.

Reviews.Author: Michelle D.
Reviews.Content: Overrated tourist trap but still an excellent choice. There was a small line at the door but it moved quick and we were seated in good time too. Place was packed with rowdy tourists and our waitress was a darling. We ordered the charbroiled oysters were great and smothered in cheese and butter. Whatever the sauce on them, it was garlicy (but I like that!). I ordered the fried shrimp with french fries and hush puppies. I can't remember eating a plate overwhelmed in fried carboydrated food but it too was good. Shrimp had a thick batter on them, fries were crispy, pups average. I do like Acme, think it's worth a visit...if there's no line (because there are so many other great choices in NOLA) - but if on your trip to NOLA you don't make it here, don't live with regrets. That said, on my next trip to NOLA, I'll gladly return as everything we ate was indeed delicious.

Reviews.Author: Todd C.
Reviews.Content: Go for the chargrilled oysters, they were awesome. Don't come for the PoBoys or Gumbo, there's better to be had at lots of other places.

Reviews.Author: Carrie W.
Reviews.Content: I don't really have much to say about this place other than...it was A-OK.  Nothing brilliant, nothing terrible...We ordered the charbroiled oysters (of course) and the seafood gumbo.  Both were good, but not spectacular and perhaps that's more because I'm not really a huge fan of either normally.  Definitely on the expensive side, and we sat at the bar and got to watch people shucking oysters.

Reviews.Author: Brent G.
Reviews.Content: Wasn't that impressed. Long line out front and sort of small inside. Prices were a bit high for the atmosphere. All the locals recommended here so I was expecting a real good experience and knock your socks off cajun/creole food but it was just ok. I ordered everything from oysters to gumbo and crawfish etoufee. It was good, but def. not great. I hear the vibe is usually good on weekends and it's a happening singles joint. I was here on a Tuesday night.

Reviews.Author: Scott R. D.
Reviews.Content: If you want reasonably priced delicious local food in the French Quarter, wait in line for this place. I've eaten here at least twice every trip to N.O. and never had anything that wasn't great.

Reviews.Author: Melissa S.
Reviews.Content: Okay the chargrilled oysters are amazing. And my only pointers would be to go mid week around 2 pm to avoid the line. The crawdaddy hush puppies are worth a go too. And stay out of the ACME at the airport, not even close to the real one.

Reviews.Author: Alison G.
Reviews.Content: Wow!!!!! Amazing! So good! Never a big fan of oysters until I came here. Yum yum yum!!!!!!! Tip- come at 11am for lunch when it opens to avoid lines.

Reviews.Author: Fernando A.
Reviews.Content: It was my best food in New Orleans. Great; I will highly recommended. Grilled Oysters so good

Reviews.Author: Christine B.
Reviews.Content: Excellent raw oysters, pretty good po-boys.  The red beans and rice, jambalaya, etc were good, but not the best in town.  However, I'd drive 12 hours with almost no hesitation for the chargrilled oysters.  Heaven in a shell.  They take the oysters on the half shell, add some spicy butter and a pinch of cheese, throw them on a grill--perfection.  Seriously some of the best food I've had in New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: lottie t.
Reviews.Content: The line for this place is ridiculous! But at the same time, the food is DELICIOUS. The chargrilled oysters are more than worth it! Just get a plate for yourself. They're grilled, and have cheese and butter and all sorts of yummy goodness in it. The oyster po boy was also good, but definitely, get the chargrilled oysters!

Reviews.Author: Danny F.
Reviews.Content: The lunch crowed was vary large. We had to wait about 15 minutes to be seated. I had the "Peace Maker" both oysters and shrimp. It was very good.

Reviews.Author: Napoleon V.
Reviews.Content: We were only 2 so we sat at the bar.  Awesome service. Ordered the 1/2 shrimp, 1/2 fried oysters, real good.  Cocktail sauce is the best I've had. Po boy sandwich is huge, good for 2. Portions are great and reasonable prices, great atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Hung L.
Reviews.Content: I was here in the great city of New Orleans for Mardi Gras 2012 and had seen this on Man v. Food. Me, Greg and Denise tried their grilled oysters for an appetizer and my gosh.. I was blown away. These oysters after being grilled are topped with parmesan cheese. It was a little overcooked but still very delicious. Right behind us was the grill and it was fun to watch them work to grill the oysters and shucking it. The place is the only place I've ever had crawdad po boy sandwich! It's amazing! The line was long but well worth the wait.  If you don't want to be in the French quarters for ACME they also have another location in Metarie.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer Y.
Reviews.Content: If you love oysters, you MUST come here. Both raw and chargrilled oysters are amazing! Great prices too.I used to love the shrimp poboy here (until I visited Parkway and then realized this pales in comparison). If you do get a shrimp poboy though, I'd suggest getting tabasco mayo on it. Yum!Red beans & rice, jambalaya, fried crawfish tails (appetizer) and fried seafood are nothing life-changing, but they're all good and consistent.Conclusion: I come here often and love the atmosphere in the FQ location. I give Acme 5 stars on their oysters alone so make sure you get some!

Reviews.Author: Mark H.
Reviews.Content: Warmed up with a couple of dozen on the half shell followed by a dozen char grilled oysters, followed by a peace maker po boy which has both fried oysters and fried shrimp on it. The food and atmosphere here are awesome. You wait outside until they can seat you but don't let the line put you off. Might just be a couple of larger parties. They will ask how many when you walk up.  You may get seated immediately.

Reviews.Author: rose n.
Reviews.Content: Best oysters in NOLA. Waited a ridiculous time, almost passed out from heat, made friends in line. Amazing soup with oysters in it too.

Reviews.Author: Christina S.
Reviews.Content: Acme Oyster House is definitely an experience to be had!  I must warn you, the place can get very busy....very fast....so make sure you get there early.  A line can easily form during the first 30 minutes of dinner hour and can stretch all the way down the street, maybe even around the corner!  We got there right before the dinner rush, at around 4:45/5 Pm, so we were very lucky to get seated right away!  Now, if you've never had an oyster, but you're curious, this would definitely be the place to try them out.  You can buy a dozen or a half dozen, and they come prepared in many different ways.  I myself am not an oyster fan, so I stayed away from them.  Their menu has decent prices and you can find a pretty good deal if you get one of their dinner combos.  I went for the half and half fried fish platter.  I got half a serving of fried shrimp and half a serving of fried catfish.  Now, if the amounts of each fish I was served was TRULY half, then the original servings must be HUGE!!!  My meal consisted of two large fillets of catfish breaded and fried, served over a heaping helping of seasoned fries, the fried shrimp and pieces of toasted baguette.  It also came with a side of very crispy, to-die-for hush puppies.    The catfish fillets were absolutely delicious and like nothing I'd ever tasted before.  The fillets were moist and flaky and I could taste the freshness of the gulf waters in the fish.  I felt as if I was eating a fish I had just caught not a moment before.  The shrimp was very different--they were crispy on the outside, moist on the inside (the way fried shrimp should be) and had a very different seasoning that had a strange zing to it.  Each bite sent an odd stinging sensation through my sinuses to the point where I couldn't eat more than 4 shrimps.  Thinking it was just me, I passed them off to my comrades and they had the same sensations.  Maybe it was just the batch I got? Maybe not; all I know is I don't think I'll be ordering the shrimp again....OH WELL!!! at least the extremely delicious hush puppies, perfectly seasoned fries and beautifully cooked catfish made up for it!  And all for under $20!!!  Definitely can't beat that.  If you have the chance to visit Acme Oyster House, do it!  If there's a line, it's worth the wait.  I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Author: Megan W.
Reviews.Content: The Char-grilled oysters - gotta try them!!!

Reviews.Author: Cynthia H.
Reviews.Content: Is this place a tourist trap? Most definitely. Is it worth the wait? Most definitely.Being a huge fan of seafood, I needed to get my fill of oysters while I was in New Orleans. I tried both their raw and chargrilled oysters. They were amazing. The raw oysters were plump and juicy and fresh. Their chargrilled oysters were full of flavor... definitely use the bread to soak up all that sauce! Their seafood gumbo was OK, nothing to write home about. Their seafood etouffee was much better - very tasty.I sat by the bar and watched the shuckers work their magic. They were amusing and engaging - lots of back and forth between the shuckers (who doubled as our servers) and the customers. It was a good time.As for the wait, groups of 4 sat down faster than individuals or couples. That made no sense. I waited on line for about 20 minutes... and it was only a little after 6pm. After I finished dinner, the line out the door was quite ridiculous.

Reviews.Author: Chloe J.
Reviews.Content: I hate oysters, but I loved the raw and char-grilled oysters. Seriously, it was so good that I had dreams about it and as soon as I got back from from NOLA. Oh, and their cocktail sauce is so good too, I would go back to  NOLA just for Acme.

Reviews.Author: K. Kevin N.
Reviews.Content: Went here twice in 3 days. The raw oysters were delicious. The hostess and server were friendly and courteous. Overall, a wonderful dining experience. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly P.
Reviews.Content: Waited 30 minutes in line outside for a first-available table for two. I'd been told to try the chargrilled oysters, but I'm not really a fan of fried or steamed or raw oysters. Tried them anyway, thank The Lord! These were hands down, the best thing I have eaten, before or since, in this city. My dinner companion, who was on a foodie pilgrimage of sorts, even returned again the next night.

Reviews.Author: Mary Elizabeth M.
Reviews.Content: Decent gumbo and delicious hushpuppies for a quick meal at a great price!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer P.
Reviews.Content: We didn't have to wait at all to get in here(we went after the Superbowl).  I got a dozen raw oysters and they were great , I also got the crawfish po' boy all i have to say is yum!  My husband got the 10 napkin roast beef and it lives up to its name our friends got the Acme special po' boy and the jambalaya...there definitely were no complaints at our table just full stomachs!!! Can't wait to go back :)

Reviews.Author: Matt M.
Reviews.Content: This is the Place ,Oysters and PO Boys! expect to wait in line even if your Drew Breeze ,but the line moves fast and the service is get you fed! Great Char Grilled Oysters

Reviews.Author: Jen K.
Reviews.Content: Grilled oysters, raw oysters, po' boys, etouffee, it has it all! Our group basically ordered some of everything and shared.  I didn't have a bad dish.  Yes, the wait was long, yes it's touristy, but it's one of those rare places that stays true to the cuisine in the city that it's in.  I would have no hesitation about returning again.

Reviews.Author: Darrin D.
Reviews.Content: ACME is a must do when you come New Orleans. They have the best oysters in town.

Reviews.Author: Aimee B.
Reviews.Content: Charbroiled oysters were delish..gave dragos a run for their money! Nice staff..must check out if you are in the quarters!

Reviews.Author: Tracy A.
Reviews.Content: For our first meal in New Orleans, we were all really excited about Acme. Expected a long wait, but it only ended up being like ten minutes. We got inside- it felt like a chain, a New Orleans tinted TGIF. I'm a huge oyster fan and we started off with a few dozen oysters... BLECH! Not only were the outsides of them so dirty that they turned your hands black, they were flavorless and filled with shell. They were so gross that it pretty much colored our views on the rest of the meal. Our server was nice, nothing too special. Had the peace-maker Po-Boy which was tasty, but after that first round of oysters, their specialty, the whole thing was kind of over for me. Not worth the hype- go to Felix's if you want good oysters.

Reviews.Author: Gardner T.
Reviews.Content: Got to Acme at a good time on a Friday, only had to wait outside in line for about 15 minutes (only b/c we wanted a table, bar seats open up fairly quickly).  My girlfriend and I split some raw oysters and a pound of crawfish.  Both were out of sight.  True, Acme didn't cook the oysters, but they do source super tasty ones.  For the meal she had shrimp étouffée and I had the roast beef sandwich - both were fantastic.  Our server, Billy, was attentive yet didn't bother us all the time.  A couple of TV's were showing sports, but the sound wasn't on: great for background entertainment.  I would go back here in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Author: Steve G.
Reviews.Content: My son and I were in New Orleans for the Final 4 and stopped in Acme Oyster House for lunch. The line outside was a good indication it had to be good. We were not disappointed. My son had his first oysters and loved them. I had a Peacemaker Po-boy and loved it.

Reviews.Author: Jeff B.
Reviews.Content: I used to come down to NOLA to stay with my friend who was going to Tulane.  We stopped by Acme a number of times and I was always very impressed with their raw oysters.  Fresh and clean with a great flavor.  Another of my favorite items from the menu was the Peace Maker.  It's an awesome fried oyster po-boy.  I remember seeing a thing the Food Network did on Acme years back, where they said the Peace Maker got it's name because one of the guys at the restaurant would make one and bring it home to his wife so that she wouldn't give him a hard time about the long hours he was working...or something along those lines.  Kinda funny picturing an angry wife being won over by a huge oyster po-boy!  I'm sure it worked, it's a great sandwich!  This is a great place to come to in the heart of New Orleans.  Can't wait to make it back down here!

Reviews.Author: Jones D.
Reviews.Content: As my ever so frank brother in law put it, this place is akin to Outback but with oysters.  Couldn't have said it better myself.  Oysters were yum for sure- especially the buttery grilled ones.  Abita in pitchers from the tap- another plus.  Pretty bland menu items, overpriced and crowded with the high schoolers...eh, not so great.  If you spend as much as we did on oysters and pitchers, you may as well go to Jaques Imo's or a nice sit down.  Thanks bro for pickin up the tab!

Reviews.Author: Justin H.
Reviews.Content: Ok now this spot was a good pick. Had the chargrilled oysters and the sampler (it was like red beans and rice, gumbo and sausage). The chargrilled oysters were bananas!! Those things had me licking the shells, paper... everything. The sampler was pretty decent but i expected it to be better since i was actually in New Orleans. Ive had better gumbo and red beans and rice at Papadeauxs. The chargrilled oysters give this place 4 stars.

Reviews.Author: This Is Q.
Reviews.Content: A great place to go while visiting New Orleans... there WILL be a line... but if you want to skip ahead, tell the lady at the door that you want to sit at the bar!  It's almost better than a table seat because you get to sit right across from the guys shucking the oysters.  Good times!

Reviews.Author: Masumi T.
Reviews.Content: The char-grilled oysters were amazing. How could you go wrong when you drench oysters with Parmesan and butter? The raw oysters were good also but I often bit into some shell bits which I didn't enjoy. The soft shell crab po boy was good but I felt the bread was too thick. The service was really good. The maitree'd and our waitress were both nice and helpful.  To avoid lines, try to go as early as possible to opening time.  We didn't have to wait to be seated.

Reviews.Author: Kristie M.
Reviews.Content: Awesome... Chargrilled oysters!! First review I have ever written and first oysters I have ever eaten!!

Reviews.Author: Hans G.
Reviews.Content: I don't do oysters, so I really have no right to be commenting here.  My colleague loved his, and I want to offer props for the great environment (you'd never guess it was a chain after chatting up the shucker that's been there since 1979) and the etouffee was much better than I expected.

Reviews.Author: Abigail O.
Reviews.Content: oysters and hot sauce, oh my!!first i have to say, don't be deterred by the three stars.  i definitely recommend this place, and you should wait in line for it (the line moves fast, and it's not like it's going to be snowing out or anything).the good:food!  i think we had 2 or 3 dozen oysters between us, some the traditional half-shell variety, and some of their specialty chargrilled types.  although i tend to be a purist about oysters, those chargrilled puppies were spectacular!!  i had to stop my boyfriend from licking out the shells.  but i didn't stop him from ordering more.we also had a sampler that came with etouffee, jambalaya, and red beans n rice... nola staples.  good and solid, nothing outstanding though.some interesting cocktails and local brews, but nothing that stood out to me.decor and ambiance was meh.  the server was very nice, but too busy and we were often waiting on refills or to order something else.  i appreciate the kitchiness of the checkered tablecloths and down-home atmosphere, but you can still make it look polished, and it seemed like they didn't really bother.i will reiterate that i absolutely recommend anyone to visit this place while in nola, but my biggest gripe is about places like this that are famous and get a ton of business, and thus don't really bother about the details since people are going to come in the door regardless.anyway, just go and eat some oysters for me!!

Reviews.Author: Eddie H.
Reviews.Content: I think there are better options for Cajun food but you cant argue the freshness of the oysters. We got a dozen on the half shell for starters and I got the fried oyster and shrimp sandwich called the peacemaker. It came on soft bread with Tabasco mayo, shredded lettuce and pickles. It was awesome, the only draw back is for 10.00 it should come with fries. My friend got the jambalaya and it was so so.....All in all its a pretty good Cajun joint for being off Bourbon St. If you want more authentic food, head outside the quarter.

Reviews.Author: rodney t.
Reviews.Content: One of the first places we eat when in New Orleans.  I would highly recomment the char-broiled oysters.  They are delicious!  Also, the service is good and the atmosphere is "just off Bourbon Street rowdy."  Expect to stand in line  when you arrive.  They are that good.

Reviews.Author: Marki V.
Reviews.Content: .                                             ACME                                                  o                                                 yst                                                erso                                               ysters                                              oysters                                             oysterso                                            ystersoyst                                           ersoysterso                                          ystersoysters                                         oystersoysters                                        oystersoysterso                                       ystersoystersoyst                                      ersoystersoysterso                                      CHAAAAAGRILLEDStar minus'd for being stingy with the bread and portions. Side of jambalaya (which is good)is like 2 tablespoons, for $4.99 it's a rip-off!

Reviews.Author: Maurice H.
Reviews.Content: This place has been here forever and always has a line out the door.  So, imagine my good fortune when at 8:30pm on Halloween, on my way to a party, I'm walking by and there is no line.  I took that as a sign that I needed some oysters.  I sat at the bar, talked to some interesting visitors and inhaled the first dozen.  I then savored the second dozen, and finished with 6 baked. (Unfortunately, those were overdone!).  There are other things to eat at Acme, but it's an oyster house for good reason.  It is busy, loud, touristy, a little shabby, but still the place to have a few.  I will be there each time I am in New Orleans, because it is a ritual now.

Reviews.Author: Jeff K.
Reviews.Content: Only had the char grilled oysters and would come back every day for them if I could.  Those buttery morsels with a cold beer and a dash of hot sauce made for the best hangover cure. This place is worthy of the 1000+ reviews.

Reviews.Author: Leslie S.
Reviews.Content: There are several oyster houses on Bourbon Street and we tried several. Hands down Acme was the best. Meaty, velvety, briney, Oysters. Grilled oysters in a sauce worthy of a bath with crusty bread to sop it up. Perfect Étouffée and a great Fried Fish Po-Boy. Beer on tap and a classic staff makes the the Oyster House to visit.

Reviews.Author: Ray G.
Reviews.Content: Overrated and overpriced tourist trap. What a dry and uninspiring shrimp po boy and the grilled oysters are way overpriced. The raw oysters on the half-shell were okay. Do yourself a favor, skip this place and go across the street to Felix's. It is much better, lower price and you usually don't have to wait.

Reviews.Author: David D.
Reviews.Content: Every oyster is bomb- a lishious!! The char- grilled ones are awesome ! I love this place and glad that yelp helped me stumble onto this gem.There was a short line but we didn't mind. I will eat 20 myself next time we hit up the NOLA. keep it up guys.

Reviews.Author: mark s.
Reviews.Content: Great oysters, fun environment, and good service.I just don't understand why you'd wait in line - a line that extends into the street, even on a Monday at Four (4) PM  - and pay a serious premium to eat here when Felix's is right across the street.Oh, that's right.  You wanted to be able to return home and tell everyone you went to a place that was featured on TV.  Nice.  TV was the shit in the 1980s.

Reviews.Author: Jack Y.
Reviews.Content: trying to have dinner for 5 at 830 on a friday night? dont come here. the line was down the block, the weather was stifling and the crowd was getting rowdier by the minute. we waited for about 10 mins and decided to go across the street (you'll have to google what's across the street) and come back later. 1.5 hrs later...there was STILL a line!! but it was short and we finally got to eat after 5 mins of waiting.everything was delicious! the raw oysters were so buttery and fresh. every po-boy sandwich we got was delicious...ESPECIALLY the fried catfish and fried oyster. grilled oysters, however, are better at drago. dont short change yourself by skipping this place because of the oil spill, the food is delicious.

Reviews.Author: Rachael T.
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful for anyone who enjoys seafood. Authentic and casual, Acme has a cajun stylle, with quality dishes, and oysters to die for!

Reviews.Author: Noora A.
Reviews.Content: The most amazing chargrilled oysters!!! Do not make the same mistake my husband and made the first time we went and order 6 to share. You need to irder the full dozen because once you start it's hard to stop. We found our selves scraping the shell for every last morsel... Amazing!!! I also want to recommend the chicken gumbo which was much more flavorful than the seafood one. And to end with a bang you can't pass up the bread pudding which was so rich and oooey and gooey and amazing!!!!

Reviews.Author: Nick H.
Reviews.Content: It seems this place is known for their Chargrilled Oysters, something the waitress suggested when we sat down. Holy crazyness, we only got a half (dozen) but I wish we just stuck with oysters on the half shell on day, totally incredible. Definitely an appetizer to get. The atmosphere is fun, the music is great and going as a party of 2 will get you in faster than a party of 4 or 6.

Reviews.Author: Rex D.
Reviews.Content: Our group went here on a Tuesday night and the restaurant was busy but there was no wait for our table. It's a very casual restaurant, think fried shrimp and french fries with large groups of people drinking and being loud and having a good time.The server was friendly. We ordered raw oysters,a  fried oyster sandwich, the sampler and gumbo. All of the food was good, not the best seafood I've ever tasted but good enough and overall, we had a great time. The price was also reasonable, for the 3 of us, less than 50.00$.

Reviews.Author: Brittany H.
Reviews.Content: Yummy! Had the chargrilled oysters and peacemaker po-boy and split it with a friend. Plenty of food and served hot! Service was good, but expect a wait and no flare.

Reviews.Author: Allen T.
Reviews.Content: Came here with my cousin as we were wrapping up our cross-country road trip. They have some amazing oysters! Price is a little high, but then again, it's New Orleans. This restaurant was very close to our hotel and is around the corner from Bourbon Street. Great place and would recommend it.

Reviews.Author: Randy S.
Reviews.Content: I've never been a fan of seafood with the exception of shrimp.  My friends and I went here on my first trip to New Orleans on Halloween 2009.  I was sick, so I didn't eat anything.  I just waited in line and people watched outside and in.  When we went back to Acme in for St. Pat's day 2010, my friend talked me into trying the oysters.  I had no idea what I was afraid of.  I was thinking the oysters would be slimey, fishy, etc.  We ordered the charbroiled oysters in the 1/2 dozen size.  We both split them.  I squeezed the lemon onto my 3 and took a taste - WOW!  They were buttery/garlicy/lemony and absolutely fantastic.  Granted, I have nothing to compare them to, but they were absolutely great.  My friend also ordered a shrimp po' boy.  It came overflowing with delicious, bite sized, breaded shrimp.  By far the best shrimp I have ever had - as I ended up stealing half of her sandwich.  We went back there in October and again in December, both times being extremely pleased with our food.  The gumbo is great, the shrimp is delicious and the oysters are amazing! And for anyone who doesn't like waiting in the line... On our Halloween trip for 2010, Val Kilmer was eating there.  He had to wait in line like everyone else too, which made me feel better about our half hour wait!

Reviews.Author: Calvin D.
Reviews.Content: OK, it a long wait and there are other oyster bars in NOLA but they are not The Acme Oyster House.  I arrived at about 7:30 or so and got in line.  I had the fortune of having a very nice young lady from London get in line behind me which helped pass the time.  We had a very nice conversation while waiting and ended up having dinner together at the bar. We each had chicken/andouille  gumbo and a dozen oysters.  The gumbo had a nice smoky taste and was well made. The oysters were just plain good.

Reviews.Author: Jadea G.
Reviews.Content: Can I give them 6 stars? I had had the oyster po boy and it was spilling over with perfectly cooked oysters. I dream about this sandwich. I don't know about anything else they make but what I had has made a lasting impression.

Reviews.Author: Scott D.
Reviews.Content: $48 for some oysters, few drinks, and an appetizer seemed pretty steep.  The oysters tasted fresh but the sampler was just okay.  Probably go back but would give some other places a shot first.

Reviews.Author: Joe G.
Reviews.Content: Damn good oysters charbroild where the best butter, cheese, & garlic fish & chips is vary good small beers could have been bigger.

Reviews.Author: Mo P.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here during Thanks Giving week this year. Though we aren't huge fans of oysters we decided to give this a try due to all the reviews - boy was I glad. We had a 1/2 order of the grilled oysters and truly wish we would have ordered more. I crave this place all the time now. GO and order a lot of Gilles oysters you will not be disappointed, even if you aren't the biggest oyster fan.

Reviews.Author: Jason M.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled oysters...... The best!

Reviews.Author: Lu S.
Reviews.Content: I can't believe this place is such a hot spot.Waitstaff is less than pleasant.Food ain't that great, I've had better seafood etouffee at other places w/o a line.To be fair, I didn't try the oysters.But from first impressions, I'd say eat elsewhere in the Quarter.

Reviews.Author: Tam Henry Le N.
Reviews.Content: I could've sworn I cried a tear of happiness after a chargrilled oyster. The Fried Peace Maker Po-Boy is in the same tier as the oysters.

Reviews.Author: Felicia B.
Reviews.Content: Started with the chargrilled oysters and they were amazing. The oyster soup and po-boy were also delicious. Splitting a dozen grilled oysters and adding a cup or bowl of soup would be plenty for a meal.

Reviews.Author: Richard B.
Reviews.Content: Best damn chicken and sausage gumbo ever.  The base is dark and flavorful.

Reviews.Author: Kris M.
Reviews.Content: As recommended we had the chargrilled oysters, two dozen. They were great. Crawpuppies were so-so. We went in the mid afternoon, between rushes, and had no wait to sit at the bar. Bartender was polite enough.

Reviews.Author: bridget y.
Reviews.Content: The waitress had attitude problem, when asked her questions about certain dishes, she was not patient and even at one pint raised her voice! My question not even take 10 seconds! Read lots of reviews on yelp! But I'm so disappointed! Def not gonna be back again! Service sucks! I pay for good service not some waitress with attitude!

Reviews.Author: Pat G.
Reviews.Content: Good service but mediocre food.  The night before I had ad terrific dinner at Felix's right across the street with out of town friends.  Food was great.  I had a shrimp poboy with large perfectly cooked shrimp.  Had lunch at Acme with the same group because they'd heard so much about it. Ordered the same meal.  Shrimp were tiny, over-breaded, and probably some bulk frozen product that may not have been caught in South Louisiana and could even be imported. Think that they've been coasting on a reputation they no longer deserve.

Reviews.Author: Emily M.
Reviews.Content: i actually don't like raw oysters, but this place has many other great options. poboys are all pretty good, as is the jambalaya and gumbo. the atmosphere's also pretty cool, with red-checkered table-cloths and such. we had to wait a while the last time we went, but, on a weekend, that's to be expected. overall, a fun experience and yummy food.

Reviews.Author: Ryan T.
Reviews.Content: It's been a week since I ate there last, and I already miss it.  The jambalaya is incredible!  The crawfish and corn bisque was fantastic too.  Great food all around, very reasonable prices, and our waitress kept refilling our drinks before we could finish them.

Reviews.Author: Ryan W.
Reviews.Content: Don't Miss the chargrilled oysters!

Reviews.Author: Jerrold S.
Reviews.Content: Crowded and probably the best place you'll find within walking distance of Bourbon St for gumbo and po boys.  The catfish is definitely the way to go.  The gumbo was ok but still disappointed in not being able to find a really good bowl of gumbo in the 4 places I tried.  There was somebody on Chowhound who said no 2 gumbos are alike they're like snowflakes....ummm ok whatever.  Just tell me where to find some of the best gumbos.

Reviews.Author: Marivic L.
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to get there during a lull in the day, after lunch and before dinner, before the lines started forming outside of the restaurant. At any rate, we got in, sat right up to the bar, ordered a dozen oysters, a beer and a soda. The oysters were HUGE, fresh, and tasty, all for under $11. The atmosphere is friendly and casual, like a local bar, only with fabulous oysters. I'll be going there again before I leave. YUM!

Reviews.Author: Danielle B.
Reviews.Content: I had Oysters and Crawfish Etoufee here. Service was fast and nice and i found it to be inexpensive. The line was some what long but I think thats for show- as we were seated in about 2 minutes.

Reviews.Author: Heather J.
Reviews.Content: Never had oysters and I tried the fried oysters and they were delicious.  I also had a turkey sandwhich and gumbo.  The bread was delicious.

Reviews.Author: Thuy H.
Reviews.Content: Too much hype about this place and it ruined it for me.  (Charbroiled and raw) Oysters were pretty good, but everything else wasn't.  The crawfish were the biggest disappointment.  They didn't taste fresh and shouldn't it be seasoned??  The po boy was lacking something, maybe some sauce?  The jambalya and grilled smoked sausage wasn't too bad so those are good choices for sides.  Service needs a bit of picking up since our drinks were empty most of the dining experience.  I don't think I'd come back, not really worth it.

Reviews.Author: lin h.
Reviews.Content: Food is ok, but not great. Their chargrilled oysters are ok, but if you want amazing ones, head over to Drago's (who invented them). Their shrimp po-boy was pretty good, but it's not your average new orleans overstuffed po boy. Their gumbo is not worth getting. Their jambalaya is above average but not close to the best i've had. LONG lines as this place is very touristy. Ok for the tourist experience but not the best place if you want good new orleans food.

Reviews.Author: Michie W.
Reviews.Content: Raw oyster, so fresh and sweet. Oh my god. were we glad that we went to New Orleans. Living southern California, it's so hard to find a fresh seafood. especially raw oyster. My husband and I sit at the bar and had our dozen and a half prepared for us right in front of our eyes. They got it down to the science. We also ordered fried seafood platter. It was also good.

Reviews.Author: Lynn B.
Reviews.Content: Acme is a must stop in N'awlins.  Didn't think I was going to make it here this time as the others in the party had already been here - twice.  But when I asked where we should have our last lunch before flying out it was unanimous - Acme!  We all ordered the grilled oysters and were sopping the plates clean of their tasty melted butter and parmesan cheese with the bread - yum!!!  The red beans and rice, gumbo and jambalaya were all good too and of course the beer was good and cold. This is a very casual atmosphere with it's plastic table cloths and picnic style rows of tables which just adds to the fun.  Highly recommend this for a laid back southern/creole style meal.

Reviews.Author: Rich J.
Reviews.Content: This was my introduction to new orleans...first place I went after we checked into our hotel. Well, dirty, unwashed oysters is not the way I want to start my vacation. Yes, I am giving this tourist trap 1 star...my first one star review...because not washing the muck off the oysters before serving them is inexcusable.  Plus, God knows how long they were sitting there already shucked. This place blows.

Reviews.Author: Nate S.
Reviews.Content: A tourist site with the soul of a TGI Friday's. We had a couple Peacemaker Po' Boys, but apparently the shrimp were enforcing peace through total domination of the oysters. One of the sandwiches had nary a single oyster on an entire half. Bread was so so. Actually had a much better Po' at the Royal House, where they also have great chargrilled oysters. ACME's are OK, but they have too much cheese on them. Folks inside Acme were very nice and efficient, but the line guardian pissed us off. We were four, it was raining, and one person was sick. She went a half block to the hotel to get a coat and be warm so we could call her when it was our turn to be seated. They wouldn't take us until she was there and kept pulling groups from behind us in line. So she arrived in five minutes and had to wait again in line anyway. I get that you can't just hold empty tables, but that wasn't the case, and we explained nicely. Losers. There are too many places for good oysters (like Drago's) to waste time with Acme's shtick.

Reviews.Author: Betty C.
Reviews.Content: This place is popular. Go during off peak dining times. We went at 5:25pm and were seated right away. Service was quick and the food came out quickly too. We tried the famous bbq char grilled oysters, and the shrimp and soft shell crab platter with a side of hush puppies. The oysters came out piping hot and the bread was the perfect dipping accompaniment. The shrimp was good (ask for the cocktail sauce, it has a crazy kick!). Everytime we walked by after for the rest of the weekend, the line was out the door. Trust us, go during off peak times if you don't want to wait!

Reviews.Author: Brenda D.
Reviews.Content: I had the softshell crab sandwich.  They know how to fix 'em.  If you don't want the bread, you can order a softshell crab platter.  I wish I could have one of these every day.  They get five stars because they were very accommodating.  You see, they close at 10PM and we got there right at 10 and they weren't letting any more people in the door.  We somehow convinced them to let us in so we ordered a bunch of food and in a hurry.  Their charbroiled oysters were sooooo good.  This place is always packed.  Get there earlier rather than later.

Reviews.Author: Emily H.
Reviews.Content: I went for the oysters within one hour of arriving in town. They hit the spot. I asked the guy how many oysters he shucks in a day. He said over 200. Mind blowing. I went at 4:00. There was a huge line every other time I walked by so I'm glad I went when I did.

Reviews.Author: Cameron B.
Reviews.Content: This is a must try while in New Orleans. The line is always out the door, but don't be discouraged, as it moves fast. The oysters on the half shell as well as the po-boys are my fav. If you are up for the splurge, get the softshell crab po-boy. It is to die for!!

Reviews.Author: Marcus K.
Reviews.Content: I guess I prefer my California oysters on the grill with a BBQ sauce. These ones were encrusted with parmesan.  Really greasy.  Oyster rockerfeller soup was also tasty but its basically a thick chowder with a couple deep fried oysters thrown in.   Bottom line, good but totally overrated.

Reviews.Author: Lisa I.
Reviews.Content: After being inspired by the Man vs. Food challenge here, my friend and I decided to be brave and try oysters for the first time here.  We were immediately greeted by THE nicest hostess.  Both of us got a half dozen oysters, and the sauce they gave with the oysters made it an EXCELLENT experience.  We both got po boys for lunch, with a side of french fries, and two sweet tea vodka and lemonades.  Just to top it off, we got the pecan dessert, which was absolutely heavenly.  All in all, it was a good place to eat, but with all of the friendly service we got there, I'll throw in an additional star!

Reviews.Author: Kristen R.
Reviews.Content: The char-grilled oysters where delicious, drenched in butter, Cajun seasoning and served up on french bread. So good I had to come back again the next day! I also tried some of the New Orleans sampler not very impressed with the gumbo or jambalaya, red beans and rice were pretty good but def. go and have some oysters and abita.

Reviews.Author: Leah V.
Reviews.Content: i don't eat oysters, so my review is for those of us who have to tote along to oyster places with our friends that do.i got the 10 napkin roast beef and while thankfully, it wasn't as messy as i anticipated, it certainly packed in an enormous amount of flavor. the size of the sandwich is just right and the moist beef is the perfect consistency. ps-we went at around 5:30 and had to wait in a short line, but by the time we left at around 7:00, the line was around the block...so go early.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer C.
Reviews.Content: Had dinner here my first night in NOLA.  Ordered the famous chargrilled oysters and peacemaker po-boys. The chargrilled oysters were pretty good, but I was disappointed in the size!  It's not Acme's fault though, since every restaurant I ordered oysters in had tiny ones.  All of them were like an inch big.  Maybe not oyster season?  Oysters were lemon and buttery breadcrumb goodness.  But if I were to choose between Acme and Dragos...Dragos wins.  See my review for that soon.  Po'boys were OK.  I did love the tabasco infused mayo...wish I had asked for more!

Reviews.Author: Coral E.
Reviews.Content: One word:  CRAWPUPPIES!

Reviews.Author: Stan S.
Reviews.Content: Excellent oyster bar, boiled crawfish and fried food as well as char grilled oysters. One of the few places I'll eat in the quarter. Self service, so a good place to bring large groups if you are afraid of sorting out large tabs. The Po Boys and Gumbo are only so-so here, I stick to the raw bar and crawfish although I am a big fan of their char grilled oysters. Sit right at the bar if you want the whole experience, but be a sport and drop something into the tip jar.

Reviews.Author: Michael O.
Reviews.Content: This place was AMAZING!!!!!! I had the Seafood Combo of Fried Oysters and Fried Catfish with the "Oyster Shooter" which consists of an oytser, vodka, hot sauce and some other crap! NEVER AGAIN! lol! That was just for "Tourism" only! lol! But, The food was great! Also,  had the Oyster Rockefella Soup! Great too! I love this place!

Reviews.Author: Misha T.
Reviews.Content: The oysters are of pretty good quality but I thought their baked ones had way too much salt. The suckers are briny already so you can tone down the salt and it'll still be fine. Anyways if you get out of the french quarter a little you can do cheaper and for that reason 3 stars.

Reviews.Author: April D.
Reviews.Content: I really don't understand the appeal, we didn't get oysters so maybe thats why we don't think this place is all that.We wouldn't have even gone here but options were low, it was around 3:30, we were hungry, and alot of restaurants were closed for shift change, or had a line out the door, so we settled.The wait wasn't terrible, but we had to stand in front of a stinky alley way while we waited. The inside was dark, noisy and crowded. Staff was friendly enough, the hostess made me give her my drink I had brought in from another place I had been drinking while we stood in line.:PWe shared the Boo fries with roast beef gravy and cheese...nothing special, small serving of run of the mill fries with average tasting gravy and a sprinkle of cheddar cheese.I got the fried catfish and shrimp with coleslaw and hushpuppies. There were bones in the catfish. The food was okay otherwise, I could've gotten the same where I live in Las Vegas.The hubby got the Acme 10 napkin roast beef po boy. I think he only used 2 napkins. It was nothing special, more bread and gravy than meat. What a disappointment. We decided to stop eating and try a different restaurant in a few hours, I'm glad we did.

Reviews.Author: Mike W.
Reviews.Content: The food was extremely delicious. I had the fried oysters platter. The servings are huge and very filling. Enjoyed every last bite.

Reviews.Author: Claire S.
Reviews.Content: This place is definitely over-hyped but how can you go wrong with oysters.  We had a dozen fresh oysters and half a dozen grilled oysters.   Yay oysties!! Mmmm.  Fresh oysters were good, not the best I've had ever but very good, grilled oysters were delicious.  Craw puppies tasted like hush puppies, you should probably just eat oysters here.  The place is busy, but they did get us seated in 15 minutes so it wasn't too bad, the bartender was sweet and I enjoyed coming here.  Don't understand why is so super-popular but the oysters are good.  I'm glad we came but I would probably try another oyster place next time we are in town.

Reviews.Author: Jillian R.
Reviews.Content: Okay...somehow my visiting guests convinced me to come here again with them. I begged and pleaded to go elsewhere but it was around 10 or 11 at night after a Hornets game and we didn't have a lot of options. I told them we should at least go to Deanie's instead (we saw Deuce McAllister and his guests entering Deanie's when we passed) but they'd had it before and wanted to try something new. SO...we went to Acme. It took 10 minutes before our server acknowledged us, even though he paid a lot of attention to the 50-somethings we were sharing a table with. I guess a table of 20-somethings isn't as enticing to a server who makes $2.50/hr and lives off tips, although I always tip upwards of 20% if the service is worth it. We finally put in our drink orders (all of us got beer) and ordered a dozen raw oysters to start. Now, as a disclaimer, I used to work in a high-volume seafood restaurant and we would pre-shuck our oysters and store them in a fridge until they were used. I'm sure Acme does the same thing due to the ridiculous amount of oyster ordered. However, one thing Acme obviously doesn't do is at least spritz their oysters before they're brought to the table. The dozen oysters we received had obviously been sitting in a fridge for hours and had taken on a rubbery consistency due to lack of moisture. They also hadn't been properly cut from the bottom shell so the meat was still attached--meaning the oyster was shredded with the oyster fork when trying to remove them from the shell. There was also only 11 oysters on our tray of what was supposed to be "a dozen"...and the server wasn't very apologetic about any of the above. If you're going to have "oyster" in the name of your restaurant...get them right, PLEASE!The food (entrees consisted of oyster poboy, shrimp poboy, gumbo) was so very, very mediocre and tragically overpriced. I'm truly embarrassed people who visit the south for the first time leave thinking this is true New Orleans seafood. Oh..and parking is a bitch, but it's the Quarter obviously.Do yourself a favor and DO NOT try Acme Oyster House. It's overpriced and lackluster.

Reviews.Author: Danielle R.
Reviews.Content: Long lines so get there early and be prepared to wait. The jambalaya was the best !!!!

Reviews.Author: Sandi P.
Reviews.Content: First stop on a recent vacation/ conference trip to NOLA. Husband declared oysters fresh and very delicious. My fried crawfish was equal parts spice and crunchy goodness. We had a 10 min. wait to get in, were seated at the bar counter, where we were served our requisite Abita beers very quickly and food followed shortly thereafter. Place looks smaller than on TV but as delicious as promised!!

Reviews.Author: Jay C.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled Oysters, nuff said! The shrimp and oyster po boy and etoufee were excellent as well, we ate here 3 times in 5 days, yep.....

Reviews.Author: Mike L.
Reviews.Content: Winner. Raw oysters were fresh as hell. I could eat a few dozen. Chargrilled oysters were ok, Dragos were better. The fried shrimp platter I got was top notch... SUPER fresh shrimp - de-turded and almost butterflied. Fried perfectly and the cocktail sauce had an extra horseradish kick. Loved it all and will go back for SURE.

Reviews.Author: Thompson L.
Reviews.Content: Acme Oyster was a little over hyped for me and I probably ordered the wrong dishes.  My gf and I shared a half dozen grilled oysters, half dozen raw oysters, a cup of gumbo and the Peace Maker Po Boy (fried shrimp + oysters).  I found the grilled oysters to be too salty and not worth the price when compared to the raw oysters.  The raw Louisiana oysters were on point and I really enjoyed the gumbo (probably one of the best I tried on this trip).  The Peace Maker Po Boy was what really got me upset.  The fried shrimp and oysters were tasty but they served it on stale hard french bread.  That's a huge no no and it ruined my meal.  There's a reason why they tell you on the menu it's only the #4 sandwich in New Orleans... I def wouldn't brag about it.  Go with the fried dinner  platters since that's what most patrons were ordering (it looked good).  I just had a bad first experience.

Reviews.Author: Beth F.
Reviews.Content: I went to Acme during my recent NOLA trip. Stopped in around 11:00 a.m. which is probably the best time to get there...by the time I left there was a line to get in. I sat at the regular bar, not the oyster bar and started with Abita Amber drafts. The bartender was very nice and attentive when needed. After a beer I decided to have a dozen raw and a side of hush puppies. The oysters are big, sweet, and fresh. The sauce is thin but rich and had a nice heat. The hush puppies were perfectly cooked and absolutely delicious. I ended up having another dozen and a few more beers. These were the best oysters of the trip and I definitely recommend going. It does get crowded quickly so timing is everything.

Reviews.Author: Lisa G.
Reviews.Content: This place is always packed and always has a line out the door.  I don't see what the hype is all about, though.  We got in and got a table fine enough, but the food was nothing to write home about.  Drinks were weak.  Food was greasy.

Reviews.Author: Jaime G.
Reviews.Content: Holy chargrilled oysters in the French Quarter of New Orleans!  So good.  Kind of a Cajun version of oysters Rockefeller but better. Anything oyster here at ACME is good. I tried the fresh oysters and red beans and rice too but chargrilled is the way to go. And right by bourbon street makes it even better.

Reviews.Author: Christopher F.
Reviews.Content: One of the oldest and most popular oyster house's in New Orleans we had to have fresh oysters.  The oysters were fresh, huge and wonderful.  We also ordered the fried fish platter included catfish, oysters, and shrimp.  The fried fish was the best battered fish I have ever eaten, the oysters and shrimp were nice as well.  The other nice thing about this place is you have 5 different tabasco's to chose from.  The only negative about this place is its located by bourbon street so super crowded and the desert menu was a little limited.

Reviews.Author: Cristina T.
Reviews.Content: After seeing Acme on Man vs. Food, I thought it would be a good addition to my food your of New Orleans. Everytime we passed by, there was always a line, so we chose another restaurant instead. However, on our last day in NOLA, we knew we would have to tough it out and wait. For lunch around noon, it only took 20 minutes. We were seated at the oyster bar and promptly served our food. We ordered the piece po-boy which was topped with tabasco mayo and filled with oysters and shrimp. So delicious and on the most perfect po-boy bread imaginable. We also ordered the sampler plate that had seafood gumbo, andouille sausage and red beans and rice. Everything was flavorful and delicious. I am so glad we finally got the chance to eat here-it was worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Maly A.
Reviews.Content: I must admit.....I tried this place years ago during my first visit to NOLA. Would definitely eat here again in future when i am in town. Great place, good food, a 'must try' that should be on your list while visiting NOLA.

Reviews.Author: Sonya S.
Reviews.Content: Food is completely unmemorable. Oysters overpriced for what you get. Inside is a bit grungy and in need of a revamp. Also had the rice, beans and sausage and they had no flavor.

Reviews.Author: Tala T.
Reviews.Content: Looking for great Chargrilled oysters in the French Quarter? Then look no further. Acme Oyster House on Iberville street offers a delicious variety of oysters (raw and chargrilled), gumbo soup, jambalaya, soft shell crab, etc. The atmosphere is also great. There is usually a line up outside to be seated since the restaurant is on the smaller side; however, it really doesn't take long to get seated. Plus its all part of the fun. If you are in the french quarter then definitely stop over at Acme's for some oysters.

Reviews.Author: Rachel S.
Reviews.Content: Our group rented the private room on the upper floor and we had a lot of food. It was mind blowing delicious. The oysters were cooked and sprinkled with parmesan cheese. We had coleslaw, hush puppies, gumbo, mac and cheese, and fried shrimp. I will be talking about this meal for years. The line is out the door, so if it wasn't for this private party I would have never had the patience to wait to get in, but man it would be worth it.

Reviews.Author: Alice J.
Reviews.Content: The wait took awhile. We had a group of 6 and waited about 45-60 minutes. A few things were really good but others just okay. Definitely get the chargrilled oysters, they were delicious. The fried catfish was also good. However the shrimp po boy, gumbo, and sweet potato fries were nothing special.

Reviews.Author: K R.
Reviews.Content: Awesome place! Great food...great service! Loved our waitress, Anndrea. She was amazing. Had oysters both raw & char-grilled. And the roast beef po'boy was excellent. Also had the Oysters Rockefeller soup...it was good but a bit rich. The fried crawfish tails with remoulade were yummy. For dessert, we had Barq's root beer float and took a slice of bananas foster cheesecake back to our hotel room. Can't wait to go back to this place.

Reviews.Author: Paul D.
Reviews.Content: Awesome oysters!

Reviews.Author: Carlos O.
Reviews.Content: Bread Pudding was amazing. Poboys are loaded with your choice of Sea Goodies....

Reviews.Author: Jenn J.
Reviews.Content: I am not big on seafood but I tried the Charbroiled Oysters that my boyfriend ordered and they were delicious; extremely flavorful, fresh and beautifully presented. My Oysters Rockefeller soup was delicious too, if a bit salty.  I had the Fish Poboy which was crispy, fresh and the fish seemed to be good quality (not fishy, white meat, etc). If there is a wait to get in, you should definitely wait! It was just the two of us so we were able to jump the line a bit and sit at the bar but the line moves quickly from what we saw when we were waiting.

Reviews.Author: Kara B.
Reviews.Content: I'm not much for seafood (read: yuckety-bleck) but the jambalaya was so good I almost didn't hear the crackling of all the crustaceans going on in the room. Almost.

Reviews.Author: Mr. Lo Kee E.
Reviews.Content: First off: It was cold  and we were asked to wait outside until the third person from our party finished parking. Not cool. Chilly.  We came back in and were asked to get out again. It wasn't crowded and there was plenty of room for us to stand and wait. Not the best welcome. The food: Oysters are big just like everyone says and taste just fine. I definitely prefer the raw oysters over the char-grilled. We also tried the crawfish po-boy and shrimp po-boy. The breading overpowered the seafood.We really couldn't eat the crawfish from the po-boy- it didn't taste right. We also ordered the jambalaya and gumbo. Mediocre.  I understand this place and its tradition, but expected more by way of hospitality and food.

Reviews.Author: Matthew P.
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time here, but my first time that I was sober enough to write a review...I had the soft-shell crab poboy, some raw oysters, and some crab and corn bisque...casual and reasonable.  A great spot for big parties.

Reviews.Author: todd b.
Reviews.Content: despite the hype, this place is actually good. Bourbon street is annoying, and these places seem a dime a dozen, but the fish is good. I had boiled crawfish which was tasty, and my partner had a tilapia po boy. The fish was fresh, well spiced, and not too greasy. There is no atmosphere here at all though except for drunken brohims and families.

Reviews.Author: Stefanie N.
Reviews.Content: What an experience this place was!  It was the first stop we went to for oysters and Acme did not dissapoint.  The crab corn chowder was delicious with large chunks of crab and plenty of sweet corn kernels.  We only ordered the raw oysters and they came out perfectly shucked.  The oysters were delicious, fresh, and had a clean flavor... but they were a tad bit too large.

Reviews.Author: Tom D.
Reviews.Content: Great Po-Boys -- and the Bloody Mary's are outstanding. Great fresh oysters -- and lots of fun!

Reviews.Author: Jeff M.
Reviews.Content: How many clams can a clam shucker shuck if a clam shucker can shuck clams? If you get a seat at the bar, you can count! They guys are damn good at what they do. As for the food? Excellent po' boys. Excellent crawfish. Awesome oysters. It's a wait. But well worth it.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan D.
Reviews.Content: Acme Oyster House is a tourist-y seafood restaurant in the Quarter, but they keep standards fairly high, so I'm rating it a little higher than I would normally rate such a place. I wouldn't have darkened their door except that my family was in town, and for some reason they have a mortal fear of traveling outside the Quarter, and this place always has a line outside the door, so they assumed it was going to be good. The line outside is totally misleading: the restaurant makes everyone wait outside for a table, even when there are plenty of empty tables inside! It is complete theater! They just want to look like they are constantly busy, so they make everyone wait outside and the hosts seat parties at a purposely...shall we say "deliberate"...pace.Inside is a bustling, high-volume operation, with a menu that contains all the NOLA seafood standards. During our visit, we had a dozen raw oysters ($13.50), and they were good...shucked in such a way that the liquor remained, served with all the normal accoutrements. For my entree, I had a fried soft shell crab platter ($16.99) with french fries and cole slaw. The crab tasted very good and fresh, and though it was fried perhaps a little too "vigorously," it had a nice cornmeal crust. The fries and slaw were so-so. Another member of my party had the Peace Maker po-boy ($12.99), which contained fried oysters, shrimp and a Tabasco-infused mayo. I had a bite and it was pretty delicious...if I ever find myself at Acme again, I'm going to order this. Another member of my party had the New Orleans Medley ($12.99), a sampler trio of gumbo, jambalaya and red beans & rice. They were all competent versions of NOLA classics, but definitely nothing to write home about.For dessert we shared a bread pudding with whiskey sauce ($4.99). It was OK...again, I've had much better. It was a little bit dense and oversweet. The restaurant is very noisy during dinner time, and service is brusque but competent. For a tourist place, you could do a lot worse than Acme. You could also go outside the quarter and go somewhere like Superior Seafood, which costs about the same and is far, far better in every way.

Reviews.Author: Feldman A.
Reviews.Content: Although you'll have to confront the traffic of the French quarter and the gang of tourists, from all over the South, getting smashed and gettin friendly as they wait in line to get in; at this French quarter location, you get ALL the ambiance. You also get the magic formula: charbroiled oysters with melted cheese, in the shell, which when combined with cold draft beer become an experience of pure palatal pleasure. The rest of the menu is fairly good as well. But these oysters are unlike anything you have ever tasted. Go for the full dozen. A half dozen will never be enough. Reasonably priced too..so bonus. Schwing!

Reviews.Author: Paula S.
Reviews.Content: Well, we made the mistake of deciding to try this place on a Friday night at 6:30 (with two kids in tow, none-the-less). We waited in line for 45 minutes. Outside. In the NOLA heat. Arg. But we'd heard great things, so we stayed.I will say this: The chargrilled oysters are out of this world. Amazing. Swimming in butter and garlic. I could make a meal off of them alone (although it would take several platters)!The po-boys are ok. It is a sandwich of fried seafood, after all. We tried both the soft-shelled crab po-boy and a fried shrimp po-boy. The place is really loud, kinda cramped, but fun. Lots of TVs for football (the Saints pre-season game was on, so it was nutty). It is in the heart of the French Quarter, though, so don't expect to park anywhere close by.

Reviews.Author: Will M.
Reviews.Content: They've got all the New Orleans favorites... crawfish, any fried seafood you want, and of course oysters! Always packed with tourits and locals so be prepared for a wait!

Reviews.Author: Edward J.
Reviews.Content: Best oysters I've ever had. The Jambalaya was OK. I was alone so I sat at the bar, of course I was subjected to the TV, and basketball to top it off. If oysters are your thing, come here.

Reviews.Author: Grant C.
Reviews.Content: We did some upscale eating in New Orleans, but this is more my kind of place. Nothing says New Orleans like cold beer and fried seafood.  Come here for the classics, like crawfish etouffe, a fried oyster po boy, or some red beans and rice.  We had a few plates of oysters washed down with some Dixie beer.  Booyah.

Reviews.Author: Harry T.
Reviews.Content: Not much of an interior but a great place to bring a large party.  I ordered a dozen Gulf oysters and they were delicious.  I was happy they were still tasty and big just as I remembered them.  I also split a fried oyster po boy and it was good but nothing too memorable.  Great place to bring newbs and tourist in New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: Josh W.
Reviews.Content: Maybe a tourist trap but whatever.  Me and my crew were maybe 2 hours fresh in New Orleans and looking for lunch.  Thankfully we chose this joint as the Peace Maker Po'boy was out-rage-us.  Outrageous!  This place was the start of my New Orleans po'boy binge - great spot with great food and service.  Would happily return.

Reviews.Author: Barney B.
Reviews.Content: a line to get in - in the freezing cold.  it can't be worth it, can it?it was.

Reviews.Author: Jorgen M.
Reviews.Content: Ya its great, they have awesome oysters and its always packed.. But its a bit touristy... go at least once. then go find where the locals go

Reviews.Author: Robert D.
Reviews.Content: The lady and I stopped in last tuesday for some oysters beer and gumbo after receiving recommendations from several friends...  well, they were right when they said we should go, because the food/service were really good.  The place has kind of a divey/neon light/busy decor but it was clean and the chargrilled oysters were out of this world.  Also, try the gumbo!  We'll be back next time we are in the Big Easy.

Reviews.Author: John F.
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably the best food I think I've ever had in a restaurant!! Both my wife and I loved it. Not fancy. Waited about 45 minutes on a Monday night in October and it was worth the wait. We had roast beef po boy, shrimp po boy and boo fries (cheese fries covered in beef gravy). We got our own table but most are seated at group type tables. Noisy but fun and great service!  We'll be back!!!

Reviews.Author: Erick N.
Reviews.Content: Made my first visit because my usual oyster bar was closed across the street.  The atmospher at ACME is very Vibrant with a lot of hustle and bustle.  We sat at the shucking bar and enjoyed watching the suckers work their magic.  I shared the softshell crab poboy and had a half dozen of chargrilled oysters.  Food was good, but I still prefer Felix's which is across the street.

Reviews.Author: Cynthia M.
Reviews.Content: Fast and friendly service. Awesome oysters!

Reviews.Author: Christie B.
Reviews.Content: Sit at the bar; great oysters.

Reviews.Author: Kevin L.
Reviews.Content: AMAZING fresh oysters. Both raw and grilled were delicious, and only $15.99 for a dozen. I also had the soft shell crab poboy, which was good as well. If I had to do it again i'd just have three dozen oysters for lunch.

Reviews.Author: JENNY G.
Reviews.Content: Ok, had heard about this place prior to my trip.  So, on Sunday morning we were wondering around aimlessly.  Found ourselves on Bourbon St - cant drink all day if you dont start in the morning!!!!!  So, we had a few beers here and then and then headed to Fat Tuesdays for a frozen concoction - then decided to walk and find something to eat as it was getting about lunch time.  So, we stumbled upon Acme Oyster House along with just about everyone else that was awake on the sleepy Sunday in New Orleans.  There was a line about 20 deep.  There was a girl with a clipboard - she take your name, just the number in your party.  It was a little confusing but that could have been my frozen concoction kicking in - we were finally to the front of the line and the girl with the clip board was a total buzz kill when she informed me I had to ditch my frozen concoction!!! BOO!!!  Upon  entering I wanted out immediately - very small space tables right on top of each other, awful service.  Our waitress had way too many tables to be able to keep up.  We got our drinks after our entrees.  I ordered the New Orleans Medley - a sampling of Gumbo, Jambalaya,Smoked Sausage and Red Beans and Rice.  It was all ok.  Maybe I should have had the oysters instead.

Reviews.Author: Rosella S.
Reviews.Content: despite the carnival-like line that snakes out the door that puts you at the mercy of street crooners looking for tips, i keep going back here for the peacemaker (or more fittingly, pacemaker) po' boy and raw oysters on the half shell.service is friendly and efficient - we ordered the raw oysters and it was already chilled and ready like it was waiting for us.  the crispy, deep-fried crustaceans and bivalves layered between spreads of tabasco-flavored mayo balanced out the 'healthiness' of the lettuce and tomato sprinkled in between the crusty bread.  yum!

Reviews.Author: Marc W.
Reviews.Content: I had their soft shell crab po-boy and it was good.  Not as good as Please U Restaurant, but good none the less.  The fresh oysters that I had were very good and tasty.  And obviously fresh.  Unfortunately there was no good wine to choose from but at least they had a decent selection of Abita beers.

Reviews.Author: Colleen B.
Reviews.Content: We lucked out and only had to wait 5 minutes - timing is everything! Acme offers a great selection of items besides oysters, though that is the main draw. The atmosphere is pretty festive, it's Nawlins after all, it was sporty while we were there as it was Sunday afternoon and the Mannings were playing. What I recommend here aside from oysters is something you will not find in SF - gravy cheese fries. Yep...uh huh!

Reviews.Author: Jeff L.
Reviews.Content: Thanks NO yelpers for all your recommendations!I spend one night and two meals in NO and decided on ACME as one of the meals...  and it did not disappoint.  what do I love as much as running?  well, duh, eating!  After busting my ass for 26 miles in the Mardi Gras Marathon, I still managed to walk about a mile from my hotel to ACME :) We were in a very tight timeline so after showering from the race, I rushed over to the restaurant.  after turning the corner on Iberville, I saw "the line."  wow.  (rene, felix did not have a line across the street, but I had to try ACME after seeing the 300+ reviews).  But a nice lady who was taking customers name in line walked me straight to the bar for take out.  Thank goodness since I was not going to wait in the line.  "can I order raw oysters to go?"  "no"  "can I order the charlboiled oysters to go?" "no"  (and I can understand for quality control).  So I ordered the following:  soft shelled crab, oyster platter, and a peacemaker po'boy to go.  and while I waited had myself 1/2 dozen raw oysters.....   man it was the most delicious oysters I ever had.  SO fresh and the sauce was spot on.  My only regret is I only ordered the 1/2 dozen....  should have gone for about 2 dozen!what a fantastic place.

Reviews.Author: Neil S.
Reviews.Content: Everything I expected.  This review is long over due, especially since I've been back from New Orleans for nearly 2 months, but I haven't forgotten the taste and flavor of Acme Oyster House.  The Oysters are delicious raw or chargrilled.  The poboi's are tasty, I got the soft shell crab.  Beer is generic, just go with Abita and you won't go wrong.  Its a packed house during dinner, especially when tourists are visiting (i.e. me).  So be prepared to wait in line outside to get seated.  Great atmosphere, noisy, everyone seems to be having a great time.  Service is suitable, especially with the massive amount of people to glide through.  I had no problems with Acme and no regrets.  Five stars in my book.  Oh yeah, Acme was also featured on Man Vs. Food for the Oyster eating challenge.

Reviews.Author: P S.
Reviews.Content: The char grilled oysters are incredibly delicious. Everything we have eaten here is good, as are their Bloody Mary's.

Reviews.Author: Chad K.
Reviews.Content: Wow! Raw oysters rocked, sampler platter, ettoufee, and bread pudding were delish. drinks were stiff. Definitely make time to stop by next time you're in NOLA.

Reviews.Author: LH D.
Reviews.Content: I swung by on my walk from the Market in the FQ to my hotel in CBD. Was told a must stop. So I grabbed a Peace...something (po boy with fried oysters and shrimp) and a side of Jambalaya. The Po Boy bread was soft and perfect and the sandwich was great with the 3 little Tabasco packets, maybe I could have done with a couple more! Sandwhich was filling so I couldn't eat all the Jambalaya, one bite and it was yum! It's on the drier side, not soupier like John Besh's Luke restaurant last night. It was warm with sausage and chicken, I so wish I wasn't full. This was a part of my 30 hour stop to taste New Orleans and I recc. Everyone stop by or get it to go!

Reviews.Author: Linda B.
Reviews.Content: Yep.  Just what I was looking for - some incredibly tasty oysters.  Tried the fresh oysters and the charbroiled oysters.  The cocktail sauce was nicely spiked with a good amount of horseradish.  The charbroiled oysters were a pleasant surprise.  Garlicky, cheesey and buttery, served with lightly toasted slices of french bread to mop of any butter/cheese, if you have any left behind.  Everything that is right and wrong with this world.  Servers were very friendly and helpful. Wait in line was maybe 10 minutes on a Wednesday night..? Well worth it.  Will be back.

Reviews.Author: Jenna C.
Reviews.Content: I could give you a long drawn out review, or I could simply say I love this place so much that their menus is literally hanging in my kitchen.... in California. Yeah that;s how much I love it. My first visit was actually 10 years ago in a few days. I've never had a bad dish here. I've been here a handful of times, I make sure to stop every visit to New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: Saj A.
Reviews.Content: There always seems to be a LONG line for this one...but for good reason...ACME is absolutely a MUST place to eat in NOLA! I absolutely dont like my oysters to be tampered with, I like 'em Raw. But while here, we got the Charcoal Oysters for our table. So glad we did, it was very tasty!!Even the Beef Po'Boy was great, the juices and beef kept falling all over the place..delicious!Just one thing I didnt care for much - the oyster shooter...eck, can avoid this one. Would love to go back again.

Reviews.Author: Kate S.
Reviews.Content: We ate here last night at a friend's recommendation. It was my first Louisiana-oyster eating experience so I wasn't sure what to expect - but they were quite delish! However, I'd have to agree with Christine B.'s, review...the chargrilled oysters were outstanding. I mean, you can pretty much throw spicy butter and a handful of cheese on just about anything and I'll love it, but these truly were fantastic. The red beans and rice were so-so, but I'm no connoisseur of Louisiana cooking so I won't go too far...all in all, good food but not sure I'd run back.

Reviews.Author: Andy G.
Reviews.Content: Cold beer, great oysters and good service.  This place was packed and Scott, the manager, hooked us up.  Everything that was brought was excellent, fast and friendly.  It's more of a dive - but they don't gouge you on prices and they're a very fun, authentic place to slurp oysters.  They do have other things if you don't like oysters, but seriously why would you go there for anything but the little creatures?

Reviews.Author: Singha F.
Reviews.Content: I ordered the combo with half a shrimp poboy and a side of jambalaya.  The shrimp poboy was pretty good, and the jambalaya was ok.  I had a few bites of my friend's peace maker poboy, and that was one damn good poboy.  The chargrilled oysters, topped with parmesan and butter, are delicious too.  Dip the bread they give you in the butter from the oysters....yum.  There is always a line at this place, so your best bet is to go at an odd time.  Get the peace maker, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Joshua L.
Reviews.Content: Was just here on vakay from Jersey. Got the shrimp po' boy. Loved it. Absolutely delicous. Ordered oysters for the first time, oh yeah, and last time. I can suck down raw clams all day but there is no way I will ever eat a raw Oyster again. Excellent po' boy, though.

Reviews.Author: Tammy Q.
Reviews.Content: Total tourist trap. They make you wait in line to give the illusion that the restaurant is busy. However, when you walk there - there's plenty of seats available. Food was nothing spectacular. I barely remember the gumbo I ordered and the oysters and po boys that my friends got was sub par compared to the other places we had already visited. For an authentic experience, check out Felix across the street.

Reviews.Author: Sunny D.
Reviews.Content: Hmmm....what to order here....how about some oysters? Pretty good plan and you can't go wrong if that's what you like. The lines tend to be pretty long as its a popular place.
