I like the fact that its unpretentious, full of life and the servers seem to be actually enjoying their job (although they hide it well by pretending to be grouchy?). The grilled oysters were delicious and you get a bit of crusty french bread to eat it with. Very casual (the perfect location in which to eat oysters). I hate dressing up just to be worried about making a mess. Let me wear my jeans and keep serving up those grilled oysters!

Reviews.Author: Helen L.
Reviews.Content: Amazing, amazing oysters!! The oysters are super fresh and the baked oysters are to die for. Mmm my mouth waters just thinking about it! Everybody visiting the big easy should make it a point to stop by Acme Oyster House before they leave. The baked oysters are topped with parmesan, butter, and garlic...perfect combination and absolutely packed with flavor. Drizzle it with a little tobasco and lemon juice...heaven! Oysters with a side of red beans and rice -- those are all you really need to order. The other items on the menu are nothing to write home about. Absolutely cannot wait to indulge myself the next time I come to New Orleans :)

Reviews.Author: Glo F.
Reviews.Content: This place has the best charbroiled oysters and the seafood gumbo was tasty. Friend had the softshell crab po'boy, and it was good too. The beer on draft was ice cold.  The only thing that was not so good were the french fries.  It was crowed for dinner, there's a line on a tuesday night at 6 pm.  We chose to sit at the bar so we didn't have to wait.  This was the only restaurant that had a line in the french quarters and there are plenty of restaurants in this part of French Quarters. Go early and order the oysters!!

Reviews.Author: Ji-In L.
Reviews.Content: We grabbed seats at the oyster bar on our first night in NOLA.  We shared 12 fresh oysters and a giant plate of fried shrimp, fried oysters, fried catfish, fried softshell crab, and... fries.  Hah.  The catfish was soooo good.  Moist and meaty.  But the softshell crab was the star of the show.  So worth adding to the plate for the extra few bucks.  Well, I take that back.  I think the real star of the night was the old man with the thick N'awlins accent who came up to me and kept pretending (?) to pour his red wine on my head.  And I'm pretty sure he called me a Commie.

Reviews.Author: Zoe B.
Reviews.Content: I love the seafood etouffe! My husband and I had the seafood etouffe, fried soft shell crab and a side jambalaya, everything was tasting great, and the seafood etouffe was my favorite of the night. It made me fall in love with this dish. Acme did a great job. The soft shell crab wasn't crispy enough though but I am still satisfied with Acme. The service was good too. The line was long but efficient. I hope we would have such great seafood in Honolulu. I know, you probably wonder why I said that, people think Honolulu must have good seafood, but I am telling you it's not true. I don't think people in Honolulu know how to make the seafood right. So yah enough said, I love the seafood in NOLA and Acme is one of the places I would have seafood at when visiting NOLA.

Reviews.Author: Andy Y.
Reviews.Content: Our flight got into NO late so we headed straight to Acme with our luggage and chow'd down!  Fried shrimp poboys came with the nicely fried and seasoned shrimp and toasty french bread.  Gumbo had a nice texture and not too thick.  Service was fast friendly and just right.  Always love Acme whenever I am in New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: Frank B.
Reviews.Content: BOMB, BOMB and did I say BOMB!!!! Being from the West Coast it is difficult to find a good Po'boy and Louisiana styled seafood. I don't know where to begin with this place. First, please do not get scared by the line outside the door (it moves fast). Second, staff was very friendly and inviting. Okay, now for the food. Charbroiled oysters (drool), Oyster/Shrimp Po'boy (drool), Seafood Gumbo, as Homer would so eloquently put it (ahhhhhhhh, with some drool dribbling down his mouth). To top it off they had Yeungling by the pitcher!!!! I will admit, this may not be the most authentic seafood New Orleans has to offer but it is a fabulous introduction.

Reviews.Author: david d.
Reviews.Content: Love the oysters here! this place and drago's are my favorites

Reviews.Author: Jiho S.
Reviews.Content: Lotta hype but  admittedly the food was well worth the trip. Sat at the bar at 10pm on a saturday evening (dining room was busy, but not terribly busy).  Split a po boy with a friend and ate oysters all night. Sitting at the bar was fun, we got to see all the guys shuck oysters all night and converse with them. Raw oysters are great but the grilled ones are something to try if you haven't yet...think the preparation is specific to the region....not just grilled plain, but its covered in a butter/garlic mix that's quite rich but tasty with a few slices of french bread (sauce makes great for dipping). Very casual eatery (felt like I was in  TGIF's) but very lively and just 2 blocks from bourbon. Would come back.

Reviews.Author: Caroline G.
Reviews.Content: Great oysters on the half shell! Draft beers are small but I was there for the food luckily. Place was packed but we were seated after a 10 minute wait. Wait staff was nice and the appetizers are interesting. We made a meal out of them and the raw oysters. Would come back again!

Reviews.Author: Alien T.
Reviews.Content: Excellent place for Char broiled oysters. If you are visiting to NOLA and want to eat oyster then this is the place. It is very touristy but very good place for locals also. The staff is very friendly and funny. Best thing is sit at the bar and watch them prepare the oysters plates.

Reviews.Author: Maya P.
Reviews.Content: BEST CHAR-GRILLED OYSTERS EVER! Wish they shipped their oysters to Chicago. Made a batch similar to theirs at home, taste ok. Not as good as Acme! BEST JAMBALAYA EVER! Felix's tasted rotten.

Reviews.Author: Mau L.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled oysters and seafood ettoufee is delish here! The line gets really long Fri and Sat nights so make sure you leave a friend in line while you go out exploring or bring a snack while in line.

Reviews.Author: JW U.
Reviews.Content: Simply the best in the French quarter. Always a long line at night and well worth the wait. You can not replicate the experience and food any pace on the planet. Go for the wood fired grilled oysters. They are outstanding and often overlooked by the novice raw bar bunny.

Reviews.Author: Ian H.
Reviews.Content: Great oysters both fresh and grilled and a nice sampler plate too. This place is great value and worth queuing for. 5* at this price.

Reviews.Author: John G.
Reviews.Content: There's more than oysters here! I highly recommend the shrimp po boy and red beans and rice.

Reviews.Author: Jason B.
Reviews.Content: Would get 5 stars but they are overpriced.

Reviews.Author: Nick W.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled oysters were amazing, awesome gumbo, and the Peacemaker was great.... just wish they toasted the bread in New Orleans.  Great stop in New Orleans and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Lisa K.
Reviews.Content: Delicious. All I got was the chargrilled oysters and that was plenty. Although I wish I got the full dozen instead of the wimpy 1/2 dozen! I also heard the boo fries were very good too! I went on a Thursday night and the wait was about 30 minutes. But I was alone (work trip) and was seated at the bar in 2 minutes. It is a very touristy spot near Bourbon Street, but hey I am a tourist and looking for great food!

Reviews.Author: T H.
Reviews.Content: Long Line mediocre food everything seems to be fried. I was eating my half dozen oysters on a half shell when a cockroach crawled over my foot then scurried back underneath the door into the dish washing area. The whole place is sort of dirty around the edges. We tried to take a picture of the roach but apparently they run when the flash from the camera hits them. I had the soft shell crab platter it was lackluster surrounded by lukewarm fries.

Reviews.Author: Charles G.
Reviews.Content: Good as always.

Reviews.Author: John G.
Reviews.Content: Food was good, the chicken/sausage gumbo was phenomenal, but the service was shit and ruined the experience for us and I'll never go back.  The waitress was very surely and rude, to the point of throwing plates into the busing tray, and making the experience very uncomfortable for us.  I understand that bad days happen, I'm human too, and waited tables for 8 years, I know it's not always the fault of the servers, just don't take it out on us and don't be mean!  This reflects a management issue, oversight like this is reflective of larger problems and issues.  Plus, they were really trying to run us out of the place as soon as they could, taking our plates without asking, asking if we needed anything else countless times.  Hold the fuck up, we're almost finished, damn!  We were able to get in fairly quickly, maybe a 10-15 wait at the door which isn't bad.  Food wasn't good enough though to sit through this type of abuse and maybe you have a million other folks waiting to get in, but you get enough folks treated poorly, and maybe the Acme Oyster House might care a bit more about how the service they provide.

Reviews.Author: Rachel S.
Reviews.Content: I miss this place.really have to go back to New Orleans just for those grilled oysters!!!!

Reviews.Author: Brian P.
Reviews.Content: Grilled oysters! They were awesome! Only a short wait at lunch

Reviews.Author: Todd R.
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable chargrilled oysters!  A must have!!!

Reviews.Author: Darvin D.
Reviews.Content: 1st time to enjoy charbroiled oysters and I think these may be the best. As for the poor boys, I have had better and worse. The service was as good as could be expected for a group of 12.

Reviews.Author: AMarshall A.
Reviews.Content: This place was AWESOME! Good service, good atmosphere and great food. The Lima Bean and Tasso soup was excellent.

Reviews.Author: M V.
Reviews.Content: They said it would be a 25 minute wait. It was about 10 and would have been well worth the 25 minute wait anyway. Great service. Raw oysters in the half shell were perfect. Boyfriend doesn't eat fish. He loved his smoked sausage po boy sandwich.

Reviews.Author: Matt G.
Reviews.Content: Expect to wait on the weekends but you are in for excellent oysters.

Reviews.Author: Isabella R.
Reviews.Content: I just wasn't wowed by his place. We'd been to a little po-boy place near Metarie during the day and had a pretty authentic po-boy. I wanted to blow that experience out of the water and have a peacemaker po-boy at Acme. I hate to say it was just O.K. Good but nothing memorable. I now realize I should have had the chargrilled oysters so next time I'll fit those into my culinary tour. I guess it's also the vibe of the place-the servers are nice, it's just that it has a New Orleans-themed mall restaurant feel. I hate to be the tourist who wants it all, but a little real feeling goes far with me.

Reviews.Author: Will Y.
Reviews.Content: Simply the best po-boy in the world.

Reviews.Author: Aesah L.
Reviews.Content: I knew everyone comes here for the oysters, but since I'm allergic to shellfish I had to eat something else...and I was not disappointed. The jambalaya, red beans and rice, and gumbo medley was delicious and not expensive at all. In particular, the jambalaya was one of the best I'd had. Definitely worth the visit.

Reviews.Author: Cisco R.
Reviews.Content: Get there early if you plan to go during the evenings on a weekend. The oysters were fantastic (I had about 12 of them plus an oyster shot) and the gumbo was superb. There was a tad too much garlic but thats OK in my book. This place is definitely a plus!

Reviews.Author: Alex H.
Reviews.Content: the first time I came here was six years ago and had fresh oysters and crawfish and it was awesome.the second time in NOLA, I came back again but it was in august, and unfortunately, crawfish was not in season. we had the mixed seafood platter and the shrimp/catfish po'boy. their fried catfish is the best. i dont really find fried oyster that good, but the combination was a good choice and the serving size is plenty to fill you up.

Reviews.Author: Meghan P.
Reviews.Content: The chargrilled oysters are really, really good.  They bring them to you hissing and hot, with the cheese and butter bubbling.  Mmmm!  I also had etouffee, with fried crawdad tails.  I'd recommend skipping the tails... they don't add much.  Mostly they taste like fried shrimp (in other words, they just had a fried flavor).  The etouffee was pretty good.  I also had the bananas foster dessert ( I thought it was a pie, but it turned out to be cheesecake.  That was okay.The line moves pretty quikly, and if you're in a small group you definently can get seated quickly if you don't mind the bar.  The bartender wasn't super friendly (definently not chatty), but he didn't try to hurry me out when I was waiting for the Twins to lose.

Reviews.Author: tony c.
Reviews.Content: do not let the wait deter you- if you love oysters, this is the place to be!  the raw oysters are really nice and fresh.  the oyster shooters are cheap and delicious.  chargrilled oysters?  i'd never had such a thing before but they. are. incredible.  i cant begin to say enough about this place.also- what goes better with oysters than bloody marys?!  that's right, nothing.  and they have one of the best that ive ever had in my entire life...  with pickled ocra, pickled green beans, garlic stuffed olives and a mary mix that's out of this world.  hands down, it's a new orleans must have.

Reviews.Author: Harry K.
Reviews.Content: After checking in with the maitree'd we waited for about 30 minutes to be seated. This place is overrated! We tried the fried seafood platter, 2 dozen fresh oysters and 2 dozen char grilled oysters. The best thing about this place was the grilled oysters. Otherwise, if I had known I wouldn't have visited. I had better oysters elsewhere in New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: Unknown
Reviews.Content: A New Orleans institution since forever, the Acme serves up the freshest oysters and the best Cajun stews, Jambalayas, and Po'Boys in town. Service is fast, which is a good thing, since there is a line out the door most of the day. We generally come here for lunch and then spend the rest of the afternoon walking off the result. Nothing fancy by any stretch, just good ol' Cajun home cooking at its best.

Reviews.Author: Jeff W.
Reviews.Content: I know that I am going to eat well when I come here, but today's lunch was fantastic!  The grilled oysters are awesome!  I had to order another half dozen as desert!

Reviews.Author: scott s.
Reviews.Content: yummy!  stopped here for a fried oyster po'boy and was not disappointed.  the oysters were actually sort of fluffy, which i thought was a physical impossibility for anything fried.  nice!  they actually reminded me of tempura, if that gives you a point of reference.service was quick and friendly, food was good and plentiful, price was very reasonable.  i'll be back.

Reviews.Author: Marebear P.
Reviews.Content: Pros: Had the chargrilled oysters and they were very good! Shared a seafood platter with hubby and it was enough food for the both of us. Cons: The place is small, loud, and cramped. There was a long long long line outside ...so expect to wait at least 30-45 mins.

Reviews.Author: Peter L.
Reviews.Content: Just have to go.  The line gets a little long around dinner, but not much of a wait early in the afternoon.  Had the raw oysters, the chargrilled and peace maker po' boy too -- everything was delicious.  Great service.  And if you eat fifteen dozen oysters, they're half price and you get a t-shirt...

Reviews.Author: Jeanne B.
Reviews.Content: "Give me oysters and beer for dinner every day of the year and I'll feel fine!"Jimmy Buffett must have been dreaming of Acme Oyster House when he wrote that line 'cause their oysters are certainly worth singing about!  Given its location in the touristy French Quarter and its world-renowned fabulous oysters, the Acme starts getting a line around 6pm every day.  If you're in a small party (like 2 or 3) opt to sit at the bar - you'll get in faster and have the pleasure of conversing with the lovely bar staff.  The raw oysters are fantastic and a definite must.  Other menu options to consider are the oyster rockefeller soup and the sausage and rice and beans entree.  The portions are satisfying and the beer is always cold - try the Abita Andy Gator on tap.Before you leave check out their wall of fame, which lists the guests who have eaten at least 15 dozen oysters in one sitting.  It's longer than I thought it would be - a true testament to how good these oysters are!

Reviews.Author: Skylor J.
Reviews.Content: I can't stop thinking about those oysters....My friends and I went to NO for New Years.  The hotel clerk told us to go to Felix's it is the same as ACME and we wouldn't have to wait in line so we went there the first night (not great).  Then we went to ACME the second morning around 11:00am and my friends were parking the car and you can not be seated until your enitre party is there and you can't split checks..so we finally got seated of course I ordered a bloody mary (i had a looong night). It was great then I ordered some grilled oysters AMAZING!!! It will be worth the wait...We drove back home to Houston and stopped at the ACME in Baton Rouge..We were first line this time. lol.. No need it has pleanty of space..This time I had grilled and iced oysters...The grilled were the BEST!!...You have to visit this place..I am going back for Madi Gras just to go there....lol..seriously...

Reviews.Author: Tiffy G.
Reviews.Content: This was my first stop once we unpacked at the hotel.  The Chargrilled Oysters and Oyster Remoulade was my fave!  The raw oysters were ok, you can find better elsewhere around the French Quarter (Royal Oyster House!).  I don't recommend the Fried Crawfish Tail.  It was dry and didn't taste any meat!  Arrive early, as there's always a line outside.

Reviews.Author: Lee B.
Reviews.Content: Great oysters, a tad too touristy for me but honestly the charbroiled oyesters are worth coming in for.  I usually do oysters fried when I eat them but I suggest doing them raw and charbroiled.  The service was great and the prices aren't crazy.  Worth checking out when near Bourbon Street.  Wash them down with with an ice cold Abita.

Reviews.Author: Linh N.
Reviews.Content: I have been here a few times and every time the wait is ridiculous.  The food is great though.  I know most people come here for the char grilled oysters but my favorite dish is the fried catfish.

Reviews.Author: Olga K.
Reviews.Content: Delicious oysters.  Lots of tourists.  Yes, there will be a line.  But overall, a lot less touristy and gimmicky than we thought it would be.  And the oysters are very good.

Reviews.Author: Kimba V.
Reviews.Content: Kinda disappointed after all the hype I've heard over this place.  Kinda proves my suspicion that maybe overly hyped restaurants aren't THAT great.  We waited in line for about 45 minutes only to find out that crawfish was out of season and they weren't boiling anything in the kitchen.  I ended up getting a small bowl of the seafood etouffee.  It was good, and that's all I will say.  We got a dozen oysters as an appetizer and I will admit that I have had better.  Still tasty but not satisfying my expectations.  Oh well...off to my next stop.

Reviews.Author: Gina L.
Reviews.Content: YES YES AND YES!  Go with the charbroiled oyster recommendation, could have made a meal of those alone, also had the fish/shrimp combo, just didnt have enough room  :((  The server was awesome!  Will be back!!!!  Oh and the previous (positive) reviews are RIGHT ON.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer H.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for for the Charbroiled Oysters, but 3 stars overall because of the fact that there is NO OTHER Gluten Free options.  Most of New Orleans is this way, because they use Roux in everything.  Difficult to find GF options in NOLA unless you go to more upscale restaurants.  But the charbroiled oysters were phenomenol!

Reviews.Author: Vincent L.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled oysters are the best oysters I've ever had in my life (so far). My gf and I made it a point to come back to this place during our visit to NOLA just for the oysters. And we're glad we did. They're a bit on the salty side, but I think that's just the way they're seasoned. The restaurant also gives you bread so you can dip it in the oyster juice. So make sure you soak it all up. I found myself (without shame) licking the inside of the shell because it was so delicious. Be careful when you first get them though, the shells are HOT when touched. I wish I could have some right now!

Reviews.Author: Diana N.
Reviews.Content: I went right during lunch as it opened and there was no wait. The soft shell crab is great but a little on the pricey side, well worth it though. We also had chargrilled oysters and true to what everyone has said - buttery and garlic-goodness!

Reviews.Author: Margaret S.
Reviews.Content: My first time eating oysters and they were delicious!!!! The wait was horrendous and the atmosphere needs improvement....just an FYI

Reviews.Author: A K.
Reviews.Content: BEST oyster in town!!  Don't forget to try baked oyster!!!

Reviews.Author: Josy J.
Reviews.Content: Love this place.  Have to  experience the Acme when in the big easy.  Even though locals and tourists alike visit here, it has maintained it's excellence as long as we have been coming here, and that would be about for the last 8 years.

Reviews.Author: Brian J.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled Oysters were to die for.  Gumbo not so much.  Bread pudding had a lackluster presentation but was delicious and a perfect finish.  Since it is called the Acme OYSTER house, I suggest sticking with namesake dish.

Reviews.Author: Lindsay T.
Reviews.Content: Some f-in good oysters. It's a packed house at 11:15 in the morning on a Sunday so plan accordingly.

Reviews.Author: Martin K.
Reviews.Content: Just like everyone else mentioned... well worth it!

Reviews.Author: Jacki G.
Reviews.Content: What a great way to experience NOLA cuisine on our first day in town. We stopped by after a long day of traveling and were seated immediately (it was a Monday at 3:00pm), but it was still rather crowded. We got our food very quickly, and I'm glad we did because everything was incredible! Three of us devoured our boo fries in about 5 minutes (DELISH!), and my brother and I were fortunate enough to have ordered the chargrilled oysters (over the raw) to split. They were INCREDIBLE!! The garlic and cheese were an excellent combo and made for some incredibly happy foodies! We were so blown away that we ordered another dozen. I was really happy we decided to go here over Felix's as everything was so good!!!

Reviews.Author: Rachel H.
Reviews.Content: The long line is well worth the wait because this was the best restaurant I went to in New Orleans!! The food was so so so good!!! I had the chargrilled oysters, and they were so delicious!! They are steeped in butter and Parmesan cheese, and there was bread to sop it all up! I also got the fried fish po boy, which was served with red beans and rice. The fish was fried to perfection, and it was melt-in-your-mouth!! I will definitely be back here whenever I visit!!

Reviews.Author: Kellysue H.
Reviews.Content: Being that it is a tourist place it is still very good.  Service was good. You have to try the chargrilled oysters. Would recommend going after the lunch rush or before the dinner rush because the line can get pretty long.

Reviews.Author: Kate O.
Reviews.Content: At Acme, the Chargrilled Oysters are a must! I just returned home from my first trip down to New Orleans. I travelled with my dad and uncle who had been to NOLA a few times before but never tried Acme's. I brought a list of must-eats and must-do's and Acme did not disappoint! We ordered 1/2 dozen of the chargrilled oysters and then 2 more dozen after trying our first one! We were in NOLA for 4 days and had to go back  before we left to get another dozen!

Reviews.Author: Nessci R.
Reviews.Content: First time here everything was nice and on point service was good just found out I wasn't such a big fan of oysters lll

Reviews.Author: Patrice R.
Reviews.Content: We went the evening we arrived in NOLA which was a Sat. night.  A little intimidating to see the line waiting outside to get in.  The weather was great so it was no hardship to wait.  It took about 25 min. to be seated.  I am not a fan of oysters but my husband is, big time.  He always makes this restaurant a destination when we vacation here.  He was not disappointed at all.  I ordered the fried shrimp platter which was tasty but the breading was a bit salty.  Acme Oyster House will continue to be a destination when we travel to NOLA.

Reviews.Author: Rania A.
Reviews.Content: LOVED the food! I thought all the food was delicious. we were a group of 12 and they were great with getting us a big table in the back set up and the service was pretty fast. The best char grilled oysters and great po boys ! actual ambiance of the place is more of a diner.. but the food is worth the wait on the line!

Reviews.Author: Alex C.
Reviews.Content: Tried oysters for the first time at Acme!!! So tasty, went back the next day for more...

Reviews.Author: Brandon L.
Reviews.Content: Good food. Definitely many other Cajun places have equal if not better food WITHOUT the long line.

Reviews.Author: Emily S.
Reviews.Content: I have only been here for lunch, but their chargrilled oysters are to die for. The best I've had so far, I could eat them as my entire meal. That said, their po-boys are pretty damn good as well. I've only had the roast beef myself, but everyone I've been with has also loved their meal. The only problem is how popular the place is--often there is a line outside the door, and the sheer volume of people they feed means the service is little rushed at times. We sat at the bar the second time though and the bartender was awesome, joking around and harassing us, which made up for any lack of service on his part. Must go just for the oysters.

Reviews.Author: Laura K.
Reviews.Content: Great fun! Great people! Amazing food!! Sit at the bar for special attention. There's a reason for the line. Be patient and stay. And get the charbroiled oysters and pecan cobbler. Oh yum!!!!

Reviews.Author: Maria W.
Reviews.Content: "Worth the waiting. Delicious food and great service. Had the combo but will go back for the oysters."

Reviews.Author: CRISTINA A.
Reviews.Content: The food and drinks were very tasty. That said, everything else was awful. The hostess was like a burly, peed-off bouncer, had the attitude of "you don't like it, go somewhere else". Everybody else inside had the same attitude. Clearly, the long line outside gives them the feeling that the food speaks for itself, there's no need for customer service, the idiots will keep coming anyway. Well, I WILL NOT!

Reviews.Author: Kelly L.
Reviews.Content: After a little disappointed of trying top rate restaurants around downtown and French Quarter of New Orleans, which one really refreshed out mind. The best oyster in town for both chargrilled and raw oysters. And their Po-boy is really amazing!!There are always a waiting line, so try to be there earlier than lunch or dinner rush hours.

Reviews.Author: Wes C.
Reviews.Content: When I was in New Orleans, I was intrigued with visiting this tourist hotspot after hearing about their chargrilled oysters. After getting their, we had to wait in line for probably 15 minutes (seems like this place always as a line, but seems to move relatively quickly). Most of the tables are family style, so don't be surprised if you are sitting at a table with others. The menu contains the full spread of Louisiana cuisine from crawfish and oysters to Po-boys and smoked sausage. We started our meal with a dozen raw oysters, half dozen chargilled oysters and an order of the crawfish hush puppies. The raw oysters were large and extremely fresh. The crawfish hush puppies were perfectly crisp on the outside with melt-in-your mouth crawfish filling. The chargrilled oysters were out-of-this world with the oyster sitting in its own juices mixed with a garlic butter sauce and topped with melted romano cheese. For entrees, we got the deep-fried crawfish Po-boy, the Variety Plate (with samplings of gumbo, jambalaya, smoked sausage, and red beans on rice), and the crawfish etoufee. The entrees were good, not the best but good. What surprised me was the somewhat mediocre quantities for the amount of money they were charging. Service was ok, as were the entrees. The appetizers were the best part of the meal. I definitely suggest dinning hear once to say that you did, but there are much better and more reasonably priced eateries all around New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: Meilong Y.
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop i made when i got to NOLA, it was great!! The osyters were awsome, get the dozen, the half dozen isnt ENOUGH lol, the drinks wasnt so great, my bartender (i sat at the bar) didnt kno how to make a cocktail ON THE MENU, thats the only reason why i give 4 stars, cuz the food was GREAT!!

Reviews.Author: Christian H.
Reviews.Content: i have been to this location a few times before, but this time the food was poor in quality!!  oysters were not cold, cooked food was barely warm and a/c was almost warm???  don't know what is going on w/the place but seems they are losing it, there are just toooooo many places to eat around there to put up w/poor conditions!!!  will not be back anytime soon....

Reviews.Author: Nate S.
Reviews.Content: I hadn't been here in years and wanted to share what I remembered to be one of "NOLA's best" with my fiancé. I recommend getting there early and arriving before you get hungry. There will be a wait but it will be worth it! We sat at the bar and had the Chargrilled Oysters, Seafood Gumbo and the Peace Maker PO-Boy. All were fantastic! The service was excellent, non-stop entertainment from everyone behind the bar. They make you feel right at home! Seriously though, get there early. We walked by at least 4 times during our stay and most of the time the line was about 30 people deep...

Reviews.Author: Jules K.
Reviews.Content: Fred hit it on the head in the middle of this meal, if Acme was in New York or Los Angeles it would be a deli.  Loud brash with checkered tablecloths.  So we kept it simple, shrimp Po-Boy for me, Soft Shell Crab Po-Boy for Mark....lots of iced tea.  Fred stuck to the Oysters.  They looked good and he proclaimed them to be as well.  Get a Po-Boy and a beer and relax, you are in good hands.

Reviews.Author: Jelly F.
Reviews.Content: I love oysters! So I definitely had to check out this place when I went to NOLA. I must say that the oysters were great. Very different to the ones I usually eat from Tomales Bay but still tasty. I have to admit that I'm not a big fan of the chargrilled oysters. It's a good concept of grilling the oysters topped with parmesan cheese but its way too salty for my taste buds. So if you like oysters and happen to go to Bourbon Street, check out this place for sure.

Reviews.Author: Sandy C.
Reviews.Content: Went here in late January during a conference in beloved Nawlins...tried the half dozen grilled oysters (excellent) and the fried oyster/shrimp Po'Boy. Friends had fried shrimp and crawdads..didn't care for the crawdads, think that's an acquired taste, but the shrimp and oysters were excellent. Great food, fun atmosphere, excellent experience!

Reviews.Author: Nini D.
Reviews.Content: Went here on a Sunday afternoon and we were seated immediately. There was no line at all- except you might have to share one of the long tables in the back dining room with other people if your party is small. We had the baked oysters for an appertizer and it was pretty good! Had the half  oyster Po boy and cup of Gumbo for the meal-the Po Boy was ok- but the Gumbo was pretty good. My friend ordered the Crawfish Etoufee and it was pretty good- but once you added some hot sauce it was really good!!!

Reviews.Author: David G.
Reviews.Content: Still as amazing as always. The charbroiled oysters topped with cheese were amazing as were the fried shrimp, seafood gumbo, bloody marys, and hushpuppies!

Reviews.Author: Jeff S.
Reviews.Content: If you want the best oysters on the half shell you must try Acme. I've been several times and taken several people who have eaten oysters around the world and we all agree this is the place. If you need a little something else try the Shrimp and oyster po-boy dressed its pretty good too.

Reviews.Author: evan t.
Reviews.Content: Food is good but not worth the hour wait.  I would recommend getting food to go.  They don't do reservations and there is ALWAYS a line from all the yuppies that visit NoLa.

Reviews.Author: Anpan W.
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is worth the line. Fresh oysters, oyster po-boys, chargrilled oysters, sampler of New Orleans musts, strong drinks.

Reviews.Author: Spencer M.
Reviews.Content: I feel like the this place is only for tourist.  The oysters are good but that is about it.  The roast beef po boy is average and there gumbo was lame.  My plastic cup of beer sat empty for way to long.  The waitress hit us with a 18% grat and the service suffered.  Go somewhere else not worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Tonitini C.
Reviews.Content: Met with their Master Schucker, and it was fab! My wife and I ate by the bar and we ATE! Slurped it all down, one tray after another! If you don't eat oysters, YOU WILL NOW. Try this place out, it's an iconic joint right in the heart of the French Quarter. I can not wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Tracy H.
Reviews.Content: Oysters! Oysters! Oysters! What else can I say?

Reviews.Author: Lucy B.
Reviews.Content: We were lucky, we got to this place when there was no line outside!We ordered oysters raw, chargrilled oysters, and gumbo. Everything was just OK. The chargrilled oysters were great first bite but then became way too salty! Go across the street, the oysters are cheaper and better!

Reviews.Author: Dan Y.
Reviews.Content: I know I know it's a tourist trap.  But huge crowds means fresh oysters too!  Most people on line were for parties larger than 4.  Tell the hostess you are only 2 and chances are good you will be seated right away!  Grilled oysters were great and lived up to the hype.  Sharp Parma cheese complimented the rich oyster very well.  The oyster poboy was also delicious!  It was obviously fresh out of the fryer and the breading was just right with a good amount of seasoning.  The delicate taste of catfish however gets a bit lost in the roll.  Raw oysters were extremely fresh so go ahead and get 18 dozen.

Reviews.Author: Paul L.
Reviews.Content: Why do people give a restaurant four and five stars only to write comments like "hype" and "mediocre" in their reviews. If you start reading Acme's reviews you will find several examples. While it may be historic and the Chargrilled Oysters were good, I could find no reason beyond "hype" to score this establishment beyond a three stared A-OK. Pound for Pound Oceania was cheaper, better fare.

Reviews.Author: Patricia M.
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is if you come here, please order the fresh oysters because they really are the only thing tasty on the menu. We ordered the other foods such as gumbo, jambalaya, beans and rice, and the fried po-boy and none of these foods impressed us. But the grilled and raw oysters really impressed us so please stick to those!

Reviews.Author: Tracy F.
Reviews.Content: When Yelp asked the questions about my last meal on earth, I easily answered, ACME Oyster House in New Orleans!! I have been going to this place for as long as I can remember. The red beans and rice are my favorite. The shuckers are awesome and extremely entertaining. While oysters anyway here are delicious, I love the char-grilled oysters most of all!! I have never experienced bad service there but then again I do not act like a drunken tourist fool who is having their first NOLA experience. LOL. Be prepared for a wait but locals and tourists both love this place.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie C.
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Acme?  The service!  We sat at the bar over the weekend and had the benefit of attentive service by Pamela.  She rocked!  Pamela checked in on us frequently and had a very sweet, genuine and caring disposition.  The food was good too - had the raw oysters on the half shell and the fried crawfish tails.

Reviews.Author: T O.
Reviews.Content: This place is completely average. Feels and looks just like the chain it is. The servers are friendly and the food is very reasonably priced for the French Quarter. It is only worth it to go at an off-peak time because the line can get ridiculously long. None of of their food stands out which is too bad, but at these prices, oh well. I look for above average food when I'm eating out so I would not go here again, but I wasn't unhappy when the bill came. It is definitely super touristy, but you probably know that already.

Reviews.Author: Alex B.
Reviews.Content: Food was good... Defiantly a solid place for a good New Orleans dinner..

Reviews.Author: Randolph M.
Reviews.Content: Imagine my surprise when I ordered an oyster shooter.  In addition to the oyster, horseradish, and a bit of cocktail sauce, was: a shot of vodka!  Unexpected flavor explosion.  The oyster flavor was a bit overpowered by the vodka, but it was a unique experience for me.  Regular oysters on the half shell were great.

Reviews.Author: Rob T.
Reviews.Content: Worth going for the chargrilled oysters. (Think of this as analogous to getting at least one slice of authentic slice of New York Pizza if you're visiting New York.) I wouldn't expect to be blown away by the atmosphere or anything else on the menu. But worth a stop.

Reviews.Author: Kristen W.
Reviews.Content: omg this is the most awesome place to get raw oysters!!!  we went here earlier this year and shared 3 dozen of them between me and my bf.  love love love this place!  one advice is that it's okay (actually better) to take the bar seats as you can watch them preping the oysters in front of you while you eat.  =)did i mention this place is awesome?  =)

Reviews.Author: Scott C.
Reviews.Content: Walked 10 blocks here for weekday lunch.  A line outside?  No thanks.

Reviews.Author: Bonnie B.
Reviews.Content: Not sure what all the fuss is about. Food was mediocre. Service was good, but the fare is not worth the trip.

Reviews.Author: B P.
Reviews.Content: I ordered half of a fried fish po boy sandwich with sweet potato fries.  The fries were delicious.  The fish was bland and the bread they served it with didn't taste fresh.  The hotel concierge recommended this place.  I won't ask for their help again.  Maybe their specialty is oysters and not fish sandwiches.

Reviews.Author: Sara D.
Reviews.Content: The char broiled oysters!!! wow!!I'd give it a five, but the service was slow. The server forgot one order. Pass on the fried fish platter. Just eat the oysters!

Reviews.Author: Teri Y.
Reviews.Content: Not much to say. Line was long, staff not friendly. Oysters were delish - both raw and chargrilled. I will go if friends want to but otherwise, Ill go to Pascals oyster bar (so much fun) or the French Market Restaurant for oysters where the oysters are also great,but the wait isn't as long and the people are friendly.

Reviews.Author: Maile T.
Reviews.Content: Really long line, get there early.  The chargrilled oysters are awesome!!! Friendly staff!

Reviews.Author: Robert C.
Reviews.Content: The place was highly recommended by some friends in addition to me reading on the Yelp.  It didn't disappoint my wife and me. Were there on Sunday around noon and dreaded the long line. Some waiting in line but wasn't that bad. We asked for seats at the bar and were seated right away. The bloody mary was really good and the chargrilled oysters were so tasty. Definitely gong back.

Reviews.Author: Misty D.
Reviews.Content: I think the oysters were the size of my head. The beer mugs were frosted. My first meal in New Orleans....I still dream about it

Reviews.Author: Carpe D.
Reviews.Content: If you can wait a really long time, then you have to try it. It's a hole in a wall where locals go, good food, cheap, fun, packed.

Reviews.Author: Brian M.
Reviews.Content: Coal fired grilled oysters with garlic and cheese, If they have it as an appitizer, GET IT. My wife hates oysters, or so she thought then she ate these and is hooked. Follow it up with a po-boy and some gumbo and you better plan to waddle out the door.

Reviews.Author: Jed S.
Reviews.Content: Okay, I'm definitely in the "cooked oysters are an oxymoron" camp...but this place may have changed my opinion on the matter. Their chargrilled oysters are simply irresistable...luckily we had half cooked, half raw oysters to not steer me into the dark side completely. The soft shelled crab po boy is a must. The batter they use for the crab was perfect imo. The red beans and rice with sausage is also something to order to compliment your po boy.

Reviews.Author: Megan C.
Reviews.Content: BEST oysters on the planet.  Sit at the bar - it's the only way to go :)

Reviews.Author: Cheyenne B.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite places to eat in the NO. Charbroiled oysters are out of this world. Everything I have had here is great. Try the spiced iced tea. It's got a sweet kick.

Reviews.Author: Edith K.
Reviews.Content: We got there around 6:30 tonight and the waiting line was a short one (13 ahead of us), after 15 minutes of waiting they got space for us at the bar, which was not bad at all.Seafood Gumbo, i requested this soup with the rice on the side mainly because i wanted to enjoy the soup not the rice, and it was great!!lots of shrimp, thick base, lot of flavor. Request for the BOWL is not that big.Oyster Rockefeller Soup, this was the soup of the day, it was a creamy base topped with deep fried oysters, it was Deli-sh!!*** If you are eating at the Bar and  order soups the crackers are located behind the condiments (hot sauce rack) i found them after i was finish with my soup.Raw Oysters with horseradish tomato sauce, big-big fresh, nice clean taste.Grilled Oysters, great smoky flavor, cheesy, accompanied by warm bread, Winner!!We also got sodas and the bartender kept them full all the time, we got great and quick service, for our first time here and after walking all day it was perfect.By the time we walke3ed out the door, the line was all the way to the corner..... i guess we got lucky.New Orleans...... we will come back!!!

Reviews.Author: Shelby C.
Reviews.Content: Food was delicious! Best Po Boy ever! Had the Oyster Rockafeller soup...which was very good...but a tad salty.  Would have given this place another star....but the waitress was a little surly..and not so nice.  Oh....and the Bloody Marys rock here!

Reviews.Author: Allison Z.
Reviews.Content: Thank you yelp! Another good recommendation. We sat at the oyster bar and watched them shuck our oysters faster than you can say oyster. They were super fresh and super delish. The combo po-boy was amazingggg. I just wish I hadn't filled up on the hotel's continental breakfast first! I will note that we were in New Orleans for three days, and we kept passing by super long lines at Acme (probably because of the number of conventions in town last week--there were apparently 2 in our hotel alone). We decided to go 10 minutes before their opening at 11, and it worked like a charm.  We were seated instantly after their opening, and when we walked out 20 minutes later (did I mention they're fast?), the line was back to it's regular length, so we counted ourselves lucky,

Reviews.Author: Angel G.
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing. Started off with the oysters and I almost melted into a puddle of goo because of how good they were. Might have been the best oysters I've had in my life. Get the Craw Puppies! They are really good too. Finished my meal off with a Peace Maker. I will definitely be going back next time I'm in New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: Anush J.
Reviews.Content: Was not the biggest fan of slimy oysters... until i went to the Acme Oyster House! There are all kinds of toppings on all kinds of oysters. Went back after 5 years and loved it. Ordered the chargrilled oysters, the fried peacemaker poboy - with fried oysters and shrimp and Tabasco mayo! - and had a New Orleans bread pudding to top it off. Fantastic stuff!!

Reviews.Author: Dana P.
Reviews.Content: Read about the ACME Oyster house in the Delta magazine on the way to New Orleans. My boyfriend loves raw oysters so we had to go. What a great experience. We sat at the bar and the bartender was super funny and attentive and had great recommendations. We went for the raw and chargrilled. The chargrilled were to die for! So good!!! The manager came over and started talking to us and recommended some great places to go. The 2 guys helped make the place and New Orleans experince exceed all expectations.

Reviews.Author: Ed W.
Reviews.Content: The chargrilled oysters were okay, but not great.  The soft-shell crab platter was okay, but not great.  For a place that's tourist-centric, the overall ambience wasn't bad at all.  Don't expect much from this place, but if you want to sit at the bar and wash back some average Louisiana seafood with a good beer, you could do a lot worse.

Reviews.Author: Mani N.
Reviews.Content: This place topped off my vacation they have the best crawfish hush puppies,gumbo, and their oysters is da bomb! . I will come back to this place again when i visit New Orleans.

Reviews.Author: andy c.
Reviews.Content: so the line for ACME goes down the street past the alley most of the time.  They won't seat your party until you're all there.  but aside from their quirks, the oysters they serve here are second to none in n'awlins.  their shuckers are amazing and the oysters come so clean to your table.  i've had oysters at a few places and this by far stands head and shoulders above those elsewhere.  our party also ordered the chargrilled oysters and boo fries ((the new orleans version of fries with cheese and gravy)

Reviews.Author: Matthew W.
Reviews.Content: Yeah, it's a chain, but it still has good seafood.  We ordered a deep fried seafood plate, which had Catfish, oysters, sweet potato fries, and hushpuppies, all of which were fresh, and very good.  We also ordered shrimp etouffee, which was very tasty.  In terms of a seafood place, their prices were reasonable, especially when compared to other areas of the country such as SF, Seattle, etc.Tip: you'll probably have to wait outside in line, but ask the people at the front of the line how long they've been waiting to get an idea.  We only waited about 20-30 minutes on a Saturday evening.

Reviews.Author: Bill S.
Reviews.Content: THE BEST!    When I lived in New Orleans I would also take my visitors here.    Just thinking about visiting again is making me want to book my flight now.

Reviews.Author: C.M. C.
Reviews.Content: Delicious oysters.

Reviews.Author: jay h.
Reviews.Content: 3rd best oyster we had a over the weekend.  Absolutely nothing wrong with these.  Had the fries with cheese and gravy and my wife had red beans.  On the better end of good.  Chargrilled oyster-must have.  I have to knock it for the wait, which can get lengthy at random times of the day.  Good spot.

Reviews.Author: Victoria G.
Reviews.Content: We've had better oysters in Atlanta but the po boy still gets 4/5 from us. Overall, this place is standard fair with standard pricing in a city with plenty of outstanding food.

Reviews.Author: Clark F.
Reviews.Content: I had my first oyster here and I loved it. The hush puppies were unreal. The prices were great and the atmosphere was very fun.

Reviews.Author: Jean S.
Reviews.Content: We had a great time, sat at the bar, had fun talking to the oyster shucker and waitstaff, who were all really nice.  Got 2 dozen on the half shell and half a dozen butter garlic.  None of it sucked.  They do have to seriously dust the top of the mirror behind the bar though, we shouldn't be able to see the dust balls, it's a really tall mirror!

Reviews.Author: A W.
Reviews.Content: Getting to the point: Acme is cool. They definitely cater to tourists but the food is not as earth shattering as ppl make it sound.I never eat oysters (too slimey) but my waiter made a deal; if we hated them (and had more than half left) he'd take them back...They werent AH-MAZING...but less squishy than I'm used to AND the butter+cheese they put on it covered the usual dull flavor so we kept and enjoyed!However, that was the best thing we had.My girlfriend ordered the sampler wtih red beans, jambalya + gumbo. The beans needed seasoning, the jambalya was mushy and the gumbo...my 1st words "My dad's is better."I had the fried shrimp + catfish. Usually cant wrong wrong with this so it was satisfying. (Though the catfish @ Pat O Brien's is half the price @ $8 and a whoooooole lot better!) Good enough to stop by, see and check off your list!

Reviews.Author: Larry F.
Reviews.Content: This place isn't bad. Oysters are oysters. They have charbroiled oysters which were pretty good. Sorry folks, not much to say about this place except Adam Richman (Man Vs. Food) was here and did 100+ fresh oysters! I did get the fried crab claws which was pretty good.

Reviews.Author: Sang H.
Reviews.Content: During my 5 day trip in New Orleans, I went to almost all the near by restaurants for their oyster. Acme beats these restaurants by miles. They had the most plump oysters out of all the other restaurants, with better prices. The crawfish were deliciously spiced and chefs were amazing people to talk to.

Reviews.Author: Adrianna P.
Reviews.Content: My oysters were delicious until I looked over at the oyster bar and saw the "shucker" cleaning under his fingernails with his shucking knife. EW. Haven't been back since.

Reviews.Author: Lesley H.
Reviews.Content: It's ok.  We both had shrimp - platter and poboy - and it was alright.  They only serve Diet Pepsi - so that sucks.

Reviews.Author: jacko l.
Reviews.Content: Oysters 3 - dirty ass shells. They don't scrub them like we do in the west. Also I like east coast, colder water oysters better. They were fresh thoSeafood po boy 4 - tasty, nicely fried oystersSample dish 4 - all goodPecan cobbler 4 - not a fan of pecan dessert but if u like sugary desserts this is it

Reviews.Author: Steve G.
Reviews.Content: If you come here during meal times, especially on a busy weekend, be prepared to wait. But, if you must wait, then reward yourself with the char-grilled oysters, which are off the hook. If you look behind the bar to where the guys are shucking, you will notice that they set the really big oysters aside. Those are the ones that get char-grilled, because they shrink so much under the heat. They are the tastiest thing on the menu, and you have to get them if you never have. The rest of the food is pretty adequate New Orleans fare. Nothing surprising, and nothing that you can't get better somewhere else.

Reviews.Author: Carly C.
Reviews.Content: I have lived in NOLA for 2 1/2 years and have heard all the rants and raves about Acme Oyster House. I have walked by and seen the line that stretches to Bourbon Street on a number of occasions. We went to Acme with some friends visiting from out of town at their request.  This place is nothing special. You can get chargrilled or raw oysters and Po- boys at a number of other places in the city without waiting in the line and feeling rushed the entire time. The server basically made every gesture other than tap his pencil on the table in order to tell us to hurry up and order. Save yourself some time and go elsewhere, this is not all it's caracked up to be.

Reviews.Author: William C.
Reviews.Content: Got seated at the oyster shucking bar after waiting in line.  Looked over the menu and waited, and waited, and waited some more.  When one of the Oyster shuckers finally asked me if I would like to order, he yelled back to a woman at a register who got this extremely confused/constipated look on her face.  She yelled back at him and thus began a debate over what I ordered.  (I ordered the Jambalaya)  They then became more concerned about the hurricane the guy next to me ordered.  I got up and left.  Don't know if I will go back.

Reviews.Author: L C.
Reviews.Content: We waited in line for about 45 minutes in the rain/mist. It was worth the wait for the experience! We got a seat at the bar, prime real estate as another reviewer stated. The shucker was very nice. We ordered 1 dozen each raw and cooked oysters plus a peace maker po boy for 2 women. The shucker offered us a GIANT oyster, but sadly we had to decline since we had way too much food as it was. Very nice people and great oysters.

Reviews.Author: Joe R.
Reviews.Content: Great place in the French Quarter for oysters and other great seafood. They will make you wait to get in which builds the anticipation in this casual Nola institution. Drinks could be stiffer but the oysters make up for it.

Reviews.Author: Michael B.
Reviews.Content: Very friendly service, good tasty carb heavy authentic Cajun bar food. Excellent mains and grilled oysters. The only disappointment was the pecan cobbler.

Reviews.Author: Melissa M.
Reviews.Content: Yum! Friendly staff! Great food! The Chicken and Andouille sausage gumbo was excellent! It had a nice smokey flavor. Boo fries, beef gravy and cheddar topped fries...need I say more? Acme special po-boy was delish too! I locals were right! Good stuff!

Reviews.Author: Rachel S.
Reviews.Content: We had the New Orleans sampler.  Jambalaya, red beans and rice, andouille, and gumbo.  Not enough flavor and everything was dry except for the gumbo.  I don't use much Tabasco sauce but the beans needed it. The server was nice, she brought me a raw oyster for the price of a shooter. That was my first oyster ever and it was good and very large.  If you do go get the oysters or the fried food, the fried dishes other people were having looked good. We also tried the banana foster pie, it's a light and creamy cheesecake-good stuff.

Reviews.Author: g p.
Reviews.Content: Huge line at this place so go early!  Fresh oysters had good flavor and not fishy at all.  Their chargrilled oysters was AWESOME!  I found myself sopping up the tasty sauce with pieces of bread.  Crowded and loud but good fun atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Susan C.
Reviews.Content: The chargrilled oysters will change your life.  Seriously.

Reviews.Author: Will And Megan M.
Reviews.Content: Sooo good OMG. If I were to die tomorrow. I'd have my last meal from this place.

Reviews.Author: Kuong Y.
Reviews.Content: I would never look at oysters the same again. There is no wrong way  to have it here. Grilled, raw, etc, just do it. The line is something that will scare you, but good things are worth  waiting for.....NO GREAT things are worth waiting for. This includes the 10 napkin po boy, and of course, the OYSTER po boy

Reviews.Author: Thomas L.
Reviews.Content: Great Oysters, Decent Service. Strangely time sides.  Rude hostess. My wife and I came here on a Tuesday afternoon for lunch on our last day in NOLA.  We had noticed a long line on the weekends but with the history of this place, we wanted to make it by for at least one meal.    There were a few people waiting outside so we looked at a menu that was being shared outside with others..  We were greeted by the hostess shortly after that and while my wife was trying the put menu back away in its stored place, the hostess jerked the menu out of my wife's hand and forcefully and recklessly put it back in its place, hitting my wife with it a little bit in the process.   We got 1/2 dozen charbroiled  oysters which were fantastic.  We also ordered some red beans and rice which came out quite a few minutes before the rest of our order. The red beans and rice was very mild and really didn't have anything about it to set it apart.   For the main dish we split the Fried Peace Maker Po-Boy. This lived up to its #4 ranking.  The tabasco infused mayo was a nice complement for the seafood on the sandwich.  It was definitely one of the highlights of our meal.    We would have loved to try some dessert but we were too full.A good meal which could have been even greater without the rudeness from the hostess.

Reviews.Author: Helena H.
Reviews.Content: Words can't even describe how amazing the oysters were here. Everyone talks about the chargrilled oysters so my friend and I decided to give them a try. We went around 1130am because we had heard the line for a table is normally out the door and we got there just in time. At noon there were close to 30 people waiting to get in. We sat at the bar and ordered a 1/2 dozen of the chargrilled oysters to try. Neither of us are huge oyster fans but we knew we had to give them a try. Along with the oysters, I ordered the soup of the day which was crab and corn chowder while my friend ordered the oysters Rockefeller soup. Both soups were fantastic but the oysters...my god. They arrived and you could immediately smell the butter, cheese, and herbs on them. They are grilled and then covered in butter, herbs, a little oil, and Romano cheese. The oysters are served with lemon and chunks of bread soaking in the butter sauce. After ordering a 1/2 dozen, we immediately ordered another dozen and ate every single one. The server recommended putting some smoked pepper Tabasco on them and that was great too. Definitely recommend this place, just be prepared to wait in line.

Reviews.Author: A H.
Reviews.Content: The chargrilled oysters led to me coming back here TWICE in my trip. They were buttery, garlicy, and delicious. The jambalaya was also very good. Beware the extremely long lines. It can extend to down the block.

Reviews.Author: Zoe T.
Reviews.Content: Best chargrilled oysters in all of New Orleans hands down.

Reviews.Author: Sue J.
Reviews.Content: If I can I would give them  minus 5 starts. Don't really understand what the buzz is about. The place is way out of touch, no class what so ever. We didn't plan on going to that place but the cab driver  who bring us from airport highly recommended them. let me start from waiting in line for about an hour, just to be seated. Hostess would come out and invite next in line and preference is of course a party of 4 or more. Again I would understand, 4-6 people would order more and tip more, but it's frustrating to see all those people behind you in line going in first. When finally we've been invited inside, that hostess didn't really care if we follow her to our table, already made you feel like you are NOT welcome in this place. After we've been sited  waitress came and when we ask what she would suggest she really said " I don't know" Next even worst, my husband ordered some fried shrimps and oysters, what waitress bring to us not only looks also taste disgusting ( no presentation on plate , shrimps were not fresh ) that waitress came to us once and ask if everything OK, when hear us say NO, she wasn't prepare to do anything about it. After all we left all food on our plates and she bring us bill for $77 total. Compare restaurant Criollo at hotel Monteleone cost us $160 with drinks. Never ever if I'm in NOLA again will I try ACME, also wouldn't recommend this place to any of my friends. Of course we didn't expect that shrimps would smell like dirty restroom...... Uhhhhhhhh...

Reviews.Author: Tamara F.
Reviews.Content: Who can go to fat city and not be drawn in by the smell of those chargrilled oysters. I start shopping at Lakeside mall and before I know it, I am trying to get in.  That being said, they have the best in town, hands down. My only issue is that when I leave, I always feel left with the feeling that I wish I had just gone for the oysters and left. The rest of the menu is kind of crappy. They have some pasta and I usually get the steamed lobster, but after the oysters, everything else is kind of a let down.  How can something be so good and so bad at the same time. I wish that guy Tommy who owns it would wow us with a better menu. I want the oysters and then I never really am happy with the entree... I still can't bring myself to just order 3 or 4 dozen oysters and that's all... maybe I should. Oh, and drinks are a little expensive. The waitress asked if we wanted singles or doubles..... I chose the double twice and realized that each one was 15.00 on my bill... OUCH...

Reviews.Author: Karen B.
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment.  We wanted to see if this restaurant lived up to the hype, and we felt it fell short.  The service was pretty good, not a long wait and we got a good table.  The fresh oysters and grilled oyster were great, but the fried oysters and shrimp were overcooked, and definitely over salted.  The oil was old, and the shrimp and oysters were unevenly cooked.  Did I mention the salt?

Reviews.Author: Sabrina H.
Reviews.Content: The charbroiled oysters were fantastic, the medley dish was delicious (with rice and beans, jambalaya, and gumbo.  The soft-shell crab po-boy was good, but the oysters stole the show.  There's always a line out the door, but then once you walk in there are lots of tables open.  I wonder if that's their way of pacing the kitchen, or a ploy to make them look like they're incredibly popular?

Reviews.Author: A A.
Reviews.Content: After a 20 year absence, my husband and I returned to Acme.  20 years ago, I enjoyed the rogue-like personalities of the men behind the bar and how they interacted with the patron, namely me--7 mos pregnant and having oysters with milk--I was the brunt of quite a few jokes.  We waited in line for 30 min to get a place at the bar.  Got the oysters and this time with an Abita beer.  The men behind the bar--more interested in the women with the Hustler shopping bags.  Took them awhile to acknowledge our existence.  Now the oysters--watched these beautiful LARGE oysters being opened but they were separated from the ones placed on the platters served.  I guess their used for the grilled oysters or poboys.  I would have gladly paid more money to try them.  Nevertheless, it was somewhat disappointing.  The oysters were good but Luke's were bigger, tastier.  I would still recommend this place because it is a NOLA institution.

Reviews.Author: JoVina H.
Reviews.Content: 6/20/09 Lunch trip. Long line, we waited for about 30 minutes for a party of 4. I'm not the oyster fan but this was our goal for the day for the brthday girl in our group.  It was hot outside waiting but once we got in it was all worth it.We started with a  1/2 doz raw oysters and the BooFries. (french fries covered with cheese and a roast beef gravy)  I loved both.  I had only tried raw oysters once and it was a bad experience but my friends convinced me to try it again and I was very happy.  We also had a little gumbo, a softshell crab po boy, a 1/2 doz of the charbroiled oysters and a peacemaker po boy (half fried shrimp and half fried oyster).  All of the food was delicious.  It was very noisy and crowded but what can you expect on a Saturday afternoon at the peak lunch hour?  Overall I would recommend this place to anyone "afraid" of the raw oyster experience.  I'll come back but it wil be between peak feeding times. :)

Reviews.Author: Gina W.
Reviews.Content: Wow.  Even if you don't like oysters, you've got to try the char grilled oysters. Amazing.

Reviews.Author: M D.
Reviews.Content: You may have to wait outside on the street for awhile when busy so arrive early if you can.  One way to get seated faster is to be a single or party of two and ask to sit at oyster bar. I like to stop here for oysters before heading to dinner at the steak house next door.  There are no varieties of oysters - all the same and on the large side. But they are very good and consistent. A dozen raw are about $11 which is steel!   It can get noisy but hey, it's an oyster bar. I'd return.

Reviews.Author: Ooh Lal A.
Reviews.Content: We heard this restaurant from our Hotel Concierge. Since it was highly recommended, we decided to check it out for dinner before hitting Bourbon St. We ordered Abita local brew (Amber & Turbodog). They served the brews in a small Solo clear cup fr $3.75. Disappointed! Then my boyfriend ordered a bowl of Seafood Gumbo (shrimp & crab rice) $6.99. Very disappointed! The bowl was really a cup! I ordered the Fried Peace Maker po boy (golden fried oysters & shrimp seasoned to perfection with Tabasco infused mayo) for $10.99. It was okay! Our first visit to this place, it was a disappointment because we've already checked out local Seafood restaurants in the area that were much better for your buck!  Our second visit was at the airport, we were waiting for our flight home to Southern California. We decided to eat lunch at the ACME airport location since all the other food restaurants were closed. We tried $4 seven hush puppies and a dozen oysters (6 char-grilled & 6 raw oysters). WICKEDLY expensive! but that's expected at the airport. Not worth it!

Reviews.Author: Sean T.
Reviews.Content: This is the kind of food we came to New Orleans for.We arrived at the oyster bar a couple minutes after opening within 10 minutes the place was completely full.Everything we tried was great.The grilled oysters reminded me of escargot - little chunk of meat smothered in butter and garlic served on a sourdough round.I got the medley - which was Jambalaya (very good), red beans and rice (I have to admit I prefer the Jamaican version), gumbo (I had the seafood) and smoked sausage.  All good - but required Tabasco sauce.My wife had the smoked sausage po' boy and gumbo special.  She was pleased (and that's saying a lot).

Reviews.Author: T-Squared S.
Reviews.Content: Short wait to get in.Funky decor, with loud music ... French Quarter atmosphere (nice).Food good.  Oysters cooked in the half shell on the grill looked good, but we didn't discover them until after we ate.Catfish good. Gumbo good.Sides expensive - ~$5/ each (for fries which were average!) and for a handful of hush puppies.

Reviews.Author: Jessey Q.
Reviews.Content: Raw oysters n the oyster po boy!! none of the other places even compare.

Reviews.Author: Annie B.
Reviews.Content: Returned to Acme in June.  We had the chargrilled oysters and loaded up on Abita's.  I'm now officially a fan...  Those chargrilled oysters are so freakin' good!

Reviews.Author: Joe C.
Reviews.Content: Saw man v. Food and decided to give this place a shot. Oysters were fresh and delicious. We ordered seafood jumbo and the fried seafood platter for lunch. The plate was filled with crisp clean tasting catfish, loads of fried shrimp and fried oysters. I don't know about nola but in Dallas, you get only a few pieces of shrimp and oysters....we're talking about you pappadeaux's! The service was great with friendly wait staff abound. Great food,  good prices, and friendly staff...it's a winner.

Reviews.Author: Oldair D.
Reviews.Content: A place that has been around for 100 years must be doing something right...do not be put off by the long lines outside...the food is well worth any wait!  We went back to Acme 2 times in 3 days...the food, the service and the staff are great.  I'd highly recommend the chargrilled oysters, the raw oysters (of course), the Boo Fries, and the New Orleans Medley with chicken.

Reviews.Author: Patricia C.
Reviews.Content: 2nd trip here & they're still terrific! Sadly though, not serving LA oysters (Texas instead). They're delish, but it's sad (Shame on you BP!) Excellent Po Boy named "The Peace Maker" half oyster, half shrimp, & of course, the kick ass bread they use for Po Boys in this city. Yumscilly! We ate 3 dozen raw, a dozen char grilled (soooo wrong & tasty!) & split the Peace Maker, between just the two of us. Definitely a spot to visit while you're here

Reviews.Author: Erica R.
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Acme Oyster House and it was as good as the first visit. I started with the half dozen oysters - which were gone in two minutes. I think had the 1/2 shrimp and 1/2 catfish platter, with sweet potato fries. The shrimp were definitely my favorite part - it had to do with the breading I think. the Catfish lacked the same flavor and was just OK. The sweet potato fries were very good. I would go back for a third trip on another visit.

Reviews.Author: Keith G.
Reviews.Content: My wife and two kids had a great meal here. I don't really like the random sitting with people I don't know but that was the only draw back. The chargrilled oysters are a thing of beauty, I could eat a hundred of them. The Po Boys are great also.

Reviews.Author: Eric M.
Reviews.Content: Their charbroiled oysters are awesome. Service was great.

Reviews.Author: Timmy T.
Reviews.Content: Worth visiting if you're drunk and in the Quarter, but we tried fried oysters at about 5 different places in NOLA and this came out on the bottom. This isn't to say food was bad, it just isn't as good as other places and comes off as touristy. The fried oyster and shrimp poboy was good and a good portion but very overpriced. My partner also didn't like that they don't de-vein the shrimp. Their char grilled oysters were good but much smaller sized than other restaurants. While it was delicious, their recipe and the quality of the oysters don't really stand up to Drago's. The wait to get in was about an hour, but the waitstaff was really nice. My biggest complaint is their bathroom: it's really small and filthy and smells horrible. I always wonder what a kitchen looks like when a bathroom is that bad.

Reviews.Author: Bart E.
Reviews.Content: Acme is the quintessential New Orleans seafood and po-boy spot but i go there for the Peace Maker, a po-boy hybrid with fried oysters and shrimp. Order it with a side of hush puppies and an abita amber.  perfect meal.

Reviews.Author: linda a.
Reviews.Content: You HAVE TO go here if you are from out-of-town. They have a web-cam. But they also have more-than-decent po-boys & oysters on the half-shell. MAKE HASTE!

Reviews.Author: Kim S.
Reviews.Content: Went twice during my one week stay in New Orleans.  The first time, definitively a 5 star - the fresh oysters were HUGE and tasted absolutely amazing (in spite of the size!) - price was so reasonable too at about $13 a dozen. The second time -4 stars- oysters were much smaller and not as tasty.  Also tried hald a dozen of the highly recommended chargrilled oysters ($11) and much prefer the raw ones... the shrimp po boys sandwich was not as crispy or as good as Johny's Po Boys. Expect to wait in line but it moves quickly if you go past 1ish.

Reviews.Author: Will T.
Reviews.Content: 1lb. of Boiled Crawfish and a Master Shucker dealing up some classic NOLA Oysters.  What a treat...'spensive though.

Reviews.Author: shanu v.
Reviews.Content: Honestly...I'm not a big seafood fan at all, but I knew I had to try this place while I was in NO, and it was great.  The wait gets insane at prime lunch & dinner time, so try coming at an off-time like 4pm (we did and our party of 18 got in within 10mins).The chargrilled oysters were VERY good.  They weren't fishy tasting at all, and actually quite meaty tasting.The Peacemaker sandwich (supposedly rated #4 sandwich in the country) was OK...not great.  The fried shrimp was very very good,  but I wasn't a fan of the fried oysters.Boo fries (basically disco fries) were OK, nothing specialJambalaya was OK, and tiny tiny in portion size.I would definitely come back for the chargrilled oysters

Reviews.Author: Cynthia A.
Reviews.Content: Went back to Acme this weekend.  I have to shoot my rating up to a five star because the chargrilled oysters were better than I remember.  And it's not even oyster season.  I was with a fisherman and he said he could taste that they weren't frozen from the season, but were picked fresh.  This still might be my favorite dish ever.  Yum!

Reviews.Author: John M.
Reviews.Content: My first experience with the Char grilled oysters.  I thought they were better than Dragos.  Location was good.  There was luckily no line.  Also my first time having Abita.  I also had the shrimp po boy.  Pretty good.  Lots of bread, but it was very fun and delicious.

Reviews.Author: Diane R.
Reviews.Content: Always a winner. Yes, the long line can be intimidating. But you go to the bar, order a bloody mary to go -- mmmm! -- and the line becomes much more tolerable. The oysters, po boys and red beans and rice are all top notch.

Reviews.Author: David B.
Reviews.Content: Wow what a disappointment.Had a bowl of Gumbo.  The gumbo had no taste and was the smallest, shallowest bowl in creation.It was a complete rip off.    Tasteless food and overpriced.

Reviews.Author: Sandra S.
Reviews.Content: Oh MY!!!  That's what I have to say about their Chargrilled Oysters.  A lil' bit of heaven on a plate.  Never in my life have I had anything like this and 2 out of 3 days we were in NOLA we had them 'cause we couldn't resist.  Everything we ordered there was delish.

Reviews.Author: Ayla D.
Reviews.Content: No no no no! The line for this place is always out of the door, so we thought - yeah this will be awesome. Let me tell you, it is not. Service is the worst I have ever received, there's an auto 18% gratuity that is NOT WORTH IT and a little insulting considering we got no refills and she never came back to take entree orders - just gave us appetizers and forgot about us. We ended up just leaving and going to spend our money somewhere else for the rest of dinner.Service aside, the oysters are not that great. They're grainy and clearly not very fresh. Also really tiny - the smallest I saw the entire trip to NOLA. The chargrilled are better than the raw, but still tiny and super grainy. The cheese is great and the flavor is spot on, but they don't give you enough bread and no sauce so you have to hope you got some with the raw. Over all the food isn't awesome, the service is deplorable, and the line isn't worth it. Go to Felix's across the street. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Author: Sean B.
Reviews.Content: Better than Felix's but I can't believe people wait in line to eat here!  The food was OK but nothing really special.  The staff seems grouchy and disinterested.  There was not a line when we arrived midday on a Sunday but they asked us to go outside and wait anyway, a minute latter they showed us to our table. They got our order wrong and had the gall to add 18 percent to the bill!  Yes, there were 6 of us but the service was 10 percent tops. I  would not go back nor recommend Acme to friends.

Reviews.Author: Amin G.
Reviews.Content: Oh man...I absolutely love oysters on the shell!Visited this place by myself because I had heard so much about it. Had only the oysters and they were great! Tasted super fresh and the shucker did a great job cleaning them. Only thing preventing from giving it five stars were the size of the oysters. Kind of on the small side, but it might have been the time of the year I had gone.

Reviews.Author: Grant R.
Reviews.Content: I will always include this on any future visit to the French Quarter.

Reviews.Author: Susan B.
Reviews.Content: Char-grilled Oysters are AMAZING! Fried oysters are outstanding! Red beans and rice is a tasty dish. If I ever have another chance to dine at Acme Oyster House, I would definitely have Char-grilled Oysters followed immediately by the Pecan Cobbler, one of the best 3 desserts I've ever eaten!

Reviews.Author: Krystil A.
Reviews.Content: Boo fries, sweet potato fries and a seafood platter. YES indeed! The service is always tops and the margaritas are pretty good too. I usually go to the place on Vets but every now and then you've gotta be a tourist in your own city and enjoy the quarter. If I remember right they have a live cam that rolls on nola.com.

Reviews.Author: Chris G.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place--can't wait to go back.  Naturally, I had the raw oysters and then went for a shrimp po'boy.

Reviews.Author: Kate C.
Reviews.Content: Defiantly come here for the oysters!  The wait time can be long, especially at lunch time so try to swing by during the off-hours.  There other food is pretty good too, but usually end up feasting on oysters when I come here.

Reviews.Author: Rebekah M.
Reviews.Content: The chargrilled oysters were absolutely amazing. I'll be dreaming about them for months. The service was great and the environment was very comfortable and welcoming.

Reviews.Author: Will V.
Reviews.Content: Three words char grilled oysters.(or is it two) One of the best things I have eaten, while the wait was long it is reassurance that your oysters will be the freshest!

Reviews.Author: Courtney M.
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. Worth line. Get the chargrilled oysters.

Reviews.Author: Pamela S.
Reviews.Content: YUMMY!!! Had the chargrilled Oysters & bread pudding w/ whiskey sauce and they were soooo good. If the line outside is long and you don't mind eating at the bar let the hostess out front know & you won't have to wait as long.  The bartenders and staff are also very nice & since they are locals will tell you what you should definitely eat off of the menu.

Reviews.Author: Andrea W.
Reviews.Content: We ate here during French Quarter Festival-and eating at Acme is a long anticipated yearly treat. We could not believe how everything had deteriorated. The raw oysters were small and tasted pasteurized. The chargrilled oysters were also small and padded with lots of breading and little butter.  The service was also terrible (it was moderately busy, but there was no line to get in). We could not even get beer refills, let alone crackers or bread.

Reviews.Author: Ann B.
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience that would have been better if they would have turned the air conditioning down.  It was on full blast!  The service was good, and we enjoyed the seafood gumbo, red beans and rice, and the oysters were amazing.  We will definitely come back!

Reviews.Author: Patrick M.
Reviews.Content: If you like fresh oysters, stop by. If you are looking for a po-boy, there are better places.

Reviews.Author: Erica F.
Reviews.Content: Loved this place!  Great food and great service!

Reviews.Author: Dawn G.
Reviews.Content: Bomb.com. The food is so good

Reviews.Author: Bonnie Prince C.
Reviews.Content: Ate here twice in four days. Grilled oysters, raw oysters, gumbo, stuffed crab, pecan cobbler (!)--all excellent. Perhaps the gumbo portion could have been a bit bigger; otherwise, no complaints at all. We ate at the bar both times. Wait staff knew what it was doing. Loved it.

Reviews.Author: Richie S.
Reviews.Content: Food good,  atmosphere was good, server was a little witchy. But they packed the people in every night!

Reviews.Author: Zette R.
Reviews.Content: incredible incredible! the chargrilled oysters...You haven't had oysters until you've tried these. Also their crawfish tail po boys WOAH witb.a bust of tobacco sauce i. each bite!! yum yum. plus great service

Reviews.Author: Jessica J.
Reviews.Content: I wasn't impressed. The service was really slow. The food was decent, but I wouldn't wait more than 10 minutes to eat there. Go across the street to Felix's.

Reviews.Author: Andre H.
Reviews.Content: Fried shrimp and oyster poboy is legit. And the chargrilled oysters are fantastic.

Reviews.Author: Don D.
