Reviews.Content: Chargrilled Oysters are to die for.........Our timing was perfect as we showed up with a line of about 20 people out the door. Host asked how many and with just 2 of us took us right in and we sat up at the bar. Within one minute of sitting I was drinking my first of several Abita's Amber. Of course had to have oysters. Ordered a round of 6 grilled and after the very first one ordered another order of 6. I'm telling you chargrilled with garlic butter and then topped grated cheese. I added a couple dousings of Tabasco Chipolte and it is an absolute must have. I'm telling you I could of just filled up on Chargrilled Oysters. AMAZING, YOU MUST TRY! We then had Chicken Andouille Gumbo, and Seafood platter. Had a few tarters with the shrimp. Oysters, and catfish. For me good tarter is a must if you are eating fried seafood. All was great but really the gumbo and seafood are just good when compared to how great Oysters were.  As we were leaving I noticed the line was at now at about 40 and I have to say that I would without question stand in that line again just for the chargrilled oysters. Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Nissan S.
Reviews.Content: half n half platter is a great deal. almost everything here is fried. hush puppies were delicious.  charbroiled oysters were oily. service was ok. very close walk to the Sheraton and Marriott.

Reviews.Author: A A.
Reviews.Content: Yep.. tourist trap. We ate here over the weekend, and let me tell ya, not that great. There were crunchy pieces of shell in every bite of our char grilled oysters. I know you're thinking.. they are on a shell.. but we ate at 9 other oyster bars in 4 days, and only one other place had this problem. The line was ridiculous, and the place was over priced for the tiny oysters we got, and the cramped seating we experienced. Do yourself a favor.. go to Dragos. Delicious.

Reviews.Author: Steve H.
Reviews.Content: Long line is worth the wait, the chargrilled oysters and boo fries are a must...

Reviews.Author: Katie F.
Reviews.Content: First time ever eating oysters and i'm pretty sure this was the way to do it! These were pretty delicious! grilled and smother in butter and lemon. staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Author: Brett W.
Reviews.Content: wakako u and I took a break from our "chronicle top 100" odyssey and headed to the big easy for jazzfest! we vowed to squeeze in as much good southern eatin' as possible; acme was our first stop. wasn't sure about this place at first as it was full of tourists. but wow! delicious succulent raw oysters; big ones that don't look like much but deliver. the char-broiled oysters were even better. and the crawfish--oh, the crawfish-- are to be savored by the pound. gloriously messy, spicy and finger-lickin' yum. there's an acme in the airport too if you can't wait to get to the french quarter or if you're craving one last taste before returning to the decidedly less flavorful reality that is the world outside new orleans.

Reviews.Author: Dim S.
Reviews.Content: Killer oysters and Po Boys!  Servers were friendly and atmosphere was great.  It wouldve been nice if they served their draft beer in glasses instead of plastic cups.

Reviews.Author: David J.
Reviews.Content: had to go by here since it was on TV and stuff and wow.. I dont even like oysters and it was good.  had the combo where I got jambalaya, beans, and gumbo... maybe its because i'm from CA but this stuff was the best I've ever had and you have to get the fried crab claws... delicious !!!  I can't wait to go here again... it was just helllllla  good

Reviews.Author: Jeff S.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the first place to eat when you get here, since you don't want to risk the chance of missing it.   Definitely get the fried stuff:  my wife, who is not a seafood eater, even enjoyed the catfish.   (She had the sampler, and everything on that was good too)

Reviews.Author: Oanh N.
Reviews.Content: visit date, 3/17 and 3/19 - Everything was excellent!  The grilled oysters  and fresh oysters were to die for!  The poboy sandwiches were excellent and so were the gumbos.

Reviews.Author: Char P.
Reviews.Content: I am so sad to have to give Acme such a bad review but after waitng three years to return for their char-grilled oysters...I was sorely disappointed.  When we came three years ago, we were told by a native on our flight to not pass up Acme's char-grilled oysters.  So even tho I'm not a fan of oysters we made sure to not leave NoLa without stopping at Acme.  When we went we ordered half a dozen of the char-grilled oysters and they blew me out of the water.  We immediately ordered a dozen.  And then returned three times that trip for more.  I came back from that trip 12lbs heavier and I know it was from those oysters.  So we have been looking forward to returning to NoLa...especially for those oysters.  Three years our mouths have been watering.  We stood first in line at 10:40 am...waiting patiently for the doors to open.  Ordered my dozen and to my surprise there were only two good sized oysters out of the twelve.  The other ten oysters were no bigger than a lima bean and everything was over cooked and completely baked to the shells.  It was such an unappitizing ordeal I refuse to go back.  Especially since they have raised the prices and lowered the quality of the food.

Reviews.Author: Roger W.
Reviews.Content: the chargrilled oyster was delicious.the jambalaya was also good enough.

Reviews.Author: Maria C.
Reviews.Content: What a delicious dinner!!!  The Chargrilled Oysters were so tasty, as was the Oysters Rockefeller Soup!  Mmm mmmm mmmm!  The service was fast, though I'm told there is often a wait line outside.  My companion ordered the fried crawfish po-boy which paled in comparison to the oyster dishes, but hey- it's an OYSTER house, so it's not surprising that's what they do best.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: lars h.
Reviews.Content: Quick and professionel service. It is a tourist restaurant with the "got to go the Acme" but we don't know why. Bland and standard fare.

Reviews.Author: Chris B.
Reviews.Content: i was convinced acme oyster house was a tourist trap, but i think i've got it figured out. to keep it non-touristy and cheap, roll in, sit at the bar, order a dozen oysters along with an oyster or soft shell crab po'boy and pitcher of abita strong for two. for some local insight, have a chat with the shuckers. you'll roll out the door full, buzzed and entertained for about $45 for two tip included. now hit the market for a couple double-12s (24 oz cans for the unfamiliar) of PBR or Bud and you'll be on your way to a memorable evening in the quarter.

Reviews.Author: Kathy N.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled oysters were soooooooo delicious! They were still sizzling when they got to our table, and I wish I had some to eat now... drool. However, the etouffee left a lot to be desired.  It's supposed to have crawfish, but came with shrimp instead (our waiter did warn us, but we ordered it because he still suggested it over the sampler).  It wasn't nearly as flavorful as my bf and I like, just tiny shrimp in a brown sauce that looked and smelled like etouffee.  Moral of the story: stick to what made Acme famous... oysters, and lots of them!

Reviews.Author: Alison B.
Reviews.Content: The "10 Napkin Roast Beef Sandwich" is also delicious.  And, as promised, requires 10 napkins.

Reviews.Author: Yolanda T.
Reviews.Content: This was the first place we hit upon arrival to new orleans.  Absolutely delicious.  We started with a dozen of the delicious chargrilled oysters spiked with a dash of hot sauce.  Then we shared a Fried Piece Maker Po-boy.  This sandwhich was the bomb.  The oysters and shrimp were both perfectly fried, light and crispy on the outside and succulent on the inside.  The bread was perfect as well, with a chewy center but a light crispy exterior.  Sooo good.  During the rest of our trip, we kept wanting to come back and try more of their menu but alas, there were just too many other places to eat.  But we will be back.

Reviews.Author: Jay J.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled oysters is hands down the best thing ive ever eaten.  po boys were excellent but could of used some extra filling.  Raw oysters are excellent and fresh.  Get there early as the line gets crazy and these guys do not take reservations

Reviews.Author: Ana M.
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to walk right in and sit at the bar. This place usually has a long line. The oysters were fresh and tasty. The po boy was good too.

Reviews.Author: Amy M.
Reviews.Content: Holy Moly, the Chargrilled Oysters are out of this world!!! We fell in love! Fresh and so tasty. The line is usually long but well worth the wait. Our waitress was very nice and checked on us often! We ordered the Oyster and Shrimp Po'Boys and the New Orleans Medley-a sampling of gumbo, sausage, jambalaya, red beans & rice. Everything was tasty but I still dream of the chargrilled oysters! This is a must stop for anyone visiting NOLA!!!

Reviews.Author: Kim M.
Reviews.Content: I had a dozen of oysters here. They were fresh but lack of taste in my opinion. They were very bland. I missed the smell and taste of the sea when eating them. The oysters were big - maybe a little too big. I am more a fan of the delicate oysters from the Normandy in France.

Reviews.Author: Katherine P.
Reviews.Content: outstanding!!! fresh delish oysters!!! margaritas were awesome!!! you can't go wrong here!!!!

Reviews.Author: Gina L.
Reviews.Content: Definately the best place for raw Oysters in the Quarter.  The shrimp poboys were not the best, but with an icy cold beer, there is not much to complain about.

Reviews.Author: Ana S.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I came to this place twice in three days during our little vacay in New Orleans. We sat at the bar the first time and at a table in the back the second, and I really recommend eating at the bar if you can. You get to see the oyster shuckers hard at work and they were some great company during dinner. We chatted with "Hollywood," the master shucker, and the guy gave us great recommendations for food and beer and really made us love the place. It was both of our first times trying oysters and we were hooked. The grilled oysters are phenomenal and I recommend them as a good introduction to oysters if you're a newbie like we were. Overall, the place was a great taste of New Orleans, the food was great and pretty cheap, and we'd go back there in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Author: Nick W.
Reviews.Content: Good, but a little overrated.  I don't think waiting in line is worth it, when there is equally great food all over the French Quarter.

Reviews.Author: Wayne C.
Reviews.Content: good food but there's always a long wait.  if tourist trap ambiance is what you are into then this is your place, but if you want seafood just as good but without the wait, go across street to felix's.

Reviews.Author: Victor L.
Reviews.Content: This is overrated.  The étouffée and gumbo we ordered were simply too salty and barely eatable. I had wanted to rank 1 but decided as 2 as the chargrilled oyster was flavorful (again a little salty) and the waiter was nice enough to take off one item off the bill. I don't think I will visit this place again.

Reviews.Author: katie t.
Reviews.Content: Went on a Friday night and waited in the line outside for 45 minutes for a party of 8.  Casual atmosphere with excellent service.  We had the catfish platter (my favorite out all the restaurants where we tried catfish), the batter had a little kick to it and the filet itself was thick and juicy. We also had the New Orleans Medley (jambalaya, gumbo, red beans and rice).  The gumbo, red beans and rice and the jambalaya were great.  Other entrees tried were softshell crab po-boy. The softshell crab and fries were fried to perfection. We loved everything... but the only disappointment of the meal was the size of the oysters on that day.  Don't get me wrong, the flavor and everything about the chargrilled and raw oysters were yummy.  Just wished they were a little bit bigger.  All in all, 9/10 for a great start to NOLA.

Reviews.Author: Jon S.
Reviews.Content: the day after Mardi Gras is the time to go.  we had a 5 minute wait for a party of 8.  most of them were first timers to NOLA and they wanted the establishment joint.  it didn't let us down.  the peacemaker was excellent and the chargrilled oysters are amazing.   abita turbo dog, amber, purple haze and strawberry harvest also gave the team an appropriate big easy introduction.   we're staying in the Quarter and can only walk so far, so Felix's is also on our list, but i was pleased with this stop at ACME.

Reviews.Author: Nicholas C.
Reviews.Content: awesome oyesters omg soo much good sause !

Reviews.Author: Harry Y.
Reviews.Content: Three and a half stars really. As another reviewer stated the oysters weren't great - no flavor. Maybe they were off because I came when they opened the flood gates and killed local oysters. The BBQ oysters were fantastic though - buttery garlicky goodness. Other fare average for NOLA which is to say very good.

Reviews.Author: David M.
Reviews.Content: Cool place in the French Quarter.  Definitely a place that is flooded with tourists (us included) but still serves pretty good food.  Had the "Peacemaker" po boy which was fried oysters and shrimp, which were good if a bit under-seasoned.  The produce was fresh and the spicy mayo gave it a nice kick (and I despise mayo with the passion of a thousand burning suns).  The bread was perfect.  The wife had roast beef which was tender but the gravy was a tad bland.  Had a side of fries which were distributor-to-fryer generic, but not awful.  Ordered 1/2 dozen oysters on the half shell to start off with.  They didn't come out until after the meal.  Our server (friendly) said the oyster bar was backed up.  You'd think after 100 years they'd have that figured out.  They were very good and had a nice, briny flavor.  A couple of them were a bit on the small side, though.It was a cool place to visit, but with so many other options for great food, I doubt we would endure the line again.

Reviews.Author: John B.
Reviews.Content: Ridiculously good oysters. I usually go with raw oysters but the Chargrilled Oysters were the true stars.

Reviews.Author: Stacey O.
Reviews.Content: this is my first stop when i land in new orleans, ALWAYS! I think i sometimes dream about the grilled oysters!!  The servers are always great and seriously these oysters are a must! Po boys are great too and today i had corn and crab chowder that was quite yummy. I am a fan! :-)

Reviews.Author: Sandra V.
Reviews.Content: We were in NOLA for 5 days and visited ACME twice!  We read how long the lines could be which we saw during the late afternoon into the evening.  We didn't wait in the line over the weekend.  However, we walked by early afternoon and noticed there was no line and were seated right away.  We ordered the char grilled oyster as well as the raw ones.  Both were delicious but I preferred the grilled ones.  Make sure you take the bread and dip it in the gooey yumminess that's left on the plate.  We ordered the jambalaya which is good enough for two although I would've ate the whole plate by myself!  It was that good!  On our second day we ordered the same thing but added a po' boy sandwich which we also split.  I'm happy we didn't have to wait on line the days we went but I believe it's worth the wait.  Especially if you're from out of town.  The staff was very nice both times and the atmosphere is laid back.  Go for it and enjoy!!

Reviews.Author: J.W. H.
Reviews.Content: Having eaten in many NO spots, when you want to have oysters and beer, this is the place. Fresh Louisiana oysters....cold beer. Doesn't get much better. Do not waste time waiting for a table unless you are part of a group, since sitting at the bar and chatting with bartenders and shuckers is the true way to experience this place.

Reviews.Author: roaches F.
Reviews.Content: This is ground zero in Nawlins for food.  Every trip to the Quarter starts at Acme.  You leave your hotel after dropping off your bags, stroll a block or two down Bourbon, then walk in and immediately slip a fiver into the hands of the first shucker you see and smile while asking for a 'special' dozen of his biggest and best, raw of course, grab a seat, ask the politely aloof wait-person for a big plate of red beans & rice w/Andouille and a cold longneck, and wait.  Pretty soon your own private shucker walks up and hands you a large platter of the biggest and freshest 2-biters you've ever laid eyes - it just does not get any better.  Then the same aloof wait-person who delivered your beer returns to put a hot plate of red and white down on the table in front of you as your eyes well up with tears of joy at the anticipation of what you are about to experience.  The vibe at Acme hasn't changed in the 30 years I've been going - same great smells, same funky stuff hanging on the walls, same rickety chairs and small, intimate tables, and great food at popular prices.  I love this place - but don't tell anyone, I'm so dadgum tired of waiting for a table every dang time I go to Nawlins.

Reviews.Author: Jack H.
Reviews.Content: Favorite oysters

Reviews.Author: B B.
Reviews.Content: Always love stopping at Acme when I'm in town. Sit at the bar and hopefully you'll be lucky enough to have Curtis be your bartender. If you need help ordering, he's the one to ask.  If you ask me, can't go wrong with the raw oysters and the New Orleans Medley (sampling of red beans n rice, gumbo, andouille and jambalaya). Try their bloody mary!

Reviews.Author: Molly T.
Reviews.Content: It's all about the charbroiled oysters with butter and cheese.  Brilliant.  Do not miss them!

Reviews.Author: Angela Y.
Reviews.Content: This place was fabulous. The grilled oysters were wonderful. Don't forgot to wipe off the juice/sauce with the french bread that comes with your order! The platter with fried shrimps and fish was just ok but the sauce did add a kick to the dish!! Seafood gumbo was great. I only wish I had a bigger stomach so I could finish a bowl.

Reviews.Author: Cherlyn W.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have eaten at Acme a number of times and the food is always consistently great.  All the waitstaff are excellent and seem happy to be here.  The oysters are consistently very high quality.  We usually order the fried shrimp and oysters and they are always cooked to perfection.  All the NOLA guidebooks direct travelers to Acme and they are right.  The only drawback is you sometimes have to wait a long time for a table, but if you have time, it's worth it.

Reviews.Author: Kevin O.
Reviews.Content: A New Orleans must!  Oysters are amazing and their Po Boy was the best I had in New Orleans.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Reviews.Author: Leslie S.
Reviews.Content: Yep you have to stand in line. It was totally worth it. We started with the grilled oysters and they were worth it. I had the sample plate and my hubby had the catfish. Great gumbo and delicious red beans and rice. The hush puppies were awesome. We also enjoyed sitting at the bar watching the employees shuck the oysters. I was impressed. The guy even did one behind his back. Great experience.

Reviews.Author: Chris M.
Reviews.Content: Oh ya this was by far the best dinner I had while I was in NOLA.  The chargrilled oysters are a must if you are here. All the sides and everything were yummy.  Definitely give it a try if you are in the French quarter, you just have too.

Reviews.Author: Zalie R.
Reviews.Content: The raw oysters were my favorite! Every one talks about the chargrilled oysters - those were ok - but the cocktail sauce for the raw oysters was amazing! Definitely not something you would find in a jar! Highly highly recommend!!  Bread Pudding at the end to top it off also pretty incredible!  And the bartender - really knows how to make an amazing cosmopolitan!  It surely wasn't red!  Awesome, Awesome, Awesome.  Don't worry about the line outside of the place, we only waited 20mins. - typical for any good restaurant that EVERYONE wants to eat at!  (The hostess was pretty rude to a couple of girls standing in line in front of us and I don't take to rude behavior too well!)  Thankfully, she wasn't rude to us.

Reviews.Author: Danielle L.
Reviews.Content: I love this place. I am traveling this New Orleans and whenever I asked about good sea food restaurants, people recommended this restaurant. I waited for a long time to enjoy my fried oysters and gump and it turned out worthy enough. I sat on the bar and talking with a oyster server was a fun. He gave me a raw oyster for tasting. It was really fresh and delicious. Well, I am mouth watering. Before I leave this city, I will go back to this restaurant and I know why this place is world famous.

Reviews.Author: Tadd B.
Reviews.Content: Just ate here and video taped a mouse next to our table.  Showed the manager who said "we're the cleanest restaurant in the French Quarter.  There's construction next to us so they come out about once a week."  He took our drinks off our bill.  The drinks?  Why not the food?  Mice don't care about the four draft beers we drank.  Thanks for the $14 off and the unknown disease I may have now.  And the food was way below expectation based on the fame of this tourist trap.

Reviews.Author: K P.
Reviews.Content: Get the charbroiled oysters! You will wait in a long line, the earlier you go the better. Worth the wait!!!

Reviews.Author: Jean-Paul D.
Reviews.Content: The food was good, flavorful and fresh. The staff was fun and friendly, the prices were reasonable. It's super loud, super busy,lots of commotion. I would definitely go back but only if there was no wait, I don't think it's worth waiting 45 mins in line for.

Reviews.Author: yasi j.
Reviews.Content: great for tourists. in fact, tourists please go here and stay away from our local places.

Reviews.Author: Andrea J.
Reviews.Content: Awesome! The chargrilled oysters were recommended my our great server and she knew what she was talking about. I usually only eat oysters on the half shell and was hesitant to order grilled ones, but they were incredible.  My sister, who does not really care for oysters, tried them and is now a fan.  Fun atmosphere, attentive service and fantastic food. The beans and rice are a must as well.

Reviews.Author: Andre C.
Reviews.Content: Excellent sensible priced local food. Recommended, very casual.

Reviews.Author: Rick W.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had lunch and was very suprised at the place.  It was crowded and had a line but we were able to get 2 seats @ the bar which was just fine.  The service was good and the food excellent.  I got the grilled oysters which were just like oysters rock without the spinach and they were great.  I also got the red beans & rice,  good also.  My wife got a Poor Boy w/crawfish and was great.

Reviews.Author: Laura N.
Reviews.Content: I will be the 100th person to say this on Yelp, but the char grilled oysters are amazing.  I went with a group here and was a little apprehensive due to lines of tourists and neon sign, but the place was fabulous.  Well priced food for the area and again- the char grilled oysters were delicious.  I had some the next day at different restaurant and they were not nearly soo good as at ACME.

Reviews.Author: Jodi H.
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Acme to taste some traditional dishes of New Orleans. I was very disappointed, the food was just adequate and the service was not the greatest. Our waitress was not very friendly and the place generally lacked a personality. The menu was hardly unique, and I think there are many other restaurants that have a better ambiance to try the New Orlean's dishes.

Reviews.Author: Norman P.
Reviews.Content: Good, inexpensive food in a fun atmosphere.  Not the fanciest or finest New Orleans food, but good for a crowd that wants good eats and cold beer.  Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Marissa T.
Reviews.Content: This place is so overrated. Every time I go I get more and more aggravated. Mostly because I know I am not going to like it and instead of changing my mind it is just reinforced by tasteless food and at least screw up on my order. It may not always be big, but its enough. I refuse to go back and when I am asked where it is, along with my directions I recommend Felix's across the street. Unless you just want to be able to say you went to Acme, I would go elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: jennie b.
Reviews.Content: Shrimp po boy

Reviews.Author: Lisa S.
Reviews.Content: the grilled oysters were the best meal i have had this week in new orleans. oyster shooters $1.50. it's a slam dunk!

Reviews.Author: Carlos A.
Reviews.Content: Chargrilled oysters r the best!

Reviews.Author: MJ Y.
Reviews.Content: Definitely a place to go back to!  We got there a little after 9:00 and there was only a short wait to be seated.  The service was great and the oysters terrific.  Our favorite was the raw ones, followed by the fried.

Reviews.Author: Dario C.
Reviews.Content: CHARGRILLED OYSTERS that's all you need to know, sit at the bar grab a dozen and then anything else on the menu to follow. The Bartender made us feel like we were in our neighborhood Resturant. Was so good we returned two days later

Reviews.Author: Victoria S.
Reviews.Content: RUDE...RUDE....there was no line outside at all..so we walked inside and was told very loudly that we had to wait in the line outside...we tried to explain that there was not a line outside....we were told there is a sign outside..you need to read it...needless to say we went across the street to Felix's where they were friendly, 3.00 less on a dozen oysters, and great food!

Reviews.Author: Boogie B.
Reviews.Content: This place is alright with me. Good Po Boys and tabasco sauce!

Reviews.Author: Shannon M.
Reviews.Content: Long wait in the hot weather for so-so.  We were finally let in by the host and led to our table where we waited without so much as a hello from anyone for 10 minutes.  We flagged down a waitress standing at the bar, and asked her if she could get our waitress, she said "i'm your waitress, I'll have to help someone else".  I get her possibly being busy (which it didn't appear at that moment) but she was very impoite about it all.  We finally get her back and she was curt and cut off several members of my party as they spoke.  We ordered water and some other beverages and ordered our lunches.  When I asked her opinion about which was a better menu item between 2 po'boys she shrugged and said, "I dunno, I guess they are both the same".  Talk about lack of enthusiasm for your product.  When we finally got our meals, she seemed a bit more cheerful, I'm sure she spit in our food or something causing this change of attitude.  She forgot to bring 2 items from one person's order, and forgot both bar drinks.  We gave up asking her for anything else.  When I wanted to order a beer, we tried to wave her down 4 times, when we finally grabbed a man standing near by.  HE was informative about the beer selections, and friendly and when I asked if I'd need to wait for our waitress to order one, he said "no problem, I'll get it right now for you" and brought it faster than I could have ordered it again.  :-)     The food - I had the crawfish po'boy.  The roll it was on was really good, they could have been more generous with the sauce, the crawfish itself was okay - it was fried little bits and a bit dry, so what can you say about that really - it was okay.  The prices were moderate and it looked like some other time this might have been a good stop - our wait outside and wait inside, and the dried out po'boy.  Meh.   What is everyone else talking about when they rated this place so high.  Maybe worth another try?  I dunno.

Reviews.Author: Sarah M.
Reviews.Content: Great place! Go before 4pm!!!

Reviews.Author: Sean S.
Reviews.Content: Came here while on vacation in NOLA.  If you don't like oysters don't come here.  If you do it's a must while in the Big Easy.  We got the grilled oysters and man I'm still dreaming.  I also got a Po-Boy (World Fried Peace) which was pretty good as well

Reviews.Author: Diana V.
Reviews.Content: the char-grilled oysters were like a party in my mouth. the wait was long, but it was worth it.

Reviews.Author: JM T.
Reviews.Content: Came here after Reading all these fabulous yelp reviews.  Beware!  Don't let the long line fool you.  The food is not special.  We tried the fried oysters which were small and dominated by the breading.  The fried shrimp were also small.  The red beans and rice was average.  The gumbo was very good but don't eat the mealy shrimp.  There is nothing they do that warrants the wait.

Reviews.Author: Kim H.
Reviews.Content: We've been here a number of times and I'm still waiting to be wowed.  You wait in line forever, get seated at a table with a number of other couples, you don't get service in the order you sat down (or are ready to order for that matter) and the food is just meh.  I would recommend trying something off the beaten path.  If you want oysters, perhaps it's worth the wait, but I would much rather spend my time at the Royal House Oyster Bar where I had a fantastic experience!

Reviews.Author: Jamie M.
Reviews.Content: Good oysters and a fun, old school spot.   The charbroiled oysters were great.

Reviews.Author: Tim F.
Reviews.Content: Great food. Expect to wait 30 minutes or more, but it is worth it

Reviews.Author: Clay J.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stopped here for lunch one day after not waiting in line for dinner a previous night. We both got po-boys (one shrimp and one crawfish) and loved them. The staff was friendly and we had a nice conversation with the man preparing oysters behind the bar.

Reviews.Author: John C.
Reviews.Content: The soft crab Po Boy and the hot whiskey sauce bread pudding a la mode were fantastic.

Reviews.Author: Cheryl W.
Reviews.Content: Overall, it's a fun place with good food. But the dinner wait isn't worth it. More than 20mins, I would suggest coming back. The fast pace table seating, doesn't help the situation.

Reviews.Author: Sutanuka L.
Reviews.Content: awesome food!!!

Reviews.Author: Em P.
Reviews.Content: I was in NOLA this past weekend and our first stop was at the Acme Oyster House.  I have seen this place on several food shows and was very excited to try oysters for the first time.  We stood in line at 4 pm Saturday and waited about 30 minutes and was seated at the bar.  It was by far the best seat of the house as we got to watch the oysters getting shucked.  Plus there was a big mirror behind the bar and we were able to people watch.  Being somewhat timid about the raw oysters, I made the choice to get chargrilled instead.  It took about 15 minutes for them to show up, but it was well worth the wait.  Absolutely delicious!!  The oysters were very fresh.  They were so good, I got another half order!  I also ordered the seafood gumbo which was eh.  Not a great deal of seafood or spices.  My buddy got the jambalaya and that was very good.  The waiter was funny and took great care of us.  I can't wait to come back to NOLA to get more oysters and to try the poboys.

Reviews.Author: Marcia S.
Reviews.Content: Our first night in NOLA, we went by this restaurant and were discouraged by the long line, so went elsewhere.  Our second night, we decided to brave the line and wait to get seated.  It was definitely worth the wait,, which wasn't more than 20 minutes or so, as the food was very good.  The raw oysters weren't as tasty as those at Le Bayou, but good nonetheless.  I had the combination shrimp and oyster po' boy, which was very tasty, and my sister had the chicken gumbo and shrimp ettouffe, both of which were very good.  The service was friendly and professional and, though you're most likely to be seated at a long table with other people, it's the kind of place that it really doesn't matter and it can be fun to meet new people and share eating experiences.  We realized that we should have ordered the char-grilled oysters instead of the fresh oysters, so went back for lunch the next day and shared an order of the char-grilled, which were unbelievably good.

Reviews.Author: Beatrice L.
Reviews.Content: i had oysters for the first time here.  to be honest, i have always been intimidated by them but since this is what Acme Oyster House is known for i had to try them.  my friends and i shared both the raw and chargrilled oysters and both were delicious.  for my main dish, i had the fried combo which was breaded and deepfried catfish/shrimp/oysters along with french fries and hush puppies.  delicious!

Reviews.Author: Megan M.
Reviews.Content: lots of character. there is a line outside to get in depending on what time of the day it is. wouldnt want to be standing out there for too long with the heat! it is worth the line though! i had a crab poboy...YUM! the waiters are all very attentive and they get your food to you as soon as possible. it would be good for lunch and dinner...we went at lunch time and were seated right away.

Reviews.Author: Sarah P.
Reviews.Content: the chargrilled oysters are as amazing as everyone says. so so so delicious. a must try if you're in new orleans. my mouth is watering right now just writing about it. go!
